<span id="sec-7.1.12.1" class="secnum">[7.1.12.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring-applied-to-the-number-type "link to this section")</span> ToString Applied to the Number Type
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring) converts a Number m to String format as follows:

1.  If *m* is **NaN**, return the String `"NaN"`.
2.  If *m* is **+0** or **−0**, return the String `"0"`.
3.  If *m* is less than zero, return the String concatenation of the String `"-"` and [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(−*m*).
4.  If *m* is +∞, return the String `"Infinity"`.
5.  Otherwise, let *n*, *k*, and *s* be integers such that *k* ≥ 1, 10<sup>*k*−1</sup> ≤ *s* &lt; 10<sup>*k*</sup>, the Number value for *s* × 10<sup>*n−k*</sup> is *m*, and *k* is as small as possible. Note that *k* is the number of digits in the decimal representation of *s*, that *s* is not divisible by 10, and that the least significant digit of *s* is not necessarily uniquely determined by these criteria.
6.  If *k* ≤ *n* ≤ 21, return the String consisting of the code units of the *k* digits of the decimal representation of *s* (in order, with no leading zeroes), followed by *n−k* occurrences of the code unit 0x0030 (DIGIT ZERO).
7.  If 0 &lt; *n* ≤ 21, return the String consisting of the code units of the most significant *n* digits of the decimal representation of *s*, followed by the code unit 0x002E (FULL STOP), followed by the code units of the remaining *k−n* digits of the decimal representation of *s*.
8.  If −6 &lt; *n* ≤ 0, return the String consisting of the code unit 0x0030 (DIGIT ZERO), followed by the code unit 0x002E (FULL STOP), followed by −*n* occurrences of the code unit 0x0030 (DIGIT ZERO), followed by the code units of the *k* digits of the decimal representation of *s*.
9.  Otherwise, if *k* = 1, return the String consisting of the code unit of the single digit of *s*, followed by code unit 0x0065 (LATIN SMALL LETTER E), followed by the code unit 0x002B (PLUS SIGN) or the code unit 0x002D (HYPHEN-MINUS) according to whether *n*−1 is positive or negative, followed by the code units of the decimal representation of the integer [abs](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions)(*n*−1) (with no leading zeroes).
10. Return the String consisting of the code units of the most significant digit of the decimal representation of *s*, followed by code unit 0x002E (FULL STOP), followed by the code units of the remaining *k*−1 digits of the decimal representation of *s*, followed by code unit 0x0065 (LATIN SMALL LETTER E), followed by code unit 0x002B (PLUS SIGN) or the code unit 0x002D (HYPHEN-MINUS) according to whether *n*−1 is positive or negative, followed by the code units of the decimal representation of the integer [abs](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions)(*n*−1) (with no leading zeroes).

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> The following observations may be useful as guidelines for implementations, but are not part of the normative requirements of this Standard:

-   If x is any Number value other than **−0**, then [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)([ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(x)) is exactly the same Number value as x.

-   The least significant digit of s is not always uniquely determined by the requirements listed in step 5.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> For implementations that provide more accurate conversions than required by the rules above, it is recommended that the following alternative version of step 5 be used as a guideline:

Otherwise, let *n*, *k*, and *s* be integers such that *k* ≥ 1, 10<sup>*k*−1</sup> ≤ *s* &lt; 10<sup>*k*</sup>, the Number value for *s* × 10<sup>*n*−*k*</sup> is *m*, and *k* is as small as possible. If there are multiple possibilities for *s*, choose the value of *s* for which *s* × 10<sup>*n*−*k*</sup> is closest in value to *m*. If there are two such possible values of *s*, choose the one that is even. Note that *k* is the number of digits in the decimal representation of *s* and that *s* is not divisible by 10.

<span class="nh">NOTE 3</span> Implementers of ECMAScript may find useful the paper and code written by David M. Gay for binary-to-decimal conversion of floating-point numbers:

Gay, David M. Correctly Rounded Binary-Decimal and Decimal-Binary Conversions. Numerical Analysis, Manuscript 90-10. AT&T Bell Laboratories (Murray Hill, New Jersey). November 30, 1990. Available as
<span style="font-family:
          sans-serif"><http://cm.bell-labs.com/cm/cs/doc/90/4-10.ps.gz></span>. Associated code available as
<span style="font-family: sans-serif"><http://netlib.sandia.gov/fp/dtoa.c></span> and as
<span style="font-family: sans-serif"><http://netlib.sandia.gov/fp/g_fmt.c></span> and may also be found at the various `netlib` mirror sites.

<span id="sec-7.1.13" class="secnum">[7.1.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject "link to this section")</span> ToObject ( argument )

Otherwise return ToObject(*argument*.\[\[value\]\]).                                                                                                                           |

See [19.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-boolean-objects) for a description of Boolean objects. |

<span id="sec-7.1.14" class="secnum">[7.1.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-topropertykey "link to this section")</span> ToPropertyKey ( argument )
===============================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation ToPropertyKey converts argument to a value that can be used as a [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) by performing the following steps:

1.  Let *key* be [ToPrimitive](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toprimitive)(*argument*, hint String).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*key*).
3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*key*) is Symbol, then
    1.  Return *key*.

4.  Return [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*key*).

<span id="sec-7.1.15" class="secnum">[7.1.15](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength "link to this section")</span> ToLength ( argument )
=====================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation ToLength converts argument to an integer suitable for use as the length of an array-like object. It performs the following steps:

1.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*argument*).
2.  Let *len* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*argument*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
4.  If *len* ≤ +0, return +0.
5.  If *len* is **+∞**, return 2<sup>53</sup>-1.
6.  Return min(*len*, 2<sup>53</sup>-1).

<span id="sec-7.1.16" class="secnum">[7.1.16](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-canonicalnumericindexstring "link to this section")</span> CanonicalNumericIndexString ( argument )
===========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation CanonicalNumericIndexString returns argument converted to a numeric value if it is a String representation of a Number that would be produced by [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring), or the string `"-0"`. Otherwise, it returns <span class="value">undefined.</span> This abstract operation functions as follows:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*argument*) is String.
2.  If *argument* is `"-0"`, return −0.
3.  Let *n* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*argument*).
4.  If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)([ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*n*), *argument*) is **false**, return **undefined**.
5.  Return *n*.

A *canonical numeric string* is any String value for which the CanonicalNumericIndexString abstract operation does not return <span class="value">undefined</span>.

<span id="sec-7.2" class="secnum">[7.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-testing-and-comparison-operations "link to this section")</span> Testing and Comparison Operations
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-7.2.1" class="secnum">[7.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-requireobjectcoercible "link to this section")</span> RequireObjectCoercible ( argument )
===============================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation RequireObjectCoercible throws an error if argument is a value that cannot be converted to an Object using [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject). It is defined by [Table 14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-14):

<span id="table-14">Table 14</span> — RequireObjectCoercible Results

|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| [Completion Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) | If argument is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), return argument. Otherwise return RequireObjectCoercible(argument.\[\[value\]\]). |
| Undefined                                                                                                           | Throw a **TypeError** exception.                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Null                                                                                                                | Throw a **TypeError** exception.                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Boolean                                                                                                             | Return argument.                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Number                                                                                                              | Return argument.                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| String                                                                                                              | Return argument.                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Symbol                                                                                                              | Return argument.                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Object                                                                                                              | Return argument.                                                                                                                                                                                                         |

<span id="sec-7.2.2" class="secnum">[7.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isarray "link to this section")</span> IsArray ( argument )
=================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IsArray takes one argument argument, and performs the following steps:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*argument*) is not Object, return **false**.
2.  If *argument* is an [Array exotic object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array-exotic-objects), return **true**.
3.  If *argument* is a Proxy exotic object, then
    1.  If the value of the \[\[ProxyHandler\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *argument* is **null**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    2.  Let *target* be the value of the \[\[ProxyTarget\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *argument*.
    3.  Return IsArray(*target*).

4.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-7.2.3" class="secnum">[7.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable "link to this section")</span> IsCallable ( argument )
=======================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IsCallable determines if argument, which must be an [ECMAScript language value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types) or a [Completion Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), is a callable function with a \[\[Call\]\] internal method.

1.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*argument*).
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*argument*) is not Object, return **false**.
3.  If *argument* has a \[\[Call\]\] internal method, return **true**.
4.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-7.2.4" class="secnum">[7.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor "link to this section")</span> IsConstructor ( argument )
=============================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IsConstructor determines if argument, which must be an [ECMAScript language value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types) or a [Completion Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), is a function object with a \[\[Construct\]\] internal method.

1.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*argument*).
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*argument*) is not Object, return **false**.
3.  If *argument* has a \[\[Construct\]\] internal method, return **true**.
4.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-7.2.5" class="secnum">[7.2.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isextensible-o "link to this section")</span> IsExtensible (O)
====================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">IsExtensible</span> is used to determine whether additional properties can be added to the object that is O. A Boolean value is returned. This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is Object.
2.  Return *O*.\[\[IsExtensible\]\]().

<span id="sec-7.2.6" class="secnum">[7.2.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isinteger "link to this section")</span> IsInteger ( argument )
=====================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IsInteger determines if argument is a finite integer numeric value.

1.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*argument*).
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*argument*) is not Number, return **false**.
3.  If *argument* is **NaN**, **+∞**, or **−∞**, return **false**.
4.  If [floor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions)([abs](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions)(*argument*)) ≠ [abs](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions)(*argument*), return **false**.
5.  Return **true**.

<span id="sec-7.2.7" class="secnum">[7.2.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey "link to this section")</span> IsPropertyKey ( argument )
=============================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IsPropertyKey determines if argument, which must be an [ECMAScript language value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types) or a [Completion Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), is a value that may be used as a [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type).

1.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*argument*).
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*argument*) is String, return **true**.
3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*argument*) is Symbol, return **true**.
4.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-7.2.8" class="secnum">[7.2.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isregexp "link to this section")</span> IsRegExp ( argument )
===================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IsRegExp with argument argument performs the following steps:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*argument*) is not Object, return **false**.
2.  Let *isRegExp* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*argument*, @@match).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*isRegExp*).
4.  If *isRegExp* is not **undefined**, return [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)(*isRegExp*).
5.  If *argument* has a \[\[RegExpMatcher\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), return **true**.
6.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-7.2.9" class="secnum">[7.2.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue "link to this section")</span> SameValue(x, y)
==============================================================================================================================================================

The internal comparison abstract operation SameValue(x, y), where x and y are [ECMAScript language values](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types), produces **true** or **false**. Such a comparison is performed as follows:

1.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*x*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*y*).
3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is different from [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*y*), return **false**.
4.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is Undefined, return **true**.
5.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is Null, return **true**.
6.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is Number, then
    1.  If *x* is NaN and *y* is NaN, return **true**.
    2.  If *x* is +0 and *y* is -0, return **false**.
    3.  If *x* is -0 and *y* is +0, return **false**.
    4.  If *x* is the same Number value as *y*, return **true**.
    5.  Return **false**.

7.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is String, then
    1.  If *x* and *y* are exactly the same sequence of code units (same length and same code units at corresponding indices) return **true**; otherwise, return **false**.

8.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is Boolean, then
    1.  If *x* and *y* are both **true** or both **false**, return **true**; otherwise, return **false**.

9.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is Symbol, then
    1.  If *x* and *y* are both the same Symbol value, return **true**; otherwise, return **false**.

10. Return **true** if *x* and *y* are the same Object value. Otherwise, return **false**.

<span id="sec-7.2.10" class="secnum">[7.2.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevaluezero "link to this section")</span> SameValueZero(x, y)
========================================================================================================================================================================

The internal comparison abstract operation SameValueZero(x, y), where x and y are [ECMAScript language values](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types), produces **true** or **false**. Such a comparison is performed as follows:

1.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*x*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*y*).
3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is different from [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*y*), return **false**.
4.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is Undefined, return **true**.
5.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is Null, return **true**.
6.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is Number, then
    1.  If *x* is NaN and *y* is NaN, return **true**.
    2.  If *x* is +0 and *y* is -0, return **true**.
    3.  If *x* is -0 and *y* is +0, return **true**.
    4.  If *x* is the same Number value as *y*, return **true**.
    5.  Return **false**.

7.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is String, then
    1.  If *x* and *y* are exactly the same sequence of code units (same length and same code units at corresponding indices) return **true**; otherwise, return **false**.

8.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is Boolean, then
    1.  If *x* and *y* are both **true** or both **false**, return **true**; otherwise, return **false**.

9.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is Symbol, then
    1.  If *x* and *y* are both the same Symbol value, return **true**; otherwise, return **false**.

10. Return **true** if *x* and *y* are the same Object value. Otherwise, return **false**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> SameValueZero differs from SameValue only in its treatment of +0 and -0.

<span id="sec-7.2.11" class="secnum">[7.2.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-relational-comparison "link to this section")</span> Abstract Relational Comparison
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

The comparison x &lt; y, where x and y are values, produces **true**, **false**, or **undefined** (which indicates that at least one operand is **NaN**). In addition to x and y the algorithm takes a Boolean flag named *LeftFirst* as a parameter. The flag is used to control the order in which operations with potentially visible side-effects are performed upon x and y. It is necessary because ECMAScript specifies left to right evaluation of expressions. The default value of *LeftFirst* is **true** and indicates that the x parameter corresponds to an expression that occurs to the left of the y parameter’s corresponding expression. If *LeftFirst* is **false**, the reverse is the case and operations must be performed upon y before x. Such a comparison is performed as follows:

1.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*x*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*y*).
3.  If the *LeftFirst* flag is **true**, then
    1.  Let *px* be [ToPrimitive](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toprimitive)(*x*, hint Number).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*px*).
    3.  Let *py* be [ToPrimitive](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toprimitive)(*y*, hint Number).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*py*).

4.  Else the order of evaluation needs to be reversed to preserve left to right evaluation
    1.  Let *py* be [ToPrimitive](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toprimitive)(*y*, hint Number).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*py*).
    3.  Let *px* be [ToPrimitive](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toprimitive)(*x*, hint Number).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*px*).

5.  If both *px* and *py* are Strings, then
    1.  If *py* is a prefix of *px*, return **false**. (A String value *p* is a prefix of String value *q* if *q* can be the result of concatenating *p* and some other String *r*. Note that any String is a prefix of itself, because *r* may be the empty String.)
    2.  If *px* is a prefix of *py*, return **true**.
    3.  Let *k* be the smallest nonnegative integer such that the code unit at index *k* within *px* is different from the code unit at index *k* within *py*. (There must be such a *k*, for neither String is a prefix of the other.)
    4.  Let *m* be the integer that is the code unit value at index *k* within *px*.
    5.  Let *n* be the integer that is the code unit value at index *k* within *py*.
    6.  If *m* &lt; *n*, return **true**. Otherwise, return **false**.

6.  Else,
    1.  Let *nx* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*px*). Because *px* and *py* are primitive values evaluation order is not important.
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*nx*).
    3.  Let *ny* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*py*).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*ny*).
    5.  If *nx* is **NaN**, return **undefined**.
    6.  If *ny* is **NaN**, return **undefined**.
    7.  If *nx* and *ny* are the same Number value, return **false**.
    8.  If *nx* is **+0** and *ny* is **−0**, return **false**.
    9.  If *nx* is **−0** and *ny* is **+0**, return **false**.
    10. If *nx* is **+∞**, return **false**.
    11. If *ny* is **+∞**, return **true**.
    12. If *ny* is **−∞**, return **false**.
    13. If *nx* is **−∞**, return **true**.
    14. If the mathematical value of *nx* is less than the mathematical value of *ny* —note that these mathematical values are both finite and not both zero—return **true**. Otherwise, return **false**.

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> Step 5 differs from step 11 in the algorithm for the addition operator `+` ([12.7.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-addition-operator-plus)) in using “and” instead of “or”.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> The comparison of Strings uses a simple lexicographic ordering on sequences of code unit values. There is no attempt to use the more complex, semantically oriented definitions of character or string equality and collating order defined in the Unicode specification. Therefore String values that are canonically equal according to the Unicode standard could test as unequal. In effect this algorithm assumes that both Strings are already in normalized form. Also, note that for strings containing supplementary characters, lexicographic ordering on sequences of UTF-16 code unit values differs from that on sequences of code point values.

<span id="sec-7.2.12" class="secnum">[7.2.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-equality-comparison "link to this section")</span> Abstract Equality Comparison
================================================================================================================================================================================================

The comparison x == y, where x and y are values, produces **true** or **false**. Such a comparison is performed as follows:

1.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*x*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*y*).
3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is the same as [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*y*), then
    1.  Return the result of performing Strict Equality Comparison *x* === *y*.

4.  If *x* is **null** and *y* is **undefined**, return **true**.
5.  If *x* is **undefined** and *y* is **null**, return **true**.
6.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is Number and [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*y*) is String,
    return the result of the comparison *x* == [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*y*).
7.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is String and [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*y*) is Number,
    return the result of the comparison [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*x*) == *y*.
8.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is Boolean, return the result of the comparison [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*x*) == *y*.
9.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*y*) is Boolean, return the result of the comparison *x* == [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*y*).
10. If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is either String, Number, or Symbol and [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*y*) is Object, then
    return the result of the comparison *x* == [ToPrimitive](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toprimitive)(*y*).
11. If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is Object and [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*y*) is either String, Number, or Symbol, then
    return the result of the comparison [ToPrimitive](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toprimitive)(*x*) == *y*.
12. Return **false**.

<span id="sec-7.2.13" class="secnum">[7.2.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-equality-comparison "link to this section")</span> Strict Equality Comparison
============================================================================================================================================================================================

The comparison x === y, where x and y are values, produces **true** or **false**. Such a comparison is performed as follows:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is different from [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*y*), return **false**.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is Undefined, return **true**.
3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is Null, return **true**.
4.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is Number, then
    1.  If *x* is **NaN**, return **false**.
    2.  If *y* is **NaN**, return **false**.
    3.  If *x* is the same Number value as *y*, return **true**.
    4.  If *x* is **+0** and *y* is **−0**, return **true**.
    5.  If *x* is **−0** and *y* is **+0**, return **true**.
    6.  Return **false**.

5.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is String, then
    1.  If *x* and *y* are exactly the same sequence of code units (same length and same code units at corresponding indices), return **true**.
    2.  Else, return **false**.

6.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) is Boolean, then
    1.  If *x* and *y* are both **true** or both **false**, return **true**.
    2.  Else, return **false**.

7.  If *x* and *y* are the same Symbol value, return **true**.
8.  If *x* and *y* are the same Object value, return **true**.
9.  Return **false**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> This algorithm differs from [the SameValue Algorithm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue) ([7.2.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)) in its treatment of signed zeroes and NaNs.

<span id="sec-7.3" class="secnum">[7.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-operations-on-objects "link to this section")</span> Operations on Objects
============================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-7.3.1" class="secnum">[7.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p "link to this section")</span> Get (O, P)
=======================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">Get</span> is used to retrieve the value of a specific property of an object. The operation is called with arguments O and P where O is the object and P is the [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type). This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is Object.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
3.  Return *O*.\[\[Get\]\](*P*, *O*).

<span id="sec-7.3.2" class="secnum">[7.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getv "link to this section")</span> GetV (V, P)
=====================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation GetV is used to retrieve the value of a specific property of an [ECMAScript language value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types). If the value is not an object, the property lookup is performed using a wrapper object appropriate for the type of the value. The operation is called with arguments V and P where V is the value and P is the [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type). This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(*V*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
4.  Return *O*.\[\[Get\]\](*P*, *V*).

<span id="sec-7.3.3" class="secnum">[7.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw "link to this section")</span> Set (O, P, V, Throw)
=========================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">Set</span> is used to set the value of a specific property of an object. The operation is called with arguments O, P, V, and *Throw* where O is the object, P is the [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type), V is the new value for the property and *Throw* is a Boolean flag. This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is Object.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*Throw*) is Boolean.
4.  Let *success* be *O*.\[\[Set\]\](*P*, *V*, *O*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*success*).
6.  If *success* is **false** and *Throw* is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
7.  Return *success*.

<span id="sec-7.3.4" class="secnum">[7.3.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty "link to this section")</span> CreateDataProperty (O, P, V)
====================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">CreateDataProperty</span> is used to create a new own property of an object. The operation is called with arguments O, P, and V where O is the object, P is the [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type), and V is the value for the property. This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is Object.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
3.  Let *newDesc* be the PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]: *V*, \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true**}.
4.  Return *O*.\[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\](*P*, *newDesc*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> This abstract operation creates a property whose attributes are set to the same defaults used for properties created by the ECMAScript language assignment operator. Normally, the property will not already exist. If it does exist and is not configurable or if *O* is not extensible, \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] will return **false**.

<span id="sec-7.3.5" class="secnum">[7.3.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createmethodproperty "link to this section")</span> CreateMethodProperty (O, P, V)
========================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">CreateMethodProperty</span> is used to create a new own property of an object. The operation is called with arguments O, P, and V where O is the object, P is the [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type), and V is the value for the property. This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is Object.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
3.  Let *newDesc* be the PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]: *V*, \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true**}.
4.  Return *O*.\[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\](*P*, *newDesc*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> This abstract operation creates a property whose attributes are set to the same defaults used for built-in methods and methods defined using class declaration syntax. Normally, the property will not already exist. If it does exist and is not configurable or if *O* is not extensible, \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] will return **false**.

<span id="sec-7.3.6" class="secnum">[7.3.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdatapropertyorthrow "link to this section")</span> CreateDataPropertyOrThrow (O, P, V)
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">CreateDataPropertyOrThrow</span> is used to create a new own property of an object. It throws a <span class="value">TypeError</span> exception if the requested property update cannot be performed. The operation is called with arguments O, P, and V where O is the object, P is the [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type), and V is the value for the property. This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is Object.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
3.  Let *success* be [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*O*, *P*, *V*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*success*).
5.  If *success* is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
6.  Return *success*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> This abstract operation creates a property whose attributes are set to the same defaults used for properties created by the ECMAScript language assignment operator. Normally, the property will not already exist. If it does exist and is not configurable or if *O* is not extensible, \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] will return **false** <span style="font-family: sans-serif">causing this operation to throw a</span> **TypeError** <span style="font-family:
        sans-serif">exception</span>.

<span id="sec-7.3.7" class="secnum">[7.3.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow "link to this section")</span> DefinePropertyOrThrow (O, P, desc)
=============================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">DefinePropertyOrThrow</span> is used to call the \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] internal method of an object in a manner that will throw a **TypeError** exception if the requested property update cannot be performed. The operation is called with arguments O, P, and desc where O is the object, P is the [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type), and desc is the [Property Descriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-property-descriptor-specification-type) for the property. This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is Object.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
3.  Let *success* be *O*.\[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\](*P*, *desc*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*success*).
5.  If *success* is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
6.  Return *success*.

<span id="sec-7.3.8" class="secnum">[7.3.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-deletepropertyorthrow "link to this section")</span> DeletePropertyOrThrow (O, P)
=======================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation DeletePropertyOrThrow is used to remove a specific own property of an object. It throws an exception if the property is not configurable. The operation is called with arguments O and P where O is the object and P is the [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type). This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is Object.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
3.  Let *success* be *O*.\[\[Delete\]\](*P*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*success*).
5.  If *success* is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
6.  Return *success*.

<span id="sec-7.3.9" class="secnum">[7.3.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getmethod "link to this section")</span> GetMethod (O, P)
===============================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation GetMethod is used to get the value of a specific property of an object when the value of the property is expected to be a function. The operation is called with arguments O and P where O is the object, P is the [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type). This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  Let *func* be [GetV](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getv)(*O*, *P*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*func*).
4.  If *func* is either **undefined** or **null**, return **undefined**.
5.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*func*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
6.  Return *func*.

<span id="sec-7.3.10" class="secnum">[7.3.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty "link to this section")</span> HasProperty (O, P)
=====================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation HasProperty is used to determine whether an object has a property with the specified [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type). The property may be either an own or inherited. A Boolean value is returned. The operation is called with arguments O and P where O is the object and P is the [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type). This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is Object.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
3.  Return *O*.\[\[HasProperty\]\](*P*).

<span id="sec-7.3.11" class="secnum">[7.3.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty "link to this section")</span> HasOwnProperty (O, P)
===========================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation HasOwnProperty is used to determine whether an object has an own property with the specified [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type). A Boolean value is returned. The operation is called with arguments O and P where O is the object and P is the [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type). This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is Object.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
3.  Let *desc* be *O*.\[\[GetOwnProperty\]\](*P*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*desc*).
5.  If *desc* is **undefined**, return **false**.
6.  Return **true**.

<span id="sec-7.3.12" class="secnum">[7.3.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call "link to this section")</span> Call(F, V, \[argumentsList\])
=========================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation Call is used to call the \[\[Call\]\] internal method of a function object. The operation is called with arguments F, V , and optionally argumentsList where F is the function object, V is an [ECMAScript language value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types) that is the **this** value of the \[\[Call\]\], and argumentsList is the value passed to the corresponding argument of the internal method. If argumentsList is not present, an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) is used as its value. This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*F*).
2.  If *argumentsList* was not passed, let *argumentsList* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
3.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*F*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Return *F*.\[\[Call\]\](*V*, *argumentsList*).

<span id="sec-7.3.13" class="secnum">[7.3.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-construct "link to this section")</span> Construct (F, \[argumentsList\], \[newTarget\])
================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation Construct is used to call the \[\[Construct\]\] internal method of a function object. The operation is called with arguments F, and optionally <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*argumentsList*, and *newTarget*</span> where F is the function object. argumentsList and newTarget are the values to be passed as the corresponding arguments of the internal method. If argumentsList is not present, an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) is used as its value. If newTarget is not present, F is used as its value. This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  If *newTarget* was not passed, let *newTarget* be *F*.
2.  If *argumentsList* was not passed, let *argumentsList* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor) (*F*) is **true**.
4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor) (*newTarget*) is **true**.
5.  Return *F*.\[\[Construct\]\](*argumentsList*, *newTarget*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> If *newTarget* is not passed, this operation is equivalent to: `new         F(...argumentsList)`

<span id="sec-7.3.14" class="secnum">[7.3.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setintegritylevel "link to this section")</span> SetIntegrityLevel (O, level)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">SetIntegrityLevel</span> is used to fix the set of own properties of an object. This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is Object.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *level* is either `"sealed"` or `"frozen"`.
3.  Let *status* be *O*.\[\[PreventExtensions\]\]().
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
5.  If *status* is **false**, return **false**.
6.  Let *keys* be *O*.\[\[OwnPropertyKeys\]\]().
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*keys*).
8.  If *level* is `"sealed"`, then
    1.  Repeat for each element *k* of *keys*,
        1.  Let *status* be [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*O*, *k*, PropertyDescriptor{ \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false**}).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).

9.  Else *level* is `"frozen"`,
    1.  Repeat for each element *k* of *keys*,
        1.  Let *currentDesc* be *O*.\[\[GetOwnProperty\]\](*k*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*currentDesc*).
        3.  If *currentDesc* is not **undefined**, then
            1.  If [IsAccessorDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isaccessordescriptor)(*currentDesc*) is **true**, then
                1.  Let *desc* be the PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Configurable\]\]: **false**}.

            2.  Else,
                1.  Let *desc* be the PropertyDescriptor { \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Writable\]\]: **false** }.

            3.  Let *status* be [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*O*, *k*, *desc*).
            4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).

10. Return **true**.

<span id="sec-7.3.15" class="secnum">[7.3.15](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-testintegritylevel "link to this section")</span> TestIntegrityLevel (O, level)
=======================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">TestIntegrityLevel</span> is used to determine if the set of own properties of an object are fixed. This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is Object.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *level* is either `"sealed"` or `"frozen"`.
3.  Let *status* be [IsExtensible](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isextensible-o)(*O*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
5.  If *status* is **true**, return **false**
6.  NOTE If the object is extensible, none of its properties are examined.
7.  Let *keys* be *O*.\[\[OwnPropertyKeys\]\]().
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*keys*).
9.  Repeat for each element *k* of *keys*,
    1.  Let *currentDesc* be *O*.\[\[GetOwnProperty\]\](*k*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*currentDesc*).
    3.  If *currentDesc* is not **undefined**, then
        1.  If *currentDesc*.\[\[Configurable\]\] is **true**, return **false**.
        2.  If *level* is `"frozen"` and [IsDataDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdatadescriptor)(*currentDesc*) is **true**, then
            1.  If *currentDesc*.\[\[Writable\]\] is **true**, return **false**.

10. Return **true**.

<span id="sec-7.3.16" class="secnum">[7.3.16](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createarrayfromlist "link to this section")</span> CreateArrayFromList (elements)
=========================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">CreateArrayFromList</span> is used to create an Array object whose elements are provided by a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type). This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *elements* is a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) whose elements are all [ECMAScript language values](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types).
2.  Let *array* be [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate)(0) ([see 9.4.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate)).
3.  Let *n* be 0.
4.  For each element *e* of *elements*
    1.  Let *status* be [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*array*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*n*), *e*).
    2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is **true**.
    3.  Increment *n* by 1.

5.  Return *array*.

<span id="sec-7.3.17" class="secnum">[7.3.17](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createlistfromarraylike "link to this section")</span> CreateListFromArrayLike (obj \[, elementTypes\] )
================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation CreateListFromArrayLike is used to create a List value whose elements are provided by the indexed properties of an array-like object, obj. The optional argument elementTypes is a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the names of ECMAScript Language Types that are allowed for element values of the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is created. This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*obj*).
2.  If *elementTypes* was not passed, let *elementTypes* be (Undefined, Null, Boolean, String, Symbol, Number, Object).
3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*obj*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*obj*, `"length"`)).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
6.  Let *list* be an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
7.  Let *index* be 0.
8.  Repeat while *index* &lt; *len*
    1.  Let *indexName* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*index*).
    2.  Let *next* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*obj*, *indexName*).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*next*).
    4.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*next*) is not an element of *elementTypes*, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    5.  Append *next* as the last element of *list*.
    6.  Set *index* to *index* + 1.

9.  Return *list*.

<span id="sec-7.3.18" class="secnum">[7.3.18](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-invoke "link to this section")</span> Invoke(O,P, \[argumentsList\])
============================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">Invoke</span> is used to call a method property of an object. The operation is called with arguments O, P , and optionally argumentsList where O serves as both the lookup point for the property and the **this** value of the call, P is the [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type), and argumentsList is the list of arguments values passed to the method. If argumentsList is not present, an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) is used as its value. This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  If *argumentsList* was not passed, let *argumentsList* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
3.  Let *func* be [GetV](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getv)(*O*, *P*).
4.  Return [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*func*, *O*, *argumentsList*).

<span id="sec-7.3.19" class="secnum">[7.3.19](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinaryhasinstance "link to this section")</span> OrdinaryHasInstance (C, O)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">OrdinaryHasInstance</span> implements the default algorithm for determining if an object O inherits from the instance object inheritance path provided by constructor C. This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*C*) is **false**, return **false**.
2.  If *C* has a [\[\[BoundTargetFunction\]\]](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), then
    1.  Let *BC* be the value of *C’s* [\[\[BoundTargetFunction\]\]](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
    2.  Return [InstanceofOperator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-instanceofoperator)(*O*,*BC*) ([see 12.9.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-instanceofoperator)).

3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, return **false**.
4.  Let *P* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*C*, `"prototype"`).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*P*).
6.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*P*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
7.  Repeat
    1.  Let *O* be *O*.\[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\]().
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
    3.  If *O* is `null`, return **false**.
    4.  If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*P*, *O*) is **true**, return **true**.

<span id="sec-7.3.20" class="secnum">[7.3.20](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-speciesconstructor "link to this section")</span> SpeciesConstructor ( O, defaultConstructor )
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation SpeciesConstructor is used to retrieve the constructor that should be used to create new objects that are derived from the argument object O. The defaultConstructor argument is the constructor to use if a constructor @@species property cannot be found starting from O. This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is Object.
2.  Let *C* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"constructor"`).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*C*).
4.  If *C* is **undefined**, return *defaultConstructor*.
5.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*C*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
6.  Let *S* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*C*, @@species).
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*S*).
8.  If *S* is either **undefined** or **null**, return *defaultConstructor*.
9.  If [IsConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor)(*S*) is **true**, return *S.*
10. Throw a **TypeError** exception.

<span id="sec-7.3.21" class="secnum">[7.3.21](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-enumerableownnames "link to this section")</span> EnumerableOwnNames (O)
================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation EnumerableOwnNames is called with Object O the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is Object.
2.  Let *ownKeys* be *O*.\[\[OwnPropertyKeys\]\]().
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*ownKeys*).
4.  Let *names* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
5.  Repeat, for each element *key* of *ownKeys* in [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) order
    1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*key*) is String, then
        1.  Let *desc* be *O*.\[\[GetOwnProperty\]\](*key*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*desc*).
        3.  If *desc* is not **undefined**, then
            1.  If *desc.*\[\[Enumerable\]\] is **true**, append *key* to *names*.

6.  Order the elements of *names* so they are in the same relative order as would be produced by the Iterator that would be returned if the \[\[Enumerate\]\] internal method was invoked on *O*.
7.  Return *names*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The order of elements is returned list is the same as the enumeration order that used by a for-in statement.

<span id="sec-7.3.22" class="secnum">[7.3.22](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getfunctionrealm "link to this section")</span> GetFunctionRealm ( obj )
================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation GetFunctionRealm with argument obj performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *obj* is a callable object.
2.  If *obj* has a \[\[Realm\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), then
    1.  Return *obj*’s \[\[Realm\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

3.  If *obj* is a [Bound Function](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) exotic object, then
    1.  Let *target* be *obj*’s [\[\[BoundTargetFunction\]\]](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
    2.  Return GetFunctionRealm(*target*).

4.  If *obj* is a Proxy exotic object, then
    1.  If the value of the \[\[ProxyHandler\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *obj* is **null**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    2.  Let *proxyTarget* be the value of *obj*’s \[\[ProxyTarget\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
    3.  Return GetFunctionRealm(*proxyTarget*).

5.  Return [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Step 5 will only be reached if *target* is a non-standard exotic function object that does not have a \[\[Realm\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

<span id="sec-7.4" class="secnum">[7.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-operations-on-iterator-objects "link to this section")</span> Operations on Iterator Objects
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

See Common Iteration Interfaces ([25.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteration)).

<span id="sec-7.4.1" class="secnum">[7.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getiterator "link to this section")</span> GetIterator ( obj, method )
============================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation GetIterator with argument <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*obj* and</span> optional argument method performs the following steps:

1.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*obj*).
2.  If *method* was not passed, then
    1.  Let *method* be [GetMethod](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getmethod)(*obj*, @@iterator).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*method*).

3.  Let *iterator* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*method*,*obj*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*iterator*)*.*
5.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*iterator*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
6.  Return *iterator*.

<span id="sec-7.4.2" class="secnum">[7.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratornext "link to this section")</span> IteratorNext ( iterator, value )
==================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IteratorNext with argument iterator and optional argument value performs the following steps:

1.  If *value* was not passed, then
    1.  Let *result* be [Invoke](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-invoke)(*iterator*, `"next"`, «‍ »).

2.  Else,
    1.  Let *result* be [Invoke](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-invoke)(*iterator*, `"next"`, «‍*value*»).

3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*result*).
4.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*result*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
5.  Return *result*.
