<span id="sec-7.4.3" class="secnum">[7.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorcomplete "link to this section")</span> IteratorComplete ( iterResult )
=====================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IteratorComplete with argument iterResult performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*iterResult*) is Object.
2.  Return [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*iterResult*, `"done"`)).

<span id="sec-7.4.4" class="secnum">[7.4.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorvalue "link to this section")</span> IteratorValue ( iterResult )
===============================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IteratorValue with argument iterResult performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*iterResult*) is Object.
2.  Return [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*iterResult*, `"value"`).

<span id="sec-7.4.5" class="secnum">[7.4.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorstep "link to this section")</span> IteratorStep ( iterator )
===========================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IteratorStep with argument iterator requests the next value from iterator and returns either <span class="value">false</span> indicating that the iterator has reached its end or the IteratorResult object if a next value is available. IteratorStep performs the following steps:

1.  Let *result* be [IteratorNext](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratornext)(*iterator*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*result*).
3.  Let *done* be [IteratorComplete](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorcomplete)(*result*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*done*).
5.  If *done* is **true**, return **false**.
6.  Return *result*.

<span id="sec-7.4.6" class="secnum">[7.4.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose "link to this section")</span> IteratorClose( iterator, completion )
========================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IteratorClose with arguments iterator and completion is used to notify an iterator that it should perform any actions it would normally perform when it has reached its completed state:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*iterator*) is Object.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *completion* is a [Completion Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
3.  Let *return* be [GetMethod](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getmethod)(*iterator*, `"return"`).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*return*).
5.  If *return* is **undefined**, return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*completion*).
6.  Let *innerResult* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*return*, *iterator*, «‍ »).
7.  If *completion*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">throw</span>, return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*completion*).
8.  If *innerResult*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">throw</span>, return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*innerResult*).
9.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*innerResult*.\[\[value\]\]) is not Object*,* throw a **TypeError** exception.
10. Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*completion*).

<span id="sec-7.4.7" class="secnum">[7.4.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject "link to this section")</span> CreateIterResultObject ( value, done )
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation CreateIterResultObject with arguments value and done creates an object that supports the IteratorResult interface by performing the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*done*) is Boolean.
2.  Let *obj* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(<span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">%ObjectPrototype%</span>).
3.  Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*obj*, `"value"`, *value*).
4.  Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*obj*, `"done"`, *done*).
5.  Return *obj*.

<span id="sec-7.4.8" class="secnum">[7.4.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createlistiterator "link to this section")</span> CreateListIterator ( list )
===================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation CreateListIterator with argument list creates an Iterator ([25.1.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iterator-interface)) object whose next method returns the successive elements of list. It performs the following steps:

1.  Let *iterator* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(%IteratorPrototype%, «\[\[IteratorNext\]\], \[\[IteratedList\]\], \[\[ListIteratorNextIndex\]\]»).
2.  Set *iterator’s* \[\[IteratedList\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *list*.
3.  Set *iterator’s* \[\[ListIteratorNextIndex\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to 0.
4.  Let *next* be a new built-in function object as defined in ListIterator `next` ([7.4.8.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-listiterator-next)).
5.  Set *iterator’s* \[\[IteratorNext\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *next*.
6.  Perform [CreateMethodProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createmethodproperty)(*iterator*, `"next"`, *next*).
7.  Return *iterator*.

<span id="sec-7.4.8.1" class="secnum">[7.4.8.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-listiterator-next "link to this section")</span> ListIterator next( )
===============================================================================================================================================================================

The ListIterator `next` method is a standard built-in function object ([clause 17](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-standard-built-in-objects)) that performs the following steps:

1.  Let *O* be the **this** value.
2.  Let *f* be the active function object.
3.  If *O* does not have a \[\[IteratorNext\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *next* be the value of the \[\[IteratorNext\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
5.  If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*f*, *next*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
6.  If *O* does not have a \[\[IteratedList\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
7.  Let *list* be the value of the \[\[IteratedList\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
8.  Let *index* be the value of the \[\[ListIteratorNextIndex\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
9.  Let *len* be the number of elements of *list*.
10. If *index* ≥ *len*, then
    1.  Return [CreateIterResultObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject)(**undefined**, **true**).

11. Set the value of the \[\[ListIteratorNextIndex\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O* to *index*+1.
12. Return [CreateIterResultObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject)(*list*\[*index*\], **false**).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> A ListIterator `next` method will throw an exception if applied to any object other than the one with which it was originally associated.

<span id="sec-8" class="secnum">[8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-executable-code-and-execution-contexts "link to this section")</span> Executable Code and Execution Contexts
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-8.1" class="secnum">[8.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments "link to this section")</span> Lexical Environments
==========================================================================================================================================================================

A *Lexical Environment* is a specification type used to define the association of *Identifiers* to specific variables and functions based upon the lexical nesting structure of ECMAScript code. A Lexical Environment consists of an [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) and a possibly null reference to an *outer* Lexical Environment. Usually a Lexical Environment is associated with some specific syntactic structure of ECMAScript code such as a *FunctionDeclaration*, a *BlockStatement*, or a *Catch* clause of a *TryStatement* and a new Lexical Environment is created each time such code is evaluated.

An [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) records the identifier bindings that are created within the scope of its associated Lexical Environment. It is referred to as the Lexical Environment’s EnvironmentRecord

The outer environment reference is used to model the logical nesting of Lexical Environment values. The outer reference of a (inner) Lexical Environment is a reference to the Lexical Environment that logically surrounds the inner Lexical Environment. An outer Lexical Environment may, of course, have its own outer Lexical Environment. A Lexical Environment may serve as the outer environment for multiple inner Lexical Environments. For example, if a *FunctionDeclaration* contains two nested *FunctionDeclarations* then the Lexical Environments of each of the nested functions will have as their outer Lexical Environment the Lexical Environment of the current evaluation of the surrounding function.

A *global environment* is a Lexical Environment which does not have an outer environment. The global environment’s outer environment reference is **null**. A global environment’s EnvironmentRecord may be prepopulated with identifier bindings and includes an associated *global object* whose properties provide some of [the global environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-environment-records)’s identifier bindings. This global object is the value of a global environment’s `this` binding. As ECMAScript code is executed, additional properties may be added to the global object and the initial properties may be modified.

A *module environment* is a Lexical Environment that contains the bindings for the top level declarations of a *Module*. It also contains the bindings that are explicitly imported by the *Module*. The outer environment of a module environment is a global environment.

A *function environment* is a Lexical Environment that corresponds to the invocation of an [ECMAScript function object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-function-objects). A function environment may establish a new `this` binding. A function environment also captures the state necessary to support `super` method invocations.

Lexical Environments and [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) values are purely specification mechanisms and need not correspond to any specific artefact of an ECMAScript implementation. It is impossible for an ECMAScript program to directly access or manipulate such values.

<span id="sec-8.1.1" class="secnum">[8.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records "link to this section")</span> Environment Records
============================================================================================================================================================================

There are two primary kinds of Environment Record values used in this specification: *declarative Environment Records* and *object Environment Records*. Declarative Environment Records are used to define the effect of ECMAScript language syntactic elements such as *FunctionDeclarations*, *VariableDeclarations*, and *Catch* clauses that directly associate identifier bindings with [ECMAScript language values](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types). Object Environment Records are used to define the effect of ECMAScript elements such as *WithStatement* that associate identifier bindings with the properties of some object. [Global Environment Records](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-environment-records) and function Environment Records are specializations that are used for specifically for *Script* global declarations and for top-level declarations within functions.

For specification purposes Environment Record values are values of the Record specification type and can be thought of as existing in a simple object-oriented hierarchy where Environment Record is an abstract class with three concrete subclasses, declarative Environment Record, object Environment Record, and global Environment Record. [Function Environment Records](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-environment-records) and module Environment Records are subclasses of declarative Environment Record. The abstract class includes the abstract specification methods defined in [Table 15](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-15). These abstract methods have distinct concrete algorithms for each of the concrete subclasses.

<span id="table-15">Table 15</span> — Abstract Methods of Environment Records
| Method                       | Purpose                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| HasBinding(N)                | Determine if an Environment Record has a binding for the String value N. Return **true** if it does and **false** if it does not                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| CreateMutableBinding(N, D)   | Create a new but uninitialized mutable binding in an Environment Record. The String value N is the text of the bound name. If the optional Boolean argument D is **true** the binding is may be subsequently deleted.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| CreateImmutableBinding(N, S) | Create a new but uninitialized immutable binding in an Environment Record. The String value N is the text of the bound name. If S is **true** then attempts to access the value of the binding before it is initialized or set it after it has been initialized will always throw an exception, regardless of the strict mode setting of operations that reference that binding. S is an optional parameter that defaults to **false**.                                                                                                                                                     |
| InitializeBinding(N,V)       | Set the value of an already existing but uninitialized binding in an Environment Record. The String value N is the text of the bound name. V is the value for the binding and is a value of any [ECMAScript language type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| SetMutableBinding(N,V, S)    | Set the value of an already existing mutable binding in an Environment Record. The String value N is the text of the bound name. V is the value for the binding and may be a value of any [ECMAScript language type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types). S is a Boolean flag. If S is **true** and the binding cannot be set throw a **TypeError** exception.                                                                                                                                                                             |
| GetBindingValue(N,S)         | Returns the value of an already existing binding from an Environment Record. The String value N is the text of the bound name. S is used to identify references originating in [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code) or that otherwise require strict mode reference semantics. If S is **true** and the binding does not exist throw a **ReferenceError** exception. If the binding exists but is uninitialized a **ReferenceError** is thrown, regardless of the value of *<span style="font-family: Times New Roman">S</span>.* |
| DeleteBinding(N)             | Delete a binding from an Environment Record. The String value N is the text of the bound name. If a binding for N exists, remove the binding and return **true**. If the binding exists but cannot be removed return **false**. If the binding does not exist return **true**.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| HasThisBinding()             | Determine if an Environment Record establishes a `this` binding. Return **true** if it does and **false** if it does not.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| HasSuperBinding()            | Determine if an Environment Record establishes a `super` method binding. Return **true** if it does and **false** if it does not.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| WithBaseObject ()            | If this Environment Record is associated with a `with` statement, return the with object. Otherwise, return <span class="value">undefined</span>.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |

<span id="sec-8.1.1.1" class="secnum">[8.1.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-declarative-environment-records "link to this section")</span> Declarative Environment Records
========================================================================================================================================================================================================

Each declarative [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) is associated with an ECMAScript program scope containing variable, constant, let, class, module, import, and/or function declarations. A declarative [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) binds the set of identifiers defined by the declarations contained within its scope.

The behaviour of the concrete specification methods for declarative Environment Records is defined by the following algorithms.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.1.1" class="secnum">[8.1.1.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-declarative-environment-records-hasbinding-n "link to this section")</span> HasBinding(N)
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method HasBinding for declarative Environment Records simply determines if the argument identifier is one of the identifiers bound by the record:

1.  Let *envRec* be the declarative [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  If *envRec* has a binding for the name that is the value of *N*, return **true**.
3.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.1.2" class="secnum">[8.1.1.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-declarative-environment-records-createmutablebinding-n-d "link to this section")</span> CreateMutableBinding (N, D)
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method CreateMutableBinding for declarative Environment Records creates a new mutable binding for the name N that is uninitialized. A binding must not already exist in this [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for N. If Boolean argument D is provided and has the value **true** the new binding is marked as being subject to deletion.

1.  Let *envRec* be the declarative [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *envRec* does not already have a binding for *N*.
3.  Create a mutable binding in *envRec* for *N* and record that it is uninitialized. If *D* is **true** record that the newly created binding may be deleted by a subsequent DeleteBinding call.
4.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family:
                    sans-serif">empty</span>).

<span id="sec-8.1.1.1.3" class="secnum">[8.1.1.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-declarative-environment-records-createimmutablebinding-n-s "link to this section")</span> CreateImmutableBinding (N, S)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method CreateImmutableBinding for declarative Environment Records creates a new immutable binding for the name N that is uninitialized. A binding must not already exist in this [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for N. If Boolean argument S is provided and has the value **true** the new binding is marked as a strict binding.

1.  Let *envRec* be the declarative [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *envRec* does not already have a binding for *N*.
3.  Create an immutable binding in *envRec* for *N* and record that it is uninitialized. If *S* is **true** record that the newly created binding is a strict binding.
4.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family:
                    sans-serif">empty</span>).

<span id="sec-8.1.1.1.4" class="secnum">[8.1.1.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-declarative-environment-records-initializebinding-n-v "link to this section")</span> InitializeBinding (N,V)
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method InitializeBinding for declarative Environment Records is used to set the bound value of the current binding of the identifier whose name is the value of the argument N to the value of argument V. An uninitialized binding for N must already exist.

1.  Let *envRec* be the declarative [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *envRec* must have an uninitialized binding for *N*.
3.  Set the bound value for *N* in *envRec* to *V*.
4.  Record that the binding for *N* in *envRec* has been initialized.
5.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family:
                    sans-serif">empty</span>).

<span id="sec-8.1.1.1.5" class="secnum">[8.1.1.1.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-declarative-environment-records-setmutablebinding-n-v-s "link to this section")</span> SetMutableBinding (N,V,S)
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method SetMutableBinding for declarative Environment Records attempts to change the bound value of the current binding of the identifier whose name is the value of the argument N to the value of argument V. A binding for N normally already exist, but in rare cases it may not. If the binding is an immutable binding, a **TypeError** is thrown if <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">S</span> is <span class="value">true</span>.

1.  Let *envRec* be the declarative [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  If *envRec* does not have a binding for *N*, then
    1.  If *S* is **true** throw a **ReferenceError** exception.
    2.  Perform *envRec*.CreateMutableBinding(*N*, **true**).
    3.  Perform *envRec*.InitializeBinding(*N*, *V*).
    4.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family:
                            sans-serif">empty</span>).

3.  If the binding for *N* in *envRec* is a strict binding, let *S* be **true**.
4.  If the binding for *N* in *envRec* has not yet been initialized throw a **ReferenceError** exception.
5.  Else if the binding for *N* in *envRec* is a mutable binding, change its bound value to *V*.
6.  Else this must be an attempt to change the value of an immutable binding so if *S* is **true** throw a **TypeError** exception.
7.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family:
                    sans-serif">empty</span>).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> An example of ECMAScript code that results in a missing binding at step 2 is:

    function f(){eval("var x; x = (delete x, 0);")}

<span id="sec-8.1.1.1.6" class="secnum">[8.1.1.1.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-declarative-environment-records-getbindingvalue-n-s "link to this section")</span> GetBindingValue(N,S)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method GetBindingValue for declarative Environment Records simply returns the value of its bound identifier whose name is the value of the argument N. If the binding exists but is uninitialized a **ReferenceError** is thrown, regardless of the value of *<span style="font-family: Times New Roman">S</span>.*

1.  Let *envRec* be the declarative [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *envRec* has a binding for *N*.
3.  If the binding for *N* in *envRec* is an uninitialized binding, throw a **ReferenceError** exception.
4.  Return the value currently bound to *N* in *envRec*.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.1.7" class="secnum">[8.1.1.1.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-declarative-environment-records-deletebinding-n "link to this section")</span> DeleteBinding (N)
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method DeleteBinding for declarative Environment Records can only delete bindings that have been explicitly designated as being subject to deletion.

1.  Let *envRec* be the declarative [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *envRec* has a binding for the name that is the value of *N*.
3.  If the binding for *N* in *envRec* cannot be deleted, return **false**.
4.  Remove the binding for *N* from *envRec*.
5.  Return **true**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.1.8" class="secnum">[8.1.1.1.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-declarative-environment-records-hasthisbinding "link to this section")</span> HasThisBinding ()
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================

Regular declarative Environment Records do not provide a `this` binding.

1.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.1.9" class="secnum">[8.1.1.1.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-declarative-environment-records-hassuperbinding "link to this section")</span> HasSuperBinding ()
===============================================================================================================================================================================================================

Regular declarative Environment Records do not provide a `super` binding.

1.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.1.10" class="secnum">[8.1.1.1.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-declarative-environment-records-withbaseobject "link to this section")</span> WithBaseObject()
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================

Declarative Environment Records always return **undefined** as their WithBaseObject.

1.  Return **undefined**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.2" class="secnum">[8.1.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-environment-records "link to this section")</span> Object Environment Records
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

Each object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) is associated with an object called its *binding object*. An object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) binds the set of string identifier names that directly correspond to the property names of its binding object. Property keys that are not strings in the form of an *IdentifierName* are not included in the set of bound identifiers. Both own and inherited properties are included in the set regardless of the setting of their \[\[Enumerable\]\] attribute. Because properties can be dynamically added and deleted from objects, the set of identifiers bound by an object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) may potentially change as a side-effect of any operation that adds or deletes properties. Any bindings that are created as a result of such a side-effect are considered to be a mutable binding even if the Writable attribute of the corresponding property has the value **false**. Immutable bindings do not exist for object Environment Records.

Object Environment Records created for `with` statements ([13.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-with-statement)) can provide their binding object as an implicit **this** value for use in function calls. The capability is controlled by a withEnvironment Boolean value that is associated with each object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records). By default, the value of withEnvironment is **false** for any object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records).

The behaviour of the concrete specification methods for object Environment Records is defined by the following algorithms.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.2.1" class="secnum">[8.1.1.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-environment-records-hasbinding-n "link to this section")</span> HasBinding(N)
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method HasBinding for object Environment Records determines if its associated binding object has a property whose name is the value of the argument N:

1.  Let *envRec* be the object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *bindings* be the binding object for *envRec*.
3.  Let *foundBinding* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*bindings*, *N*)
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*foundBinding*).
5.  If *foundBinding* is **false**, return **false**.
6.  If the *withEnvironment* flag of *envRec* is **false**, return **true**.
7.  Let *unscopables* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*bindings*, @@unscopables).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*unscopables*).
9.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*unscopables*) is Object, then
    1.  Let *blocked* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*unscopables*, *N*)).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*blocked*).
    3.  If *blocked* is **true**, return **false**.

10. Return **true**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.2.2" class="secnum">[8.1.1.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-environment-records-createmutablebinding-n-d "link to this section")</span> CreateMutableBinding (N, D)
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method CreateMutableBinding for object Environment Records creates in an Environment Record’s associated binding object a property whose name is the String value and initializes it to the value **undefined**. If Boolean argument D is provided and has the value **true** the new property’s \[\[Configurable\]\] attribute is set to **true**, otherwise it is set to **false**.

1.  Let *envRec* be the object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *bindings* be the binding object for *envRec*.
3.  If *D* is **true** then let *configValue* be **true** otherwise let *configValue* be **false**.
4.  Return [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*bindings*, *N*, PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]:**undefined**, \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **true** , \[\[Configurable\]\]: *configValue*}).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Normally *envRec* will not have a binding for *N* but if it does, the semantics of [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow) may result in an existing binding being replaced or shadowed or cause an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) to be returned.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.2.3" class="secnum">[8.1.1.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-environment-records-createimmutablebinding-n-s "link to this section")</span> CreateImmutableBinding (N, S)
================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method CreateImmutableBinding is never used within this specification in association with Object Environment Records.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.2.4" class="secnum">[8.1.1.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-environment-records-initializebinding-n-v "link to this section")</span> InitializeBinding (N,V)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method InitializeBinding for object Environment Records is used to set the bound value of the current binding of the identifier whose name is the value of the argument N to the value of argument V. An uninitialized binding for N must already exist.

1.  Let *envRec* be the object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *envRec* must have an uninitialized binding for *N*.
3.  Record that the binding for *N* in *envRec* has been initialized.
4.  Return *envRec*.SetMutableBinding(*N*, *V*, **false**).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> In this specification, all uses of CreateMutableBinding for object Environment Records are immediately followed by a call to InitializeBinding for the same name. Hence, implementations do not need to explicitly track the initialization state of individual object Environment Record bindings.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.2.5" class="secnum">[8.1.1.2.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-environment-records-setmutablebinding-n-v-s "link to this section")</span> SetMutableBinding (N,V,S)
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method SetMutableBinding for object Environment Records attempts to set the value of the Environment Record’s associated binding object’s property whose name is the value of the argument N to the value of argument V. A property named N normally already exists but if it does not or is not currently writable, error handling is determined by the value of the Boolean argument S.

1.  Let *envRec* be the object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *bindings* be the binding object for *envRec*.
3.  Return [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*bindings*, *N*, *V*, *S*).

<span id="sec-8.1.1.2.6" class="secnum">[8.1.1.2.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-environment-records-getbindingvalue-n-s "link to this section")</span> GetBindingValue(N,S)
================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method GetBindingValue for object Environment Records returns the value of its associated binding object’s property whose name is the String value of the argument identifier N. The property should already exist but if it does not the result depends upon the value of the S argument:

1.  Let *envRec* be the object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *bindings* be the binding object for *envRec*.
3.  Let *value* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*bindings*, *N*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*value*).
5.  If *value* is **false**, then
    1.  If *S* is **false**, return the value **undefined**, otherwise throw a **ReferenceError** exception.

6.  Return [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*bindings*, *N*).

<span id="sec-8.1.1.2.7" class="secnum">[8.1.1.2.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-environment-records-deletebinding-n "link to this section")</span> DeleteBinding (N)
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method DeleteBinding for object Environment Records can only delete bindings that correspond to properties of the environment object whose \[\[Configurable\]\] attribute have the value **true**.

1.  Let *envRec* be the object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *bindings* be the binding object for *envRec*.
3.  Return *bindings*.\[\[Delete\]\](*N*).

<span id="sec-8.1.1.2.8" class="secnum">[8.1.1.2.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-environment-records-hasthisbinding "link to this section")</span> HasThisBinding ()
========================================================================================================================================================================================================

Regular object Environment Records do not provide a `this` binding.

1.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.2.9" class="secnum">[8.1.1.2.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-environment-records-hassuperbinding "link to this section")</span> HasSuperBinding ()
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

Regular object EnvironmentRecords do not provide a `super` binding.

1.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.2.10" class="secnum">[8.1.1.2.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-environment-records-withbaseobject "link to this section")</span> WithBaseObject()
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================

Object Environment Records return **undefined** as their WithBaseObject unless their withEnvironment flag is **true**.

1.  Let *envRec* be the object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  If the *withEnvironment* flag of *envRec* is **true**, return the binding object for *envRec*.
3.  Otherwise, return **undefined**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.3" class="secnum">[8.1.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-environment-records "link to this section")</span> Function Environment Records
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

A function [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) is a declarative [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) that is used to represent the top-level scope of a function and, if the function is not an *ArrowFunction*, provides a `this` binding. If a function is not an *ArrowFunction* function and references `super`, its function [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) also contains the state that is used to perform `super` method invocations from within the function.

Function Environment Records have the additional state fields listed in [Table 16](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-16).

<span id="table-16">Table 16</span> — Additional Fields of Function Environment Records
| Field Name                | Value                                             | Meaning                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|---------------------------|---------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| \[\[thisValue\]\]         | Any                                               | This is the <span class="value">this</span> value used for this invocation of the function.                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| \[\[thisBindingStatus\]\] | `"lexical"` | `"initialized"` | `"uninitialized"` | If the value is `"lexical"`, this is an *ArrowFunction* and does not have a local this value.                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| \[\[FunctionObject\]\]    | Object                                            | The function Object whose invocation caused this [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) to be created.                                                                                                                                          |
| \[\[HomeObject\]\]        | Object | **undefined**                            | If the associated function has `super` property accesses and is not an *ArrowFunction*, \[\[HomeObject\]\] is the object that the function is bound to as a method. The default value for \[\[HomeObject\]\] is <span class="value">undefined</span>.                                                        |
| \[\[NewTarget\]\]         | Object | **undefined**                            | If this [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) was created by the \[\[Construct\]\] internal method, \[\[NewTarget\]\] is the value of the \[\[Construct\]\] newTarget parameter. Otherwise, its value is <span class="value">undefined</span>. |

Function Environment Records support all of the declarative Environment Record methods listed in [Table 15](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-15) and share the same specifications for all of those methods except for HasThisBinding and HasSuperBinding. In addition, function Environment Records support the methods listed in [Table 17](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-17):

<span id="table-17">Table 17</span> — Additional Methods of Function Environment Records
| Method                                                                                      | Purpose                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| [BindThisValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bindthisvalue)(V) | Set the \[\[thisValue\]\] and record that it has been initialized.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| GetThisBinding()                                                                            | Return the value of this [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records)’s `this` binding. Throws a <span class="value">ReferenceError</span> if the `this` binding has not been initialized.                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| [GetSuperBase](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getsuperbase)()    | Return the object that is the base for `super` property accesses bound in this [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records). The object is derived from this [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records)’s \[\[HomeObject\]\] field. The value <span class="value">undefined</span> indicates that `super` property accesses will produce runtime errors. |

The behaviour of the additional concrete specification methods for function Environment Records is defined by the following algorithms:

<span id="sec-8.1.1.3.1" class="secnum">[8.1.1.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bindthisvalue "link to this section")</span> BindThisValue(V)
===========================================================================================================================================================================

1.  Let *envRec* be the function [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *envRec*.\[\[thisBindingStatus\]\] is not `"lexical"`.
3.  If *envRec*.\[\[thisBindingStatus\]\] is `"initialized"`, throw a **ReferenceError** exception.
4.  Set *envRec*.\[\[thisValue\]\] to *V*.
5.  Set *envRec*.\[\[thisBindingStatus\]\] to `"initialized"`.
6.  Return *V*.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.3.2" class="secnum">[8.1.1.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-environment-records-hasthisbinding "link to this section")</span> HasThisBinding ()
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

1.  Let *envRec* be the function [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  If *envRec*.\[\[thisBindingStatus\]\] is `"lexical"`, return **false**; otherwise, return **true**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.3.3" class="secnum">[8.1.1.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-environment-records-hassuperbinding "link to this section")</span> HasSuperBinding ()
============================================================================================================================================================================================================

1.  Let *envRec* be the function [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  If *envRec*.\[\[thisBindingStatus\]\] is `"lexical"`, return **false**.
3.  If *envRec*.\[\[HomeObject\]\] has the value **undefined**, return **false**, otherwise, return **true**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.3.4" class="secnum">[8.1.1.3.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-environment-records-getthisbinding "link to this section")</span> GetThisBinding ()
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

1.  Let *envRec* be the function [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *envRec*.\[\[thisBindingStatus\]\] is not `"lexical"`.
3.  If *envRec*.\[\[thisBindingStatus\]\] is `"uninitialized"`, throw a **ReferenceError** exception.
4.  Return *envRec*.\[\[thisValue\]\].

<span id="sec-8.1.1.3.5" class="secnum">[8.1.1.3.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getsuperbase "link to this section")</span> GetSuperBase ()
=========================================================================================================================================================================

1.  Let *envRec* be the function [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *home* be the value of *envRec*.\[\[HomeObject\]\].
3.  If *home* has the value **undefined**, return **undefined**.
4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*home*) is Object.
5.  Return *home.*\[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\]().

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-environment-records "link to this section")</span> Global Environment Records
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

A global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) is used to represent the outer most scope that is shared by all of the ECMAScript *Script* elements that are processed in a common [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) ([8.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms)). A global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) provides the bindings for built-in globals ([clause 18](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-object)), properties of the global object, and for all top-level declarations ([13.1.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-block-static-semantics-toplevellexicallyscopeddeclarations), [13.1.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-block-static-semantics-toplevelvarscopeddeclarations)) that occur within a *Script*.

A global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) is logically a single record but it is specified as a composite encapsulating an object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) and a declarative [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records). The object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) has as its base object the global object of the associated [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms). This global object is the value returned by the global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records)’s GetThisBinding concrete method. The object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) component of a global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) contains the bindings for all built-in globals ([clause 18](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-object)) and all bindings introduced by a <span style="font-family: Times New
          Roman">*FunctionDeclaration*, *GeneratorDeclaration*</span>, or *VariableStatement* contained in global code. The bindings for all other ECMAScript declarations in global code are contained in the declarative [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) component of the global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records).

Properties may be created directly on a global object. Hence, the object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) component of a global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) may contain both bindings created explicitly by <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*FunctionDeclaration*, *GeneratorDeclaration*</span>, or *VariableDeclaration* declarations and binding created implicitly as properties of the global object. In order to identify which bindings were explicitly created using declarations, a global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) maintains a list of the names bound using its CreateGlobalVarBindings and CreateGlobalFunctionBindings concrete methods.

Global Environment Records have the additional fields listed in [Table 18](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-18) and the additional methods listed in [Table 19](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-19).

<span id="table-18">Table 18</span> — Additional Fields of Global Environment Records
| Field Name                | Value                                                                                                                       | Meaning                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|---------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| \[\[ObjectRecord\]\]      | [Object Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-environment-records)           | Binding object is the global object. It contains global built-in bindings as well as <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*FunctionDeclaration*, *GeneratorDeclaration*</span>, and *VariableDeclaration* bindings in global code for the associated [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms). |
| \[\[DeclarativeRecord\]\] | [Declarative Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-declarative-environment-records) | Contains bindings for all declarations in global code for the associated [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) code except for <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*FunctionDeclaration*, *GeneratorDeclaration*</span>, and *VariableDeclaration* bindings.                               |
| \[\[VarNames\]\]          | [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of String              | The string names bound by <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*FunctionDeclaration*, *GeneratorDeclaration*</span>, and *VariableDeclaration* declarations in global code for the associated [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms).                                                        |

<span id="table-19">Table 19</span> — Additional Methods of Global Environment Records
| Method                                                                                                                        | Purpose                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| GetThisBinding()                                                                                                              | Return the value of this [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records)’s `this` binding.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| [HasVarDeclaration](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasvardeclaration) (N)                          | Determines if the argument identifier has a binding in this [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) that was created using a <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*VariableDeclaration*,</span> *FunctionDeclaration*, or <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*GeneratorDeclaration*.</span>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| [HasLexicalDeclaration](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-haslexicaldeclaration) (N)                  | Determines if the argument identifier has a binding in this [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) that was created using a lexical declaration such as a *LexicalDeclaration* or a *ClassDeclaration*.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| [HasRestrictedGlobalProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasrestrictedglobalproperty) (N)      | Determines if the argument is the name of a global object property that may not be shadowed by a global lexically binding.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| [CanDeclareGlobalVar](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-candeclareglobalvar) (N)                      | Determines if a corresponding [CreateGlobalVarBinding](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createglobalvarbinding) call would succeed if called for the same argument N.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| [CanDeclareGlobalFunction](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-candeclareglobalfunction) (N)            | Determines if a corresponding [CreateGlobalFunctionBinding](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createglobalfunctionbinding) call would succeed if called for the same argument N.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| [CreateGlobalVarBinding](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createglobalvarbinding)(N, D)              | Used to create and initialize to **undefined** a global `var` binding in the \[\[ObjectRecord\]\] component of a global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records). The binding will be a mutable binding. The corresponding global object property will have attribute values appropriate for a `var`. The String value N is the bound name. If D is **true** the binding may be deleted. Logically equivalent to CreateMutableBinding followed by a SetMutableBinding but it allows var declarations to receive special treatment.                                                         |
| [CreateGlobalFunctionBinding](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createglobalfunctionbinding)(N, V, D) | Create and initialize a global `function` binding in the \[\[ObjectRecord\]\] component of a global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records). The binding will be a mutable binding. The corresponding global object property will have attribute values appropriate for a `function`. The String value N is the bound name. *V* is the initialization value. If the optional Boolean argument D is **true** the binding is may be deleted. Logically equivalent to CreateMutableBinding followed by a SetMutableBinding but it allows function declarations to receive special treatment. |

The behaviour of the concrete specification methods for global Environment Records is defined by the following algorithms.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4.1" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-environment-records-hasbinding-n "link to this section")</span> HasBinding(N)
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method HasBinding for global Environment Records simply determines if the argument identifier is one of the identifiers bound by the record:

1.  Let *envRec* be the global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *DclRec* be *envRec*.\[\[DeclarativeRecord\]\].
3.  If *DclRec.*HasBinding(*N*) is **true**, return **true**.
4.  Let *ObjRec* be *envRec*.\[\[ObjectRecord\]\].
5.  Return *ObjRec.*HasBinding(*N*).

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4.2" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-environment-records-createmutablebinding-n-d "link to this section")</span> CreateMutableBinding (N, D)
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method CreateMutableBinding for global Environment Records creates a new mutable binding for the name N that is uninitialized. The binding is created in the associated DeclarativeRecord. A binding for N must not already exist in the DeclarativeRecord. If Boolean argument D is provided and has the value **true** the new binding is marked as being subject to deletion.

1.  Let *envRec* be the global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *DclRec* be *envRec*.\[\[DeclarativeRecord\]\].
3.  If *DclRec*.HasBinding(*N*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Return *DclRec*.CreateMutableBinding(*N*, *D*).

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4.3" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-environment-records-createimmutablebinding-n-s "link to this section")</span> CreateImmutableBinding (N, S)
================================================================================================================================================================================================================================
