The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method CreateImmutableBinding for global Environment Records creates a new immutable binding for the name N that is uninitialized. A binding must not already exist in this [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for N. If Boolean argument S is provided and has the value **true** the new binding is marked as a strict binding.

1.  Let *envRec* be the global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *DclRec* be *envRec*.\[\[DeclarativeRecord\]\].
3.  If *DclRec*.HasBinding(*N*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Return *DclRec*.CreateImmutableBinding(*N*, *S*).

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4.4" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-environment-records-initializebinding-n-v "link to this section")</span> InitializeBinding (N,V)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method InitializeBinding for global Environment Records is used to set the bound value of the current binding of the identifier whose name is the value of the argument N to the value of argument V. An uninitialized binding for N must already exist.

1.  Let *envRec* be the global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *DclRec* be *envRec*.\[\[DeclarativeRecord\]\].
3.  If *DclRec.*HasBinding(*N*) is **true**, then
    1.  Return *DclRec*.InitializeBinding(*N*, *V*).

4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): If the binding exists it must be in the object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records).
5.  Let *ObjRec* be *envRec*.\[\[ObjectRecord\]\].
6.  Return *ObjRec.*InitializeBinding(*N*, *V*).

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4.5" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-environment-records-setmutablebinding-n-v-s "link to this section")</span> SetMutableBinding (N,V,S)
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method SetMutableBinding for global Environment Records attempts to change the bound value of the current binding of the identifier whose name is the value of the argument N to the value of argument V. If the binding is an immutable binding, a **TypeError** is thrown if <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">S</span> is <span class="value">true</span>. A property named N normally already exists but if it does not or is not currently writable, error handling is determined by the value of the Boolean argument S.

1.  Let *envRec* be the global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *DclRec* be *envRec*.\[\[DeclarativeRecord\]\].
3.  If *DclRec.*HasBinding(*N*) is **true**, then
    1.  Return *DclRec.*SetMutableBinding(*N*, *V*, *S*).

4.  Let *ObjRec* be *envRec*.\[\[ObjectRecord\]\].
5.  Return *ObjRec*.SetMutableBinding(*N*, *V*, *S*).

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4.6" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-environment-records-getbindingvalue-n-s "link to this section")</span> GetBindingValue(N,S)
================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method GetBindingValue for global Environment Records returns the value of its bound identifier whose name is the value of the argument N. If the binding is an uninitialized binding throw a **ReferenceError** exception. A property named N normally already exists but if it does not or is not currently writable, error handling is determined by the value of the Boolean argument S.

1.  Let *envRec* be the global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *DclRec* be *envRec*.\[\[DeclarativeRecord\]\].
3.  If *DclRec.*HasBinding(*N*) is **true**, then
    1.  Return *DclRec.*GetBindingValue(*N*, *S*).

4.  Let *ObjRec* be *envRec*.\[\[ObjectRecord\]\].
5.  Return *ObjRec*.GetBindingValue(*N*, *S*).

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4.7" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-environment-records-deletebinding-n "link to this section")</span> DeleteBinding (N)
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method DeleteBinding for global Environment Records can only delete bindings that have been explicitly designated as being subject to deletion.

1.  Let *envRec* be the global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *DclRec* be *envRec*.\[\[DeclarativeRecord\]\].
3.  If *DclRec.*HasBinding(*N*) is **true**, then
    1.  Return *DclRec.*DeleteBinding(*N*).

4.  Let *ObjRec* be *envRec*.\[\[ObjectRecord\]\].
5.  Let *globalObject* be the binding object for *ObjRec*.
6.  Let *existingProp* be [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty)(*globalObject*, *N*).
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*existingProp*).
8.  If *existingProp* is **true**, then
    1.  Let *status* be *ObjRec.*DeleteBinding(*N*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
    3.  If *status* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *varNames* be *envRec*.\[\[VarNames\]\].
        2.  If *N* is an element of *varNames*, remove that element from the *varNames*.

    4.  Return *status*.

9.  Return **true**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4.8" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-environment-records-hasthisbinding "link to this section")</span> HasThisBinding ()
========================================================================================================================================================================================================

[Global Environment Records](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-environment-records) always provide a `this` binding whose value is the associated global object.

1.  Return **true**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4.9" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-environment-records-hassuperbinding "link to this section")</span> HasSuperBinding ()
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

1.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4.10" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-environment-records-withbaseobject "link to this section")</span> WithBaseObject()
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================

[Global Environment Records](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-environment-records) always return **undefined** as their WithBaseObject.

1.  Return **undefined**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4.11" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-environment-records-getthisbinding "link to this section")</span> GetThisBinding ()
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

1.  Let *envRec* be the global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *ObjRec* be *envRec*.\[\[ObjectRecord\]\].
3.  Let *bindings* be the binding object for *ObjRec*.
4.  Return *bindings*.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4.12" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasvardeclaration "link to this section")</span> HasVarDeclaration (N)
======================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method HasVarDeclaration for global Environment Records determines if the argument identifier has a binding in this record that was created using a *VariableStatement* or a <span class="prod">*FunctionDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span></span>

1.  Let *envRec* be the global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *varDeclaredNames* be *envRec*.\[\[VarNames\]\].
3.  If *varDeclaredNames* contains the value of *N*, return **true**.
4.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4.13" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-haslexicaldeclaration "link to this section")</span> HasLexicalDeclaration (N)
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method HasLexicalDeclaration for global Environment Records determines if the argument identifier has a binding in this record that was created using a lexical declaration such as a *LexicalDeclaration* or a <span class="prod">*ClassDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span></span>

1.  Let *envRec* be the global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *DclRec* be *envRec*.\[\[DeclarativeRecord\]\].
3.  Return *DclRec.*HasBinding(*N*).

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4.14" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasrestrictedglobalproperty "link to this section")</span> HasRestrictedGlobalProperty (N)
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method HasRestrictedGlobalProperty for global Environment Records determines if the argument identifier is the name of a property of the global object that must not be shadowed by a global lexically binding:

1.  Let *envRec* be the global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *ObjRec* be *envRec*.\[\[ObjectRecord\]\].
3.  Let *globalObject* be the binding object for *ObjRec*.
4.  Let *existingProp* be *globalObject*.\[\[GetOwnProperty\]\](*N*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*existingProp*).
6.  If *existingProp* is **undefined**, return **false**.
7.  If *existingProp*.\[\[Configurable\]\] is **true**, return **false**.
8.  Return **true**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Properties may exist upon a global object that were directly created rather than being declared using a var or function declaration. A global lexical binding may not be created that has the same name as a non-configurable property of the global object. The global property `undefined` is an example of such a property.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4.15" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4.15](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-candeclareglobalvar "link to this section")</span> CanDeclareGlobalVar (N)
==========================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method CanDeclareGlobalVar for global Environment Records determines if a corresponding [CreateGlobalVarBinding](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createglobalvarbinding) call would succeed if called for the same argument N. Redundant var declarations and var declarations for pre-existing global object properties are allowed.

1.  Let *envRec* be the global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *ObjRec* be *envRec*.\[\[ObjectRecord\]\].
3.  Let *globalObject* be the binding object for *ObjRec*.
4.  Let *hasProperty* be [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty)(*globalObject, N*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*hasProperty*).
6.  If *hasProperty* is **true**, return **true**.
7.  Return [IsExtensible](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isextensible-o)(*globalObject*).

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4.16" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4.16](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-candeclareglobalfunction "link to this section")</span> CanDeclareGlobalFunction (N)
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method CanDeclareGlobalFunction for global Environment Records determines if a corresponding [CreateGlobalFunctionBinding](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createglobalfunctionbinding) call would succeed if called for the same argument N.

1.  Let *envRec* be the global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *ObjRec* be *envRec*.\[\[ObjectRecord\]\].
3.  Let *globalObject* be the binding object for *ObjRec*.
4.  Let *existingProp* be *globalObject*.\[\[GetOwnProperty\]\](*N*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*existingProp*).
6.  If *existingProp* is **undefined**, return [IsExtensible](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isextensible-o)(*globalObject*).
7.  If *existingProp*.\[\[Configurable\]\] is **true**, return **true**.
8.  If [IsDataDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdatadescriptor)(*existingProp*) is **true** and *existingProp* has attribute values {\[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **true**}, return **true**.
9.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4.17" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4.17](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createglobalvarbinding "link to this section")</span> CreateGlobalVarBinding (N, D)
===================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method CreateGlobalVarBinding for global Environment Records creates and initializes a mutable binding in the associated object Environment Record and records the bound name in the associated \[\[VarNames\]\] [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type). If a binding already exists, it is reused and assumed to be initialized.

1.  Let *envRec* be the global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *ObjRec* be *envRec*.\[\[ObjectRecord\]\].
3.  Let *globalObject* be the binding object for *ObjRec*.
4.  Let *hasProperty* be [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty)(*globalObject, N*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*hasProperty*).
6.  Let *extensible* be [IsExtensible](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isextensible-o)(*globalObject*).
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*extensible*).
8.  If *hasProperty* is **false** and *extensible* is **true**, then
    1.  Let *status* be *ObjRec.*CreateMutableBinding(*N*, *D*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
    3.  Let *status* be *ObjRec.*InitializeBinding(*N*, **undefined**).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).

9.  Let *varDeclaredNames* be *envRec*.\[\[VarNames\]\].
10. If *varDeclaredNames* does not contain the value of *N*, then
    1.  Append *N* to *varDeclaredNames*.

11. Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family:
                    sans-serif">empty</span>).

<span id="sec-8.1.1.4.18" class="secnum">[8.1.1.4.18](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createglobalfunctionbinding "link to this section")</span> CreateGlobalFunctionBinding (N, V, D)
================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method CreateGlobalFunctionBinding for global Environment Records creates and initializes a mutable binding in the associated object Environment Record and records the bound name in the associated \[\[VarNames\]\] [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type). If a binding already exists, it is replaced.

1.  Let *envRec* be the global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  Let *ObjRec* be *envRec*.\[\[ObjectRecord\]\].
3.  Let *globalObject* be the binding object for *ObjRec*.
4.  Let *existingProp* be *globalObject*.\[\[GetOwnProperty\]\](*N*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*existingProp*).
6.  If *existingProp* is **undefined** or *existingProp*.\[\[Configurable\]\] is **true**, then
    1.  Let *desc* be the PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]:*V*, \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **true** , \[\[Configurable\]\]: *D*}.

7.  Else,
    1.  Let *desc* be the PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]:*V* }.

8.  Let *status* be [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*globalObject*, *N*, *desc*).
9.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
10. Let *status* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*globalObject*, *N*, *V*, **false**).
11. Record that the binding for *N* in *ObjRec* has been initialized.
12. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
13. Let *varDeclaredNames* be *envRec*.\[\[VarNames\]\].
14. If *varDeclaredNames* does not contain the value of *N*, then
    1.  Append *N* to *varDeclaredNames*.

15. Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family:
                    sans-serif">empty</span>).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Global function declarations are always represented as own properties of the global object. If possible, an existing own property is reconfigured to have a standard set of attribute values. Steps 10-12 are equivalent to what calling the InitializeBinding concrete method would do and if *globalObject* is a Proxy will produce the same sequence of Proxy trap calls.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.5" class="secnum">[8.1.1.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-environment-records "link to this section")</span> Module Environment Records
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

A module [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) is a declarative [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) that is used to represent the outer scope of an ECMAScript *Module*. In additional to normal mutable and immutable bindings, module Environment Records also provide immutable import bindings which are bindings that provide indirect access to a target binding that exists in another Environment Record.

Module Environment Records support all of the declarative Environment Record methods listed in [Table 15](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-15) and share the same specifications for all of those methods except for GetBindingValue, DeleteBinding, HasThisBinding and GetThisBinding. In addition, module Environment Records support the methods listed in [Table 20](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-20):

<span id="table-20">Table 20</span> — Additional Methods of Module Environment Records
| Method                                                                                                          | Purpose                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| [CreateImportBinding](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createimportbinding)(N, M, N2 ) | Create an immutable indirect binding in a module [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records). The String value N is the text of the bound name. M is a [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) ([see 15.2.1.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations)), and N2 is a binding that exists in M’s module [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records). |
| GetThisBinding()                                                                                                | Return the value of this [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records)’s `this` binding.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |

The behaviour of the additional concrete specification methods for module Environment Records are defined by the following algorithms:

<span id="sec-8.1.1.5.1" class="secnum">[8.1.1.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-environment-records-getbindingvalue-n-s "link to this section")</span> GetBindingValue(N,S)
================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method GetBindingValue for module Environment Records returns the value of its bound identifier whose name is the value of the argument N. However, if the binding is an indirect binding the value of the target binding is returned. If the binding exists but is uninitialized a <span class="value">ReferenceError</span> is thrown, regardless of the value of *<span style="font-family: Times New
          Roman">S</span>.*

1.  Let *envRec* be the module [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *envRec* has a binding for *N*.
3.  If the binding for *N* is an indirect binding, then
    1.  Let *M* and *N2* be the indirection values provided when this binding for *N* was created.
    2.  Let *targetEnv* be *M*.\[\[Environment\]\].
    3.  If *targetEnv* is **undefined**, throw a **ReferenceError** exception.
    4.  Let *targetER* be *targetEnv*’s [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
    5.  Return *targetER*.GetBindingValue(*N2*, *S*).

4.  If the binding for *N* in *envRec* is an uninitialized binding, throw a **ReferenceError** exception.
5.  Return the value currently bound to *N* in *envRec*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Because a *Module* is always [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), calls to GetBindingValue should always pass **true** <span style="font-family: sans-serif">as</span> <span style="font-family: sans-serif">the value of</span> *S*.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.5.2" class="secnum">[8.1.1.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-environment-records-deletebinding-n "link to this section")</span> DeleteBinding (N)
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method DeleteBinding for module Environment Records refuses to delete bindings.

1.  Let *envRec* be the module [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  If *envRec* does not have a binding for the name that is the value of *N*, return **true**.
3.  Return **false**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Because the bindings of a module [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) are not deletable.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.5.3" class="secnum">[8.1.1.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-environment-records-hasthisbinding "link to this section")</span> HasThisBinding ()
========================================================================================================================================================================================================

Module Environment Records provide a `this` binding.

1.  Return **true**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.5.4" class="secnum">[8.1.1.5.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-environment-records-getthisbinding "link to this section")</span> GetThisBinding ()
========================================================================================================================================================================================================

1.  Return **undefined**.

<span id="sec-8.1.1.5.5" class="secnum">[8.1.1.5.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createimportbinding "link to this section")</span> CreateImportBinding (N, M, N2)
===============================================================================================================================================================================================

The concrete [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) method CreateImportBinding for module Environment Records creates a new initialized immutable indirect binding for the name N. A binding must not already exist in this [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for N. M is a [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) ([see 15.2.1.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations)), and N2 is the name of a binding that exists in M’s module [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records). Accesses to the value of the new binding will indirectly access the bound value of value of the target binding.

1.  Let *envRec* be the module [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for which the method was invoked.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *envRec* does not already have a binding for *N*.
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *M* is a [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records).
4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): When *M*.\[\[Environment\]\] is instantiated it will have a direct binding for *N2*.
5.  Create an immutable indirect binding in *envRec* for *N* that references *M* and *N2* as its target binding and record that the binding is initialized.
6.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family:
                    sans-serif">empty</span>).

<span id="sec-8.1.2" class="secnum">[8.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environment-operations "link to this section")</span> Lexical Environment Operations
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

The following abstract operations are used in this specification to operate upon lexical environments:

<span id="sec-8.1.2.1" class="secnum">[8.1.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getidentifierreference "link to this section")</span> GetIdentifierReference (lex, name, strict)
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation GetIdentifierReference is called with a [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) lex, a String name, and a Boolean flag strict. The value of lex may be **null**. When called, the following steps are performed:

1.  If *lex* is the value **null**, then
    1.  Return a value of type [Reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type) whose base value is **undefined**, whose referenced name is *name*, and whose strict reference flag is *strict*.

2.  Let *envRec* be *lex*’s [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
3.  Let *exists* be *envRec*.HasBinding(*name*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*exists*).
5.  If *exists* is **true**, then
    1.  Return a value of type [Reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type) whose base value is *envRec*, whose referenced name is *name*, and whose strict reference flag is *strict.*

6.  Else
    1.  Let *outer* be the value of *lex’s* [outer environment reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
    2.  Return GetIdentifierReference(*outer*, *name*, *strict*).

<span id="sec-8.1.2.2" class="secnum">[8.1.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newdeclarativeenvironment "link to this section")</span> NewDeclarativeEnvironment (E)
================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation NewDeclarativeEnvironment is called with a [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) as argument E the following steps are performed:

1.  Let *env* be a new [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
2.  Let *envRec* be a new declarative [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) containing no bindings.
3.  Set *env’s* [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) to be *envRec*.
4.  Set the [outer lexical environment reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) of *env* to *E*.
5.  Return *env*.

<span id="sec-8.1.2.3" class="secnum">[8.1.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newobjectenvironment "link to this section")</span> NewObjectEnvironment (O, E)
=========================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation NewObjectEnvironment is called with an Object O and a [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) E as arguments, the following steps are performed:

1.  Let *env* be a new [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
2.  Let *envRec* be a new object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) containing *O* as the binding object.
3.  Set *env’s* [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) to *envRec*.
4.  Set the [outer lexical environment reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) of *env* to *E*.
5.  Return *env*.

<span id="sec-8.1.2.4" class="secnum">[8.1.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newfunctionenvironment "link to this section")</span> NewFunctionEnvironment ( F, newTarget )
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation NewFunctionEnvironment is called with arguments F and newTarget the following steps are performed:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *F* is an ECMAScript function.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*newTarget*) is Undefined or Object.
3.  Let *env* be a new [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
4.  Let *envRec* be a new function [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) containing no bindings.
5.  Set *envRec*.\[\[FunctionObject\]\] to *F*.
6.  If *F’s* \[\[ThisMode\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">lexical</span>, set *envRec*.\[\[thisBindingStatus\]\] to `"lexical"`.
7.  Else, Set *envRec*.\[\[thisBindingStatus\]\] to `"uninitialized"`.
8.  Let *home* be the value of *F’s* \[\[HomeObject\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
9.  Set *envRec*.\[\[HomeObject\]\] to *home*.
10. Set *envRec*.\[\[NewTarget\]\] to *newTarget*.
11. Set *env’s* [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) to be *envRec*.
12. Set the [outer lexical environment reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) of *env* to the value of *F’s* \[\[Environment\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
13. Return *env*.

<span id="sec-8.1.2.5" class="secnum">[8.1.2.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newglobalenvironment "link to this section")</span> NewGlobalEnvironment ( G )
========================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation NewGlobalEnvironment is called with an ECMAScript Object G as its argument, the following steps are performed:

1.  Let *env* be a new [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
2.  Let *objRec* be a new object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) containing *G* as the binding object.
3.  Let *dclRec* be a new declarative [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) containing no bindings.
4.  Let *globalRec* be a new global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records).
5.  Set *globalRec*.\[\[ObjectRecord\]\] to *objRec*.
6.  Set *globalRec*.\[\[DeclarativeRecord\]\] to *dclRec*.
7.  Set *globalRec*.\[\[VarNames\]\] to a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
8.  Set *env’s* [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) to *globalRec*.
9.  Set the [outer lexical environment reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) of *env* to **null**
10. Return *env*.

<span id="sec-8.1.2.6" class="secnum">[8.1.2.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newmoduleenvironment "link to this section")</span> NewModuleEnvironment (E)
======================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation NewModuleEnvironment is called with a [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) argument E the following steps are performed:

1.  Let *env* be a new [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
2.  Let *envRec* be a new module [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) containing no bindings.
3.  Set *env’s* [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) to be *envRec*.
4.  Set the [outer lexical environment reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) of *env* to *E*.
5.  Return *env*.

<span id="sec-8.2" class="secnum">[8.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms "link to this section")</span> Code Realms
========================================================================================================================================================

Before it is evaluated, all ECMAScript code must be associated with a *Realm*. Conceptually, a realm consists of a set of intrinsic objects, an ECMAScript global environment, all of the ECMAScript code that is loaded within the scope of that global environment, and other associated state and resources.

A Realm is specified as a Record with the fields specified in [Table 21](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-21):

<span id="table-21">Table 21</span> — Realm Record Fields
| Field Name          | Value                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | Meaning                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|---------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| \[\[intrinsics\]\]  | Record whose field names are intrinsic keys and whose values are objects                                                                                                                                                                                          | These are the intrinsic values used by code associated with this Realm                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| \[\[globalThis\]\]  | Object                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | The global object for this Realm                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| \[\[globalEnv\]\]   | [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments)                                                                                                                                                             | The global environment for this Realm                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| \[\[templateMap\]\] | A [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of Record { \[\[strings\]\]: [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type), \[\[array\]\]: Object}. | Template objects are canonicalized separately for each Realm using its \[\[templateMap\]\]. Each \[\[strings\]\] value is a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing, in source text order, the raw string values of a *TemplateLiteral* that has been evaluated. The associated \[\[array\]\] value is the corresponding template object that is passed to a tag function. |

An implementation may define other, implementation specific fields.

<span id="sec-8.2.1" class="secnum">[8.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createrealm "link to this section")</span> CreateRealm ( )
================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation CreateRealm with no arguments performs the following steps:

1.  Let *realmRec* be a new Record.
2.  Perform [CreateIntrinsics](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createintrinsics)(*realmRec*).
3.  Set *realmRec*.\[\[globalThis\]\] to **undefined**.
4.  Set *realmRec*.\[\[globalEnv\]\] to **undefined**.
5.  Set *realmRec*.\[\[templateMap\]\] to a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
6.  Return *realmRec*.

<span id="sec-8.2.2" class="secnum">[8.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createintrinsics "link to this section")</span> CreateIntrinsics ( realmRec )
===================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation CreateIntrinsics with argument realmRec performs the following steps:

1.  Let *intrinsics* be a new Record.
2.  Set *realmRec*.\[\[intrinsics\]\] to *intrinsics*.
3.  Let *objProto* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(**null**).
4.  Set *intrinsics*.\[\[%ObjectPrototype%\]\] to *objProto*.
5.  Let *throwerSteps* be the algorithm steps specified in [9.2.7.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%throwtypeerror%) for the [%ThrowTypeError%](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%throwtypeerror%) function.
6.  Let *thrower* be [CreateBuiltinFunction](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createbuiltinfunction)(*realmRec*, *throwerSteps*, **null**).
7.  Set *intrinsics*.\[\[<span style="font-family: sans-serif">[%ThrowTypeError%](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%throwtypeerror%)</span>\]\] to *thrower*.
8.  Let *noSteps* be an empty sequence of algorithm steps.
9.  Let *funcProto* be [CreateBuiltinFunction](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createbuiltinfunction)(*realmRec*, *noSteps*, *objProto*).
10. Set *intrinsics*.\[\[%FunctionPrototype%\]\] to *funcProto*.
11. [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *thrower*.\[\[SetPrototypeOf\]\](*funcProto*).
12. Perform [AddRestrictedFunctionProperties](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-addrestrictedfunctionproperties)(*funcProto*, *realmRec*).
13. Set fields of *intrinsics* with the values listed in [Table 7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-7) that have not already been handled above. The field names are the names listed in column one of the table. The value of each field is a new object value fully and recursively populated with property values as defined by the specification of each object in clauses 18-26. All object property values are newly created object values. All values that are built-in function objects are created by performing [CreateBuiltinFunction](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createbuiltinfunction)(*realmRec*, &lt;steps&gt;, &lt;prototype&gt;, &lt;slots&gt;) where &lt;steps&gt; is the definition of that function provided by this specification, &lt;prototype&gt; is the specified value of the function’s \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) and &lt;slots&gt; is a list of the names, if any, of the functions specified internal slots. The creation of the intrinsics and their properties must be ordered to avoid any dependencies upon objects that have not yet been created.
14. Return *intrinsics*.

<span id="sec-8.2.3" class="secnum">[8.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setrealmglobalobject "link to this section")</span> SetRealmGlobalObject ( realmRec, globalObj )
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation SetRealmGlobalObject with arguments realmRec and globalObj performs the following steps:

1.  If *globalObj* is **undefined**, then
    1.  Let *intrinsics* be *realmRec*.\[\[intrinsics\]\].
    2.  Let *globalObj* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(*intrinsics*.\[\[%ObjectPrototype%\]\]).

2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*globalObj*) is Object.
3.  Set *realmRec*.\[\[globalThis\]\] to *globalObj*.
4.  Let *newGlobalEnv* be [NewGlobalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newglobalenvironment)(*globalObj*).
5.  Set *realmRec*.\[\[globalEnv\]\] to *newGlobalEnv*.
6.  Return *realmRec*.

<span id="sec-8.2.4" class="secnum">[8.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setdefaultglobalbindings "link to this section")</span> SetDefaultGlobalBindings ( realmRec )
===================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation SetDefaultGlobalBindings with argument realmRec performs the following steps:

1.  Let *global* be *realmRec*.\[\[globalThis\]\].
2.  For each property of the Global Object specified in [clause 18](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-object), do
    1.  Let *name* be the string value of the property name.
    2.  Let *desc* be the fully populated data property descriptor for the property containing the specified attributes for the property. For properties listed in [18.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-properties-of-the-global-object), [18.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-constructor-properties-of-the-global-object), or [18.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-other-properties-of-the-global-object) the value of the \[\[Value\]\] attribute is the corresponding intrinsic object from *realmRec*.
    3.  Let *status* be [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*global*, *name*, *desc*).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).

3.  Return *global*.

<span id="sec-8.3" class="secnum">[8.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts "link to this section")</span> Execution Contexts
======================================================================================================================================================================

An *execution context* is a specification device that is used to track the runtime evaluation of code by an ECMAScript implementation. At any point in time, there is at most one execution context that is actually executing code. This is known as the *running* execution context. A stack is used to track execution contexts. The running execution context is always the top element of this stack. A new execution context is created whenever control is transferred from the executable code associated with the currently running execution context to executable code that is not associated with that execution context. The newly created execution context is pushed onto the stack and becomes the running execution context.

An execution context contains whatever implementation specific state is necessary to track the execution progress of its associated code. Each execution context has at least the state components listed in [Table 22](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-22).

<span id="table-22">Table 22</span> —State Components for All Execution Contexts
| Component                                                                      | Purpose                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| code evaluation state                                                          | Any state needed to perform, suspend, and resume evaluation of the code associated with this execution context.                                                                                                                                 |
| Function                                                                       | If this execution context is evaluating the code of a function object, then the value of this component is that function object. If the context is evaluating the code of a *Script* or *Module*, the value is <span class="value">null</span>. |
| [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) | The [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) from which associated code accesses ECMAScript resources.                                                                                                    |

Evaluation of code by the running execution context may be suspended at various points defined within this specification. Once the running execution context has been suspended a different execution context may become the running execution context and commence evaluating its code. At some later time a suspended execution context may again become the running execution context and continue evaluating its code at the point where it had previously been suspended. Transition of the running execution context status among execution contexts usually occurs in stack-like last-in/first-out manner. However, some ECMAScript features require non-LIFO transitions of the running execution context.

The value of the [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) component of the running execution context is also called the *current [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms)*. The value of the Function component of the running execution context is also called the *active function object.*

Execution contexts for ECMAScript code have the additional state components listed in [Table 23](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-23).

<span id="table-23">Table 23</span> — Additional State Components for ECMAScript Code Execution Contexts
| Component           | Purpose                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|---------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| LexicalEnvironment  | Identifies the [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) used to resolve identifier references made by code within this execution context.                                                                                                       |
| VariableEnvironment | Identifies the [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) whose [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) holds bindings created by *VariableStatements* within this execution context. |

The LexicalEnvironment and VariableEnvironment components of an execution context are always Lexical Environments. When an execution context is created its LexicalEnvironment and VariableEnvironment components initially have the same value.

Execution contexts representing the evaluation of generator objects have the additional state components listed in [Table 24](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-24).

<span id="table-24">Table 24</span> — Additional State Components for Generator Execution Contexts
| Component | Purpose                                                        |
|-----------|----------------------------------------------------------------|
| Generator | The GeneratorObject that this execution context is evaluating. |

In most situations only the running execution context (the top of the execution context stack) is directly manipulated by algorithms within this specification. Hence when the terms “LexicalEnvironment”, and “VariableEnvironment” are used without qualification they are in reference to those components of the running execution context.

An execution context is purely a specification mechanism and need not correspond to any particular artefact of an ECMAScript implementation. It is impossible for ECMAScript code to directly access or observe an execution context.

<span id="sec-8.3.1" class="secnum">[8.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-resolvebinding "link to this section")</span> ResolveBinding ( name, \[env\] )
====================================================================================================================================================================================

The ResolveBinding abstract operation is used to determine the binding of name passed as a string value. The optional argument env can be used to explicitly provide the [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) that is to be searched for the binding. During execution of ECMAScript code, ResolveBinding is performed using the following algorithm:

1.  If *env* was not passed or if *env* is **undefined**, then
    1.  Let *env* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).

2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *env* is a [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
3.  If the code matching the syntactic production that is being evaluated is contained in [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), let *strict* be **true**, else let *strict* be **false**.
4.  Return [GetIdentifierReference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getidentifierreference)(*env*, *name*, *strict* ).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The result of ResolveBinding is always a [Reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type) value with its referenced name component equal to the *name* argument.

<span id="sec-8.3.2" class="secnum">[8.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getthisenvironment "link to this section")</span> GetThisEnvironment ( )
==============================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">GetThisEnvironment</span> finds the [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) that currently supplies the binding of the keyword `this`. <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">GetThisEnvironment</span> performs the following steps:

1.  Let *lex* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
2.  Repeat
    1.  Let *envRec* be *lex*’s [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
    2.  Let *exists* be *envRec*.HasThisBinding().
    3.  If *exists* is **true**, return *envRec*.
    4.  Let *outer* be the value of *lex’s* [outer environment reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
    5.  Let *lex* be *outer*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The loop in step 2 will always terminate because the list of environments always ends with [the global environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-global-environment-records) which has a `this` binding.

<span id="sec-8.3.3" class="secnum">[8.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-resolvethisbinding "link to this section")</span> ResolveThisBinding ( )
==============================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation ResolveThisBinding determines the binding of the keyword `this` using the [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts). ResolveThisBinding performs the following steps:

1.  Let *envRec* be [GetThisEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getthisenvironment)( ).
2.  Return *envRec*.GetThisBinding().

<span id="sec-8.3.4" class="secnum">[8.3.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getnewtarget "link to this section")</span> GetNewTarget ( )
==================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation GetNewTarget determines the NewTarget value using the [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts). GetNewTarget performs the following steps:

1.  Let *envRec* be [GetThisEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getthisenvironment)( ).
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *envRec* has a \[\[NewTarget\]\] field.
3.  Return *envRec*.\[\[NewTarget\]\].

<span id="sec-8.3.5" class="secnum">[8.3.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getglobalobject "link to this section")</span> GetGlobalObject ( )
========================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">GetGlobalObject</span> returns the global object used by [the currently running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts). <span style="font-family: Times New
      Roman">GetGlobalObject</span> performs the following steps:

1.  Let *ctx* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
2.  Let *currentRealm* be *ctx’s* [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms).
3.  Return *currentRealm*.\[\[globalThis\]\].

<span id="sec-8.4" class="secnum">[8.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-jobs-and-job-queues "link to this section")</span> Jobs and Job Queues
========================================================================================================================================================================

A Job is an abstract operation that initiates an ECMAScript computation when no other ECMAScript computation is currently in progress. A Job abstract operation may be defined to accept an arbitrary set of job parameters.

Execution of a Job can be initiated only when there is no running [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) and [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) is empty. A PendingJob is a request for the future execution of a Job. A PendingJob is an internal Record whose fields are specified in [Table 25](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-25). Once execution of a Job is initiated, the Job always executes to completion. No other Job may be initiated until the currently running Job completes. However, the currently running Job or external events may cause the enqueuing of additional PendingJobs that may be initiated sometime after completion of the currently running Job.

<span id="table-25">Table 25</span> — PendingJob Record Fields
| Field Name          | Value                                                                                                  | Meaning                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|---------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| \[\[Job\]\]         | The name of a Job abstract operation                                                                   | This is the abstract operation that is performed when execution of this PendingJob is initiated. Jobs are abstract operations that use NextJob rather than Return to indicate that they have completed.                                  |
| \[\[Arguments\]\]   | A [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) | The [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of argument values that are to be passed to \[\[Job\]\] when it is activated.                                                   |
| \[\[Realm\]\]       | A [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) Record                | The [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) for the initial [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) when this Pending Job is initiated. |
| \[\[HostDefined\]\] | Any, default value is <span class="value">undefined</span>.                                            | Field reserved for use by host environments that need to associate additional information with a pending Job.                                                                                                                            |

A Job Queue is a FIFO queue of PendingJob records. Each Job Queue has a name and the full set of available Job Queues are defined by an ECMAScript implementation. Every ECMAScript implementation has at least the Job Queues defined in [Table 26](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-26).

<span id="table-26">Table 26</span> — Required Job Queues
| Name        | Purpose                                                                                                                                         |
|-------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| ScriptJobs  | Jobs that validate and evaluate ECMAScript *Script* and *Module* source text. See clauses 10 and 15.                                            |
| PromiseJobs | Jobs that are responses to the settlement of a Promise ([see 25.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-promise-objects)). |

A request for the future execution of a Job is made by enqueueing, on a Job Queue, a PendingJob record that includes a Job abstract operation name and any necessary argument values. When there is no running [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) and [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) is empty, the ECMAScript implementation removes the first PendingJob from a Job Queue and uses the information contained in it to create an [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) and starts execution of the associated Job abstract operation.

The PendingJob records from a single Job Queue are always initiated in FIFO order. This specification does not define the order in which multiple Job Queues are serviced. An ECMAScript implementation may interweave the FIFO evaluation of the PendingJob records of a Job Queue with the evaluation of the PendingJob records of one or more other Job Queues. An implementation must define what occurs when there are no running [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) and all Job Queues are empty.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Typically an ECMAScript implementation will have its Job Queues pre-initialized with at least one PendingJob and one of those Jobs will be the first to be executed. An implementation might choose to free all resources and terminate if the current Job completes and all Job Queues are empty. Alternatively, it might choose to wait for a some implementation specific agent or mechanism to enqueue new PendingJob requests.

The following abstract operations are used to create and manage Jobs and Job Queues:

<span id="sec-8.4.1" class="secnum">[8.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-enqueuejob "link to this section")</span> EnqueueJob ( queueName, job, arguments)
=======================================================================================================================================================================================

The EnqueueJob abstract operation requires three arguments: queueName, job, and arguments. It performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*queueName*) is String and its value is the name of a Job Queue recognized by this implementation.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *job* is the name of a Job.
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *arguments* is a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that has the same number of elements as the number of parameters required by *job*.
4.  Let *callerContext* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
5.  Let *callerRealm* be *callerContext’s* [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms).
6.  Let *pending* be PendingJob{ \[\[Job\]\]: *job*, \[\[Arguments\]\]: *arguments*, \[\[Realm\]\]: *callerRealm*, \[\[HostDefined\]\]: **undefined** }.
7.  Perform any implementation or host environment defined processing of *pending*. This may include modifying the \[\[HostDefined\]\] field or any other field of *pending*.
8.  Add *pending* at the back of the Job Queue named by *queueName*.
9.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>).

<span id="sec-8.4.2" class="secnum">[8.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-nextjob-result "link to this section")</span> NextJob result
==================================================================================================================================================================

An algorithm step such as:

1.  NextJob *result*.

is used in Job abstract operations in place of:

1.  Return *result*.

Job abstract operations must not contain a Return step or a [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt) step. The NextJob result operation is equivalent to the following steps:

1.  If *result* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), perform implementation defined unhandled exception processing.
2.  [Suspend](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) and remove it from [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): The [execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) is now empty.
4.  Let *nextQueue* be a non-empty Job Queue chosen in an implementation defined manner. If all Job Queues are empty, the result is implementation defined.
5.  Let *nextPending* be the PendingJob record at the front of *nextQueue*. Remove that record from *nextQueue*.
6.  Let *newContext* be a new [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
7.  Set *newContext*’s [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) to *nextPending*.\[\[Realm\]\].
8.  Push *newContext* onto [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts); *newContext* is now [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
9.  Perform any implementation or host environment defined job initialization using *nextPending*.
10. Perform the abstract operation named by *nextPending*.\[\[Job\]\] using the elements of *nextPending*.\[\[Arguments\]\] as its arguments.

<span id="sec-8.5" class="secnum">[8.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-initialization "link to this section")</span> ECMAScript Initialization()
======================================================================================================================================================================================

An ECMAScript implementation performs the following steps prior to the execution of any Jobs or the evaluation of any ECMAScript code:

1.  Let *realm* be [CreateRealm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createrealm)().
2.  Let *newContext* be a new [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
3.  Set the Function of *newContext* to **null**.
4.  Set the [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) of *newContext* to *realm*.
