5.  Push *newContext* onto [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts); *newContext* is now [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
6.  Let *status* be [InitializeHostDefinedRealm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-initializehostdefinedrealm)(*realm*).
7.  If *status* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), then
    1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): The first realm could not be created.
    2.  Terminate ECMAScript execution.

8.  In an implementation dependent manner, obtain the ECMAScript source texts (see [clause 10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-source-code)) for zero or more ECMAScript scripts and/or ECMAScript modules. For each such *sourceText* do,
    1.  If *sourceText* is the source code of a script, then
        1.  Perform [EnqueueJob](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-enqueuejob)(`"ScriptJobs"`, [ScriptEvaluationJob](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-scriptevaluationjob), « *sourceText* »).

    2.  Else *sourceText* is the source code of a module,
        1.  Perform [EnqueueJob](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-enqueuejob)(`"ScriptJobs"`, [TopLevelModuleEvaluationJob](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toplevelmoduleevaluationjob), « *sourceText* »).

9.  NextJob [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).

<span id="sec-8.5.1" class="secnum">[8.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-initializehostdefinedrealm "link to this section")</span> InitializeHostDefinedRealm ( realm )
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation InitializeHostDefinedRealm with parameter realm performs the following steps:

1.  If this implementation requires use of an exotic object to serve as *realm*’s global object, let *global* be such an object created in an implementation defined manner. Otherwise, let *global* be **undefined** indicating that an ordinary object should be created as the global object.
2.  Perform [SetRealmGlobalObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setrealmglobalobject)(*realm*, *global*).
3.  Let *globalObj* be [SetDefaultGlobalBindings](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setdefaultglobalbindings)(*realm*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*globalObj*).
5.  Create any implementation defined global object properties on *globalObj*.
6.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).

<span id="sec-9" class="secnum">[9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-and-exotic-objects-behaviours "link to this section")</span> Ordinary and Exotic Objects Behaviours
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-9.1" class="secnum">[9.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots "link to this section")</span> Ordinary Object Internal Methods and Internal Slots
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

All ordinary objects have an [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) called \[\[Prototype\]\]. The value of this [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is either **null** or an object and is used for implementing inheritance. Data properties of the \[\[Prototype\]\] object are inherited (are visible as properties of the child object) for the purposes of get access, but not for set access. Accessor properties are inherited for both get access and set access.

Every ordinary object has a Boolean-valued \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) that controls whether or not properties may be added to the object. If the value of the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is **false** then additional properties may not be added to the object. In addition, if \[\[Extensible\]\] is **false** the value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the object may not be modified. Once the value of an object’s \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) has been set to **false** it may not be subsequently changed to **true**.

In the following algorithm descriptions, assume O is an ordinary object, P is a [property key value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type), V is any [ECMAScript language value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types), and *Desc* is a [Property Descriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-property-descriptor-specification-type) record.

<span id="sec-9.1.1" class="secnum">[9.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-getprototypeof "link to this section")</span> \[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\] ( )
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\] internal method of O is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Return the value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.

<span id="sec-9.1.2" class="secnum">[9.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-setprototypeof-v "link to this section")</span> \[\[SetPrototypeOf\]\] (V)
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[SetPrototypeOf\]\] internal method of O is called with argument V the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): Either [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*V*) is Object or [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*V*) is Null.
2.  Let *extensible* be the value of the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
3.  Let *current* be the value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
4.  If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*V*, *current*), return **true.**
5.  If *extensible* is **false**, return **false**.
6.  Let *p* be *V*.
7.  Let *done* be **false**.
8.  Repeat while *done* is **false**,
    1.  If *p* is **null**, let *done* be **true**.
    2.  Else, if [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*p*, *O*) is **true**, return **false**.
    3.  Else,
        1.  If the \[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\] internal method of *p* is not the ordinary object internal method defined in [9.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-getprototypeof), let *done* be **true**.
        2.  Else, let *p* be the value of *p*’s \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

9.  Set the value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O* to *V*.
10. Return **true**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The loop in step 8 guarantees that there will be no circularities in any prototype chain that only includes objects that use the ordinary object definitions for \[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\] and \[\[SetPrototypeOf\]\].

<span id="sec-9.1.3" class="secnum">[9.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-isextensible "link to this section")</span> \[\[IsExtensible\]\] ( )
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[IsExtensible\]\] internal method of O is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Return the value of the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.

<span id="sec-9.1.4" class="secnum">[9.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-preventextensions "link to this section")</span> \[\[PreventExtensions\]\] ( )
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[PreventExtensions\]\] internal method of O is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Set the value of the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O* to **false**.
2.  Return **true.**

<span id="sec-9.1.5" class="secnum">[9.1.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-getownproperty-p "link to this section")</span> \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] (P)
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] internal method of O is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P, the following steps are taken:

1.  Return [OrdinaryGetOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarygetownproperty)(*O*, *P*).

<span id="sec-9.1.5.1" class="secnum">[9.1.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarygetownproperty "link to this section")</span> OrdinaryGetOwnProperty (O, P)
=============================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation OrdinaryGetOwnProperty is called with Object O and with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P, the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  If *O* does not have an own property with key *P*, return **undefined**.
3.  Let *D* be a newly created [Property Descriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-property-descriptor-specification-type) with no fields.
4.  Let *X* be *O*’s own property whose key is *P*.
5.  If *X* is a data property, then
    1.  Set *D*.\[\[Value\]\] to the value of *X*’s \[\[Value\]\] attribute.
    2.  Set *D*.\[\[Writable\]\] to the value of *X*’s \[\[Writable\]\] attribute

6.  Else *X* is an accessor property, so
    1.  Set *D*.\[\[Get\]\] to the value of *X*’s \[\[Get\]\] attribute.
    2.  Set *D*.\[\[Set\]\] to the value of *X*’s \[\[Set\]\] attribute.

7.  Set *D*.\[\[Enumerable\]\] to the value of *X*’s \[\[Enumerable\]\] attribute.
8.  Set *D*.\[\[Configurable\]\] to the value of *X*’s \[\[Configurable\]\] attribute.
9.  Return *D*.

<span id="sec-9.1.6" class="secnum">[9.1.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-defineownproperty-p-desc "link to this section")</span> \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] (P, Desc)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] internal method of O is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P and [Property Descriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-property-descriptor-specification-type) *Desc*, the following steps are taken:

1.  Return [OrdinaryDefineOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarydefineownproperty)(*O*, *P*, *Desc*).

<span id="sec-9.1.6.1" class="secnum">[9.1.6.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarydefineownproperty "link to this section")</span> OrdinaryDefineOwnProperty (O, P, Desc)
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">OrdinaryDefineOwnProperty</span> is called with Object O, [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) <span style="font-family: Times New
        Roman">*P*,</span> and [Property Descriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-property-descriptor-specification-type) *Desc* the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *current* be *O*.\[\[GetOwnProperty\]\](*P*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*current*).
3.  Let *extensible* be the value of the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
4.  Return [ValidateAndApplyPropertyDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-validateandapplypropertydescriptor)(*O*, *P*, *extensible*, *Desc*, *current*).

<span id="sec-9.1.6.2" class="secnum">[9.1.6.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscompatiblepropertydescriptor "link to this section")</span> IsCompatiblePropertyDescriptor (Extensible, Desc, Current)
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">IsCompatiblePropertyDescriptor</span> is called with Boolean value *Extensible*, and Property Descriptors *Desc*, and *Current* the following steps are taken:

1.  Return [ValidateAndApplyPropertyDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-validateandapplypropertydescriptor)(**undefined**, **undefined**, *Extensible*, *Desc*, *Current*).

<span id="sec-9.1.6.3" class="secnum">[9.1.6.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-validateandapplypropertydescriptor "link to this section")</span> ValidateAndApplyPropertyDescriptor (O, P, extensible, Desc, current)
================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">ValidateAndApplyPropertyDescriptor</span> is called with Object O, [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) <span style="font-family: Times New
        Roman">*P*,</span> Boolean value extensible, and Property Descriptors *Desc*, and current the following steps are taken:

This algorithm contains steps that test various fields of the [Property Descriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-property-descriptor-specification-type) *Desc* for specific values. The fields that are tested in this manner need not actually exist in *Desc*. If a field is absent then its value is considered to be **false**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> If **undefined** is passed as the *O* argument only validation is performed and no object updates are performed.

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): If *O* is not **undefined** then [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  If *current* is **undefined**, then
    1.  If *extensible* is **false**, return **false**.
    2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *extensible* is **true**.
    3.  If [IsGenericDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isgenericdescriptor)(*Desc*) or [IsDataDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdatadescriptor)(*Desc*) is **true**, then
        1.  If *O* is not **undefined**, create an own data property named *P* of object *O* whose \[\[Value\]\], \[\[Writable\]\], \[\[Enumerable\]\] and \[\[Configurable\]\] attribute values are described by *Desc*. If the value of an attribute field of *Desc* is absent, the attribute of the newly created property is set to its default value.

    4.  Else *Desc* must be an accessor [Property Descriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-property-descriptor-specification-type),
        1.  If *O* is not **undefined**, create an own accessor property named *P* of object *O* whose \[\[Get\]\], \[\[Set\]\], \[\[Enumerable\]\] and \[\[Configurable\]\] attribute values are described by *Desc*. If the value of an attribute field of *Desc* is absent, the attribute of the newly created property is set to its default value.

    5.  Return **true**.

3.  Return **true**, if every field in *Desc* is absent.
4.  Return **true**, if every field in *Desc* also occurs in *current* and the value of every field in *Desc* is the same value as the corresponding field in *current* when compared using [the SameValue algorithm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue).
5.  If the \[\[Configurable\]\] field of *current* is **false**, then
    1.  Return **false**, if the \[\[Configurable\]\] field of *Desc* is **true**.
    2.  Return **false**, if the \[\[Enumerable\]\] field of *Desc* is present and the \[\[Enumerable\]\] fields of *current* and *Desc* are the Boolean negation of each other.

6.  If [IsGenericDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isgenericdescriptor)(*Desc*) is **true**, no further validation is required.
7.  Else if [IsDataDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdatadescriptor)(*current*) and [IsDataDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdatadescriptor)(*Desc*) have different results, then
    1.  Return **false**, if the \[\[Configurable\]\] field of *current* is **false**.
    2.  If [IsDataDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdatadescriptor)(*current*) is **true**, then
        1.  If *O* is not **undefined**, convert the property named *P* of object *O* from a data property to an accessor property. Preserve the existing values of the converted property’s \[\[Configurable\]\] and \[\[Enumerable\]\] attributes and set the rest of the property’s attributes to their default values.

    3.  Else,
        1.  If *O* is not **undefined**, convert the property named *P* of object *O* from an accessor property to a data property. Preserve the existing values of the converted property’s \[\[Configurable\]\] and \[\[Enumerable\]\] attributes and set the rest of the property’s attributes to their default values.

8.  Else if [IsDataDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdatadescriptor)(*current*) and [IsDataDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdatadescriptor)(*Desc*) are both **true**, then
    1.  If the \[\[Configurable\]\] field of *current* is **false**, then
        1.  Return **false**, if the \[\[Writable\]\] field of *current* is **false** and the \[\[Writable\]\] field of *Desc* is **true**.
        2.  If the \[\[Writable\]\] field of *current* is **false**, then
            1.  Return **false**, if the \[\[Value\]\] field of *Desc* is present and [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*Desc*.\[\[Value\]\], *current*.\[\[Value\]\]) is **false**.

    2.  Else the \[\[Configurable\]\] field of *current* is **true**, so any change is acceptable.

9.  Else [IsAccessorDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isaccessordescriptor)(*current*) and [IsAccessorDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isaccessordescriptor)(*Desc*) are both **true**,
    1.  If the \[\[Configurable\]\] field of *current* is **false**, then
        1.  Return **false**, if the \[\[Set\]\] field of *Desc* is present and [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*Desc*.\[\[Set\]\], *current*.\[\[Set\]\]) is **false**.
        2.  Return **false**, if the \[\[Get\]\] field of *Desc* is present and [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*Desc*.\[\[Get\]\], *current*.\[\[Get\]\]) is **false**.

10. If *O* is not **undefined**, then
    1.  For each field of *Desc* that is present, set the corresponding attribute of the property named *P* of object *O* to the value of the field.

11. Return **true**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Step 8.b allows any field of Desc to be different from the corresponding field of current if current’s \[\[Configurable\]\] field is **true**. This even permits changing the \[\[Value\]\] of a property whose \[\[Writable\]\] attribute is **false**. This is allowed because a **true** \[\[Configurable\]\] attribute would permit an equivalent sequence of calls where \[\[Writable\]\] is first set to **true**, a new \[\[Value\]\] is set, and then \[\[Writable\]\] is set to **false**.

<span id="sec-9.1.7" class="secnum">[9.1.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-hasproperty-p "link to this section")</span> \[\[HasProperty\]\](P)
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[HasProperty\]\] internal method of O is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P, the following steps are taken:

1.  Return [OrdinaryHasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinaryhasproperty)(*O*, *P*).

<span id="sec-9.1.7.1" class="secnum">[9.1.7.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinaryhasproperty "link to this section")</span> OrdinaryHasProperty (O, P)
=======================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation OrdinaryHasProperty is called with Object O and with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P, the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  Let *hasOwn* be [OrdinaryGetOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarygetownproperty)(*O*, *P*).
3.  If *hasOwn* is not **undefined**, return **true**.
4.  Let *parent* be *O*.\[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\]().
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*parent*).
6.  If *parent* is not **null**, then
    1.  Return *parent*.\[\[HasProperty\]\](*P*).

7.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-9.1.8" class="secnum">[9.1.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-get-p-receiver "link to this section")</span> \[\[Get\]\] (P, Receiver)
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[Get\]\] internal method of O is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P and [ECMAScript language value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types) *Receiver* the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  Let *desc* be *O*.\[\[GetOwnProperty\]\](*P*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*desc*).
4.  If *desc* is **undefined**, then
    1.  Let *parent* be *O*.\[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\]().
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*parent*).
    3.  If *parent* is **null**, return **undefined.**
    4.  Return *parent*.\[\[Get\]\](*P*, *Receiver*).

5.  If [IsDataDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdatadescriptor)(*desc*) is **true**, return *desc*.\[\[Value\]\].
6.  Otherwise, [IsAccessorDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isaccessordescriptor)(*desc*) must be **true** so, let *getter* be *desc*.\[\[Get\]\].
7.  If *getter* is **undefined**, return **undefined**.
8.  Return [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*getter,* *Receiver*).

<span id="sec-9.1.9" class="secnum">[9.1.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-set-p-v-receiver "link to this section")</span> \[\[Set\]\] ( P, V, Receiver)
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[Set\]\] internal method of O is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P, value V, and [ECMAScript language value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types) *Receiver*, the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  Let *ownDesc* be *O*.\[\[GetOwnProperty\]\](*P*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*ownDesc*).
4.  If *ownDesc* is **undefined**, then
    1.  Let *parent* be *O*.\[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\]().
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*parent*).
    3.  If *parent* is not **null**, then
        1.  Return *parent*.\[\[Set\]\](*P*, *V*, *Receiver*).

    4.  Else,
        1.  Let *ownDesc* be the PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]: **undefined**, \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true**}.

5.  If [IsDataDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdatadescriptor)(*ownDesc*) is **true**, then
    1.  If *ownDesc*.\[\[Writable\]\] is **false**, return **false**.
    2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*Receiver*) is not Object, return **false**.
    3.  Let *existingDescriptor* be *Receiver*.\[\[GetOwnProperty\]\](*P*).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*existingDescriptor*).
    5.  If *existingDescriptor* is not **undefined**, then
        1.  Let *valueDesc* be the PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]: *V*}.
        2.  Return *Receiver*.\[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\](*P*, *valueDesc*).

    6.  Else *Receiver* does not currently have a property *P*,
        1.  Return [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*Receiver*, *P*, *V*).

6.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsAccessorDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isaccessordescriptor)(*ownDesc*) is **true**.
7.  Let *setter* be *ownDesc*.\[\[Set\]\].
8.  If *setter* is **undefined**, return **false**.
9.  Let *setterResult* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*setter*, *Receiver*, «*V*»).
10. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setterResult*).
11. Return **true**.

<span id="sec-9.1.10" class="secnum">[9.1.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-delete-p "link to this section")</span> \[\[Delete\]\] (P)
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[Delete\]\] internal method of O is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  Let *desc* be *O*.\[\[GetOwnProperty\]\](*P*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*desc*).
4.  If *desc* is **undefined**, return **true**.
5.  If *desc*.\[\[Configurable\]\] is **true**, then
    1.  Remove the own property with name *P* from *O*.
    2.  Return **true**.

6.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-9.1.11" class="secnum">[9.1.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-enumerate "link to this section")</span> \[\[Enumerate\]\] ()
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[Enumerate\]\] internal method of O is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Return an Iterator object ([25.1.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iterator-interface)) whose `next` method iterates over all the String-valued keys of enumerable properties of *O*. The Iterator object must inherit from %IteratorPrototype% ([25.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%iteratorprototype%-object)). The mechanics and order of enumerating the properties is not specified but must conform to the rules specified below.

The iterator’s `next` method processes object properties to determine whether the [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) should be returned as an iterator value. Returned property keys do not include keys that are Symbols. Properties of the target object may be deleted during enumeration. A property that is deleted before it is processed by the iterator’s `next` method is ignored. If new properties are added to the target object during enumeration, the newly added properties are not guaranteed to be processed in the active enumeration. A property name will be returned by the iterator’s `next` method at most once in any enumeration.

Enumerating the properties of the target object includes enumerating properties of its prototype, and the prototype of the prototype, and so on, recursively; but a property of a prototype is not processed if it has the same name as a property that has already been processed by the iterator’s `next` method. The values of \[\[Enumerable\]\] attributes are not considered when determining if a property of a prototype object has already been processed. The enumerable property names of prototype objects must be obtained as if by invoking the prototype object’s \[\[Enumerate\]\] internal method. \[\[Enumerate\]\] must obtain the own property keys of the target object as if by calling its \[\[OwnPropertyKeys\]\] internal method. Property attributes of the target object must be obtained as if by calling its \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] internal method.

NOTE The following is an informative definition of an ECMAScript generator function that conforms to these rules:

    function* enumerate(obj) {

    let visited=new Set;

    for (let key of Reflect.ownKeys(obj)) {

    if (typeof key === "string") {

    let desc = Reflect.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(obj,key);

    if (desc) {

    visited.add(key);

    if (desc.enumerable) yield key;

    }

    }

    }

    let proto = Reflect.getPrototypeOf(obj)

    if (proto === null) return;

    for (let protoName of Reflect.enumerate(proto)) {

    if (!visited.has(protoName)) yield protoName;

    }

    }

<span id="sec-9.1.12" class="secnum">[9.1.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-ownpropertykeys "link to this section")</span> \[\[OwnPropertyKeys\]\] ( )
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[OwnPropertyKeys\]\] internal method of O is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *keys* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
2.  For each own [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) *P* of *O* that is an integer index, in ascending numeric index order
    1.  Add *P* as the last element of *keys*.

3.  For each own [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) *P* of *O* that is a String but is not an integer index, in property creation order
    1.  Add *P* as the last element of *keys*.

4.  For each own [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) *P* of *O* that is a Symbol, in property creation order
    1.  Add *P* as the last element of *keys*.

5.  Return *keys*.

<span id="sec-9.1.13" class="secnum">[9.1.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate "link to this section")</span> ObjectCreate(proto, internalSlotsList)
==========================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation ObjectCreate with argument proto (an object or null) is used to specify the runtime creation of new ordinary objects. The optional argument internalSlotsList is a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of the names of additional internal slots that must be defined as part of the object. If the list is not provided, an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) is used. This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  If *internalSlotsList* was not provided, let *internalSlotsList* be an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
2.  Let *obj* be a newly created object with an [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) for each name in *internalSlotsList*.
3.  Set *obj*’s essential internal methods to the default ordinary object definitions specified in [9.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
4.  Set the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *obj* to *proto*.
5.  Set the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *obj* to **true**.
6.  Return *obj*.

<span id="sec-9.1.14" class="secnum">[9.1.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarycreatefromconstructor "link to this section")</span> OrdinaryCreateFromConstructor ( constructor, intrinsicDefaultProto, internalSlotsList )
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation OrdinaryCreateFromConstructor creates an ordinary object whose \[\[Prototype\]\] value is retrieved from a constructor’s `prototype` property, if it exists. Otherwise the intrinsic named by intrinsicDefaultProto is used for \[\[Prototype\]\]. The optional internalSlotsList is a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of the names of additional internal slots that must be defined as part of the object. If the list is not provided, an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) is used. This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *intrinsicDefaultProto* is a string value that is this specification’s name of an intrinsic object. The corresponding object must be an intrinsic that is intended to be used as the \[\[Prototype\]\] value of an object.
2.  Let *proto* be [GetPrototypeFromConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getprototypefromconstructor)(*constructor*, *intrinsicDefaultProto*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*proto*).
4.  Return [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(*proto*, *internalSlotsList*).

<span id="sec-9.1.15" class="secnum">[9.1.15](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getprototypefromconstructor "link to this section")</span> GetPrototypeFromConstructor ( constructor, intrinsicDefaultProto )
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation GetPrototypeFromConstructor determines the \[\[Prototype\]\] value that should be used to create an object corresponding to a specific constructor. The value is retrieved from the constructor’s `prototype` property, if it exists. Otherwise the intrinsic named by intrinsicDefaultProto is used for \[\[Prototype\]\]. This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *intrinsicDefaultProto* is a string value that is this specification’s name of an intrinsic object. The corresponding object must be an intrinsic that is intended to be used as the \[\[Prototype\]\] value of an object.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor) (*constructor*) is **true**.
3.  Let *proto* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*constructor*, `"prototype"`).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*proto*).
5.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*proto*) is not Object, then
    1.  Let *realm* be [GetFunctionRealm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getfunctionrealm)(*constructor*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*realm*).
    3.  Let *proto* be *realm’s* intrinsic object named *intrinsicDefaultProto*.

6.  Return *proto*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> If *constructor* does not supply a \[\[Prototype\]\] value, the default value that is used is obtained from the [Code Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) of the *constructor* function rather than from [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).

<span id="sec-9.2" class="secnum">[9.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-function-objects "link to this section")</span> ECMAScript Function Objects
========================================================================================================================================================================================

ECMAScript function objects encapsulate parameterized ECMAScript code closed over a [lexical environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) and support the dynamic evaluation of that code. An ECMAScript function object is an ordinary object and has the same internal slots and the same internal methods as other ordinary objects. The code of an ECMAScript function object may be either [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code) ([10.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code)) or non-[strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code). An ECMAScript function object whose code is [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code) is called a *strict function*. One whose code is not [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code) is called a *non-strict function*.

ECMAScript function objects have the additional internal slots listed in [Table 27](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-27).

<span id="table-27">Table 27</span> — Internal Slots of ECMAScript Function Objects
| Internal Slot            | Type                                                                                                  | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|--------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| \[\[Environment\]\]      | [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) | The [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) that the function was closed over. Used as the outer environment when evaluating the code of the function.                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| \[\[FormalParameters\]\] | Parse Node                                                                                            | The root parse node of the source text that defines the function’s formal parameter list.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| \[\[FunctionKind\]\]     | String                                                                                                | Either `"normal"`, `"classConstructor"` or `"generator"`.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| \[\[ECMAScriptCode\]\]   | Parse Node                                                                                            | The root parse node of the source text that defines the function’s body.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| \[\[ConstructorKind\]\]  | String                                                                                                | Either `"base"` or `"derived"`.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| \[\[Realm\]\]            | [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) Record                 | The [Code Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) in which the function was created and which provides any intrinsic objects that are accessed when evaluating the function.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| \[\[ThisMode\]\]         | (lexical, strict, global)                                                                             | Defines how `this` references are interpreted within the formal parameters and code body of the function. **lexical** means that `this` refers to the **this** value of a lexically enclosing function. **strict** means that the **this** value is used exactly as provided by an invocation of the function. **global** means that a **this** value of <span class="value">undefined</span> is interpreted as a reference to the global object. |
| \[\[Strict\]\]           | Boolean                                                                                               | <span class="value">true</span> if this is a strict mode function, <span class="value">false</span> if this is not a strict mode function.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| \[\[HomeObject\]\]       | Object                                                                                                | If the function uses `super`, this is the object whose \[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\] provides the object where `super` property lookups begin.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |

All ECMAScript function objects have the \[\[Call\]\] internal method defined here. ECMAScript functions that are also constructors in addition have the \[\[Construct\]\] internal method. ECMAScript function objects whose code is not [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code) have the \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] internal method defined here.

<span id="sec-9.2.1" class="secnum">[9.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-function-objects-call-thisargument-argumentslist "link to this section")</span> \[\[Call\]\] ( thisArgument, argumentsList)
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The \[\[Call\]\] internal method for an [ECMAScript function object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-function-objects) F is called with parameters thisArgument and argumentsList, a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of [ECMAScript language values](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types). The following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *F* is an [ECMAScript function object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-function-objects).
2.  If *F*’s \[\[FunctionKind\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is `"classConstructor"`, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  Let *callerContext* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
4.  Let *calleeContext* be [PrepareForOrdinaryCall](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-prepareforordinarycall)(*F*, **undefined**).
5.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *calleeContext* is now [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
6.  Perform [OrdinaryCallBindThis](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarycallbindthis)(*F*, *calleeContext*, *thisArgument*).
7.  Let *result* be [OrdinaryCallEvaluateBody](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarycallevaluatebody)(*F*, *argumentsList*).
8.  Remove *calleeContext* from [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) and restore *callerContext* as [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
9.  If *result*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">return</span>, return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(*result*.\[\[value\]\]).
10. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*result*).
11. Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> When *calleeContext* is removed from [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) in step 8 it must not be destroyed if it is [suspended](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) and retained for later resumption by an accessible generator object*.*

<span id="sec-9.2.1.1" class="secnum">[9.2.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-prepareforordinarycall "link to this section")</span> PrepareForOrdinaryCall( F, newTarget )
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation PrepareForOrdinaryCall is called with function object F <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">and [ECMAScript language value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types) *newTarget*</span>, the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*newTarget*) is Undefined or Object.
2.  Let *callerContext* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
3.  Let *calleeContext* be a new [ECMAScript code execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
4.  Set the Function of *calleeContext* to *F*.
5.  Let *calleeRealm* be the value of *F’s* \[\[Realm\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
6.  Set the [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) of *calleeContext* to *calleeRealm*.
7.  Let *localEnv* be [NewFunctionEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newfunctionenvironment)(*F*, *newTarget*).
8.  Set the [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of *calleeContext* to *localEnv*.
9.  Set the [VariableEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of *calleeContext* to *localEnv*.
10. If *callerContext* is not already [suspended](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts), [Suspend](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) *callerContext*.
11. Push *calleeContext* onto [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts); *calleeContext* is now [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
12. <span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE Any exception objects produced after this point are associated with</span> *calleeRealm*.
13. Return *calleeContext*.

<span id="sec-9.2.1.2" class="secnum">[9.2.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarycallbindthis "link to this section")</span> OrdinaryCallBindThis ( F, calleeContext, thisArgument )
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation OrdinaryCallBindThis is called with function object F, [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) calleeContext, and ECMAScript value thisArgument the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *thisMode* be the value of *F*’s \[\[ThisMode\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
2.  If *thisMode* is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">lexical</span>, return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).
3.  Let *calleeRealm* be the value of *F’s* \[\[Realm\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
4.  Let *localEnv* be the [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of *calleeContext*.
5.  If *thisMode* is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">strict</span>, let *thisValue* be *thisArgument*.
6.  Else
    1.  if *thisArgument* is **null** or **undefined**, then
        1.  Let *thisValue* be *calleeRealm*.\[\[globalThis\]\].

    2.  Else
        1.  Let *thisValue* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(*thisArgument*).
        2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *thisValue* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
        3.  <span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject) produces</span> <span style="font-family: sans-serif">wrapper objects using</span> *calleeRealm*.

7.  Let *envRec* be *localEnv*’s [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
8.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): The next step never returns an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) because *envRec*.\[\[thisBindingStatus\]\] is `"uninitialized"`.
9.  Return *envRec*.[BindThisValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bindthisvalue)(*thisValue*).

<span id="sec-9.2.1.3" class="secnum">[9.2.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarycallevaluatebody "link to this section")</span> OrdinaryCallEvaluateBody ( F, argumentsList )
===============================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation OrdinaryCallEvaluateBody is called with function object F and [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) argumentsList the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *status* be [FunctionDeclarationInstantiation](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functiondeclarationinstantiation)(*F*, *argumentsList*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*)
3.  Return the result of EvaluateBody of the parsed code that is the value of *F*'s \[\[ECMAScriptCode\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) passing *F* as the argument.

<span id="sec-9.2.2" class="secnum">[9.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-function-objects-construct-argumentslist-newtarget "link to this section")</span> \[\[Construct\]\] ( argumentsList, newTarget)
================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The \[\[Construct\]\] internal method for an [ECMAScript Function object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-function-objects) F is called with parameters argumentsList and <span style="font-family: Times New
      Roman">*newTarget*. *argumentsList*</span> is a possibly empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of [ECMAScript language values](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types). The following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *F* is an [ECMAScript function object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-function-objects).
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*newTarget*) is Object.
3.  Let *callerContext* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
4.  Let *kind* be *F*’s \[\[ConstructorKind\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  If *kind* is `"base"`, then
    1.  Let *thisArgument* be [OrdinaryCreateFromConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarycreatefromconstructor)(*newTarget*, `"%ObjectPrototype%"`).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*thisArgument*).

6.  Let *calleeContext* be [PrepareForOrdinaryCall](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-prepareforordinarycall)(*F*, *newTarget*).
7.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *calleeContext* is now [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
8.  If *kind* is `"base"`, perform [OrdinaryCallBindThis](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarycallbindthis)(*F*, *calleeContext*, *thisArgument*).
9.  Let *constructorEnv* be the [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of *calleeContext*.
10. Let *envRec* be *constructorEnv*’s [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
11. Let *result* be [OrdinaryCallEvaluateBody](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarycallevaluatebody)(*F*, *argumentsList*).
12. Remove *calleeContext* from [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) and restore *callerContext* as [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
13. If *result*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">return</span>, then
    1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*result*.\[\[value\]\]) is Object, return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(*result*.\[\[value\]\]).
    2.  If *kind* is `"base"`, return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(*thisArgument*).
    3.  If *result*.\[\[value\]\] is not **undefined**, throw a **TypeError** exception.

14. Else, [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*result*).
15. Return *envRec*.GetThisBinding().

<span id="sec-9.2.3" class="secnum">[9.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functionallocate "link to this section")</span> FunctionAllocate (functionPrototype, strict \[,functionKind\] )
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation FunctionAllocate requires the two arguments <span style="font-family: Times New
      Roman">*functionPrototype* and *strict*.</span> It also accepts one optional argument, functionKind. FunctionAllocate performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*functionPrototype*) is Object.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): If *functionKind* is present, its value is either `"normal"`, `"non-constructor"` or `"generator"`.
3.  If *functionKind* is not present, let *functionKind* be `"normal"`.
4.  If *functionKind* is `"non-constructor"`, then
    1.  Let *functionKind* be `"normal"`.
    2.  Let *needsConstruct* be **false**.

5.  Else let *needsConstruct* be **true**.
6.  Let *F* be a newly created [ECMAScript function object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-function-objects) with the internal slots listed in [Table 27](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-27). All of those internal slots are initialized to **undefined**.
7.  Set *F*’s essential internal methods to the default ordinary object definitions specified in [9.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
8.  Set *F*’s \[\[Call\]\] internal method to the definition specified in [9.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-function-objects-call-thisargument-argumentslist).
9.  If *needsConstruct* is **true**, then
    1.  Set *F*’s \[\[Construct\]\] internal method to the definition specified in [9.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-function-objects-construct-argumentslist-newtarget).
    2.  If *functionKind* is `"generator"`, set the \[\[ConstructorKind\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *F* to `"derived"`.
    3.  Else, set the \[\[ConstructorKind\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *F* to `"base"`.
    4.  NOTE Generator functions are tagged as `"derived"` constructors to prevent \[\[Construct\]\] from preallocating a generator instance. Generator instance objects are allocated when EvaluateBody is applied to the *GeneratorBody* of a generator function.

10. Set the \[\[Strict\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *F* to *strict*.
11. Set the \[\[FunctionKind\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *F* to *functionKind*.
12. Set the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *F* to *functionPrototype*.
13. Set the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *F* to **true**.
14. Set the \[\[Realm\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *F* to [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms).
15. Return *F*.

<span id="sec-9.2.4" class="secnum">[9.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functioninitialize "link to this section")</span> FunctionInitialize (F, kind, ParameterList, Body, Scope)
================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation FunctionInitialize requires the arguments: a function object F, kind which is one of (Normal, Method, Arrow), a parameter list production specified by *ParameterList*, a body production specified by *Body*, a [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) specified by <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*Scope*.</span> FunctionInitialize performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *F* is an extensible object that does not have a `length` own property.
2.  Let *len* be the ExpectedArgumentCount of *ParameterList*.
3.  Let *status* be [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*F*, `"length"`, PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]: *len*, \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true**}).
4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
5.  Let *Strict* be the value of the \[\[Strict\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *F*.
6.  Set the \[\[Environment\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *F* to the value of *Scope*.
7.  Set the \[\[FormalParameters\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *F* to *ParameterList* .
8.  Set the \[\[ECMAScriptCode\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *F* to *Body*.
9.  If *kind* is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">Arrow</span>, set the \[\[ThisMode\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *F* to <span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">lexical</span>.
10. Else if *Strict* is **true**, set the \[\[ThisMode\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *F* to <span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">strict</span>.
11. Else set the \[\[ThisMode\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *F* to <span style="font-family: sans-serif">global</span>.
12. Return *F*.

<span id="sec-9.2.5" class="secnum">[9.2.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functioncreate "link to this section")</span> FunctionCreate (kind, ParameterList, Body, Scope, Strict, prototype)
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation FunctionCreate requires the arguments: kind which is one of (Normal, Method, Arrow), a parameter list production specified by *ParameterList*, a body production specified by *Body*, a [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) specified by *Scope*, a Boolean flag *Strict*, and optionally, an object <span style="font-family:
      Times New Roman">*prototype*.</span> FunctionCreate performs the following steps:

1.  If the *prototype* argument was not passed, then
    1.  Let *prototype* be the intrinsic object %FunctionPrototype%.

2.  If *kind* is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">Normal</span>, let *allocKind* be `"non-constructor"`.
3.  Else let *allocKind* be `"normal"`.
4.  Let *F* be [FunctionAllocate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functionallocate)(*prototype*, *Strict*, *allocKind*).
5.  Return [FunctionInitialize](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functioninitialize)(*F*, *kind*, *ParameterList*, *Body*, *Scope*).

<span id="sec-9.2.6" class="secnum">[9.2.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorfunctioncreate "link to this section")</span> GeneratorFunctionCreate (kind, ParameterList, Body, Scope, Strict)
===============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation GeneratorFunctionCreate requires the arguments: kind which is one of (Normal, Method), a parameter list production specified by *ParameterList*, a body production specified by *Body*, a [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) specified by *Scope*, and a Boolean flag *Strict*. GeneratorFunctionCreate performs the following steps:

1.  Let *functionPrototype* be the intrinsic object %Generator%.
2.  Let *F* be [FunctionAllocate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functionallocate)(*functionPrototype*, *Strict*, `"generator"`).
3.  Return [FunctionInitialize](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functioninitialize)(*F*, *kind*, *ParameterList*, *Body*, *Scope*).

<span id="sec-9.2.7" class="secnum">[9.2.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-addrestrictedfunctionproperties "link to this section")</span> AddRestrictedFunctionProperties ( F, realm )
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation AddRestrictedFunctionProperties is called with a function object F and [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) Record realm as its argument. It performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *realm*.\[\[intrinsics\]\].\[\[<span style="font-family:
                  sans-serif">%ThrowTypeError%\]\] exists and has been initialized.</span>
2.  Let *thrower* be *realm*.\[\[intrinsics\]\].\[\[<span style="font-family:
                  sans-serif">%ThrowTypeError%\]\].</span>
3.  Let *status* be [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*F*, `"caller"`, PropertyDescriptor {\[\[Get\]\]: *thrower*, \[\[Set\]\]: *thrower*, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true**}).
4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
5.  Return [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*F* , `"arguments"`, PropertyDescriptor {\[\[Get\]\]: *thrower*, \[\[Set\]\]: *thrower*, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true**}).
6.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): The above returned value is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).

<span id="sec-9.2.7.1" class="secnum">[9.2.7.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%throwtypeerror% "link to this section")</span> %ThrowTypeError% ( )
==============================================================================================================================================================================

The %ThrowTypeError% intrinsic is an anonymous built-in function object that is defined once for each [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms). When %ThrowTypeError% is called it performs the following steps:

1.  Throw a **TypeError** exception.

The value of the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of a %ThrowTypeError% function is <span class="value">false</span>.

The `length` property of a %ThrowTypeError% function has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-9.2.8" class="secnum">[9.2.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makeconstructor "link to this section")</span> MakeConstructor (F, writablePrototype, prototype)
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation MakeConstructor requires a Function argument F and optionally, a Boolean writablePrototype and an object prototype. If prototype is provided it is assumed to already contain, if needed, a `"constructor"` property whose value is F. This operation converts F into a constructor by performing the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *F* is an [ECMAScript function object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-function-objects).
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *F* has a \[\[Construct\]\] internal method.
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *F* is an extensible object that does not have a `prototype` own property.
4.  If the *writablePrototype* argument was not provided, let *writablePrototype* be **true**.
5.  If the *prototype* argument was not provided, then
    1.  Let *prototype* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(<span style="font-family:
