                        sans-serif">%ObjectPrototype%</span>).
    2.  Let *status* be [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*prototype*, `"constructor"`, PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]: *F*, \[\[Writable\]\]: *writablePrototype*, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true** }).
    3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).

6.  Let *status* be [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*F*, `"prototype"`, PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]: *prototype*, \[\[Writable\]\]: *writablePrototype*, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false**}).
7.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
8.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).

<span id="sec-9.2.9" class="secnum">[9.2.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makeclassconstructor "link to this section")</span> MakeClassConstructor ( F)
===================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation MakeClassConstructor with argument F performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *F* is an [ECMAScript function object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-function-objects).
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *F*’s \[\[FunctionKind\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is `"normal"`.
3.  Set *F*’s \[\[FunctionKind\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to `"classConstructor"`.
4.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).

<span id="sec-9.2.10" class="secnum">[9.2.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makemethod "link to this section")</span> MakeMethod ( F, homeObject)
=============================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation MakeMethod with arguments F and homeObject configures F as a method by performing the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *F* is an [ECMAScript function object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-function-objects).
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*homeObject* ) is Object.
3.  Set the \[\[HomeObject\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *F* to *homeObject*.
4.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).

<span id="sec-9.2.11" class="secnum">[9.2.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname "link to this section")</span> SetFunctionName (F, name, prefix)
========================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation SetFunctionName requires a Function argument F, a String or Symbol argument name and optionally a String argument prefix. This operation adds a `name` property to F by performing the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *F* is an extensible object that does not have a `name` own property.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*name*) is either Symbol or String.
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): If *prefix* was passed then [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*prefix*) is String.
4.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*name*) is Symbol, then
    1.  Let *description* be *name*’s \[\[Description\]\] value.
    2.  If *description* is **undefined**, let *name* be the empty String.
    3.  Else, let *name* be the concatenation of `"["`, *description*, and `"]"`.

5.  If *prefix* was passed, then
    1.  Let *name* be the concatenation of *prefix*, code unit 0x0020 (SPACE), and *name*.

6.  Return [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*F*, `"name"`, PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]: *name*, \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true**}).
7.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): the result is never an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).

<span id="sec-9.2.12" class="secnum">[9.2.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functiondeclarationinstantiation "link to this section")</span> FunctionDeclarationInstantiation(func, argumentsList)
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> When an [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) is established for evaluating an ECMAScript function a new function [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) is created and bindings for each formal parameter are instantiated in that [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records). Each declaration in the function body is also instantiated. If the function’s formal parameters do not include any default value initializers then the body declarations are instantiated in the same [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) as the parameters. If default value parameter initializers exist, a second [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) is created for the body declarations. Formal parameters and functions are initialized as part of FunctionDeclarationInstantiation. All other bindings are initialized during evaluation of the function body.

FunctionDeclarationInstantiation is performed as follows using arguments func and argumentsList. func is the function object for which the [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) is being established.

1.  Let *calleeContext* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
2.  Let *env* be the [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of *calleeContext*.
3.  Let *envRec* be *env*’s [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
4.  Let *code* be the value of the \[\[ECMAScriptCode\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *func*.
5.  Let *strict* be the value of the \[\[Strict\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *func*.
6.  Let *formals* be the value of the \[\[FormalParameters\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *func*.
7.  Let *parameterNames* be the BoundNames of *formals*.
8.  If *parameterNames* has any duplicate entries, let *hasDuplicates* be **true**. Otherwise, let *hasDuplicates* be **false**.
9.  Let *simpleParameterList* be IsSimpleParameterList of *formals*.
10. Let *hasParameterExpressions* be ContainsExpression of *formals.*
11. Let *varNames* be the VarDeclaredNames of *code*.
12. Let *varDeclarations* be the VarScopedDeclarations of *code*.
13. Let *lexicalNames* be the LexicallyDeclaredNames of *code*.
14. Let *functionNames* be an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
15. Let *functionsToInitialize* be an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
16. For each *d* in *varDeclarations*, in reverse list order do
    1.  If *d* is neither a *VariableDeclaration* or a *ForBinding*, then
        1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *d* is either a *FunctionDeclaration* or a *GeneratorDeclaration*.
        2.  Let *fn* be the sole element of the BoundNames of *d.*
        3.  If *fn* is not an element of *functionNames*, then
            1.  Insert *fn* as the first element of *functionNames*.
            2.  NOTE If there are multiple <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*FunctionDeclarations* or *GeneratorDeclarations*</span> for the same name, the last declaration is used.
            3.  Insert *d* as the first element of *functionsToInitialize*.

17. Let *argumentsObjectNeeded* be **true**.
18. If the value of the \[\[ThisMode\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *func* is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">lexical</span>, then
    1.  NOTE Arrow functions never have an arguments objects.
    2.  Let *argumentsObjectNeeded* be **false**.

19. Else if `"arguments"` is an element of *parameterNames*, then
    1.  Let *argumentsObjectNeeded* be **false**.

20. Else if *hasParameterExpressions* is **false**, then
    1.  If `"arguments"` is an element of *functionNames* or if `"arguments"` is an element of *lexicalNames*, then
        1.  Let *argumentsObjectNeeded* be **false**.

21. For each String *paramName* in *parameterNames*, do
    1.  Let *alreadyDeclared* be *envRec*.HasBinding(*paramName*).
    2.  NOTE Early errors ensure that duplicate parameter names can only occur in non-strict functions that do not have parameter default values or rest parameters.
    3.  If *alreadyDeclared* is **false**, then
        1.  Let *status* be *envRec*.CreateMutableBinding(*paramName*).
        2.  If *hasDuplicates* is **true**, then
            1.  Let *status* be *envRec*.InitializeBinding(*paramName*, **undefined**).

        3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is never an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) for either of the above operations.

22. If *argumentsObjectNeeded* is **true**, then
    1.  If *strict* is **true** or if *simpleParameterList* is **false**, then
        1.  Let *ao* be [CreateUnmappedArgumentsObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createunmappedargumentsobject)(*argumentsList*)*.*

    2.  Else,
        1.  NOTE mapped argument object is only provided for non-strict functions that don’t have a rest parameter, any parameter default value initializers, or any destructured parameters .
        2.  Let *ao* be [CreateMappedArgumentsObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createmappedargumentsobject)(*func*, *formals*, *argumentsList*, *env*).

    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*ao*).
    4.  If *strict* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *status* be *envRec*.CreateImmutableBinding(`"arguments"`).

    5.  Else,
        1.  Let *status* be *envRec*.CreateMutableBinding(`"arguments"`).

    6.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is never an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
    7.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *envRec*.InitializeBinding(`"arguments"`, *ao*).
    8.  Append `"arguments"` to *parameterNames*.

23. Let *iteratorRecord* be Record {\[\[iterator\]\]: [CreateListIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createlistiterator)(*argumentsList*), \[\[done\]\]: **false**}.
24. If *hasDuplicates* is **true**, then
    1.  Let *formalStatus* be IteratorBindingInitialization for *formals* with *iteratorRecord* and **undefined** as arguments.

25. Else,
    1.  Let *formalStatus* be IteratorBindingInitialization for *formals* with *iteratorRecord* and *env* as arguments.

26. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*formalStatus*).
27. If *hasParameterExpressions* is **false**, then
    1.  NOTE Only a single [lexical environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) is needed for the parameters and top-level vars.
    2.  Let *instantiatedVarNames* be a copy of the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) *parameterNames*.
    3.  For each *n* in *varNames*, do
        1.  If *n* is not an element of *instantiatedVarNames*, then
            1.  Append *n* to *instantiatedVarNames*.
            2.  Let *status* be *envRec*.CreateMutableBinding(*n*).
            3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is never an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
            4.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *envRec*.InitializeBinding(*n*, **undefined**).

    4.  Let *varEnv* be *env*.
    5.  Let *varEnvRec* be *envRec*.

28. Else,
    1.  NOTE A separate [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) is needed to ensure that closures created by expressions in the formal parameter list do not have visibility of declarations in the function body.
    2.  Let *varEnv* be [NewDeclarativeEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newdeclarativeenvironment)(*env*).
    3.  Let *varEnvRec* be *varEnv*’s [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
    4.  Set the [VariableEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of *calleeContext* to *varEnv*.
    5.  Let *instantiatedVarNames* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
    6.  For each *n* in *varNames*, do
        1.  If *n* is not an element of *instantiatedVarNames*, then
            1.  Append *n* to *instantiatedVarNames*.
            2.  Let *status* be *varEnvRec*.CreateMutableBinding(*n*).
            3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is never an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
            4.  If *n* is not an element of *parameterNames* or if *n* is an element of *functionNames*, let *initialValue* be **undefined**.
            5.  else,
                1.  Let *initialValue* be *envRec.*GetBindingValue(*n*, **false**).
                2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*initialValue*).

            6.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *varEnvRec*.InitializeBinding(*n*, *initialValue*).
            7.  NOTE vars whose names are the same as a formal parameter, initially have the same value as the corresponding initialized parameter.

29. NOTE: Annex [B.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-block-level-function-declarations-web-legacy-compatibility-semantics) adds additional steps at this point.
30. If *strict* is **false**, then
    1.  Let *lexEnv* be [NewDeclarativeEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newdeclarativeenvironment)(*varEnv*).
    2.  NOTE: Non-strict functions use a separate lexical [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for top-level lexical declarations so that a direct `eval` ([see 12.3.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-calls-runtime-semantics-evaluation)) can determine whether any var scoped declarations introduced by the eval code conflict with pre-existing top-level lexically scoped declarations. This is not needed for strict functions because a strict direct `eval` always places all declarations into a new [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records).

31. Else, let *lexEnv* be *varEnv*.
32. Let *lexEnvRec* be *lexEnv*’s [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
33. Set the [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of *calleeContext* to *lexEnv*.
34. Let *lexDeclarations* be the LexicallyScopedDeclarations of *code*.
35. For each element *d* in *lexDeclarations* do
    1.  NOTE A lexically declared name cannot be the same as a function/generator declaration, formal parameter, or a var name. Lexically declared names are only instantiated here but not initialized.
    2.  For each element *dn* of the BoundNames of *d* do
        1.  If IsConstantDeclaration of *d* is **true**, then
            1.  Let *status* be *lexEnvRec*.CreateImmutableBinding(*dn*, **true**).

        2.  Else,
            1.  Let *status* be *lexEnvRec*.CreateMutableBinding(*dn*, **false**).

    3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is never an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).

36. For each parsed grammar phrase *f* in *functionsToInitialize*, do
    1.  Let *fn* be the sole element of the BoundNames of *f.*
    2.  Let *fo* be the result of performing InstantiateFunctionObject for *f* with argument *lexEnv*.
    3.  Let *status* be *varEnvRec*.SetMutableBinding(*fn*, *fo*, **false**).
    4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is never an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).

37. Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>).

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> [B.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-block-level-function-declarations-web-legacy-compatibility-semantics) provides an extension to the above algorithm that is necessary for backwards compatibility with web browser implementations of ECMAScript that predate ECMAScript 2015.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> Parameter *Initializers* may contain direct eval expressions ([12.3.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-calls-runtime-semantics-evaluation)). Any top level declarations of such evals are only visible to the eval code ([10.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-types-of-source-code)). The creation of the environment for such declarations is described in [14.1.18](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions-runtime-semantics-iteratorbindinginitialization).

<span id="sec-9.3" class="secnum">[9.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-built-in-function-objects "link to this section")</span> Built-in Function Objects
====================================================================================================================================================================================

The built-in function objects defined in this specification may be implemented as either ECMAScript function objects ([9.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-function-objects)) whose behaviour is provided using ECMAScript code or as implementation provided exotic function objects whose behaviour is provided in some other manner. In either case, the effect of calling such functions must conform to their specifications. An implementation may also provide additional built-in function objects that are not defined in this specification.

If a built-in function object is implemented as an exotic object it must have the ordinary object behaviour specified in [9.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots). All such exotic function objects also have \[\[Prototype\]\], \[\[Extensible\]\], and \[\[Realm\]\] internal slots.

Unless otherwise specified every built-in function object has the %FunctionPrototype% object ([19.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-function-prototype-object)) as the initial value of its \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

The behaviour specified for each built-in function via algorithm steps or other means is the specification of the function body behaviour for both \[\[Call\]\] and \[\[Construct\]\] invocations of the function. However, \[\[Construct\]\] invocation is not supported by all built-in functions. For each built-in function, when invoked with \[\[Call\]\], the \[\[Call\]\] thisArgument provides the <span class="value">this</span> value, the \[\[Call\]\] argumentsList provides the named parameters, and the NewTarget value is <span class="value">undefined</span>. When invoked with \[\[Construct\]\], the <span class="value">this</span> value is uninitialized, the \[\[Construct\]\] argumentsList provides the named parameters, and the \[\[Construct\]\] newTarget parameter provides the NewTarget value. If the built-in function is implemented as an [ECMAScript function object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-function-objects) then this specified behaviour must be implemented by the ECMAScript code that is the body of the function. Built-in functions that are ECMAScript function objects must be strict mode functions. If a built-in constructor has any \[\[Call\]\] behaviour other than throwing a <span class="value">TypeError</span> exception, an ECMAScript implementation of the function must be done in a manner that does not cause the function’s \[\[FunctionKind\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to have the value `"classConstructor"`.

Built-in function objects that are not identified as constructors do not implement the \[\[Construct\]\] internal method unless otherwise specified in the description of a particular function. When a built-in constructor is called as part of a `new` expression the argumentsList parameter of the invoked \[\[Construct\]\] internal method provides the values for the built-in constructor’s named parameters.

Built-in functions that are not constructors do not have a `prototype` property unless otherwise specified in the description of a particular function.

If a built-in function object is not implemented as an ECMAScript function it must provide \[\[Call\]\] and \[\[Construct\]\] internal methods that conform to the following definitions:

<span id="sec-9.3.1" class="secnum">[9.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-built-in-function-objects-call-thisargument-argumentslist "link to this section")</span> \[\[Call\]\] ( thisArgument, argumentsList)
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The \[\[Call\]\] internal method for a built-in function object F is called with parameters thisArgument and argumentsList, a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of [ECMAScript language values](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types). The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *callerContext* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
2.  If *callerContext* is not already [suspended](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts), [Suspend](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) *callerContext*.
3.  Let *calleeContext* be a new [ECMAScript code execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
4.  Set the Function of *calleeContext* to *F*.
5.  Let *calleeRealm* be the value of *F’s* \[\[Realm\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
6.  Set the [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) of *calleeContext* to *calleeRealm*.
7.  Perform any necessary implementation defined initialization of *calleeContext*.
8.  Push *calleeContext* onto [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts); *calleeContext* is now [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
9.  Let *result* be the [Completion Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) that is the result of evaluating *F* in an implementation defined manner that conforms to the specification of *F*. *thisArgument* is the **this** value, *argumentsList* provides the named parameters, and the NewTarget value is **undefined**.
10. Remove *calleeContext* from [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) and restore *callerContext* as [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
11. Return *result*.

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> When *calleeContext* is removed from [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) it must not be destroyed if it has been [suspended](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) and retained by an accessible generator object for later resumption*.*

<span id="sec-9.3.2" class="secnum">[9.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-built-in-function-objects-construct-argumentslist-newtarget "link to this section")</span> \[\[Construct\]\] (argumentsList, newTarget)
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The \[\[Construct\]\] internal method for built-in function object F is called with parameters argumentsList and newTarget. The steps performed are the same as \[\[Call\]\] ([see 9.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-built-in-function-objects-call-thisargument-argumentslist)) except that step 9 is replaced by:

1.  Let *result* be the [Completion Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) that is the result of evaluating *F* in an implementation defined manner that conforms to the specification of *F*. The **this** value is uninitialized, *argumentsList* provides the named parameters, and *newTarget* provides the NewTarget value.

<span id="sec-9.3.3" class="secnum">[9.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createbuiltinfunction "link to this section")</span> CreateBuiltinFunction(realm, steps, prototype, internalSlotsList)
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation CreateBuiltinFunction takes arguments <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*realm*, *prototype*,</span> and steps. The optional argument internalSlotsList is a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of the names of additional internal slots that must be defined as part of the object. If the list is not provided, an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) is used. CreateBuiltinFunction returns a built-in function object created by the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *realm* is a [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) Record.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *steps* is either a set of algorithm steps or other definition of a functions behaviour provided in this specification.
3.  Let *func* be a new built-in function object that when called performs the action described by *steps*. The new function object has internal slots whose names are the elements of *internalSlotsList*. The initial value of each of those internal slots is **undefined*.***
4.  Set the \[\[Realm\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *func* to *realm*.
5.  Set the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *func* to *prototype*.
6.  Return *func*.

Each built-in function defined in this specification is created as if by calling the CreateBuiltinFunction abstract operation, unless otherwise specified.

<span id="sec-9.4" class="secnum">[9.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-built-in-exotic-object-internal-methods-and-slots "link to this section")</span> Built-in Exotic Object Internal Methods and Slots
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

This specification defines several kinds of built-in exotic objects. These objects generally behave similar to ordinary objects except for a few specific situations. The following exotic objects use the ordinary object internal methods except where it is explicitly specified otherwise below:

<span id="sec-9.4.1" class="secnum">[9.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects "link to this section")</span> Bound Function Exotic Objects
================================================================================================================================================================================================

A *bound function* is an exotic object that wraps another function object. A bound function is callable (it has a \[\[Call\]\] internal method and may have a \[\[Construct\]\] internal method). Calling a bound function generally results in a call of its wrapped function.

Bound function objects do not have the internal slots of ECMAScript function objects defined in [Table 27](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-27). Instead they have the internal slots defined in [Table 28](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-28).

<span id="table-28">Table 28</span> — Internal Slots of Exotic Bound Function Objects
| Internal Slot               | Type                                                                                                        | Description                                                                                          |
|-----------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| \[\[BoundTargetFunction\]\] | Callable Object                                                                                             | The wrapped function object.                                                                         |
| \[\[BoundThis\]\]           | Any                                                                                                         | The value that is always passed as the **this** value when calling the wrapped function.             |
| \[\[BoundArguments\]\]      | [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of Any | A list of values whose elements are used as the first arguments to any call to the wrapped function. |

Unlike ECMAScript function objects, bound function objects do not use an alternative definition of the \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] internal methods. Bound function objects provide all of the essential internal methods as specified in [9.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots). However, they use the following definitions for the essential internal methods of function objects.

<span id="sec-9.4.1.1" class="secnum">[9.4.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects-call-thisargument-argumentslist "link to this section")</span> \[\[Call\]\] ( thisArgument, argumentsList)
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[Call\]\] internal method of an exotic [bound function](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) object, F, which was created using the bind function is called with parameters thisArgument and argumentsList, a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of [ECMAScript language values](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types), the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *target* be the value of *F’s* [\[\[BoundTargetFunction\]\]](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
2.  Let *boundThis* be the value of *F’s* [\[\[BoundThis\]\]](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
3.  Let *boundArgs* be the value of *F’s* [\[\[BoundArguments\]\]](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
4.  Let *args* be a new list containing the same values as the list *boundArgs* in the same order followed by the same values as the list *argumentsList* in the same order.
5.  Return [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*target*, *boundThis*, *args*).

<span id="sec-9.4.1.2" class="secnum">[9.4.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects-construct-argumentslist-newtarget "link to this section")</span> \[\[Construct\]\] (argumentsList, newTarget)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[Construct\]\] internal method of an exotic [bound function](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) object, F that was created using the bind function is called with a list of arguments <span style="font-family:
        Times New Roman">*argumentsList* and *newTarget*</span>, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *target* be the value of *F’s* [\[\[BoundTargetFunction\]\]](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *target* has a \[\[Construct\]\] internal method.
3.  Let *boundArgs* be the value of *F’s* [\[\[BoundArguments\]\]](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
4.  Let *args* be a new list containing the same values as the list *boundArgs* in the same order followed by the same values as the list *argumentsList* in the same order.
5.  If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*F*, *newTarget*) is **true**, let *newTarget* be *target*.
6.  Return [Construct](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-construct)(*target*, *args*, *newTarget*).

<span id="sec-9.4.1.3" class="secnum">[9.4.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-boundfunctioncreate "link to this section")</span> BoundFunctionCreate (targetFunction, boundThis, boundArgs)
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation BoundFunctionCreate with arguments targetFunction, boundThis and boundArgs is used to specify the creation of new [Bound Function](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) exotic objects. It performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*targetFunction*) is Object.
2.  Let *proto* be *targetFunction*.\[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\]().
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*proto*).
4.  Let *obj* be a newly created object.
5.  Set *obj*’s essential internal methods to the default ordinary object definitions specified in [9.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
6.  Set the \[\[Call\]\] internal method of *obj* as described in [9.4.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects-call-thisargument-argumentslist).
7.  If *targetFunction* has a \[\[Construct\]\] internal method, then
    1.  Set the \[\[Construct\]\] internal method of *obj* as described in [9.4.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects-construct-argumentslist-newtarget).

8.  Set the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *obj* to *proto*.
9.  Set the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *obj* to **true**.
10. Set the [\[\[BoundTargetFunction\]\]](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *obj* to *targetFunction*.
11. Set the [\[\[BoundThis\]\]](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *obj* to the value of *boundThis*.
12. Set the [\[\[BoundArguments\]\]](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *obj* to *boundArgs*.
13. Return *obj*.

<span id="sec-9.4.2" class="secnum">[9.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array-exotic-objects "link to this section")</span> Array Exotic Objects
==============================================================================================================================================================================

An *Array object* is an exotic object that gives special treatment to array index property keys ([see 6.1.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type)). A property whose property name is an array index is also called an *element*. Every Array object has a `length` property whose value is always a nonnegative integer less than <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">2<sup>32</sup></span>. The value of the `length` property is numerically greater than the name of every own property whose name is an array index; whenever an own property of an Array object is created or changed, other properties are adjusted as necessary to maintain this invariant. Specifically, whenever an own property is added whose name is an array index, the value of the `length` property is changed, if necessary, to be one more than the numeric value of that array index; and whenever the value of the `length` property is changed, every own property whose name is an array index whose value is not smaller than the new length is deleted. This constraint applies only to own properties of an Array object and is unaffected by `length` or array index properties that may be inherited from its prototypes.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> A String property name *P* is an *array index* if and only if [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)([ToUint32](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-touint32)(*P*)) is equal to *P* and [ToUint32](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-touint32)(*P*) is not equal to 2<sup>32</sup>−1.

Array exotic objects always have a non-configurable property named `"length"`.

Array exotic objects provide an alternative definition for the \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] internal method. Except for that internal method, Array exotic objects provide all of the other essential internal methods as specified in [9.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

<span id="sec-9.4.2.1" class="secnum">[9.4.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array-exotic-objects-defineownproperty-p-desc "link to this section")</span> \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] ( P, Desc)
===========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] internal method of an [Array exotic object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array-exotic-objects) A is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P, and [Property Descriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-property-descriptor-specification-type) *Desc* the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  If *P* is `"length"`, then
    1.  Return [ArraySetLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraysetlength)(*A*, *Desc*).

3.  Else if *P* is an array index, then
    1.  Let *oldLenDesc* be [OrdinaryGetOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarygetownproperty)(*A*, `"length"`).
    2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *oldLenDesc* will never be **undefined** or an accessor descriptor because Array objects are created with a length data property that cannot be deleted or reconfigured.
    3.  Let *oldLen* be *oldLenDesc*.\[\[Value\]\].
    4.  Let *index* be [ToUint32](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-touint32)(*P*).
    5.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *index* will never be an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
    6.  If *index* ≥ *oldLen* and *oldLenDesc*.\[\[Writable\]\] is **false**, return **false**.
    7.  Let *succeeded* be [OrdinaryDefineOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarydefineownproperty)(*A*, *P*, *Desc*).
    8.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *succeeded* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
    9.  If *succeeded* is **false**, return **false**.
    10. If *index* ≥ *oldLen*
        1.  Set *oldLenDesc*.\[\[Value\]\] to *index* + 1.
        2.  Let *succeeded* be [OrdinaryDefineOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarydefineownproperty)(*A*, `"length"`, *oldLenDesc*).
        3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *succeeded* is **true**.

    11. Return **true**.

4.  Return [OrdinaryDefineOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarydefineownproperty)(*A*, *P*, *Desc*).

<span id="sec-9.4.2.2" class="secnum">[9.4.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate "link to this section")</span> ArrayCreate(length, proto)
===============================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation ArrayCreate with argument length (a positive integer) and optional argument proto is used to specify the creation of new Array exotic objects. It performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *length* is an integer Number ≥ 0.
2.  If *length* is −0, let *length* be +0.
3.  If *length*&gt;2<sup>32</sup>-1, throw a **RangeError** exception.
4.  If the *proto* argument was not passed, let *proto* be the intrinsic object <span style="font-family:
                  sans-serif">%ArrayPrototype%</span>.
5.  Let *A* be a newly created [Array exotic object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array-exotic-objects).
6.  Set *A*’s essential internal methods except for \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] to the default ordinary object definitions specified in [9.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
7.  Set the \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] internal method of *A* as specified in [9.4.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array-exotic-objects-defineownproperty-p-desc).
8.  Set the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *A* to *proto*.
9.  Set the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *A* to **true**.
10. Perform [OrdinaryDefineOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarydefineownproperty)(*A*, `"length"`, PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]: *length*, \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false**}).
11. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): the preceding step never produces an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
12. Return *A*.

<span id="sec-9.4.2.3" class="secnum">[9.4.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrayspeciescreate "link to this section")</span> ArraySpeciesCreate(originalArray, length)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation ArraySpeciesCreate with arguments originalArray and length is used to specify the creation of a new Array object using a constructor function that is derived from originalArray. It performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *length* is an integer Number ≥ 0.
2.  If *length* is −0, let *length* be +0.
3.  Let *C* be **undefined**.
4.  Let *isArray* be [IsArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isarray)(*originalArray*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*isArray*).
6.  If *isArray* is **true**, then
    1.  Let *C* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*originalArray*, `"constructor"`).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*C*).
    3.  If [IsConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor)(*C*) is **true**, then
        1.  Let *thisRealm* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms).
        2.  Let *realmC* be [GetFunctionRealm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getfunctionrealm)(*C*).
        3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*realmC*).
        4.  If *thisRealm* and *realmC* are not the same [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) Record, then
            1.  If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*C*, *realmC*.\[\[intrinsics\]\].\[\[%Array%\]\]) is **true**, let *C* be **undefined**.

    4.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*C*) is Object, then
        1.  Let *C* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*C*, @@species).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*C*).
        3.  If *C* is **null**, let *C* be **undefined**.

7.  If *C* is **undefined**, return [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate)(*length*).
8.  If [IsConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor)(*C*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception*.*
9.  Return [Construct](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-construct)(*C*, «*length*»).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> If *originalArray* was created using the standard built-in Array constructor for a [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) that is not the [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) of [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts), then a new Array is created using the [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) of [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts). This maintains compatibility with Web browsers that have historically had that behaviour for the Array.prototype methods that now are defined using ArraySpeciesCreate.

<span id="sec-9.4.2.4" class="secnum">[9.4.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraysetlength "link to this section")</span> ArraySetLength(A, Desc)
===============================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation ArraySetLength is called with an [Array exotic object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array-exotic-objects) <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*A*,</span> and [Property Descriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-property-descriptor-specification-type) *Desc* the following steps are taken:

1.  If the \[\[Value\]\] field of *Desc* is absent, then
    1.  Return [OrdinaryDefineOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarydefineownproperty)(*A*, `"length"`, *Desc*).

2.  Let *newLenDesc* be a copy of *Desc*.
3.  Let *newLen* be [ToUint32](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-touint32)(*Desc*.\[\[Value\]\]).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*newLen*).
5.  Let *numberLen* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*Desc*.\[\[Value\]\]).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*newLen*).
7.  If *newLen* ≠ *numberLen*, throw a **RangeError** exception.
8.  Set *newLenDesc*.\[\[Value\]\] to *newLen*.
9.  Let *oldLenDesc* be [OrdinaryGetOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarygetownproperty)(*A*, `"length"`).
10. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *oldLenDesc* will never be **undefined** or an accessor descriptor because Array objects are created with a length data property that cannot be deleted or reconfigured.
11. Let *oldLen* be *oldLenDesc*.\[\[Value\]\].
12. If *newLen* ≥*oldLen*, then
    1.  Return [OrdinaryDefineOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarydefineownproperty)(*A*, `"length"`, *newLenDesc*).

13. If *oldLenDesc*.\[\[Writable\]\] is **false**, return **false**.
14. If *newLenDesc*.\[\[Writable\]\] is absent or has the value **true**, let *newWritable* be **true**.
15. Else,
    1.  Need to defer setting the \[\[Writable\]\] attribute to **false** in case any elements cannot be deleted.
    2.  Let *newWritable* be **false**.
    3.  Set *newLenDesc*.\[\[Writable\]\] to **true**.

16. Let *succeeded* be [OrdinaryDefineOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarydefineownproperty)(*A*, `"length"`, *newLenDesc*).
17. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *succeeded* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
18. If *succeeded* is **false**, return **false**.
19. While *newLen* &lt; *oldLen* repeat,
    1.  Set *oldLen* to *oldLen* – 1.
    2.  Let *deleteSucceeded* be *A*.\[\[Delete\]\]([ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*oldLen*)).
    3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *deleteSucceeded* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
    4.  If *deleteSucceeded* is **false**, then
        1.  Set *newLenDesc*.\[\[Value\]\] to *oldLen* *+* 1.
        2.  If *newWritable* is **false**, set *newLenDesc*.\[\[Writable\]\] to **false**.
        3.  Let *succeeded* be [OrdinaryDefineOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarydefineownproperty)(*A*, `"length"`, *newLenDesc*).
        4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *succeeded* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
        5.  Return **false**.

20. If *newWritable* is **false**, then
    1.  Return [OrdinaryDefineOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarydefineownproperty)(*A*, `"length"`, PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Writable\]\]: **false**}). This call will always return **true**.

21. Return **true**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> In steps 3 and 4, if *Desc*.\[\[Value\]\] is an object then its `valueOf` method is called twice. This is legacy behaviour that was specified with this effect starting with the 2<sup>nd</sup> Edition of this specification.

<span id="sec-9.4.3" class="secnum">[9.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-string-exotic-objects "link to this section")</span> String Exotic Objects
================================================================================================================================================================================

A *String object* is an exotic object that encapsulates a String value and exposes virtual integer indexed data properties corresponding to the individual code unit elements of the string value. Exotic String objects always have a data property named `"length"` whose value is the number of code unit elements in the encapsulated String value. Both the code unit data properties and the `"length"` property are non-writable and non-configurable.

Exotic String objects have the same internal slots as ordinary objects. They also have a \[\[StringData\]\] internal slot.

Exotic String objects provide alternative definitions for the following internal methods. All of the other exotic String object essential internal methods that are not defined below are as specified in [9.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

<span id="sec-9.4.3.1" class="secnum">[9.4.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-string-exotic-objects-getownproperty-p "link to this section")</span> \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] ( P )
============================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] internal method of an exotic String object S is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  Let *desc* be [OrdinaryGetOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarygetownproperty)(*S*, *P*).
3.  If *desc* is not **undefined** return *desc*.
4.  Return [StringGetIndexProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-stringgetindexproperty)(*S*, *P*).

<span id="sec-9.4.3.1.1" class="secnum">[9.4.3.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-stringgetindexproperty "link to this section")</span> StringGetIndexProperty (S, P)
=================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation StringGetIndexProperty is called with an exotic String object S and with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P, the following steps are taken:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*P*) is not String, return **undefined**.
2.  Let *index* be [CanonicalNumericIndexString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-canonicalnumericindexstring) (*P*).
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *index* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
4.  If *index* is **undefined**, return **undefined**.
5.  If [IsInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isinteger)(*index*) is **false**, return **undefined**.
6.  If *index* = −0, return **undefined**.
7.  Let *str* be the String value of the \[\[StringData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *S*.
8.  Let *len* be the number of elements in *str*.
9.  If *index* &lt; 0 or *len* ≤ *index*, return **undefined**.
10. Let *resultStr* be a String value of length 1, containing one code unit from *str*, specifically the code unit at index *index*.
11. Return a PropertyDescriptor{ \[\[Value\]\]: *resultStr*, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-9.4.3.2" class="secnum">[9.4.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-string-exotic-objects-hasproperty-p "link to this section")</span> \[\[HasProperty\]\](P)
===================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[HasProperty\]\] internal method of an exotic String object S is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *elementDesc* be [StringGetIndexProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-stringgetindexproperty)(*S*, *P*).
2.  If *elementDesc* is not **undefined**, return **true**.
3.  Return [OrdinaryHasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinaryhasproperty)(*S*, *P*)..

<span id="sec-9.4.3.3" class="secnum">[9.4.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-string-exotic-objects-ownpropertykeys "link to this section")</span> \[\[OwnPropertyKeys\]\] ( )
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[OwnPropertyKeys\]\] internal method of a [String exotic object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-string-exotic-objects) O is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *keys* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
2.  Let *str* be the String value of the \[\[StringData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
3.  Let *len* be the number of elements in *str*.
4.  For each integer *i* starting with 0 such that *i* &lt; *len*, in ascending order,
    1.  Add [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*i*) as the last element of *keys*

5.  For each own [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) *P* of *O* such that *P* is an integer index and [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*P*) ≥ *len*, in ascending numeric index order,
    1.  Add *P* as the last element of *keys*.

6.  For each own [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) *P* of *O* such that [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*P*) is String and *P* is not an integer index, in property creation order,
    1.  Add *P* as the last element of *keys*.

7.  For each own [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) *P* of *O* such that [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*P*) is Symbol, in property creation order,
    1.  Add *P* as the last element of *keys*.

8.  Return *keys*.

<span id="sec-9.4.3.4" class="secnum">[9.4.3.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-stringcreate "link to this section")</span> StringCreate( value, prototype)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation StringCreate with arguments value and prototype is used to specify the creation of new exotic String objects. It performs the following steps:

1.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*prototype*).
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*value*) is String.
3.  Let *S* be a newly created [String exotic object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-string-exotic-objects).
4.  Set the \[\[StringData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *S* to *value*.
5.  Set *S*’s essential internal methods to the default ordinary object definitions specified in [9.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
6.  Set the \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] internal method of *S* as specified in [9.4.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-string-exotic-objects-getownproperty-p).
7.  Set the \[\[HasProperty\]\] internal method of *S* as specified in [9.4.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-string-exotic-objects-hasproperty-p).
8.  Set the \[\[OwnPropertyKeys\]\] internal method of *S* as specified in [9.4.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-string-exotic-objects-ownpropertykeys).
9.  Set the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *S* to *prototype*.
10. Set the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *S* to **true**.
11. Let *length* be the number of code unit elements in *value.*
12. Let *status* be [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*S*, `"length"`, PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]: *length*, \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }).
13. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
14. Return *S*.

<span id="sec-9.4.4" class="secnum">[9.4.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arguments-exotic-objects "link to this section")</span> Arguments Exotic Objects
======================================================================================================================================================================================

Most ECMAScript functions make an arguments objects available to their code. Depending upon the characteristics of the function definition, its argument object is either an ordinary object or an *arguments exotic object*. An arguments exotic object is an exotic object whose array index properties map to the formal parameters bindings of an invocation of its associated ECMAScript function.

Arguments exotic objects have the same internal slots as ordinary objects. They also have a \[\[ParameterMap\]\] internal slot. Ordinary arguments objects also have a \[\[ParameterMap\]\] internal slot whose value is always undefined. For ordinary argument objects the \[\[ParameterMap\]\] internal slot is only used by `Object.prototype.toString` ([19.1.3.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.prototype.tostring)) to identify them as such.

Arguments exotic objects provide alternative definitions for the following internal methods. All of the other exotic arguments object essential internal methods that are not defined below are as specified in [9.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots)

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> For non-strict functions the integer indexed data properties of an arguments object whose numeric name values are less than the number of formal parameters of the corresponding function object initially share their values with the corresponding argument bindings in the function’s [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts). This means that changing the property changes the corresponding value of the argument binding and vice-versa. This correspondence is broken if such a property is deleted and then redefined or if the property is changed into an accessor property. For strict mode functions, the values of the arguments object’s properties are simply a copy of the arguments passed to the function and there is no dynamic linkage between the property values and the formal parameter values.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> The ParameterMap object and its property values are used as a device for specifying the arguments object correspondence to argument bindings. The ParameterMap object and the objects that are the values of its properties are not directly observable from ECMAScript code. An ECMAScript implementation does not need to actually create or use such objects to implement the specified semantics.

<span class="nh">NOTE 3</span> Arguments objects for strict mode functions define non-configurable accessor properties named `"caller"` and `"callee"` which throw a **TypeError** exception on access. The `"callee"` property has a more specific meaning for non-strict functions and a `"caller"` property has historically been provided as an implementation-defined extension by some ECMAScript implementations. The strict mode definition of these properties exists to ensure that neither of them is defined in any other manner by conforming ECMAScript implementations.

<span id="sec-9.4.4.1" class="secnum">[9.4.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arguments-exotic-objects-getownproperty-p "link to this section")</span> \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] (P)
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================

The \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] internal method of an arguments exotic object when called with a [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P performs the following steps:

1.  Let *args* be the arguments object.
2.  Let *desc* be [OrdinaryGetOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarygetownproperty)(*args*, *P*).
3.  If *desc* is **undefined**, return *desc*.
4.  Let *map* be the value of the \[\[ParameterMap\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the arguments object.
5.  Let *isMapped* be [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty)(*map*, *P*).
6.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *isMapped* is never an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
7.  If the value of *isMapped* is **true**, then
    1.  Set *desc*.\[\[Value\]\] to [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*map*, *P*).

8.  If [IsDataDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdatadescriptor)(*desc*) is **true** and *P* is `"caller"` and *desc*.\[\[Value\]\] is a strict mode Function object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
9.  Return *desc*.

If an implementation does not provide a built-in `caller` property for argument exotic objects then step 8 of this algorithm is must be skipped.

<span id="sec-9.4.4.2" class="secnum">[9.4.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arguments-exotic-objects-defineownproperty-p-desc "link to this section")</span> \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] (P, Desc)
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] internal method of an arguments exotic object when called with a [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P and [Property Descriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-property-descriptor-specification-type) *Desc* performs the following steps:

1.  Let *args* be the arguments object.
2.  Let *map* be the value of the \[\[ParameterMap\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the arguments object.
3.  Let *isMapped* be [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty)(*map*, *P*).
4.  Let *allowed* be [OrdinaryDefineOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarydefineownproperty)(*args*, *P*, *Desc*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*allowed*).
6.  If *allowed* is **false**, return **false**.
7.  If the value of *isMapped* is **true**, then
    1.  If [IsAccessorDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isaccessordescriptor)(*Desc*) is **true**, then
        1.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *map*.\[\[Delete\]\](*P*).

    2.  Else
        1.  If *Desc*.\[\[Value\]\] is present, then
            1.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*map*, *P*, *Desc*.\[\[Value\]\], **false**).
            2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *setStatus* is **true** because formal parameters mapped by argument objects are always writable.

        2.  If *Desc*.\[\[Writable\]\] is present and its value is **false**, then
            1.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *map*.\[\[Delete\]\](*P*).

8.  Return **true**.

<span id="sec-9.4.4.3" class="secnum">[9.4.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arguments-exotic-objects-get-p-receiver "link to this section")</span> \[\[Get\]\] (P, Receiver)
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The \[\[Get\]\] internal method of an arguments exotic object when called with a [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P and [ECMAScript language value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types) *Receiver* performs the following steps:

1.  Let *args* be the arguments object.
2.  Let *map* be the value of the \[\[ParameterMap\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the arguments object.
3.  Let *isMapped* be [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty)(*map*, *P*).
4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *isMapped* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
5.  If the value of *isMapped* is **false**, then
    1.  Return the result of calling the default ordinary object \[\[Get\]\] internal method ([9.1.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-get-p-receiver)) on *args* passing *P* and *Receiver* as the arguments.

6.  Else *map* contains a formal parameter mapping for *P*,
    1.  Return [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*map*, *P*).

<span id="sec-9.4.4.4" class="secnum">[9.4.4.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arguments-exotic-objects-set-p-v-receiver "link to this section")</span> \[\[Set\]\] ( P, V, Receiver)
================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The \[\[Set\]\] internal method of an arguments exotic object when called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P, value V, and [ECMAScript language value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types) *Receiver* performs the following steps:

1.  Let *args* be the arguments object.
2.  If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*args*, *Receiver*) is **false**, then
    1.  Let *isMapped* be **false**.

3.  Else,
    1.  Let *map* be the value of the \[\[ParameterMap\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the arguments object.
    2.  Let *isMapped* be [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty)(*map*, *P*).
