    3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *isMapped* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).

4.  If *isMapped* is **true**, then
    1.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*map*, *P*, *V*, **false**).
    2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *setStatus* is **true** because formal parameters mapped by argument objects are always writable.

5.  Return the result of calling the default ordinary object \[\[Set\]\] internal method ([9.1.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-set-p-v-receiver)) on *args* passing *P*, *V* and *Receiver* as the arguments.

<span id="sec-9.4.4.5" class="secnum">[9.4.4.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arguments-exotic-objects-delete-p "link to this section")</span> \[\[Delete\]\] (P)
=============================================================================================================================================================================================

The \[\[Delete\]\] internal method of an arguments exotic object when called with a [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P performs the following steps:

1.  Let *map* be the value of the \[\[ParameterMap\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the arguments object.
2.  Let *isMapped* be [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty)(*map*, *P*).
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *isMapped* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
4.  Let *result* be the result of calling the default \[\[Delete\]\] internal method for ordinary objects ([9.1.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-delete-p)) on the arguments object passing *P* as the argument.
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*result*).
6.  If *result* is **true** and the value of *isMapped* is **true**, then
    1.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *map*.\[\[Delete\]\](*P*).

7.  Return *result*.

<span id="sec-9.4.4.6" class="secnum">[9.4.4.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createunmappedargumentsobject "link to this section")</span> CreateUnmappedArgumentsObject(argumentsList)
===================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">CreateUnmappedArgumentsObject</span> called with an argument argumentsList performs the following steps:

1.  Let *len* be the number of elements in *argumentsList*.
2.  Let *obj* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(%ObjectPrototype%, «‍\[\[ParameterMap\]\]»).
3.  Set *obj*’s \[\[ParameterMap\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to **undefined**.
4.  Perform [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*obj*, `"length"`, PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]: *len*, \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true**}).
5.  Let *index* be 0.
6.  Repeat while *index* &lt; *len*,
    1.  Let *val* be *argumentsList*\[*index*\].
    2.  Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*obj*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*index*), *val*).
    3.  Let *index* be *index* + 1

7.  Perform [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*obj*, @@iterator, PropertyDescriptor {\[\[Value\]\]:%ArrayProto\_values%, \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true**}).
8.  Perform [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*obj*, `"caller"`, PropertyDescriptor {\[\[Get\]\]: [%ThrowTypeError%](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%throwtypeerror%), \[\[Set\]\]: [%ThrowTypeError%](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%throwtypeerror%), \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false**}).
9.  Perform [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*obj*, `"callee"`, PropertyDescriptor {\[\[Get\]\]: [%ThrowTypeError%](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%throwtypeerror%), \[\[Set\]\]: [%ThrowTypeError%](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%throwtypeerror%), \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false**}).
10. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): the above property definitions will not produce an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
11. Return *obj*

<span id="sec-9.4.4.7" class="secnum">[9.4.4.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createmappedargumentsobject "link to this section")</span> CreateMappedArgumentsObject ( func, formals, argumentsList, env )
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">CreateMappedArgumentsObject</span> is called with object func, parsed grammar phrase formals, [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) argumentsList, and [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*env*.</span> The following steps are performed:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *formals* does not contain a rest parameter, any binding patterns, or any initializers. It may contain duplicate identifiers.
2.  Let *len* be the number of elements in *argumentsList*.
3.  Let *obj* be a newly created arguments exotic object with a \[\[ParameterMap\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
4.  Set the \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] internal method of *obj* as specified in [9.4.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arguments-exotic-objects-getownproperty-p).
5.  Set the \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] internal method of *obj* as specified in [9.4.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arguments-exotic-objects-defineownproperty-p-desc).
6.  Set the \[\[Get\]\] internal method of *obj* as specified in [9.4.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arguments-exotic-objects-get-p-receiver).
7.  Set the \[\[Set\]\] internal method of *obj* as specified in [9.4.4.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arguments-exotic-objects-set-p-v-receiver).
8.  Set the \[\[Delete\]\] internal method of *obj* as specified in [9.4.4.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arguments-exotic-objects-delete-p).
9.  Set the remainder of *obj*’s essential internal methods to the default ordinary object definitions specified in [9.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
10. Set the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *obj* to %ObjectPrototype%.
11. Set the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *obj* to **true**.
12. Let *parameterNames* be the BoundNames of *formals*.
13. Let *numberOfParameters* be the number of elements in *parameterNames*
14. Let *index* be 0.
15. Repeat while *index* &lt; *len* ,
    1.  Let *val* be *argumentsList*\[*index*\].
    2.  Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*obj*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*index*), *val*).
    3.  Let *index* be *index* + 1

16. Perform [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*obj*, `"length"`, PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]: *len*, \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true**}).
17. Let *map* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(**null**).
18. Let *mappedNames* be an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
19. Let *index* be *numberOfParameters* − 1.
20. Repeat while *index* ≥ 0 ,
    1.  Let *name* be *parameterNames*\[*index*\].
    2.  If *name* is not an element of *mappedNames*, then
        1.  Add *name* as an element of the list *mappedNames*.
        2.  If *index* &lt; *len*, then
            1.  Let *g* be [MakeArgGetter](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makearggetter)(*name*, *env*).
            2.  Let *p* be [MakeArgSetter](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makeargsetter)(*name*, *env*).
            3.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *map*.\[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\]([ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*index*), PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Set\]\]: *p*, \[\[Get\]\]: *g,* \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true**}).

    3.  Let *index* be *index* − 1

21. Set the \[\[ParameterMap\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *obj* to *map*.
22. Perform [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*obj*, @@iterator, PropertyDescriptor {\[\[Value\]\]:%ArrayProto\_values%, \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true**}).
23. Perform [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*obj*, `"callee"`, PropertyDescriptor {\[\[Value\]\]: *func*, \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true**}).
24. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): the above property definitions will not produce an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
25. Return *obj*

<span id="sec-9.4.4.7.1" class="secnum">[9.4.4.7.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makearggetter "link to this section")</span> MakeArgGetter ( name, env)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">MakeArgGetter</span> called with String name and [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) env creates a built-in function object that when executed returns the value bound for name in env. It performs the following steps:

1.  Let *realm* be [the current Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
2.  Let *steps* be the steps of an ArgGetter function as specified below.
3.  Let *getter* be [CreateBuiltinFunction](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createbuiltinfunction)(*realm*, *steps*, %FunctionPrototype%, «‍\[\[name\]\], \[\[env\]\]» ).
4.  Set *getter’s* \[\[name\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *name*.
5.  Set *getter’s* \[\[env\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *env*.
6.  Return *getter*.

An ArgGetter function is an anonymous built-in function with \[\[name\]\] and \[\[env\]\] internal slots. When an ArgGetter function f that expects no arguments is called it performs the following steps:

1.  Let *name* be the value of *f’s* \[\[name\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
2.  Let *env* be the value of *f’s* \[\[env\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots)
3.  Return *env*.GetBindingValue(*name*, **false**).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> ArgGetter functions are never directly accessible to ECMAScript code.

<span id="sec-9.4.4.7.2" class="secnum">[9.4.4.7.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makeargsetter "link to this section")</span> MakeArgSetter ( name, env)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">MakeArgSetter</span> called with String name and [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) env creates a built-in function object that when executed sets the value bound for name in env. It performs the following steps:

1.  Let *realm* be [the current Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
2.  Let *steps* be the steps of an ArgSetter function as specified below.
3.  Let *setter* be [CreateBuiltinFunction](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createbuiltinfunction)(*realm*, *steps*, %FunctionPrototype%, «‍\[\[name\]\], \[\[env\]\]» ).
4.  Set *setter’s* \[\[name\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *name*.
5.  Set *setter’s* \[\[env\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *env*.
6.  Return *setter*.

An ArgSetter function is an anonymous built-in function with \[\[name\]\] and \[\[env\]\] internal slots. When an ArgSetter function f is called with argument value it performs the following steps:

1.  Let *name* be the value of *f’s* \[\[name\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
2.  Let *env* be the value of *f’s* \[\[env\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots)
3.  Return *env*.SetMutableBinding(*name*, *value*, **false**).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> ArgSetter functions are never directly accessible to ECMAScript code.

<span id="sec-9.4.5" class="secnum">[9.4.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects "link to this section")</span> Integer Indexed Exotic Objects
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

An *Integer Indexed object* is an exotic object that performs special handling of integer index property keys.

Integer Indexed exotic objects have the same internal slots as ordinary objects additionally \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\], \[\[ArrayLength\]\], \[\[ByteOffset\]\], and \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] internal slots.

Integer Indexed Exotic objects provide alternative definitions for the following internal methods. All of the other Integer Indexed exotic object essential internal methods that are not defined below are as specified in [9.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

<span id="sec-9.4.5.1" class="secnum">[9.4.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-getownproperty-p "link to this section")</span> \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] ( P )
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] internal method of an Integer Indexed exotic object O is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *O* is an Object that has a \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*P*) is String, then
    1.  Let *numericIndex* be [CanonicalNumericIndexString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-canonicalnumericindexstring)(*P*).
    2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *numericIndex* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
    3.  If *numericIndex* is not **undefined**, then
        1.  Let *value* be [IntegerIndexedElementGet](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integerindexedelementget) (*O*, *numericIndex*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*value*).
        3.  If *value* is **undefined**, return **undefined**.
        4.  Return a PropertyDescriptor{ \[\[Value\]\]: *value*, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

4.  Return [OrdinaryGetOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarygetownproperty)(*O*, *P*).

<span id="sec-9.4.5.2" class="secnum">[9.4.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-hasproperty-p "link to this section")</span> \[\[HasProperty\]\](P)
============================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[HasProperty\]\] internal method of an Integer Indexed exotic object O is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P, the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *O* is an Object that has a \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*P*) is String, then
    1.  Let *numericIndex* be [CanonicalNumericIndexString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-canonicalnumericindexstring)(*P*).
    2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *numericIndex* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
    3.  If *numericIndex* is not **undefined**, then
        1.  Let *buffer* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
        2.  If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*buffer*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
        3.  If [IsInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isinteger)(*numericIndex*) is **false**, return **false**
        4.  If *numericIndex* = −0, return **false**.
        5.  If *numericIndex* &lt; 0, return **false**.
        6.  If *numericIndex* ≥ the value of *O*’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), return **false**.
        7.  Return **true**.

4.  Return [OrdinaryHasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinaryhasproperty)(*O*, *P*).

<span id="sec-9.4.5.3" class="secnum">[9.4.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-defineownproperty-p-desc "link to this section")</span> \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] ( P, Desc)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] internal method of an Integer Indexed exotic object O is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P, and [Property Descriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-property-descriptor-specification-type) *Desc* the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *O* is an Object that has a \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*P*) is String, then
    1.  Let *numericIndex* be [CanonicalNumericIndexString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-canonicalnumericindexstring) (*P*).
    2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *numericIndex* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
    3.  If *numericIndex* is not **undefined**, then
        1.  If [IsInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isinteger)(*numericIndex*) is **false**, return **false**
        2.  Let *intIndex* be *numericIndex*.
        3.  If *intIndex* = −0, return **false**.
        4.  If *intIndex* &lt; 0, return **false**.
        5.  Let *length* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
        6.  If *intIndex* ≥ *length*, return **false**.
        7.  If [IsAccessorDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isaccessordescriptor)(*Desc*) is **true**, return **false.**
        8.  If *Desc* has a \[\[Configurable\]\] field and if *Desc*.\[\[Configurable\]\] is **true**, return **false*.***
        9.  If *Desc* has an \[\[Enumerable\]\] field and if *Desc*.\[\[Enumerable\]\] is **false**, return **false*.***
        10. If *Desc* has a \[\[Writable\]\] field and if *Desc*.\[\[Writable\]\] is **false**, return **false**.
        11. If *Desc* has a \[\[Value\]\] field, then
            1.  Let *value* be *Desc*.\[\[Value\]\].
            2.  Return [IntegerIndexedElementSet](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integerindexedelementset) (*O*, *intIndex*, *value*).

        12. Return **true**.

4.  Return [OrdinaryDefineOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarydefineownproperty)(*O*, *P*, *Desc*).

<span id="sec-9.4.5.4" class="secnum">[9.4.5.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-get-p-receiver "link to this section")</span> \[\[Get\]\] (P, Receiver)
================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[Get\]\] internal method of an Integer Indexed exotic object O is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P and [ECMAScript language value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types) *Receiver* the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*P*) is String and if [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*O*, *Receiver*) is **true**, then
    1.  Let *numericIndex* be [CanonicalNumericIndexString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-canonicalnumericindexstring) (*P*).
    2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *numericIndex* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
    3.  If *numericIndex* is not **undefined**, then
        1.  Return [IntegerIndexedElementGet](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integerindexedelementget) (*O*, *numericIndex*).

3.  Return the result of calling the default ordinary object \[\[Get\]\] internal method ([9.1.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-get-p-receiver)) on *O* passing *P* and *Receiver* as arguments.

<span id="sec-9.4.5.5" class="secnum">[9.4.5.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-set-p-v-receiver "link to this section")</span> \[\[Set\]\] ( P, V, Receiver)
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[Set\]\] internal method of an Integer Indexed exotic object O is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P, value V, and [ECMAScript language value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types) *Receiver*, the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*P*) is String and if [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*O*, *Receiver*) is **true**, then
    1.  Let *numericIndex* be [CanonicalNumericIndexString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-canonicalnumericindexstring) (*P*).
    2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *numericIndex* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
    3.  If *numericIndex* is not **undefined**, then
        1.  Return [IntegerIndexedElementSet](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integerindexedelementset) (*O*, *numericIndex*, *V*).

3.  Return the result of calling the default ordinary object \[\[Set\]\] internal method ([9.1.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-get-p-receiver)) on *O* passing *P*, *V*, and *Receiver* as arguments.

<span id="sec-9.4.5.6" class="secnum">[9.4.5.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-ownpropertykeys "link to this section")</span> \[\[OwnPropertyKeys\]\] ()
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[OwnPropertyKeys\]\] internal method of an Integer Indexed exotic object O is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *keys* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *O* is an Object that has \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\], \[\[ArrayLength\]\], \[\[ByteOffset\]\], and \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] internal slots.
3.  Let *len* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
4.  For each integer *i* starting with 0 such that *i* &lt; *len*, in ascending order,
    1.  Add [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*i*) as the last element of *keys*.

5.  For each own [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) *P* of *O* such that [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*P*) is String and *P* is not an integer index, in property creation order
    1.  Add *P* as the last element of *keys*.

6.  For each own [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) *P* of *O* such that [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*P*) is Symbol, in property creation order
    1.  Add *P* as the last element of *keys*.

7.  Return *keys*.

<span id="sec-9.4.5.7" class="secnum">[9.4.5.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integerindexedobjectcreate "link to this section")</span> IntegerIndexedObjectCreate <span style="font-family:
            sans-serif">(prototype, internalSlotsList)</span>
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IntegerIndexedObjectCreate with arguments prototype and internalSlotsList is used to specify the creation of new Integer Indexed exotic objects. The argument internalSlotsList is a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of the names of additional internal slots that must be defined as part of the object. IntegerIndexedObjectCreate performs the following steps:

1.  Let *A* be a newly created object with an [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) for each name in *internalSlotsList*.
2.  Set *A*’s essential internal methods to the default ordinary object definitions specified in [9.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
3.  Set the \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] internal method of *A* as specified in [9.4.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-getownproperty-p).
4.  Set the \[\[HasProperty\]\] internal method of *A* as specified in [9.4.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-hasproperty-p).
5.  Set the \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] internal method of *A* as specified in [9.4.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-defineownproperty-p-desc).
6.  Set the \[\[Get\]\] internal method of *A* as specified in [9.4.5.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-get-p-receiver).
7.  Set the \[\[Set\]\] internal method of *A* as specified in [9.4.5.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-set-p-v-receiver).
8.  Set the \[\[OwnPropertyKeys\]\] internal method of *A* as specified in [9.4.5.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-ownpropertykeys).
9.  Set the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *A* to *prototype*.
10. Set the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *A* to **true**.
11. Return *A*.

<span id="sec-9.4.5.8" class="secnum">[9.4.5.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integerindexedelementget "link to this section")</span> IntegerIndexedElementGet ( O, index )
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IntegerIndexedElementGet with arguments O and index performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*index*) is Number.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *O* is an Object that has \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\], \[\[ArrayLength\]\], \[\[ByteOffset\]\], and \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] internal slots.
3.  Let *buffer* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
4.  If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*buffer*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
5.  If [IsInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isinteger)(*index*) is **false**, return **undefined**
6.  If *index* = −0, return **undefined**.
7.  Let *length* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
8.  If *index* &lt; 0 or *index* ≥ *length*, return **undefined**.
9.  Let *offset* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ByteOffset\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
10. Let *arrayTypeName* be the string value of *O*’s \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
11. Let *elementSize* be the Number value of the Element Size value specified in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *arrayTypeName*.
12. Let *indexedPosition* = (*index* × *elementSize*) + *offset*.
13. Let *elementType* be the string value of the Element Type value in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *arrayTypeName*.
14. Return [GetValueFromBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvaluefrombuffer)(*buffer*, *indexedPosition*, *elementType*).

<span id="sec-9.4.5.9" class="secnum">[9.4.5.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integerindexedelementset "link to this section")</span> IntegerIndexedElementSet ( O, index, value )
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IntegerIndexedElementSet with arguments O, index, and value performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*index*) is Number.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *O* is an Object that has \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\], \[\[ArrayLength\]\], \[\[ByteOffset\]\], and \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] internal slots.
3.  Let *numValue* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*value*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*numValue*).
5.  Let *buffer* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
6.  If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*buffer*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
7.  If [IsInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isinteger)(*index*) is **false**, return **false**
8.  If *index* = −0, return **false**.
9.  Let *length* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
10. If *index* &lt; 0 or *index* ≥ *length*, return **false**.
11. Let *offset* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ByteOffset\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
12. Let *arrayTypeName* be the string value of *O*’s \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
13. Let *elementSize* be the Number value of the Element Size value specified in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *arrayTypeName*.
14. Let *indexedPosition* = (*index* × *elementSize*) + *offset*.
15. Let *elementType* be the string value of the Element Type value in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *arrayTypeName*.
16. Let *status* be [SetValueInBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setvalueinbuffer)(*buffer*, *indexedPosition*, *elementType*, *numValue*).
17. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
18. Return **true**.

<span id="sec-9.4.6" class="secnum">[9.4.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-namespace-exotic-objects "link to this section")</span> Module Namespace Exotic Objects
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

A *module namespace object* is an exotic object that exposes the bindings exported from an ECMAScript *Module* (See [15.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-exports)). There is a one-to-one correspondence between the String-keyed own properties of a module namespace exotic object and the binding names exported by the *Module*. The exported bindings include any bindings that are indirectly exported using `export         *` export items. Each String-valued own [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) is the StringValue of the corresponding exported binding name. These are the only String-keyed properties of a module namespace exotic object. Each such property has the attributes {\[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span>}. Module namespace objects are not extensible.

Module namespace objects have the internal slots defined in [Table 29](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-29).

<span id="table-29">Table 29</span> — Internal Slots of Module Namespace Exotic Objects
| Internal Slot   | Type                                                                                                           | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|-----------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| \[\[Module\]\]  | [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records)             | The [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) whose exports this namespace exposes.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| \[\[Exports\]\] | [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of String | A [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the String values of the exported names exposed as own properties of this object. The list is ordered as if an Array of those string values had been sorted using `Array.prototype.sort` using [SortCompare](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-sortcompare) as *<span style="font-family: Times New Roman">comparefn</span>.* |

Module namespace exotic objects provide alternative definitions for all of the internal methods.

<span id="sec-9.4.6.1" class="secnum">[9.4.6.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-namespace-exotic-objects-getprototypeof "link to this section")</span> \[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\] ( )
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\] internal method of a module namespace exotic object O is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Return **null**.

<span id="sec-9.4.6.2" class="secnum">[9.4.6.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-namespace-exotic-objects-setprototypeof-v "link to this section")</span> \[\[SetPrototypeOf\]\] (V)
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[SetPrototypeOf\]\] internal method of a module namespace exotic object O is called with argument V the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): Either [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*V*) is Object or [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*V*) is Null.
2.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-9.4.6.3" class="secnum">[9.4.6.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-namespace-exotic-objects-isextensible "link to this section")</span> \[\[IsExtensible\]\] ( )
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[IsExtensible\]\] internal method of a module namespace exotic object O is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-9.4.6.4" class="secnum">[9.4.6.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-namespace-exotic-objects-preventextensions "link to this section")</span> \[\[PreventExtensions\]\] ( )
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[PreventExtensions\]\] internal method of a module namespace exotic object O is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Return **true**.

<span id="sec-9.4.6.5" class="secnum">[9.4.6.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-namespace-exotic-objects-getownproperty-p "link to this section")</span> \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] (P)
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] internal method of a module namespace exotic object O is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P, the following steps are taken:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*P*) is Symbol, return [OrdinaryGetOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarygetownproperty)(*O*, *P*).
2.  Let *exports* be the value of *O*’s \[\[Exports\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
3.  If *P* is not an element of *exports*, return **undefined**.
4.  Let *value* be *O*.\[\[Get\]\](*P*, *O*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(value).
6.  Return PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]: *value*, \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-9.4.6.6" class="secnum">[9.4.6.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-namespace-exotic-objects-defineownproperty-p-desc "link to this section")</span> \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] (P, Desc)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] internal method of a module namespace exotic object O is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P and [Property Descriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-property-descriptor-specification-type) *Desc*, the following steps are taken:

1.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-9.4.6.7" class="secnum">[9.4.6.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-namespace-exotic-objects-hasproperty-p "link to this section")</span> \[\[HasProperty\]\] (P)
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[HasProperty\]\] internal method of a module namespace exotic object O is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P, the following steps are taken:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*P*) is Symbol, return [OrdinaryHasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinaryhasproperty)(*O*, *P*).
2.  Let *exports* be the value of *O*’s \[\[Exports\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
3.  If *P* is an element of *exports*, return **true**.
4.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-9.4.6.8" class="secnum">[9.4.6.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-namespace-exotic-objects-get-p-receiver "link to this section")</span> \[\[Get\]\] (P, Receiver)
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[Get\]\] internal method of a module namespace exotic object O is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P and [ECMAScript language value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types) *Receiver* the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*P*) is Symbol, then
    1.  Return the result of calling the default ordinary object \[\[Get\]\] internal method ([9.1.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-get-p-receiver)) on *O* passing *P* and *Receiver* as arguments.

3.  Let *exports* be the value of *O*’s \[\[Exports\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
4.  If *P* is not an element of *exports*, return **undefined**.
5.  Let *m* be the value of *O*’s \[\[Module\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
6.  Let *binding* be *m*.[ResolveExport](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-resolveexport)(*P*, «», «»).
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*binding*).
8.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *binding* is neither **null** nor `"ambiguous"`.
9.  Let *targetModule* be *binding*.\[\[module\]\],
10. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *targetModule* is not **undefined**.
11. Let *targetEnv* be *targetModule*.\[\[Environment\]\].
12. If *targetEnv* is **undefined**, throw a **ReferenceError** exception.
13. Let *targetEnvRec* be *targetEnv*’s [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
14. Return *targetEnvRec*.GetBindingValue(*binding.*\[\[bindingName\]\], **true**).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> [ResolveExport](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-resolveexport) is idempotent and side-effect free. An implementation might choose to pre-compute or cache the [ResolveExport](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-resolveexport) results for the \[\[Exports\]\] of each module namespace exotic object.

<span id="sec-9.4.6.9" class="secnum">[9.4.6.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-namespace-exotic-objects-set-p-v-receiver "link to this section")</span> \[\[Set\]\] ( P, V, Receiver)
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[Set\]\] internal method of <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">a</span> module namespace exotic object O is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P, value V, and [ECMAScript language value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types) *Receiver*, the following steps are taken:

1.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-9.4.6.10" class="secnum">[9.4.6.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-namespace-exotic-objects-delete-p "link to this section")</span> \[\[Delete\]\] (P)
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[Delete\]\] internal method of a module namespace exotic object O is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  Let *exports* be the value of *O*’s \[\[Exports\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
3.  If *P* is an element of *exports*, return **false**.
4.  Return **true**.

<span id="sec-9.4.6.11" class="secnum">[9.4.6.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-namespace-exotic-objects-enumerate "link to this section")</span> \[\[Enumerate\]\] ()
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[Enumerate\]\] internal method of a module namespace exotic object O is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *exports* be the value of *O*’s \[\[Exports\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
2.  Return [CreateListIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createlistiterator)(*exports*).

<span id="sec-9.4.6.12" class="secnum">[9.4.6.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-namespace-exotic-objects-ownpropertykeys "link to this section")</span> \[\[OwnPropertyKeys\]\] ( )
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[OwnPropertyKeys\]\] internal method of a module namespace exotic object O is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *exports* be a copy of the value of *O*’s \[\[Exports\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
2.  Let *symbolKeys* be the result of calling the default ordinary object \[\[OwnPropertyKeys\]\] internal method ([9.1.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-ownpropertykeys)) on *O* passing no arguments.
3.  Append all the entries of *symbolKeys* to the end of *exports*.
4.  Return *exports*.

<span id="sec-9.4.6.13" class="secnum">[9.4.6.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-modulenamespacecreate "link to this section")</span> ModuleNamespaceCreate (module, exports)
========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation ModuleNamespaceCreate with arguments module, and exports is used to specify the creation of new module namespace exotic objects. It performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *module* is a [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) ([see 15.2.1.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations)).
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *module*.\[\[Namespace\]\] is **undefined**.
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *exports* is a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of string values.
4.  Let *M* be a newly created object.
5.  Set *M*’s essential internal methods to the definitions specified in [9.4.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-namespace-exotic-objects).
6.  Set *M*’s \[\[Module\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *module*.
7.  Set *M*’s \[\[Exports\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *exports*.
8.  Create own properties of *M* corresponding to the definitions in [26.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-namespace-objects).
9.  Set *module*.\[\[Namespace\]\] to *M*.
10. Return *M*.

<span id="sec-9.5" class="secnum">[9.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-proxy-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots "link to this section")</span> Proxy Object Internal Methods and Internal Slots
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

A proxy object is an exotic object whose essential internal methods are partially implemented using ECMAScript code. Every proxy objects has an [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) called \[\[ProxyHandler\]\]. The value of \[\[ProxyHandler\]\] is an object, called the proxy’s *handler object*, or <span class="value">null</span>. Methods (see [Table 30](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-30)) of a handler object may be used to augment the implementation for one or more of the proxy object’s internal methods. Every proxy object also has an [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) called \[\[ProxyTarget\]\] whose value is either an object or the **null** value. This object is called the proxy’s *target object*.

<span id="table-30">Table 30</span> — Proxy Handler Methods
| Internal Method           | Handler Method             |
|---------------------------|----------------------------|
| \[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\]    | `getPrototypeOf`           |
| \[\[SetPrototypeOf\]\]    | `setPrototypeOf`           |
| \[\[IsExtensible\]\]      | `isExtensible`             |
| \[\[PreventExtensions\]\] | `preventExtensions`        |
| \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\]    | `getOwnPropertyDescriptor` |
| \[\[HasProperty\]\]       | `has`                      |
| \[\[Get\]\]               | `get`                      |
| \[\[Set\]\]               | `set`                      |
| \[\[Delete\]\]            | `deleteProperty`           |
| \[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\] | `defineProperty`           |
| \[\[Enumerate\]\]         | `enumerate`                |
| \[\[OwnPropertyKeys\]\]   | `ownKeys`                  |
| \[\[Call\]\]              | `apply`                    |
| \[\[Construct\]\]         | `construct`                |

When a handler method is called to provide the implementation of a proxy object internal method, the handler method is passed the proxy’s target object as a parameter. A proxy’s handler object does not necessarily have a method corresponding to every essential internal method. Invoking an internal method on the proxy results in the invocation of the corresponding internal method on the proxy’s target object if the handler object does not have a method corresponding to the internal trap.

The \[\[ProxyHandler\]\] and \[\[ProxyTarget\]\] internal slots of a proxy object are always initialized when the object is created and typically may not be modified. Some proxy objects are created in a manner that permits them to be subsequently *revoked*. When a proxy is revoked, its \[\[ProxyHander\]\] and \[\[ProxyTarget\]\] internal slots are set to **null** causing subsequent invocations of internal methods on that proxy object to throw a <span class="value">TypeError</span> exception.

Because proxy objects permit the implementation of internal methods to be provided by arbitrary ECMAScript code, it is possible to define a proxy object whose handler methods violates the invariants defined in [6.1.7.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-invariants-of-the-essential-internal-methods). Some of the internal method invariants defined in [6.1.7.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-invariants-of-the-essential-internal-methods) are essential integrity invariants. These invariants are explicitly enforced by the proxy object internal methods specified in this section. An ECMAScript implementation must be robust in the presence of all possible invariant violations.

In the following algorithm descriptions, assume O is an ECMAScript proxy object, P is a [property key value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type), V is any [ECMAScript language value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types) and <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">Desc</span> is a [Property Descriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-property-descriptor-specification-type) record.

<span id="sec-9.5.1" class="secnum">[9.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-proxy-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-getprototypeof "link to this section")</span> \[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\] ( )
===============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\] internal method of a Proxy exotic object O is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *handler* be the value of the \[\[ProxyHandler\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
2.  If *handler* is **null**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*handler*) is Object.
4.  Let *target* be the value of the \[\[ProxyTarget\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
5.  Let *trap* be [GetMethod](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getmethod)(*handler*, `"getPrototypeOf"`).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*trap*).
7.  If *trap* is **undefined**, then
    1.  Return *target*.\[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\]().

8.  Let *handlerProto* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*trap*, *handler*, «*target*»).
9.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*handlerProto*).
10. If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*handlerProto*) is neither Object nor Null, throw a **TypeError** exception.
11. Let *extensibleTarget* be [IsExtensible](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isextensible-o)(*target*).
12. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*extensibleTarget*).
13. If *extensibleTarget* is **true**, return *handlerProto*.
14. Let *targetProto* be *target*.\[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\]().
15. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*targetProto*).
16. If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*handlerProto*, *targetProto*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
17. Return *handlerProto*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> \[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\] for proxy objects enforces the following invariant:

-   The result of \[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\] must be either an Object or **null**.

-   If the target object is not extensible, \[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\] applied to the proxy object must return the same value as \[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\] applied to the proxy object’s target object.

<span id="sec-9.5.2" class="secnum">[9.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-proxy-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-setprototypeof-v "link to this section")</span> \[\[SetPrototypeOf\]\] (V)
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[SetPrototypeOf\]\] internal method of a Proxy exotic object O is called with argument V the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): Either [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*V*) is Object or [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*V*) is Null.
2.  Let *handler* be the value of the \[\[ProxyHandler\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
3.  If *handler* is **null**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*handler*) is Object.
5.  Let *target* be the value of the \[\[ProxyTarget\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
6.  Let *trap* be [GetMethod](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getmethod)(*handler*, `"setPrototypeOf"`).
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*trap*).
8.  If *trap* is **undefined**, then
    1.  Return *target*.\[\[SetPrototypeOf\]\](*V*).

9.  Let *booleanTrapResult* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*trap*, *handler*, «*target*, *V*»)).
10. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*booleanTrapResult*).
11. Let *extensibleTarget* be [IsExtensible](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isextensible-o)(*target*).
12. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*extensibleTarget*).
13. If *extensibleTarget* is **true**, return *booleanTrapResult*.
14. Let *targetProto* be *target*.\[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\]().
15. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*targetProto*).
16. If *booleanTrapResult* is **true** and [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*V*, *targetProto*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
17. Return *booleanTrapResult*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> \[\[SetPrototypeOf\]\] for proxy objects enforces the following invariant:

-   The result of \[\[SetPrototypeOf\]\] is a Boolean value.

-   If the target object is not extensible, the argument value must be the same as the result of \[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\] applied to target object.

<span id="sec-9.5.3" class="secnum">[9.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-proxy-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-isextensible "link to this section")</span> \[\[IsExtensible\]\] ( )
===========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[IsExtensible\]\] internal method of a Proxy exotic object O is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *handler* be the value of the \[\[ProxyHandler\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
2.  If *handler* is **null**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*handler*) is Object.
4.  Let *target* be the value of the \[\[ProxyTarget\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
5.  Let *trap* be [GetMethod](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getmethod)(*handler*, `"isExtensible"`).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*trap*).
7.  If *trap* is **undefined**, then
    1.  Return *target*.\[\[IsExtensible\]\]().

8.  Let *booleanTrapResult* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*trap*, *handler*, «*target*»)).
9.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*booleanTrapResult*).
10. Let *targetResult* be *target*.\[\[IsExtensible\]\]().
11. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*targetResult*).
12. If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*booleanTrapResult*, *targetResult*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
13. Return *booleanTrapResult*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> \[\[IsExtensible\]\] for proxy objects enforces the following invariant:

-   The result of \[\[IsExtensible\]\] is a Boolean value.

-   \[\[IsExtensible\]\] applied to the proxy object must return the same value as \[\[IsExtensible\]\] applied to the proxy object’s target object with the same argument.

<span id="sec-9.5.4" class="secnum">[9.5.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-proxy-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-preventextensions "link to this section")</span> \[\[PreventExtensions\]\] ( )
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[PreventExtensions\]\] internal method of a Proxy exotic object O is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *handler* be the value of the \[\[ProxyHandler\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
2.  If *handler* is **null**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*handler*) is Object.
4.  Let *target* be the value of the \[\[ProxyTarget\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
5.  Let *trap* be [GetMethod](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getmethod)(*handler*, `"preventExtensions"`).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*trap*).
7.  If *trap* is **undefined**, then
    1.  Return *target*.\[\[PreventExtensions\]\]().

8.  Let *booleanTrapResult* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*trap*, *handler*, «*target*»)).
9.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*booleanTrapResult*).
10. If *booleanTrapResult* is **true**, then
    1.  Let *targetIsExtensible* be *target*.\[\[IsExtensible\]\]().
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*targetIsExtensible*).
    3.  If *targetIsExtensible* is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.

11. Return *booleanTrapResult*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> \[\[PreventExtensions\]\] for proxy objects enforces the following invariant:

-   The result of \[\[PreventExtensions\]\] is a Boolean value.

-   \[\[PreventExtensions\]\] applied to the proxy object only returns **true** if \[\[IsExtensible\]\] applied to the proxy object’s target object is **false**.

<span id="sec-9.5.5" class="secnum">[9.5.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-proxy-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots-getownproperty-p "link to this section")</span> \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] (P)
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] internal method of a Proxy exotic object O is called with [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) P, the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)(*P*) is **true**.
2.  Let *handler* be the value of the \[\[ProxyHandler\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
3.  If *handler* is **null**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*handler*) is Object.
5.  Let *target* be the value of the \[\[ProxyTarget\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
6.  Let *trap* be [GetMethod](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getmethod)(*handler*, `"getOwnPropertyDescriptor"`).
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*trap*).
8.  If *trap* is **undefined**, then
    1.  Return *target*.\[\[GetOwnProperty\]\](*P*).

9.  Let *trapResultObj* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*trap*, *handler*, «*target*, *P*»).
10. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*trapResultObj*).
11. If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*trapResultObj*) is neither Object nor Undefined, throw a **TypeError** exception.
12. Let *targetDesc* be *target*.\[\[GetOwnProperty\]\](*P*).
13. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*targetDesc*).
14. If *trapResultObj* is **undefined**, then
    1.  If *targetDesc* is **undefined**, return **undefined**.
    2.  If *targetDesc*.\[\[Configurable\]\] is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    3.  Let *extensibleTarget* be [IsExtensible](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isextensible-o)(*target*).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*extensibleTarget*).
    5.  If [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)(*extensibleTarget*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    6.  Return **undefined**.

15. Let *extensibleTarget* be [IsExtensible](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isextensible-o)(*target*).
16. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*extensibleTarget*).
17. Let *resultDesc* be [ToPropertyDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-topropertydescriptor)(*trapResultObj*).
18. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*resultDesc*).
19. [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) [CompletePropertyDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completepropertydescriptor)(*resultDesc*).
20. Let *valid* be [IsCompatiblePropertyDescriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscompatiblepropertydescriptor) (*extensibleTarget*, *resultDesc*, *targetDesc*).
21. If *valid* is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
22. If *resultDesc*.\[\[Configurable\]\] is **false**, then
    1.  If *targetDesc* is **undefined** or *targetDesc*.\[\[Configurable\]\] is **true***,* then
        1.  Throw a **TypeError** exception.

23. Return *resultDesc*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] for proxy objects enforces the following invariants:

-   The result of \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] must be either an Object or **undefined**.

-   A property cannot be reported as non-existent, if it exists as a non-configurable own property of the target object.

-   A property cannot be reported as non-existent, if it exists as an own property of the target object and the target object is not extensible.

-   A property cannot be reported as existent, if it does not exists as an own property of the target object and the target object is not extensible.
