<span id="sec-12.2.3" class="secnum">[12.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-primary-expression-literals "link to this section")</span> Literals
===========================================================================================================================================================================

Syntax
------

*Literal* <span class="geq">:</span>

*NullLiteral*

*BooleanLiteral*

*NumericLiteral*

*StringLiteral*

<span id="sec-12.2.3.1" class="secnum">[12.2.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-literals-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================

*Literal* <span class="geq">:</span> *NullLiteral*

1.  Return **null**.

*Literal* <span class="geq">:</span> *BooleanLiteral*

1.  Return **false** if *BooleanLiteral* is the token `false`.
2.  Return **true** if *BooleanLiteral* is the token `true`.

*Literal* <span class="geq">:</span> *NumericLiteral*

1.  Return the number whose value is MV of *NumericLiteral* as defined in [11.8.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-literals-numeric-literals).

*Literal* <span class="geq">:</span> *StringLiteral*

1.  Return the StringValue of *StringLiteral* as defined in [11.8.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-string-literals-static-semantics-stringvalue).

<span id="sec-12.2.4" class="secnum">[12.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array-initializer "link to this section")</span> Array Initializer
==========================================================================================================================================================================

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> An *ArrayLiteral* is an expression describing the initialization of an Array object, using a list, of zero or more expressions each of which represents an array element, enclosed in square brackets. The elements need not be literals; they are evaluated each time the array initializer is evaluated.

Array elements may be elided at the beginning, middle or end of the element list. Whenever a comma in the element list is not preceded by an *AssignmentExpression* (i.e., a comma at the beginning or after another comma), the missing array element contributes to the length of the Array and increases the index of subsequent elements. Elided array elements are not defined. If an element is elided at the end of an array, that element does not contribute to the length of the Array.

Syntax
------

*ArrayLiteral*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`[` *Elision*<sub>opt</sub> `]`

`[` *ElementList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `]`

`[` *ElementList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `,` *Elision*<sub>opt</sub> `]`

*ElementList*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*Elision*<sub>opt</sub> *AssignmentExpression*<sub>\[In,\\ ?Yield\]</sub>

*Elision*<sub>opt</sub> *SpreadElement*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*ElementList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `,` *Elision*<sub>opt</sub> *AssignmentExpression*<sub>\[In,\\ ?Yield\]</sub>

*ElementList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `,` *Elision*<sub>opt</sub> *SpreadElement*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*Elision* <span class="geq">:</span>

`,`

*Elision* `,`

*SpreadElement*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`...` *AssignmentExpression*<sub>\[In,\\ ?Yield\]</sub>

<span id="sec-12.2.4.1" class="secnum">[12.2.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-static-semantics-elisionwidth "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: ElisionWidth
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================

*Elision* <span class="geq">:</span> `,`

1.  Return the numeric value 1.

*Elision* <span class="geq">:</span> *Elision* `,`

1.  Let *preceding* be the ElisionWidth of *Elision*.
2.  Return *preceding*+1.

<span id="sec-12.2.4.2" class="secnum">[12.2.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-runtime-semantics-arrayaccumulation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: ArrayAccumulation
===================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With parameters array and nextIndex.

*ElementList* <span class="geq">:</span> *Elision*<sub>opt</sub> *AssignmentExpression*

1.  Let *padding* be the ElisionWidth of *Elision*; if *Elision* is not present, use the numeric value zero.
2.  Let *initResult* be the result of evaluating *AssignmentExpression*.
3.  Let *initValue* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*initResult*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*initValue*).
5.  Let *created* be [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*array*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)([ToUint32](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-touint32)(*nextIndex+padding*)), *initValue*).
6.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *created* is **true***.*
7.  Return *nextIndex+padding+*1.

*ElementList* <span class="geq">:</span> *Elision*<sub>opt</sub> *SpreadElement*

1.  Let *padding* be the ElisionWidth of *Elision*; if *Elision* is not present, use the numeric value zero.
2.  Return the result of performing ArrayAccumulation for *SpreadElement* with arguments *array* and *nextIndex*+*padding*.

*ElementList* <span class="geq">:</span> *ElementList* `,` *Elision*<sub>opt</sub> *AssignmentExpression*

1.  Let *postIndex* be the result of performing ArrayAccumulation for *ElementList* with arguments *array* and *nextIndex*.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*postIndex*).
3.  Let *padding* be the ElisionWidth of *Elision*; if *Elision* is not present, use the numeric value zero.
4.  Let *initResult* be the result of evaluating *AssignmentExpression*.
5.  Let *initValue* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*initResult*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*initValue*).
7.  Let *created* be [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*array*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)([ToUint32](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-touint32)(*postIndex*+*padding*)), *initValue*).
8.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *created* is **true**.
9.  Return *postIndex*+*padding+*1.

*ElementList* <span class="geq">:</span> *ElementList* `,` *Elision*<sub>opt</sub> *SpreadElement*

1.  Let *postIndex* be the result of performing ArrayAccumulation for *ElementList* with arguments *array* and *nextIndex*.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*postIndex*).
3.  Let *padding* be the ElisionWidth of *Elision*; if *Elision* is not present, use the numeric value zero.
4.  Return the result of performing ArrayAccumulation for *SpreadElement* with arguments *array* and *postIndex*+*padding*.

*SpreadElement* <span class="geq">:</span> `...` *AssignmentExpression*

1.  Let *spreadRef* be the result of evaluating *AssignmentExpression*.
2.  Let *spreadObj* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*spreadRef*).
3.  Let *iterator* be [GetIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getiterator)(*spreadObj*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*iterator*).
5.  Repeat
    1.  Let *next* be [IteratorStep](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorstep)(*iterator*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*next*).
    3.  If *next* is **false**, return *nextIndex*.
    4.  Let *nextValue* be [IteratorValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorvalue)(*next*).
    5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*nextValue*).
    6.  Let *status* be [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*array*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*nextIndex*), *nextValue*).
    7.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is **true** .
    8.  Let *nextIndex* be *nextIndex* + 1.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty) is used to ensure that own properties are defined for the array even if the standard built-in Array prototype object has been modified in a manner that would preclude the creation of new own properties using \[\[Set\]\].

<span id="sec-12.2.4.3" class="secnum">[12.2.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array-initializer-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*ArrayLiteral* <span class="geq">:</span> `[` *Elision*<sub>opt</sub> `]`

1.  Let *array* be [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate)(0).
2.  Let *pad* be the ElisionWidth of *Elision*; if *Elision* is not present, use the numeric value zero.
3.  Perform [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*array*, `"length"`, *pad*, **false**).
4.  NOTE: The above Set cannot fail because of the nature of the object returned by [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate).
5.  Return *array*.

*ArrayLiteral* <span class="geq">:</span> `[` *ElementList* `]`

1.  Let *array* be [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate)(0).
2.  Let *len* be the result of performing ArrayAccumulation for *ElementList* with arguments *array* and 0.
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
4.  Perform [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*array*, `"length"`, *len*, **false**).
5.  NOTE: The above Set cannot fail because of the nature of the object returned by [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate).
6.  Return *array*.

*ArrayLiteral* <span class="geq">:</span> `[` *ElementList* `,` *Elision*<sub>opt</sub> `]`

1.  Let *array* be [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate)(0).
2.  Let *len* be the result of performing ArrayAccumulation for *ElementList* with arguments *array* and 0.
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
4.  Let *padding* be the ElisionWidth of *Elision*; if *Elision* is not present, use the numeric value zero.
5.  Perform [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*array*, `"length"`, [ToUint32](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-touint32)(*padding*+*len*), **false**).
6.  NOTE: The above Set cannot fail because of the nature of the object returned by [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate).
7.  Return *array*.

<span id="sec-12.2.5" class="secnum">[12.2.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-initializer "link to this section")</span> Object Initializer
============================================================================================================================================================================

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> An object initializer is an expression describing the initialization of an Object, written in a form resembling a literal. It is a list of zero or more pairs of property keys and associated values, enclosed in curly brackets. The values need not be literals; they are evaluated each time the object initializer is evaluated.

Syntax
------

*ObjectLiteral*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`{` `}`

`{` *PropertyDefinitionList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `}`

`{` *PropertyDefinitionList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `,` `}`

*PropertyDefinitionList*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*PropertyDefinition*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*PropertyDefinitionList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `,` *PropertyDefinition*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*PropertyDefinition*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*IdentifierReference*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*CoverInitializedName*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*PropertyName*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `:` *AssignmentExpression*<sub>\[In,\\ ?Yield\]</sub>

*MethodDefinition*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*PropertyName*<sub>\[Yield,GeneratorParameter\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*LiteralPropertyName*

<span class="grhsannot">\[+GeneratorParameter\]</span> *ComputedPropertyName*

<span class="grhsannot">\[~GeneratorParameter\]</span> *ComputedPropertyName*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*LiteralPropertyName* <span class="geq">:</span>

*IdentifierName*

*StringLiteral*

*NumericLiteral*

*ComputedPropertyName*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`[` *AssignmentExpression*<sub>\[In,\\ ?Yield\]</sub> `]`

*CoverInitializedName*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*IdentifierReference*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> *Initializer*<sub>\[In,\\ ?Yield\]</sub>

*Initializer*<sub>\[In,\\ Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`=` *AssignmentExpression*<sub>\[?In,\\ ?Yield\]</sub>

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> *MethodDefinition* is defined in [14.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-method-definitions).

<span class="nh">NOTE 3</span> In certain contexts, *ObjectLiteral* is used as a cover grammar for a more restricted secondary grammar. The *CoverInitializedName* production is necessary to fully cover these secondary grammars. However, use of this production results in an early Syntax Error in normal contexts where an actual *ObjectLiteral* is expected.

<span id="sec-12.2.5.1" class="secnum">[12.2.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-initializer-static-semantics-early-errors "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Early Errors
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*PropertyDefinition* <span class="geq">:</span> *MethodDefinition*

-   It is a Syntax Error if HasDirectSuper of *MethodDefinition* is <span style="font-family:
                  Times New Roman">***true***</span>.

In addition to describing an actual object initializer the *ObjectLiteral* productions are also used as a cover grammar for *ObjectAssignmentPattern* ([12.14.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-destructuring-assignment)). and may be recognized as part of a *CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList*. When *ObjectLiteral* appears in a context where *ObjectAssignmentPattern* is required the following Early Error rules are **not** applied. In addition, they are not applied when initially parsing a CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList.

*PropertyDefinition* <span class="geq">:</span> *CoverInitializedName*

-   Always throw a Syntax Error if code matches <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">this production.</span>

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> This production exists so that *ObjectLiteral* can serve as a cover grammar for *ObjectAssignmentPattern* ([12.14.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-destructuring-assignment)). It cannot occur in an actual object initializer.

<span id="sec-12.2.5.2" class="secnum">[12.2.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-initializer-static-semantics-computedpropertycontains "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: ComputedPropertyContains
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With parameter symbol.

See also: [14.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-method-definitions-static-semantics-computedpropertycontains), [14.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions-static-semantics-computedpropertycontains), [14.5.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-class-definitions-static-semantics-computedpropertycontains).

*PropertyName* <span class="geq">:</span> *LiteralPropertyName*

1.  Return **false**.

*PropertyName* <span class="geq">:</span> *ComputedPropertyName*

1.  Return the result of *ComputedPropertyName* Contains *symbol*.

<span id="sec-12.2.5.3" class="secnum">[12.2.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-initializer-static-semantics-contains "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Contains
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With parameter symbol.

See also: [5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-static-semantic-rules), [12.3.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-static-semantics-static-semantics-contains), [14.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions-static-semantics-contains), [14.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrow-function-definitions-static-semantics-contains), [14.4.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions-static-semantics-contains), [14.5.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-class-definitions-static-semantics-contains).

*PropertyDefinition* <span class="geq">:</span> *MethodDefinition*

1.  If *symbol* is *MethodDefinition*, return **true**.
2.  Return the result of ComputedPropertyContains for *MethodDefinition* with argument *symbol*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Static semantic rules that depend upon substructure generally do not look into function definitions.

*LiteralPropertyName* <span class="geq">:</span> *IdentifierName*

1.  If *symbol* is a *ReservedWord*, return **false**.
2.  If *symbol* is an *Identifier* and StringValue of *symbol* is the same value as the StringValue of *IdentifierName*, return **true**;
3.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-12.2.5.4" class="secnum">[12.2.5.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-initializer-static-semantics-hascomputedpropertykey "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: HasComputedPropertyKey
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

See also: [14.3.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-method-definitions-static-semantics-hascomputedpropertykey), [14.4.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions-static-semantics-hascomputedpropertykey)

*PropertyDefinitionList* <span class="geq">:</span> *PropertyDefinitionList* `,` *PropertyDefinition*

1.  If HasComputedPropertyKey of *PropertyDefinitionList* is **true**, return **true**.
2.  Return HasComputedPropertyKey of *PropertyDefinition*.

*PropertyDefinition* <span class="geq">:</span> *IdentifierReference*

1.  Return **false**.

*PropertyDefinition* <span class="geq">:</span> *PropertyName* `:` *AssignmentExpression*

1.  Return IsComputedPropertyKey of *PropertyName*.

<span id="sec-12.2.5.5" class="secnum">[12.2.5.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-static-semantics-iscomputedpropertykey "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: IsComputedPropertyKey
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*PropertyName* <span class="geq">:</span> *LiteralPropertyName*

1.  Return **false**.

*PropertyName* <span class="geq">:</span> *ComputedPropertyName*

1.  Return **true**.

<span id="sec-12.2.5.6" class="secnum">[12.2.5.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-initializer-static-semantics-propname "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: *PropName*
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

See also: [14.3.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-method-definitions-static-semantics-propname), [14.4.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions-static-semantics-propname), [14.5.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-class-definitions-static-semantics-propname)

*PropertyDefinition* <span class="geq">:</span> *IdentifierReference*

1.  Return StringValue of *IdentifierReference*.

*PropertyDefinition* <span class="geq">:</span> *PropertyName* `:` *AssignmentExpression*

1.  Return PropName of *PropertyName*.

*LiteralPropertyName* <span class="geq">:</span> *IdentifierName*

1.  Return StringValue of *IdentifierName*.

*LiteralPropertyName* <span class="geq">:</span> *StringLiteral*

1.  Return a String value whose code units are the SV of the *StringLiteral*.

*LiteralPropertyName* <span class="geq">:</span> *NumericLiteral*

1.  Let *nbr* be the result of forming the value of the *NumericLiteral*.
2.  Return [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*nbr*).

*ComputedPropertyName* <span class="geq">:</span> `[` *AssignmentExpression* `]`

1.  Return <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>.

<span id="sec-12.2.5.7" class="secnum">[12.2.5.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-static-semantics-propertynamelist "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: PropertyNameList
===============================================================================================================================================================================================================

*PropertyDefinitionList* <span class="geq">:</span> *PropertyDefinition*

1.  If PropName of *PropertyDefinition* is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, return a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
2.  Return a new [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing PropName of *PropertyDefinition*.

*PropertyDefinitionList* <span class="geq">:</span> *PropertyDefinitionList* `,` *PropertyDefinition*

1.  Let *list* be PropertyNameList of *PropertyDefinitionList.*
2.  If PropName of *PropertyDefinition* is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, return *list*.
3.  Append PropName of *PropertyDefinition* to the end of *list*.
4.  Return *list*.

<span id="sec-12.2.5.8" class="secnum">[12.2.5.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-initializer-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*ObjectLiteral* <span class="geq">:</span> `{` `}`

1.  Return [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(<span style="font-family:
                  sans-serif">%ObjectPrototype%</span>).

<span class="prod">*ObjectLiteral* <span class="geq">:</span></span>
 `{` *PropertyDefinitionList* `}`<span style="font-family: Times New
        Roman">*
*</span> `{` *PropertyDefinitionList* `,` `}`

1.  Let *obj* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(%ObjectPrototype%).
2.  Let *status* be the result of performing PropertyDefinitionEvaluation of *PropertyDefinitionList* with arguments *obj* and **true**.
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
4.  Return *obj*.

*LiteralPropertyName* <span class="geq">:</span> *IdentifierName*

1.  Return StringValue of *IdentifierName*.

*LiteralPropertyName* <span class="geq">:</span> *StringLiteral*

1.  Return a String value whose code units are the SV of the *StringLiteral*.

*LiteralPropertyName* <span class="geq">:</span> *NumericLiteral*

1.  Let *nbr* be the result of forming the value of the *NumericLiteral*.
2.  Return [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*nbr*).

*ComputedPropertyName* <span class="geq">:</span> `[` *AssignmentExpression* `]`

1.  Let *exprValue* be the result of evaluating *AssignmentExpression*.
2.  Let *propName* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*exprValue*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*propName*).
4.  Return [ToPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-topropertykey)(*propName*).

<span id="sec-12.2.5.9" class="secnum">[12.2.5.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-initializer-runtime-semantics-propertydefinitionevaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: PropertyDefinitionEvaluation
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With parameter object and <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*enumerable*.</span>

See also: [14.3.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-method-definitions-runtime-semantics-propertydefinitionevaluation), [14.4.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions-runtime-semantics-propertydefinitionevaluation), B.3.1

*PropertyDefinitionList* <span class="geq">:</span> *PropertyDefinitionList* `,` *PropertyDefinition*

1.  Let *status* be the result of performing PropertyDefinitionEvaluation of *PropertyDefinitionList* with arguments *object* and *enumerable*.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
3.  Return the result of performing PropertyDefinitionEvaluation of *PropertyDefinition* with arguments *object* and *enumerable*.

*PropertyDefinition* <span class="geq">:</span> *IdentifierReference*

1.  Let *propName* be StringValue of *IdentifierReference*.
2.  Let *exprValue* be the result of evaluating *IdentifierReference*.
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*exprValue*).
4.  Let *propValue* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*exprValue*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*propValue*).
6.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *enumerable* is **true**.
7.  Return [CreateDataPropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdatapropertyorthrow)(*object*, *propName*, *propValue*).

*PropertyDefinition* <span class="geq">:</span> *PropertyName* `:` *AssignmentExpression*

1.  Let *propKey* be the result of evaluating *PropertyName*.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*propKey*).
3.  Let *exprValueRef* be the result of evaluating *AssignmentExpression*.
4.  Let *propValue* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*exprValueRef*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*propValue*).
6.  If [IsAnonymousFunctionDefinition](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isanonymousfunctiondefinition)(*AssignmentExpression)* is **true**, then
    1.  Let *hasNameProperty* be [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty)(*propValue*, `"name"`).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*hasNameProperty*).
    3.  If *hasNameProperty* is **false**, perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*propValue*, *propKey*).

7.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *enumerable* is **true**.
8.  Return [CreateDataPropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdatapropertyorthrow)(*object*, *propKey*, *propValue*).

*NOTE An alternative semantics for this production is given in [B.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-__proto__-property-names-in-object-initializers).*

<span id="sec-12.2.6" class="secnum">[12.2.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-defining-expressions "link to this section")</span> Function Defining Expressions
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

See [14.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions) for <span class="prod">*PrimaryExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *FunctionExpression*</span> .

See [14.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions) for <span class="prod">*PrimaryExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *GeneratorExpression*</span> .

See [14.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-class-definitions) for <span class="prod">*PrimaryExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *ClassExpression*</span> .

<span id="sec-12.2.7" class="secnum">[12.2.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-primary-expression-regular-expression-literals "link to this section")</span> Regular Expression Literals
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================

Syntax
------

See [11.8.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-literals-string-literals).

<span id="sec-12.2.7.1" class="secnum">[12.2.7.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-primary-expression-regular-expression-literals-static-semantics-early-errors "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Early Errors
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*PrimaryExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *RegularExpressionLiteral*

-   It is a Syntax Error if <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">BodyText</span> of *RegularExpressionLiteral* cannot be recognized using the goal symbol *Pattern* of the ECMAScript RegExp grammar specified in [21.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-patterns).

-   It is a Syntax Error if <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">FlagText</span> of *RegularExpressionLiteral* contains any code points other than `"g"`, `"i"`, `"m"`, `"u"`, or `"y"`, or if it contains the same code point more than once.

<span id="sec-12.2.7.2" class="secnum">[12.2.7.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regular-expression-literals-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*PrimaryExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *RegularExpressionLiteral*

1.  Let *pattern* be the string value consisting of the [UTF16Encoding](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-utf16encoding) of each code point of BodyText of *RegularExpressionLiteral*.
2.  Let *flags* be the string value consisting of the [UTF16Encoding](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-utf16encoding) of each code point of FlagText of *RegularExpressionLiteral*.
3.  Return [RegExpCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpcreate)(*pattern*, *flags*).

<span id="sec-12.2.8" class="secnum">[12.2.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-template-literals "link to this section")</span> Template Literals
==========================================================================================================================================================================

Syntax
------

*TemplateLiteral*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*NoSubstitutionTemplate*

*TemplateHead* *Expression*<sub>\[In,\\ ?Yield\]</sub> *TemplateSpans*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*TemplateSpans*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*TemplateTail*

*TemplateMiddleList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> *TemplateTail*

*TemplateMiddleList*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*TemplateMiddle* *Expression*<sub>\[In,\\ ?Yield\]</sub>

*TemplateMiddleList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> *TemplateMiddle* *Expression*<sub>\[In,\\ ?Yield\]</sub>

<span id="sec-12.2.8.1" class="secnum">[12.2.8.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-static-semantics-templatestrings "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: TemplateStrings
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================

With parameter raw.

*TemplateLiteral* <span class="geq">:</span> *NoSubstitutionTemplate*

1.  If *raw* is **false**, then
    1.  Let *string* be the TV of *NoSubstitutionTemplate*.

2.  Else,
    1.  Let *string* be the TRV of *NoSubstitutionTemplate*.

3.  Return a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the single element, *string*.

*TemplateLiteral* <span class="geq">:</span> *TemplateHead* *Expression* *TemplateSpans*

1.  If *raw* is **false**, then
    1.  Let *head* be the TV of *TemplateHead*.

2.  Else,
    1.  Let *head* be the TRV of *TemplateHead*.

3.  Let *tail* be TemplateStrings of *TemplateSpans* with argument *raw*.
4.  Return a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing *head* followed by the element, in order of *tail*.

*TemplateSpans* <span class="geq">:</span> *TemplateTail*

1.  If *raw* is **false**, then
    1.  Let *tail* be the TV of *TemplateTail*.

2.  Else,
    1.  Let *tail* be the TRV of *TemplateTail*.

3.  Return a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the single element, *tail*.

*TemplateSpans* <span class="geq">:</span> *TemplateMiddleList* *TemplateTail*

1.  Let *middle* be TemplateStrings of *TemplateMiddleList* with argument *raw*.
2.  If *raw* is **false**, then
    1.  Let *tail* be the TV of *TemplateTail*.

3.  Else,
    1.  Let *tail* be the TRV of *TemplateTail*.

4.  Return a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the elements, in order, of *middle* followed by *tail*.

*TemplateMiddleList* <span class="geq">:</span> *TemplateMiddle* *Expression*

1.  If *raw* is **false**, then
    1.  Let *string* be the TV of *TemplateMiddle*.

2.  Else,
    1.  Let *string* be the TRV of *TemplateMiddle*.

3.  Return a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the single element, *string*.

*TemplateMiddleList* <span class="geq">:</span> *TemplateMiddleList* *TemplateMiddle* *Expression*

1.  Let *front* be TemplateStrings of *TemplateMiddleList* with argument *raw*.
2.  If *raw* is **false**, then
    1.  Let *last* be the TV of *TemplateMiddle*.

3.  Else,
    1.  Let *last* be the TRV of *TemplateMiddle*.

4.  Append *last* as the last element of the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) *front*.
5.  Return *front*.

<span id="sec-12.2.8.2" class="secnum">[12.2.8.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-template-literals-runtime-semantics-argumentlistevaluation "link to this section")</span> <span style="font-family: sans-serif">Runtime Semantics:</span> ArgumentListEvaluation
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

See also: [12.3.6.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-argument-lists-runtime-semantics-argumentlistevaluation)

*TemplateLiteral* <span class="geq">:</span> *NoSubstitutionTemplate*

1.  Let *templateLiteral* be this *TemplateLiteral.*
2.  Let *siteObj* be [GetTemplateObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-gettemplateobject)(*templateLiteral*).
3.  Return a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the one element which is *siteObj*.

*TemplateLiteral* <span class="geq">:</span> *TemplateHead* *Expression* *TemplateSpans*

1.  Let *templateLiteral* be this *TemplateLiteral.*
2.  Let *siteObj* be [GetTemplateObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-gettemplateobject)(*templateLiteral*).
3.  Let *firstSub* be the result of evaluating *Expression*.
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*firstSub*).
5.  Let *restSub* be SubstitutionEvaluation of *TemplateSpans*.
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*restSub*).
7.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *restSub* is a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
8.  Return a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) whose first element is *siteObj*, whose second elements is *firstSub*, and whose subsequent elements are the elements of *restSub*, in order. *restSub* may contain no elements.

<span id="sec-12.2.8.3" class="secnum">[12.2.8.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-gettemplateobject "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: GetTemplateObject ( templateLiteral )
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">GetTemplateObject</span> is called with a grammar production, templateLiteral, as an argument. It performs the following steps:

1.  Let *rawStrings* be TemplateStrings of *templateLiteral* with argument **true**.
2.  Let *ctx* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
3.  Let *realm* be the *ctx*’s [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms).
4.  Let *templateRegistry* be *realm*.\[\[templateMap\]\].
5.  For each element *e* of *templateRegistry*, do
    1.  If *e*.\[\[strings\]\] and *rawStrings* contain the same values in the same order, then
        1.  Return *e.*\[\[array\]\].

6.  Let *cookedStrings* be TemplateStrings of *templateLiteral* with argument **false**.
7.  Let *count* be the number of elements in the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) *cookedStrings*.
8.  Let *template* be [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate)(*count*).
9.  Let *rawObj* be [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate)(*count*).
10. Let *index* be 0.
11. Repeat while *index* &lt; *count*
    1.  Let *prop* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*index*).
    2.  Let *cookedValue* be the string value *cookedStrings*\[*index*\].
    3.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *template*.\[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\](*prop*, PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]: *cookedValue*, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false**})*.*
    4.  Let *rawValue* be the string value *rawStrings*\[*index*\].
    5.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *rawObj*.\[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\](*prop*, PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]: *rawValue*, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false**})*.*
    6.  Let *index* be *index*+1.

12. Perform [SetIntegrityLevel](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setintegritylevel)(*rawObj*, `"frozen"`).
13. [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *template*.\[\[DefineOwnProperty\]\](`"raw"`, PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Value\]\]: *rawObj*, \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false**})*.*
14. Perform [SetIntegrityLevel](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setintegritylevel)(*template*, `"frozen"`).
15. Append the Record{\[\[strings\]\]: *rawStrings*, \[\[array\]\]: *template*} to *templateRegistry*.
16. Return *template*.

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> The creation of a template object cannot result in an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> Each *TemplateLiteral* in the program code of a [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) is associated with a unique template object that is used in the evaluation of tagged Templates ([12.2.8.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-template-literals-runtime-semantics-evaluation)). The template objects are frozen and the same template object is used each time a specific tagged Template is evaluated. Whether template objects are created lazily upon first evaluation of the *TemplateLiteral* or eagerly prior to first evaluation is an implementation choice that is not observable to ECMAScript code.

<span class="nh">NOTE 3</span> Future editions of this specification may define additional non-enumerable properties of template objects.

<span id="sec-12.2.8.4" class="secnum">[12.2.8.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-runtime-semantics-substitutionevaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: SubstitutionEvaluation
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*TemplateSpans* <span class="geq">:</span> *TemplateTail*

1.  Return an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).

*TemplateSpans* <span class="geq">:</span> *TemplateMiddleList* *TemplateTail*

1.  Return the result of SubstitutionEvaluation of *TemplateMiddleList*.

*TemplateMiddleList* <span class="geq">:</span> *TemplateMiddle* *Expression*

1.  Let *sub* be the result of evaluating *Expression*.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*sub*).
3.  Return a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing only *sub*.

*TemplateMiddleList* <span class="geq">:</span> *TemplateMiddleList* *TemplateMiddle* *Expression*

1.  Let *preceding* be the result of SubstitutionEvaluation of *TemplateMiddleList* .
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*preceding*).
3.  Let *next* be the result of evaluating *Expression*.
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*next*).
5.  Append *next* as the last element of the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) *preceding*.
6.  Return *preceding*.

<span id="sec-12.2.8.5" class="secnum">[12.2.8.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-template-literals-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*TemplateLiteral* <span class="geq">:</span> *NoSubstitutionTemplate*

1.  Return the string value whose code units are the elements of the TV of *NoSubstitutionTemplate* as defined in [11.8.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-template-literal-lexical-components).

*TemplateLiteral* <span class="geq">:</span> *TemplateHead* *Expression* *TemplateSpans*

1.  Let *head* be the TV of *TemplateHead* as defined in [11.8.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-template-literal-lexical-components).
2.  Let *sub* be the result of evaluating *Expression*.
3.  Let *middle* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*sub*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*middle*).
5.  Let *tail* be the result of evaluating *TemplateSpans* .
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*tail*).
7.  Return the string value whose code units are the elements of *head* followed by the elements of *middle* followed by the elements of *tail*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The string conversion semantics applied to the *Expression* value are like `String.prototype.concat` rather than the `+` operator.

*TemplateSpans* <span class="geq">:</span> *TemplateTail*

1.  Let *tail* be the TV of *TemplateTail* as defined in [11.8.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-template-literal-lexical-components).
2.  Return the string consisting of the code units of *tail*.

*TemplateSpans* <span class="geq">:</span> *TemplateMiddleList* *TemplateTail*

1.  Let *head* be the result of evaluating *TemplateMiddleList*.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*head*).
3.  Let *tail* be the TV of *TemplateTail* as defined in [11.8.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-template-literal-lexical-components).
4.  Return the string whose code units are the elements of *head* followed by the elements of *tail*.

*TemplateMiddleList* <span class="geq">:</span> *TemplateMiddle* *Expression*

1.  Let *head* be the TV of *TemplateMiddle* as defined in [11.8.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-template-literal-lexical-components).
2.  Let *sub* be the result of evaluating *Expression*.
3.  Let *middle* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*sub*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*middle*).
5.  Return the sequence of code units consisting of the code units of *head* followed by the elements of *middle*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The string conversion semantics applied to the *Expression* value are like `String.prototype.concat` rather than the `+` operator.

*TemplateMiddleList* <span class="geq">:</span> *TemplateMiddleList* *TemplateMiddle* *Expression*

1.  Let *rest* be the result of evaluating *TemplateMiddleList* .
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rest*).
3.  Let *middle* be the TV of *TemplateMiddle* as defined in [11.8.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-template-literal-lexical-components).
4.  Let *sub* be the result of evaluating *Expression*.
5.  Let *last* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*sub*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*last*).
7.  Return the sequence of code units consisting of the elements of *rest* followed by the code units of *middle* followed by the elements of *last*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The string conversion semantics applied to the *Expression* value are like `String.prototype.concat` rather than the `+` operator.

<span id="sec-12.2.9" class="secnum">[12.2.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-grouping-operator "link to this section")</span> The Grouping Operator
==============================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-12.2.9.1" class="secnum">[12.2.9.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-grouping-operator-static-semantics-early-errors "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Early Errors
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*PrimaryExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList*

-   It is a Syntax Error if the lexical token sequence matched by *CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList* cannot be parsed with no tokens left over using *ParenthesizedExpression* as the goal symbol.

-   All Early Errors rules for *ParenthesizedExpression* and its derived productions also apply to <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">CoveredParenthesizedExpression</span> of *CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList*.

<span id="sec-12.2.9.4" class="secnum">[12.2.9.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-grouping-operator-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*PrimaryExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList*

1.  Let *expr* be CoveredParenthesizedExpression of *CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList*.
2.  Return the result of evaluating *expr*.

*ParenthesizedExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `(` *Expression* `)`

1.  Return the result of evaluating *Expression*. This may be of type [Reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> This algorithm does not apply [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue) to the result of evaluating *Expression*. The principal motivation for this is so that operators such as `delete` and `typeof` may be applied to parenthesized expressions.

<span id="sec-12.3.1" class="secnum">[12.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-static-semantics "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics
========================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-12.3.1.1" class="secnum">[12.3.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-static-semantics-static-semantics-contains "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Contains
================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With parameter symbol.

See also: [5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-static-semantic-rules), [12.2.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-initializer-static-semantics-contains), [14.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions-static-semantics-contains), [14.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrow-function-definitions-static-semantics-contains), [14.4.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions-static-semantics-contains), [14.5.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-class-definitions-static-semantics-contains)

*MemberExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *MemberExpression* `.` *IdentifierName*

1.  If *MemberExpression* Contains *symbol* is **true**, return **true**.
2.  If *symbol* is a *ReservedWord*, return **false**.
3.  If *symbol* is an *Identifier* and StringValue of *symbol* is the same value as the StringValue of *IdentifierName*, return **true**;
4.  Return **false**.

*SuperProperty* <span class="geq">:</span> `super` `.` *IdentifierName*

1.  If *symbol* is the *ReservedWord* `super`, return **true**.
2.  If *symbol* is a *ReservedWord*, return **false**.
3.  If *symbol* is an *Identifier* and StringValue of *symbol* is the same value as the StringValue of *IdentifierName*, return **true**;
4.  Return **false**.

*CallExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *CallExpression* `.` *IdentifierName*

1.  If *CallExpression* Contains *symbol* is **true**, return **true**.
2.  If *symbol* is a *ReservedWord*, return **false**.
3.  If *symbol* is an *Identifier* and StringValue of *symbol* is the same value as the StringValue of *IdentifierName*, return **true**;
4.  Return **false**.
