<span id="sec-12.3.2" class="secnum">[12.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-property-accessors "link to this section")</span> Property Accessors
============================================================================================================================================================================

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Properties are accessed by name, using either the dot notation:

MemberExpression `.` IdentifierName
CallExpression `.` IdentifierName

or the bracket notation:

MemberExpression `[` Expression `]`
CallExpression `[` Expression `]`

The dot notation is explained by the following syntactic conversion:

MemberExpression `.` IdentifierName

is identical in its behaviour to

MemberExpression `[` &lt;identifier-name-string&gt; `]`

and similarly

CallExpression `.` IdentifierName

is identical in its behaviour to

CallExpression `[` &lt;identifier-name-string&gt; `]`

where &lt;identifier-name-string&gt; is the result of evaluating <span style="font-family: Times New
        Roman">StringValue of</span> *IdentifierName*.

<span id="sec-12.3.2.1" class="secnum">[12.3.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-property-accessors-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*MemberExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *MemberExpression* `[` *Expression* `]`

1.  Let *baseReference* be the result of evaluating *MemberExpression*.
2.  Let *baseValue* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*baseReference*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*baseValue*).
4.  Let *propertyNameReference* be the result of evaluating *Expression*.
5.  Let *propertyNameValue* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*propertyNameReference*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*propertyNameValue*).
7.  Let *bv* be [RequireObjectCoercible](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-requireobjectcoercible)(*baseValue*).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*bv*).
9.  Let *propertyKey* be [ToPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-topropertykey)(*propertyNameValue*).
10. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*propertyKey*).
11. If the code matched by the syntactic production that is being evaluated is [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), let *strict* be **true**, else let *strict* be **false**.
12. Return a value of type [Reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type) whose base value is *bv* and whose referenced name is *propertyKey*, and whose strict reference flag is *strict*.

*MemberExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *MemberExpression* `.` *IdentifierName*

1.  Let *baseReference* be the result of evaluating *MemberExpression*.
2.  Let *baseValue* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*baseReference*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*baseValue*).
4.  Let *bv* be [RequireObjectCoercible](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-requireobjectcoercible)(*baseValue*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*bv*).
6.  Let *propertyNameString* be StringValue of *IdentifierName*
7.  If the code matched by the syntactic production that is being evaluated is [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), let *strict* be **true**, else let *strict* be **false**.
8.  Return a value of type [Reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type) whose base value is *bv* and whose referenced name is *propertyNameString*, and whose strict reference flag is *strict*.

*CallExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *CallExpression* `[` *Expression* `]`

Is evaluated in exactly the same manner as <span class="prod">*MemberExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *MemberExpression* `[` *Expression* `]`</span> except that the contained *CallExpression* is evaluated in step 1.

*CallExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *CallExpression* `.` *IdentifierName*

Is evaluated in exactly the same manner as <span class="prod">*MemberExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *MemberExpression* `.` *IdentifierName*</span> except that the contained *CallExpression* is evaluated in step 1.

<span id="sec-12.3.3" class="secnum">[12.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-new-operator "link to this section")</span> The `new` Operator
======================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-12.3.3.1" class="secnum">[12.3.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-new-operator-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*NewExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `new` *NewExpression*

1.  Return [EvaluateNew](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-evaluatenew)(*NewExpression*, <span style="font-family:
                    sans-serif">empty</span>).

*MemberExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `new` *MemberExpression* *Arguments*

1.  Return [EvaluateNew](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-evaluatenew)(*MemberExpression*, *Arguments*).

<span id="sec-12.3.3.1.1" class="secnum">[12.3.3.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-evaluatenew "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: EvaluateNew(constructProduction, arguments)
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation EvaluateNew with arguments <span style="font-family: Times New
          Roman">*constructProduction*,</span> and arguments performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *constructProduction* is either a *NewExpression* or a *MemberExpression*.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *arguments* is either <span style="font-family:
                    sans-serif">empty</span> or an *Arguments* production.
3.  Let *ref* be the result of evaluating *constructProduction*.
4.  Let *constructor* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*ref*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*constructor*).
6.  If *arguments* is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, let *argList* be an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
7.  Else,
    1.  Let *argList* be ArgumentListEvaluation of *arguments*.
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*argList*).

8.  If [IsConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor) (*constructor*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
9.  Return [Construct](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-construct)(*constructor*, *argList*).

<span id="sec-12.3.4" class="secnum">[12.3.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-calls "link to this section")</span> Function Calls
====================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-12.3.4.1" class="secnum">[12.3.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-calls-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*CallExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *MemberExpression* *Arguments*

1.  Let *ref* be the result of evaluating *MemberExpression*.
2.  Let *func* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*ref*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*func*).
4.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*ref*) is [Reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type) and [IsPropertyReference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*ref*) is **false** and [GetReferencedName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*ref*) *is* `"eval"`, then
    1.  If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*func*, %eval%) is **true**, then
        1.  Let *argList* be ArgumentListEvaluation(*Arguments*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*argList*).
        3.  If *argList* has no elements, return **undefined.**
        4.  Let *evalText* be the first element of *argList*.
        5.  If the source code matching this *CallExpression* is [strict code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), let *strictCaller* be **true.** Otherwise let *strictCaller* be **false.**
        6.  Let *evalRealm* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms).
        7.  Return [PerformEval](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-performeval)(*evalText*, *evalRealm*, *strictCaller*, **true**). .

5.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*ref*) is [Reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type), then
    1.  If [IsPropertyReference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*ref*) is **true**, then
        1.  Let *thisValue* be [GetThisValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getthisvalue)(*ref*).

    2.  Else, the base of *ref* is an [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records)
        1.  Let *refEnv* be [GetBase](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*ref*).
        2.  Let *thisValue* be *refEnv*.WithBaseObject().

6.  Else [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*ref*) is not [Reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type),
    1.  Let *thisValue* be **undefined**.

7.  Let *thisCall* be this *CallExpression*.
8.  Let *tailCall* be [IsInTailPosition](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isintailposition)(*thisCall*). (See [14.6.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isintailposition))
9.  Return [EvaluateDirectCall](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-evaluatedirectcall)(*func*, *thisValue*, *Arguments*, *tailCall*).

A *CallExpression* whose evaluation executes step 4.a.vii is a *direct eval*.

*CallExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *CallExpression* *Arguments*

1.  Let *ref* be the result of evaluating *CallExpression*.
2.  Let *thisCall* be this *CallExpression*
3.  Let *tailCall* be [IsInTailPosition](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isintailposition)(*thisCall*). (See [14.6.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isintailposition))
4.  Return [EvaluateCall](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-evaluatecall)(*ref*, *Arguments*, *tailCall*).

<span id="sec-12.3.4.2" class="secnum">[12.3.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-evaluatecall "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: EvaluateCall( ref, arguments, tailPosition )
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation EvaluateCall takes as arguments a value ref, a syntactic grammar production arguments, and a Boolean argument tailPosition. It performs the following steps:

1.  Let *func* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*ref*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*func*).
3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*ref*) is [Reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type), then
    1.  If [IsPropertyReference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*ref*) is **true**, then
        1.  Let *thisValue* be [GetThisValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getthisvalue)(*ref*).

    2.  Else, the base of *ref* is an [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records)
        1.  Let *refEnv* be [GetBase](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*ref*).
        2.  Let *thisValue* be *refEnv*.WithBaseObject().

4.  Else [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*ref*) is not [Reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type),
    1.  Let *thisValue* be **undefined**.

5.  Return [EvaluateDirectCall](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-evaluatedirectcall)(*func*, *thisValue*, *arguments*, *tailPosition*).

<span id="sec-12.3.4.3" class="secnum">[12.3.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-evaluatedirectcall "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: EvaluateDirectCall( func, thisValue, arguments, tailPosition )
===============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation EvaluateDirectCall takes as arguments a value func, a value thisValue, a syntactic grammar production arguments, and a Boolean argument tailPosition. It performs the following steps:

1.  Let *argList* be ArgumentListEvaluation(*arguments*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*argList*).
3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*func*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*func*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
5.  If *tailPosition* is **true**, perform [PrepareForTailCall](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-preparefortailcall)().
6.  Let *result* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*func*, *thisValue*, *argList*).
7.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): If *tailPosition* is **true**, the above call will not return here, but instead evaluation will continue as if the following return has already occurred.
8.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): If *result* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) then [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*result*) is an [ECMAScript language type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types).
9.  Return *result*.

<span id="sec-12.3.5" class="secnum">[12.3.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-super-keyword "link to this section")</span> The `super` Keyword
========================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-12.3.5.1" class="secnum">[12.3.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-super-keyword-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
===================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*SuperProperty* <span class="geq">:</span> `super` `[` *Expression* `]`

1.  Let *propertyNameReference* be the result of evaluating *Expression*.
2.  Let *propertyNameValue* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*propertyNameReference*).
3.  Let *propertyKey* be [ToPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-topropertykey)(*propertyNameValue*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*propertyKey*).
5.  If the code matched by the syntactic production that is being evaluated is [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), let *strict* be **true**, else let *strict* be **false**.
6.  Return [MakeSuperPropertyReference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makesuperpropertyreference)(*propertyKey*, *strict*).

*SuperProperty* <span class="geq">:</span> `super` `.` *IdentifierName*

1.  Let *propertyKey* be StringValue of *IdentifierName*.
2.  If the code matched by the syntactic production that is being evaluated is [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), let *strict* be **true**, else let *strict* be **false**.
3.  Return [MakeSuperPropertyReference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makesuperpropertyreference)(*propertyKey*, *strict*).

*SuperCall* <span class="geq">:</span> `super` *Arguments*

1.  Let *newTarget* be [GetNewTarget](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getnewtarget)().
2.  If *newTarget* is **undefined**, throw a **ReferenceError** exception.
3.  Let *func* be [GetSuperConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getsuperconstructor)().
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*func*).
5.  Let *argList* be ArgumentListEvaluation of *Arguments*.
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*argList*).
7.  Let *result* be [Construct](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-construct)(*func*, *argList*, *newTarget*).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*result*).
9.  Let *thisER* be [GetThisEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getthisenvironment)( ).
10. Return *thisER*.[BindThisValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bindthisvalue)(*result*).

<span id="sec-12.3.5.2" class="secnum">[12.3.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getsuperconstructor "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: GetSuperConstructor ( )
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation GetSuperConstructor performs the following steps:

1.  Let *envRec* be [GetThisEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getthisenvironment)( ).
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *envRec* is a function [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records).
3.  Let *activeFunction* be *envRec*.\[\[FunctionObject\]\].
4.  Let *superConstructor* be *activeFunction*.\[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\]().
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*superConstructor*).
6.  If [IsConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor)(*superConstructor*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
7.  Return *superConstructor*.

<span id="sec-12.3.5.3" class="secnum">[12.3.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makesuperpropertyreference "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: MakeSuperPropertyReference(propertyKey, strict)
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation MakeSuperPropertyReference with arguments propertyKey and strict performs the following steps:

1.  Let *env* be [GetThisEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getthisenvironment)( ).
2.  If *env*.HasSuperBinding() is **false**, throw a **ReferenceError** exception.
3.  Let *actualThis* be *env*.GetThisBinding().
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*actualThis*).
5.  Let *baseValue* be *env*.[GetSuperBase](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getsuperbase)().
6.  Let *bv* be [RequireObjectCoercible](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-requireobjectcoercible)(*baseValue*).
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*bv*).
8.  Return a value of type [Reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type) that is a Super [Reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type) whose base value is *bv*, whose referenced name is *propertyKey*, whose thisValue is *actualThis*, and whose strict reference flag is *strict*.

<span id="sec-12.3.6" class="secnum">[12.3.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-argument-lists "link to this section")</span> Argument Lists
====================================================================================================================================================================

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The evaluation of an argument list produces a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of values ([see 6.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type)).

<span id="sec-12.3.6.1" class="secnum">[12.3.6.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-argument-lists-runtime-semantics-argumentlistevaluation "link to this section")</span> <span style="font-family: sans-serif">Runtime Semantics:</span> ArgumentListEvaluation
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

See also: [12.2.8.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-template-literals-runtime-semantics-argumentlistevaluation)

*Arguments* <span class="geq">:</span> `(` `)`

1.  Return an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).

*ArgumentList* <span class="geq">:</span> *AssignmentExpression*

1.  Let *ref* be the result of evaluating *AssignmentExpression*.
2.  Let *arg* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*ref*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*arg*).
4.  Return a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) whose sole item is *arg*.

*ArgumentList* <span class="geq">:</span> `...` *AssignmentExpression*

1.  Let *list* be an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
2.  Let *spreadRef* be the result of evaluating *AssignmentExpression*.
3.  Let *spreadObj* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*spreadRef*).
4.  Let *iterator* be [GetIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getiterator)(*spreadObj*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*iterator*).
6.  Repeat
    1.  Let *next* be [IteratorStep](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorstep)(*iterator*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*next*).
    3.  If *next* is **false**, return *list*.
    4.  Let *nextArg* be [IteratorValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorvalue)(*next*).
    5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*nextArg*).
    6.  Append *nextArg* as the last element of *list*.

*ArgumentList* <span class="geq">:</span> *ArgumentList* `,` *AssignmentExpression*

1.  Let *precedingArgs* be the result of evaluating *ArgumentList*.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*precedingArgs*).
3.  Let *ref* be the result of evaluating *AssignmentExpression*.
4.  Let *arg* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*ref*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*arg*).
6.  Append *arg* to the end of *precedingArgs*.
7.  Return *precedingArgs*.

*ArgumentList* <span class="geq">:</span> *ArgumentList* `,` `...` *AssignmentExpression*

1.  Let *precedingArgs* be the result of evaluating *ArgumentList*.
2.  Let *spreadRef* be the result of evaluating *AssignmentExpression*.
3.  Let *iterator* be [GetIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getiterator)([GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*spreadRef*) ).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*iterator*).
5.  Repeat
    1.  Let *next* be [IteratorStep](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorstep)(*iterator*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*next*).
    3.  If *next* is **false**, return *precedingArgs*.
    4.  Let *nextArg* be [IteratorValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorvalue)(*next*).
    5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*nextArg*).
    6.  Append *nextArg* as the last element of *precedingArgs*.

<span id="sec-12.3.7" class="secnum">[12.3.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tagged-templates "link to this section")</span> Tagged Templates
========================================================================================================================================================================

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> A tagged template is a function call where the arguments of the call are derived from a *TemplateLiteral* ([12.2.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-template-literals)). The actual arguments include a template object ([12.2.8.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-gettemplateobject)) and the values produced by evaluating the expressions embedded within the *TemplateLiteral*.

<span id="sec-12.3.7.1" class="secnum">[12.3.7.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tagged-templates-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*MemberExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *MemberExpression* *TemplateLiteral*

1.  Let *tagRef* be the result of evaluating *MemberExpression*.
2.  Let *thisCall* be this *MemberExpression*.
3.  Let *tailCall* be [IsInTailPosition](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isintailposition)(*thisCall*). (See [14.6.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isintailposition))
4.  Return [EvaluateCall](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-evaluatecall)(*tagRef*, *TemplateLiteral*, *tailCall*).

*CallExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *CallExpression* *TemplateLiteral*

1.  Let *tagRef* be the result of evaluating *CallExpression*.
2.  Let *thisCall* be this *CallExpression*.
3.  Let *tailCall* be [IsInTailPosition](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isintailposition)(*thisCall*). (See [14.6.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isintailposition))
4.  Return [EvaluateCall](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-evaluatecall)(*tagRef*, *TemplateLiteral*, *tailCall*).

============================================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-12.4.4.1" class="secnum">[12.4.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-postfix-increment-operator-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*PostfixExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *LeftHandSideExpression* `++`

1.  Let *lhs* be the result of evaluating *LeftHandSideExpression*.
2.  Let *oldValue* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)([GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lhs*)).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*oldValue*).
4.  Let *newValue* be the result of adding the value `1` to *oldValue*, using the same rules as for the `+` operator ([see 12.7.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-applying-the-additive-operators-to-numbers)).
5.  Let *status* be [PutValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-putvalue)(*lhs*, *newValue*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
7.  Return *oldValue*.

<span id="sec-12.4.5" class="secnum">[12.4.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-postfix-decrement-operator "link to this section")</span> Postfix Decrement Operator
============================================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-12.4.5.1" class="secnum">[12.4.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-postfix-decrement-operator-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*PostfixExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *LeftHandSideExpression* `--`

1.  Let *lhs* be the result of evaluating *LeftHandSideExpression*.
2.  Let *oldValue* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)([GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lhs*)).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*oldValue*).
4.  Let *newValue* be the result of subtracting the value `1` from *oldValue*, using the same rules as for the `-` operator ([12.7.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-applying-the-additive-operators-to-numbers)).
5.  Let *status* be [PutValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-putvalue)(*lhs*, *newValue*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
7.  Return *oldValue*.

<span id="sec-12.5.4" class="secnum">[12.5.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-delete-operator "link to this section")</span> The `delete` Operator
============================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-12.5.4.1" class="secnum">[12.5.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-delete-operator-static-semantics-early-errors "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Early Errors
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*UnaryExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `delete` *UnaryExpression*

-   It is a Syntax Error if the *UnaryExpression* is contained in [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code) and the derived *UnaryExpression* is <span class="prod">*PrimaryExpression* <span class="geq">:</span></span> IdentifierReference.

-   It is a Syntax Error if the derived *UnaryExpression* is
     <span style="font-family:
                Times New Roman">*PrimaryExpression : CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList
    *</span>and *CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList* ultimately derives a phrase that, if used in place of UnaryExpression, would produce a Syntax Error according to these rules. This rule is recursively applied.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The last rule means that expressions such as
 `delete           (((foo)))`
produce early errors because of recursive application of the first rule.

<span id="sec-12.5.4.2" class="secnum">[12.5.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-delete-operator-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*UnaryExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `delete` *UnaryExpression*

1.  Let *ref* be the result of evaluating *UnaryExpression*.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*ref*).
3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*ref*) is not [Reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type), return **true**.
4.  If [IsUnresolvableReference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*ref*) is **true**, then
    1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsStrictReference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*ref*) is **false**.
    2.  Return **true**.

5.  If [IsPropertyReference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*ref*) is **true**, then
    1.  If [IsSuperReference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*ref*), throw a **ReferenceError** exception.
    2.  Let *baseObj* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)([GetBase](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*ref*)).
    3.  Let *deleteStatus* be *baseObj*.\[\[Delete\]\]([GetReferencedName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*ref*)).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*deleteStatus*).
    5.  If *deleteStatus* is **false** and [IsStrictReference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*ref*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    6.  Return *deleteStatus*.

6.  Else *ref* is a [Reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type) to an [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) binding,
    1.  Let *bindings* be [GetBase](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*ref*).
    2.  Return *bindings*.DeleteBinding([GetReferencedName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*ref*)).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> When a `delete` operator occurs within [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), a **SyntaxError** exception is thrown if its *UnaryExpression* is a direct reference to a variable, function argument, or function name. In addition, if a `delete` operator occurs within [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code) and the property to be deleted has the attribute { \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }, a **TypeError** exception is thrown.

<span id="sec-12.5.5" class="secnum">[12.5.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-void-operator "link to this section")</span> The `void` Operator
========================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-12.5.5.1" class="secnum">[12.5.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-void-operator-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
===================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*UnaryExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `void` *UnaryExpression*

1.  Let *expr* be the result of evaluating *UnaryExpression*.
2.  Let *status* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*expr*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
4.  Return **undefined**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue) must be called even though its value is not used because it may have observable side-effects.

<span id="sec-12.5.6" class="secnum">[12.5.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-typeof-operator "link to this section")</span> The `typeof` Operator
============================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-12.5.6.1" class="secnum">[12.5.6.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-typeof-operator-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*UnaryExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `typeof` *UnaryExpression*

1.  Let *val* be the result of evaluating *UnaryExpression*.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*val*) is [Reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type), then
    1.  If [IsUnresolvableReference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*val*) is **true**, return `"undefined"`.

3.  Let *val* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*val*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*val*).
5.  Return a String according to [Table 35](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-35).

<span id="table-35">Table 35</span> — typeof Operator Results

| **Type of** <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">val</span> | Result                                                                                                               |
|-------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Undefined                                                         | `"undefined"`                                                                                                        |
| Null                                                              | `"object"`                                                                                                           |
| Boolean                                                           | `"boolean"`                                                                                                          |
| Number                                                            | `"number"`                                                                                                           |
| String                                                            | `"string"`                                                                                                           |
| Symbol                                                            | `"symbol"`                                                                                                           |
| Object (ordinary and does not implement \[\[Call\]\])             | `"object"`                                                                                                           |
| Object (standard exotic and does not implement \[\[Call\]\])      | `"object"`                                                                                                           |
| Object (implements \[\[Call\]\])                                  | `"function"`                                                                                                         |
| Object (non-standard exotic and does not implement \[\[Call\]\])  | Implementation-defined. Must not be `"undefined"`, `"boolean"`, `"function"`, `"number"`, `"symbol"`, or `"string".` |

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Implementations are discouraged from defining new `typeof` result values for non-standard exotic objects. If possible `"object"`should be used for such objects.

<span id="sec-12.5.7" class="secnum">[12.5.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-prefix-increment-operator "link to this section")</span> Prefix Increment Operator
==========================================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-12.5.7.1" class="secnum">[12.5.7.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-prefix-increment-operator-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
===============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*UnaryExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `++` *UnaryExpression*

1.  Let *expr* be the result of evaluating *UnaryExpression*.
2.  Let *oldValue* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)([GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*expr*)).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*oldValue*).
4.  Let *newValue* be the result of adding the value `1` to *oldValue*, using the same rules as for the `+` operator ([see 12.7.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-applying-the-additive-operators-to-numbers)).
5.  Let *status* be [PutValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-putvalue)(*expr*, *newValue*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
7.  Return *newValue*.

<span id="sec-12.5.8" class="secnum">[12.5.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-prefix-decrement-operator "link to this section")</span> Prefix Decrement Operator
==========================================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-12.5.8.1" class="secnum">[12.5.8.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-prefix-decrement-operator-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
===============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*UnaryExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `--` *UnaryExpression*

1.  Let *expr* be the result of evaluating *UnaryExpression*.
2.  Let *oldValue* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)([GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*expr*)).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*oldValue*).
4.  Let *newValue* be the result of subtracting the value `1` from *oldValue*, using the same rules as for the `-` operator ([see 12.7.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-applying-the-additive-operators-to-numbers)).
5.  Let *status* be [PutValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-putvalue)(*expr*, *newValue*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
7.  Return *newValue*.

<span id="sec-12.5.9" class="secnum">[12.5.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-unary-plus-operator "link to this section")</span> Unary `+` Operator
=============================================================================================================================================================================

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The unary + operator converts its operand to Number type.

<span id="sec-12.5.9.1" class="secnum">[12.5.9.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-unary-plus-operator-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*UnaryExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `+` *UnaryExpression*

1.  Let *expr* be the result of evaluating *UnaryExpression*.
2.  Return [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)([GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*expr*)).

<span id="sec-12.5.10" class="secnum">[12.5.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-unary-minus-operator "link to this section")</span> Unary `-` Operator
================================================================================================================================================================================

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The unary `-` operator converts its operand to Number type and then negates it. Negating **+0** produces **−0**, and negating **−0** produces **+0**.

<span id="sec-12.5.10.1" class="secnum">[12.5.10.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-unary-minus-operator-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*UnaryExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `-` *UnaryExpression*

1.  Let *expr* be the result of evaluating *UnaryExpression*.
2.  Let *oldValue* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)([GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*expr*)).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*oldValue*).
4.  If *oldValue* is **NaN**, return **NaN**.
5.  Return the result of negating *oldValue*; that is, compute a Number with the same magnitude but opposite sign.

<span id="sec-12.5.11" class="secnum">[12.5.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bitwise-not-operator "link to this section")</span> Bitwise NOT Operator ( `~` )
==========================================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-12.5.11.1" class="secnum">[12.5.11.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bitwise-not-operator-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*UnaryExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `~` *UnaryExpression*

1.  Let *expr* be the result of evaluating *UnaryExpression*.
2.  Let *oldValue* be [ToInt32](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toint32)([GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*expr*)).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*oldValue*).
4.  Return the result of applying bitwise complement to *oldValue*. The result is a signed 32-bit integer.

<span id="sec-12.5.12" class="secnum">[12.5.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-logical-not-operator "link to this section")</span> Logical NOT Operator ( `!` )
==========================================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-12.5.12.1" class="secnum">[12.5.12.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-logical-not-operator-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*UnaryExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `!` *UnaryExpression*

1.  Let *expr* be the result of evaluating *UnaryExpression*.
2.  Let *oldValue* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*expr*)).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*oldValue*).
4.  If *oldValue* is **true**, return **false**.
5.  Return **true**.

<span id="sec-12.6.3.1" class="secnum">[12.6.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-applying-the-mul-operator "link to this section")</span> Applying the `*` Operator
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

The `*` *MultiplicativeOperator* performs multiplication, producing the product of its operands. Multiplication is commutative. Multiplication is not always associative in ECMAScript, because of finite precision.

The result of a floating-point multiplication is governed by the rules of IEEE 754-2008 binary double-precision arithmetic:

-   If either operand is **NaN**, the result is **NaN**.

-   The sign of the result is positive if both operands have the same sign, negative if the operands have different signs.

-   Multiplication of an infinity by a zero results in **NaN**.

-   Multiplication of an infinity by an infinity results in an infinity. The sign is determined by the rule already stated above.

-   Multiplication of an infinity by a finite nonzero value results in a signed infinity. The sign is determined by the rule already stated above.

-   In the remaining cases, where neither an infinity nor NaN is involved, the product is computed and rounded to the nearest representable value using IEEE 754-2008 round-to-nearest mode. If the magnitude is too large to represent, the result is then an infinity of appropriate sign. If the magnitude is too small to represent, the result is then a zero of appropriate sign. The ECMAScript language requires support of gradual underflow as defined by IEEE 754-2008.

<span id="sec-12.6.3.2" class="secnum">[12.6.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-applying-the-div-operator "link to this section")</span> Applying the `/` Operator
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

The `/` *MultiplicativeOperator* performs division, producing the quotient of its operands. The left operand is the dividend and the right operand is the divisor. ECMAScript does not perform integer division. The operands and result of all division operations are double-precision floating-point numbers. The result of division is determined by the specification of IEEE 754-2008 arithmetic:

-   If either operand is **NaN**, the result is **NaN**.

-   The sign of the result is positive if both operands have the same sign, negative if the operands have different signs.

-   Division of an infinity by an infinity results in **NaN**.

-   Division of an infinity by a zero results in an infinity. The sign is determined by the rule already stated above.

-   Division of an infinity by a nonzero finite value results in a signed infinity. The sign is determined by the rule already stated above.

-   Division of a finite value by an infinity results in zero. The sign is determined by the rule already stated above.

-   Division of a zero by a zero results in **NaN**; division of zero by any other finite value results in zero, with the sign determined by the rule already stated above.

-   Division of a nonzero finite value by a zero results in a signed infinity. The sign is determined by the rule already stated above.

-   In the remaining cases, where neither an infinity, nor a zero, nor **NaN** is involved, the quotient is computed and rounded to the nearest representable value using IEEE 754-2008 round-to-nearest mode. If the magnitude is too large to represent, the operation overflows; the result is then an infinity of appropriate sign. If the magnitude is too small to represent, the operation underflows and the result is a zero of the appropriate sign. The ECMAScript language requires support of gradual underflow as defined by IEEE 754-2008.

<span id="sec-12.6.3.3" class="secnum">[12.6.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-applying-the-mod-operator "link to this section")</span> Applying the `%` Operator
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

The `%` *MultiplicativeOperator* yields the remainder of its operands from an implied division; the left operand is the dividend and the right operand is the divisor.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> In C and C++, the remainder operator accepts only integral operands; in ECMAScript, it also accepts floating-point operands.

The result of a floating-point remainder operation as computed by the `%` operator is not the same as the “remainder” operation defined by IEEE 754-2008. The IEEE 754-2008 “remainder” operation computes the remainder from a rounding division, not a truncating division, and so its behaviour is not analogous to that of the usual integer remainder operator. Instead the ECMAScript language defines `%` on floating-point operations to behave in a manner analogous to that of the Java integer remainder operator; this may be compared with the C library function fmod.

The result of an ECMAScript floating-point remainder operation is determined by the rules of IEEE arithmetic:

-   If either operand is **NaN**, the result is **NaN**.

-   The sign of the result equals the sign of the dividend.

-   If the dividend is an infinity, or the divisor is a zero, or both, the result is **NaN**.

-   If the dividend is finite and the divisor is an infinity, the result equals the dividend.

-   If the dividend is a zero and the divisor is nonzero and finite, the result is the same as the dividend.

-   In the remaining cases, where neither an infinity, nor a zero, nor **NaN** is involved, the floating-point remainder r from a dividend n and a divisor d is defined by the mathematical relation r = n − (d × q) where q is an integer that is negative only if n/d is negative and positive only if n/d is positive, and whose magnitude is as large as possible without exceeding the magnitude of the true mathematical quotient of n and d. r is computed and rounded to the nearest representable value using IEEE 754-2008 round-to-nearest mode.

<span id="sec-12.7.3" class="secnum">[12.7.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-addition-operator-plus "link to this section")</span> The Addition operator ( `+` )
===========================================================================================================================================================================================

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The addition operator either performs string concatenation or numeric addition.

<span id="sec-12.7.3.1" class="secnum">[12.7.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-addition-operator-plus-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*AdditiveExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *AdditiveExpression* `+` *MultiplicativeExpression*

1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *AdditiveExpression*.
2.  Let *lval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lref*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lval*).
4.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *MultiplicativeExpression*.
5.  Let *rval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rval*).
7.  Let *lprim* be [ToPrimitive](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toprimitive)(*lval*).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lprim*).
9.  Let *rprim* be [ToPrimitive](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toprimitive)(*rval*).
10. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rprim*).
11. If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*lprim*) is String or [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*rprim*) is String, then
    1.  Let *lstr* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*lprim*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lstr*).
    3.  Let *rstr* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*rprim*).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rstr*).
    5.  Return the String that is the result of concatenating *lstr* and *rstr.*

12. Let *lnum* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*lprim*).
13. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lnum*).
14. Let *rnum* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*rprim*).
15. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rnum*).
16. Return the result of applying the addition operation to *lnum* and *rnum*. See the Note below [12.7.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-applying-the-additive-operators-to-numbers).

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> No hint is provided in the calls to [ToPrimitive](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toprimitive) in steps 7 and 9. All standard objects except Date objects handle the absence of a hint as if the hint Number were given; Date objects handle the absence of a hint as if the hint String were given. Exotic objects may handle the absence of a hint in some other manner.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> Step 11 differs from step 5 of the Abstract Relational Comparison algorithm ([7.2.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey)), by using the logical-or operation instead of the logical-and operation.

<span id="sec-12.7.4" class="secnum">[12.7.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-subtraction-operator-minus "link to this section")</span> The Subtraction Operator ( `-` )
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-12.7.4.1" class="secnum">[12.7.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-subtraction-operator-minus-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*AdditiveExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *AdditiveExpression* `-` *MultiplicativeExpression*

1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *AdditiveExpression*.
2.  Let *lval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lref*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lval*).
4.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *MultiplicativeExpression*.
5.  Let *rval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rval*).
7.  Let *lnum* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*lval*).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lnum*).
9.  Let *rnum* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*rval*).
10. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rnum*).
11. Return the result of applying the subtraction operation to *lnum* and *rnum*. See the note below [12.7.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-applying-the-additive-operators-to-numbers).

<span id="sec-12.7.5" class="secnum">[12.7.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-applying-the-additive-operators-to-numbers "link to this section")</span> Applying the Additive Operators to Numbers
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The `+` operator performs addition when applied to two operands of numeric type, producing the sum of the operands. The `-` operator performs subtraction, producing the difference of two numeric operands.

Addition is a commutative operation, but not always associative.

The result of an addition is determined using the rules of IEEE 754-2008 binary double-precision arithmetic:

-   If either operand is **NaN**, the result is **NaN**.

-   The sum of two infinities of opposite sign is **NaN**.

-   The sum of two infinities of the same sign is the infinity of that sign.

-   The sum of an infinity and a finite value is equal to the infinite operand.

-   The sum of two negative zeroes is **−0**. The sum of two positive zeroes, or of two zeroes of opposite sign, is **+0**.

-   The sum of a zero and a nonzero finite value is equal to the nonzero operand.

-   The sum of two nonzero finite values of the same magnitude and opposite sign is **+0**.

-   In the remaining cases, where neither an infinity, nor a zero, nor NaN is involved, and the operands have the same sign or have different magnitudes, the sum is computed and rounded to the nearest representable value using IEEE 754-2008 round-to-nearest mode. If the magnitude is too large to represent, the operation overflows and the result is then an infinity of appropriate sign. The ECMAScript language requires support of gradual underflow as defined by IEEE 754-2008.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `-` operator performs subtraction when applied to two operands of numeric type, producing the difference of its operands; the left operand is the minuend and the right operand is the subtrahend. Given numeric operands *a* and *b*, it is always the case that *a`–`b* produces the same result as *a `+(–`b`)`*.

<span id="sec-12.8.3" class="secnum">[12.8.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-left-shift-operator "link to this section")</span> The Left Shift Operator ( `<<` )
===========================================================================================================================================================================================

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Performs a bitwise left shift operation on the left operand by the amount specified by the right operand.

<span id="sec-12.8.3.1" class="secnum">[12.8.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-left-shift-operator-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*ShiftExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *ShiftExpression* `<<` *AdditiveExpression*

1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *ShiftExpression*.
2.  Let *lval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lref*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lval*).
4.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *AdditiveExpression*.
5.  Let *rval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rval*).
7.  Let *lnum* be [ToInt32](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toint32)(*lval*).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lnum*).
9.  Let *rnum* be [ToUint32](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-touint32)(*rval*).
10. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rnum*).
11. Let *shiftCount* be the result of masking out all but the least significant 5 bits of *rnum*, that is, compute *rnum* & 0x1F.
12. Return the result of left shifting *lnum* by *shiftCount* bits. The result is a signed 32-bit integer.

<span id="sec-12.8.4" class="secnum">[12.8.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-signed-right-shift-operator "link to this section")</span> The Signed Right Shift Operator ( `>>` )
===========================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Performs a sign-filling bitwise right shift operation on the left operand by the amount specified by the right operand.

<span id="sec-12.8.4.1" class="secnum">[12.8.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-signed-right-shift-operator-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*ShiftExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *ShiftExpression* `>>` *AdditiveExpression*

1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *ShiftExpression*.
2.  Let *lval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lref*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lval*).
4.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *AdditiveExpression*.
5.  Let *rval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rval*).
7.  Let *lnum* be [ToInt32](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toint32)(*lval*).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lnum*).
9.  Let *rnum* be [ToUint32](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-touint32)(*rval*).
10. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rnum*).
11. Let *shiftCount* be the result of masking out all but the least significant 5 bits of *rnum*, that is, compute *rnum* & 0x1F.
12. Return the result of performing a sign-extending right shift of *lnum* by *shiftCount* bits. The most significant bit is propagated. The result is a signed 32-bit integer.

<span id="sec-12.8.5" class="secnum">[12.8.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-unsigned-right-shift-operator "link to this section")</span> The Unsigned Right Shift Operator ( `>>>` )
================================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Performs a zero-filling bitwise right shift operation on the left operand by the amount specified by the right operand.

<span id="sec-12.8.5.1" class="secnum">[12.8.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-unsigned-right-shift-operator-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
===================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*ShiftExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *ShiftExpression* `>>>` *AdditiveExpression*

1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *ShiftExpression*.
2.  Let *lval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lref*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lval*).
4.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *AdditiveExpression*.
5.  Let *rval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rval*).
7.  Let *lnum* be [ToUint32](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-touint32)(*lval*).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lnum*).
9.  Let *rnum* be [ToUint32](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-touint32)(*rval*).
10. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rnum*).
11. Let *shiftCount* be the result of masking out all but the least significant 5 bits of *rnum*, that is, compute *rnum* & 0x1F.
12. Return the result of performing a zero-filling right shift of *lnum* by *shiftCount* bits. Vacated bits are filled with zero. The result is an unsigned 32-bit integer.

<span id="sec-12.9" class="secnum">[12.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-relational-operators "link to this section")</span> Relational Operators
============================================================================================================================================================================

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The result of evaluating a relational operator is always of type Boolean, reflecting whether the relationship named by the operator holds between its two operands.

Syntax
------

*RelationalExpression*<sub>\[In,\\ Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>
