<span id="sec-12.9.3" class="secnum">[12.9.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-relational-operators-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*RelationalExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *RelationalExpression* `<` *ShiftExpression*

1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *RelationalExpression*.
2.  Let *lval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lref*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lval*).
4.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *ShiftExpression*.
5.  Let *rval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).
6.  Let *r* be the result of performing Abstract Relational Comparison *lval* &lt; *rval*. ([see 7.2.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ispropertykey))
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*r*).
8.  If *r* is **undefined**, return **false**. Otherwise, return *r*.

*RelationalExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *RelationalExpression* `>` *ShiftExpression*

1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *RelationalExpression*.
2.  Let *lval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lref*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lval*).
4.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *ShiftExpression*.
5.  Let *rval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).
6.  Let *r* be the result of performing Abstract Relational Comparison *rval* &lt; *lval* with *LeftFirst* equal to **false**.
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*r*).
8.  If *r* is **undefined**, return **false**. Otherwise, return *r*.

*RelationalExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *RelationalExpression* `<=` *ShiftExpression*

1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *RelationalExpression*.
2.  Let *lval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lref*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lval*).
4.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *ShiftExpression*.
5.  Let *rval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).
6.  Let *r* be the result of performing Abstract Relational Comparison *rval* &lt; *lval* with *LeftFirst* equal to **false**.
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*r*).
8.  If *r* is **true** or **undefined**, return **false**. Otherwise, return **true**.

*RelationalExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *RelationalExpression* `>=` *ShiftExpression*

1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *RelationalExpression*.
2.  Let *lval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lref*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lval*).
4.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *ShiftExpression*.
5.  Let *rval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).
6.  Let *r* be the result of performing Abstract Relational Comparison *lval* &lt; *rval*.
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*r*).
8.  If *r* is **true** or **undefined**, return **false**. Otherwise, return **true**.

*RelationalExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *RelationalExpression* `instanceof` *ShiftExpression*

1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *RelationalExpression*.
2.  Let *lval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lref*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lval*).
4.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *ShiftExpression*.
5.  Let *rval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rval*).
7.  Return [InstanceofOperator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-instanceofoperator)(*lval*, *rval*).

*RelationalExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *RelationalExpression* `in` *ShiftExpression*

1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *RelationalExpression*.
2.  Let *lval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lref*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lval*).
4.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *ShiftExpression*.
5.  Let *rval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rval*).
7.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*rval*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
8.  Return [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*rval*, [ToPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-topropertykey)(*lval*)).

<span id="sec-12.9.4" class="secnum">[12.9.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-instanceofoperator "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: InstanceofOperator(O, C)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">InstanceofOperator(*O*, *C*)</span> implements the generic algorithm for determining if an object O inherits from the inheritance path defined by constructor C. This abstract operation performs the following steps:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*C*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  Let *instOfHandler* be [GetMethod](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getmethod)(*C*,@@hasInstance).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*instOfHandler*).
4.  If *instOfHandler* is not **undefined**, then
    1.  Return [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*instOfHandler*, *C*, «*O*»)).

5.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*C*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
6.  Return [OrdinaryHasInstance](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinaryhasinstance)(*C*, *O*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Steps 5 and 6 provide compatibility with previous editions of ECMAScript that did not use a @@hasInstance method to define the `instanceof` operator semantics. If a function object does not define or inherit @@hasInstance it uses the default `instanceof` semantics.

*EqualityExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *EqualityExpression* `==` *RelationalExpression*

2.  Let *lval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lref*).

5.  Let *rval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rval*).
7.  Return the result of performing Abstract Equality Comparison *rval* == *lval*.

*EqualityExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *EqualityExpression* `!=` *RelationalExpression*

*EqualityExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *EqualityExpression* `===` *RelationalExpression*

3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lval*).
4.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *RelationalExpression*.
5.  Let *rval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rval*).
7.  Let *r* be the result of performing Strict Equality Comparison *rval* === *lval*.
8.  If *r* is **true**, return **false**. Otherwise, return **true**.

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> Given the above definition of equality:

-   String comparison can be forced by: `"" + a == "" + b`.
-   Numeric comparison can be forced by: `+a == +b`.
-   Boolean comparison can be forced by: `!a == !b`.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> The equality operators maintain the following invariants:

-   `A` `!=` `B` is equivalent to `!(A` `==` `B)`.
-   `A` `==` `B` is equivalent to `B` `==` `A`, except in the order of evaluation of `A` and `B`.

<span class="nh">NOTE 3</span> The equality operator is not always transitive. For example, there might be two distinct String objects, each representing the same String value; each String object would be considered equal to the String value by the `==` operator, but the two String objects would not be equal to each other. For Example:

-   `new String("a")` `==` `"a"` and `"a"` `==` `new               String("a")`are both **true**.
-   `new String("a")` `==` `new String("a")` is **false**.

<span class="nh">NOTE 4</span> Comparison of Strings uses a simple equality test on sequences of code unit values. There is no attempt to use the more complex, semantically oriented definitions of character or string equality and collating order defined in the Unicode specification. Therefore Strings values that are canonically equal according to the Unicode standard could test as unequal. In effect this algorithm assumes that both Strings are already in normalized form.

<span id="sec-12.11.3" class="secnum">[12.11.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-binary-bitwise-operators-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The production A **:** *<span style="font-family: Times New Roman">A</span> @ <span style="font-family:
      Times New Roman">B</span>*, where @ is one of the bitwise operators in the productions above, is evaluated as follows:

1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *A*.
2.  Let *lval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lref*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lval*).
4.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *B*.
5.  Let *rval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rval*).
7.  Let *lnum* be [ToInt32](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toint32)(*lval*).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lnum*).
9.  Let *rnum* be [ToInt32](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toint32)(*rval*).
10. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rnum*).
11. Return the result of applying the bitwise operator @ to *lnum* and *rnum*. The result is a signed 32 bit integer.

<span id="sec-12.12.3" class="secnum">[12.12.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-binary-logical-operators-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*LogicalANDExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *LogicalANDExpression* `&&` *BitwiseORExpression*

1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *LogicalANDExpression*.
2.  Let *lval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lref*).
3.  Let *lbool* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)(*lval*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lbool*).
5.  If *lbool* is **false**, return *lval*.
6.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *BitwiseORExpression*.
7.  Return [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).

*LogicalORExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *LogicalORExpression* `||` *LogicalANDExpression*

1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *LogicalORExpression*.
2.  Let *lval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lref*).
3.  Let *lbool* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)(*lval*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lbool*).
5.  If *lbool* is **true**, return *lval*.
6.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *LogicalANDExpression*.
7.  Return [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).

<span id="sec-12.13" class="secnum">[12.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-conditional-operator "link to this section")</span> Conditional Operator ( `? : )`
========================================================================================================================================================================================

Syntax
------

*ConditionalExpression*<sub>\[In,\\ Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*LogicalORExpression*<sub>\[?In,\\ ?Yield\]</sub>

*LogicalORExpression*<sub>\[?In,?Yield\]</sub> `?` *AssignmentExpression*<sub>\[In,\\ ?Yield\]</sub> `:` *AssignmentExpression*<sub>\[?In,\\ ?Yield\]</sub>

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The grammar for a *ConditionalExpression* in ECMAScript is slightly different from that in C and Java, which each allow the second subexpression to be an *Expression* but restrict the third expression to be a *ConditionalExpression*. The motivation for this difference in ECMAScript is to allow an assignment expression to be governed by either arm of a conditional and to eliminate the confusing and fairly useless case of a comma expression as the centre expression.

<span id="sec-12.13.3" class="secnum">[12.13.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-conditional-operator-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*ConditionalExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *LogicalORExpression* `?` *AssignmentExpression* `:` *AssignmentExpression*

1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *LogicalORExpression*.
2.  Let *lval* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lref*)).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lval*).
4.  If *lval* is **true**, then
    1.  Let *trueRef* be the result of evaluating the first *AssignmentExpression*.
    2.  Return [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*trueRef*).

5.  Else
    1.  Let *falseRef* be the result of evaluating the second *AssignmentExpression*.
    2.  Return [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*falseRef*).

*AssignmentExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *LeftHandSideExpression* `=` *AssignmentExpression*

-   It is a Syntax Error if *LeftHandSideExpression* is either an *ObjectLiteral* or an *ArrayLiteral* and the lexical token sequence matched by *LeftHandSideExpression* cannot be parsed with no tokens left over using *AssignmentPattern* as the goal symbol.

-   It is an early [Reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type) Error if *LeftHandSideExpression* is neither an *ObjectLiteral* nor an *ArrayLiteral* and IsValidSimpleAssignmentTarget of *LeftHandSideExpression* is <span class="value">false</span>.

*AssignmentExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *LeftHandSideExpression* *AssignmentOperator* *AssignmentExpression*

<span id="sec-12.14.4" class="secnum">[12.14.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-assignment-operators-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*AssignmentExpression*<sub>\[In,\\ Yield\]</sub> **:** *LeftHandSideExpression*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `=` *AssignmentExpression*<sub>\[?In,\\ ?Yield\]</sub>

1.  If *LeftHandSideExpression* is neither an *ObjectLiteral* nor an *ArrayLiteral*, then
    1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *LeftHandSideExpression*.
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lref*).
    3.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *AssignmentExpression*.
    4.  Let *rval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).
    5.  If [IsAnonymousFunctionDefinition](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isanonymousfunctiondefinition)(*AssignmentExpression)* and IsIdentifierRef of *LeftHandSideExpression* are both **true**, then
        1.  Let *hasNameProperty* be [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty)(*rval*, `"name"`).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*hasNameProperty*).
        3.  If *hasNameProperty* is **false**, perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*rval*, [GetReferencedName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*lref*)).

    6.  Let *status* be [PutValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-putvalue)(*lref*, *rval*).
    7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
    8.  Return *rval*.

2.  Let *assignmentPattern* be the parse of the source text corresponding to *LeftHandSideExpression* using *AssignmentPattern*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> as the goal symbol.
3.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *AssignmentExpression*.
4.  Let *rval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rval*).
6.  Let *status* be the result of performing DestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *assignmentPattern* using *rval* as the argument.
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
8.  Return *rval*.

*AssignmentExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *LeftHandSideExpression* *AssignmentOperator* *AssignmentExpression*

1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *LeftHandSideExpression*.
2.  Let *lval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lref*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lval*).
4.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *AssignmentExpression*.
5.  Let *rval* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rval*).
7.  Let *op* be the `@` where *AssignmentOperator* is `@=`
8.  Let *r* be the result of applying *op* to *lval* and *rval* as if evaluating the expression *lval* *op* *rval*.
9.  Let *status* be [PutValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-putvalue)(*lref*, *r*).
10. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
11. Return *r*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> When an assignment occurs within [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), it is an runtime error if *lref* in step 1.f.of the first algorithm or step 9 of the second algorithm it is an unresolvable reference. If it is, a **ReferenceError** exception is thrown. The *LeftHandSide* also may not be a reference to a data property with the attribute value {\[\[Writable\]\]:**false**}, to an accessor property with the attribute value {\[\[Set\]\]:**undefined**}, nor to a non-existent property of an object for which the [IsExtensible](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isextensible-o) predicate returns the value **false**. In these cases a **TypeError** exception is thrown.

<span id="sec-12.14.5" class="secnum">[12.14.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-destructuring-assignment "link to this section")</span> Destructuring Assignment
==========================================================================================================================================================================================

Supplemental Syntax
-------------------

In certain circumstances when processing the production <span class="prod">*AssignmentExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> *LeftHandSideExpression* `=` *AssignmentExpression*</span> the following grammar is used to refine the interpretation of *LeftHandSideExpression*.

*AssignmentPattern*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*ObjectAssignmentPattern*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*ArrayAssignmentPattern*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*ObjectAssignmentPattern*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`{` `}`

`{` *AssignmentPropertyList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `}`

`{` *AssignmentPropertyList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `,` `}`

*ArrayAssignmentPattern*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`[` *Elision*<sub>opt</sub> *AssignmentRestElement*<sub>\[?Yield\]opt</sub> `]`

`[` *AssignmentElementList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `]`

`[` *AssignmentElementList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `,` *Elision*<sub>opt</sub> *AssignmentRestElement*<sub>\[?Yield\]opt</sub> `]`

*AssignmentPropertyList*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*AssignmentProperty*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*AssignmentPropertyList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `,` *AssignmentProperty*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*AssignmentElementList*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*AssignmentElisionElement*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*AssignmentElementList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `,` *AssignmentElisionElement*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*AssignmentElisionElement*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*Elision*<sub>opt</sub> *AssignmentElement*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*AssignmentProperty*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*IdentifierReference*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> *Initializer*<sub>\[In,?Yield\]opt</sub>

*PropertyName* `:` *AssignmentElement*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*AssignmentElement*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*DestructuringAssignmentTarget*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> *Initializer*<sub>\[In,?Yield\]opt</sub>

*AssignmentRestElement*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`...` *DestructuringAssignmentTarget*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*DestructuringAssignmentTarget*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*LeftHandSideExpression*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

<span id="sec-12.14.5.1" class="secnum">[12.14.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-destructuring-assignment-static-semantics-early-errors "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Early Errors
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*AssignmentProperty* <span class="geq">:</span> *IdentifierReference* *Initializer*<sub>opt</sub>

-   It is a Syntax Error if IsValidSimpleAssignmentTarget of *IdentifierReference* is <span class="value">false</span>.

*DestructuringAssignmentTarget* <span class="geq">:</span> *LeftHandSideExpression*

-   It is a Syntax Error if *LeftHandSideExpression* is either an *ObjectLiteral* or an *ArrayLiteral* and if the lexical token sequence matched by *LeftHandSideExpression* cannot be parsed with no tokens left over using *AssignmentPattern* as the goal symbol.

-   It is a Syntax Error if *LeftHandSideExpression* is neither an *ObjectLiteral* nor an *ArrayLiteral* and <span style="font-family: Times New
                Roman">IsValidSimpleAssignmentTarget</span>(*LeftHandSideExpression*) is <span class="value">false</span>.

<span id="sec-12.14.5.2" class="secnum">[12.14.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-runtime-semantics-destructuringassignmentevaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: DestructuringAssignmentEvaluation
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

with parameter value

*ObjectAssignmentPattern* <span class="geq">:</span> `{` `}`

1.  Let *valid* be [RequireObjectCoercible](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-requireobjectcoercible)(*value*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*valid*).
3.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family:
                  sans-serif">empty</span>).

*ArrayAssignmentPattern* <span class="geq">:</span> `[` `]`

1.  Let *iterator* be [GetIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getiterator)(*value*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*iterator*).
3.  Return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iterator*, [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>)).

*ArrayAssignmentPattern* <span class="geq">:</span> `[` *Elision* `]`

1.  Let *iterator* be [GetIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getiterator)(*value*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*iterator*).
3.  Let *iteratorRecord* be Record {\[\[iterator\]\]: *iterator*, \[\[done\]\]: **false**}.
4.  Let *result* be the result of performing IteratorDestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *Elision* with *iteratorRecord* as the argument.
5.  If *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] is **false**, return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iterator*, *result*).
6.  Return *result*.

*ArrayAssignmentPattern* <span class="geq">:</span> `[` *Elision*<sub>opt</sub> *AssignmentRestElement* `]`

1.  Let *iterator* be [GetIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getiterator)(*value*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*iterator*).
3.  Let *iteratorRecord* be Record {\[\[iterator\]\]: *iterator*, \[\[done\]\]: **false**}.
4.  If *Elision* is present, then
    1.  Let *status* be the result of performing IteratorDestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *Elision* with *iteratorRecord* as the argument.
    2.  If *status* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), then
        1.  If *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] is **false**, return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iterator*, *status*).
        2.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*status*).

5.  Let *result* be the result of performing IteratorDestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *AssignmentRestElement* with *iteratorRecord* as the argument.
6.  If *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] is **false**, return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iterator*, *result*).
7.  Return *result*.

*ArrayAssignmentPattern* <span class="geq">:</span> `[` *AssignmentElementList* `]`

1.  Let *iterator* be [GetIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getiterator)(*value*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*iterator*).
3.  Let *iteratorRecord* be Record {\[\[iterator\]\]: *iterator*, \[\[done\]\]: **false**}.
4.  Let *result* be the result of performing IteratorDestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *AssignmentElementList* using *iteratorRecord* as the argument.
5.  If *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] is **false**, return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iterator*, *result*).
6.  Return *result*.

*ArrayAssignmentPattern* <span class="geq">:</span> `[` *AssignmentElementList* `,` *Elision*<sub>opt</sub> *AssignmentRestElement*<sub>opt</sub> `]`

1.  Let *iterator* be [GetIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getiterator)(*value*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*iterator*).
3.  Let *iteratorRecord* be Record {\[\[iterator\]\]: *iterator*, \[\[done\]\]: **false**}.
4.  Let *status* be the result of performing IteratorDestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *AssignmentElementList* using *iteratorRecord* as the argument.
5.  If *status* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), then
    1.  If *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] is **false**, return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iterator*, *status*).
    2.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*status*).

6.  If *Elision* is present, then
    1.  Let *status* be the result of performing IteratorDestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *Elision* with *iteratorRecord* as the argument.
    2.  If *status* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), then
        1.  If *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] is **false**, return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iterator*, *status*).
        2.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*status*).

7.  If *AssignmentRestElement* is present, then
    1.  Let *status* be the result of performing IteratorDestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *AssignmentRestElement* with *iteratorRecord* as the argument.

8.  If *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] is **false**, return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iterator*, *status*).
9.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*status*).

*AssignmentPropertyList* <span class="geq">:</span> *AssignmentPropertyList* `,` *AssignmentProperty*

1.  Let *status* be the result of performing DestructuringAssignmentEvaluation for *AssignmentPropertyList* using *value* as the argument.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
3.  Return the result of performing DestructuringAssignmentEvaluation for *AssignmentProperty* using *value* as the argument.

*AssignmentProperty* <span class="geq">:</span> *IdentifierReference* *Initializer*<sub>opt</sub>

1.  Let *P* be StringValue of *IdentifierReference*.
2.  Let *lref* be [ResolveBinding](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-resolvebinding)(*P)*.
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*P*).
4.  Let *v* be [GetV](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getv)(*value*, *P*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*v*).
6.  If *Initializer*<sub>opt</sub> is present and *v* is **undefined**, then
    1.  Let *defaultValue* be the result of evaluating *Initializer*.
    2.  Let *v* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*defaultValue*).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*v*).
    4.  If [IsAnonymousFunctionDefinition](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isanonymousfunctiondefinition)(*Initializer*) is **true**, then
        1.  Let *hasNameProperty* be [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty)(*v*, `"name"`).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*hasNameProperty*).
        3.  If *hasNameProperty* is **false**, perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*v*, *P*).

7.  Return [PutValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-putvalue)(*lref*,*v*).

*AssignmentProperty* <span class="geq">:</span> *PropertyName* `:` *AssignmentElement*

1.  Let *name* be the result of evaluating *PropertyName*.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*name*).
3.  Return the result of performing KeyedDestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *AssignmentElement* with *value* and *name* as the arguments.

<span id="sec-12.14.5.3" class="secnum">[12.14.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-runtime-semantics-iteratordestructuringassignmentevaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: IteratorDestructuringAssignmentEvaluation
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

with parameters iteratorRecord

*AssignmentElementList* <span class="geq">:</span> *AssignmentElisionElement*

1.  Return the result of performing IteratorDestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *AssignmentElisionElement* using *iteratorRecord* as the *argument*.

*AssignmentElementList* <span class="geq">:</span> *AssignmentElementList* `,` *AssignmentElisionElement*

1.  Let *status* be the result of performing IteratorDestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *AssignmentElementList* using *iteratorRecord* as the *argument.*
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
3.  Return the result of performing IteratorDestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *AssignmentElisionElement* using *iteratorRecord* as the *argument*.

*AssignmentElisionElement* <span class="geq">:</span> *AssignmentElement*

1.  *R*eturn the result of performing IteratorDestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *AssignmentElement* with *iteratorRecord* as the argument.

*AssignmentElisionElement* <span class="geq">:</span> *Elision* *AssignmentElement*

1.  Let *status* be the result of performing IteratorDestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *Elision* with *iteratorRecord* as the argument.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
3.  Return the result of performing IteratorDestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *AssignmentElement* with *iteratorRecord* as the argument.

*Elision* <span class="geq">:</span> `,`

1.  If *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] is **false**, then
    1.  Let *next* be [IteratorStep](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorstep)(*iteratorRecord*.\[\[iterator\]\]).
    2.  If *next* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), set *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] to **true**.
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*next*).
    4.  If *next* is **false**, set *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] to **true**.

2.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family:
                  sans-serif">empty</span>).

*Elision* <span class="geq">:</span> *Elision* `,`

1.  Let *status* be the result of performing IteratorDestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *Elision* with *iteratorRecord* as the argument.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
3.  If *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] is **false**, then
    1.  Let *next* be [IteratorStep](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorstep)(*iteratorRecord*.\[\[iterator\]\]).
    2.  If *next* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), set *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] to **true**.
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*next*).
    4.  If *next* is **false**, set *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] to **true**.

4.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family:
                  sans-serif">empty</span>).

*AssignmentElement*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> **:** *DestructuringAssignmentTarget* *Initializer*<sub>opt</sub>

1.  If *DestructuringAssignmentTarget* is neither an *ObjectLiteral* nor an *ArrayLiteral*, then
    1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *DestructuringAssignmentTarget*.
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lref*).

2.  If *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] is **false**, then
    1.  Let *next* be [IteratorStep](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorstep)(*iteratorRecord*.\[\[iterator\]\]).
    2.  If *next* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), set *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] to **true**.
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*next*).
    4.  If *next* is **false**, set *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] to **true**.
    5.  Else
        1.  Let *value* be [IteratorValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorvalue)(*next*).
        2.  If *value* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), set *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] to **true**.
        3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*value*).

3.  If *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] is **true**, let *value* be **undefined**.
4.  If *Initializer* is present and *value* is **undefined**, then
    1.  Let *defaultValue* be the result of evaluating *Initializer*.
    2.  Let *v* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*defaultValue*)
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*v*).

5.  Else, let *v* be *value*.
6.  If *DestructuringAssignmentTarget* is an *ObjectLiteral or an ArrayLiteral*, then
    1.  Let *nestedAssignmentPattern* be the parse of the source text corresponding to *DestructuringAssignmentTarget* using either *AssignmentPattern* or *AssignmentPattern*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> as the goal symbol depending upon whether this *AssignmentElement* has the <span style="font-family: sans-serif"><sub>Yield</sub></span> parameter.
    2.  Return the result of performing DestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *nestedAssignmentPattern* with *v* as the argument.

7.  If *Initializer* is present and *value* is **undefined** and [IsAnonymousFunctionDefinition](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isanonymousfunctiondefinition)(*Initializer)* and IsIdentifierRef of *DestructuringAssignmentTarget* are both **true**, then
    1.  Let *hasNameProperty* be [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty)(*v*, `"name"`).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*hasNameProperty*).
    3.  If *hasNameProperty* is **false**, perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*v*, [GetReferencedName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*lref*)).

8.  Return [PutValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-putvalue)(*lref*, *v*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Left to right evaluation order is maintained by evaluating a *DestructuringAssignmentTarget* that is not a destructuring pattern prior to accessing the iterator or evaluating the *Initializer*.

*AssignmentRestElement*<span style="font-family: sans-serif"><sub>\[Yield\]</sub> **:**</span> `...` *DestructuringAssignmentTarget*

1.  If *DestructuringAssignmentTarget* is neither an *ObjectLiteral* nor an *ArrayLiteral*, then
    1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *DestructuringAssignmentTarget*.
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lref*).

2.  Let *A* be [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate)(0).
3.  Let *n*=0;
4.  Repeat while *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] is **false,**
    1.  Let *next* be [IteratorStep](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorstep)(*iteratorRecord*.\[\[iterator\]\]).
    2.  If *next* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), set *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] to **true**.
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*next*).
    4.  If *next* is **false**, set *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] to **true**.
    5.  else,
        1.  Let *nextValue* be [IteratorValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorvalue)(*next*).
        2.  If *nextValue* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), set *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] to **true**.
        3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*nextValue*).
        4.  Let *status* be [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*A*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*n*), *nextValue*).
        5.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is **true**.
        6.  Increment *n* by 1.

5.  If *DestructuringAssignmentTarget* is neither an *ObjectLiteral* nor an *ArrayLiteral*, then
    1.  Return [PutValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-putvalue)(*lref*, *A*).

6.  Let *nestedAssignmentPattern* be the parse of the source text corresponding to *DestructuringAssignmentTarget* using either *AssignmentPattern* or *AssignmentPattern*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> as the goal symbol depending upon whether this *AssignmentElement* has the <span style="font-family: sans-serif"><sub>Yield</sub></span> parameter.
7.  Return the result of performing DestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *nestedAssignmentPattern* with *A* as the argument.

<span id="sec-12.14.5.4" class="secnum">[12.14.5.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-runtime-semantics-keyeddestructuringassignmentevaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: KeyedDestructuringAssignmentEvaluation
===============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

with parameters value and propertyName

<span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*AssignmentElement<sub>\[Yield\]</sub>*</span> **:** *DestructuringAssignmentTarget* *Initializer*<sub>opt</sub>

1.  If *DestructuringAssignmentTarget* is neither an *ObjectLiteral* nor an *ArrayLiteral*, then
    1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *DestructuringAssignmentTarget*.
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lref*).

2.  Let *v* be [GetV](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getv)(*value*, *propertyName*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*v*).
4.  If *Initializer* is present and *v* is **undefined**, then
    1.  Let *defaultValue* be the result of evaluating *Initializer*.
    2.  Let *rhsValue* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*defaultValue*)
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*rhsValue*).

5.  Else, let *rhsValue* be *v*.
6.  If *DestructuringAssignmentTarget* is an *ObjectLiteral or an ArrayLiteral*, then
    1.  Let *assignmentPattern* be the parse of the source text corresponding to *DestructuringAssignmentTarget* using either *AssignmentPattern* or *AssignmentPattern*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> as the goal symbol depending upon whether this *AssignmentElement* has the <span style="font-family: sans-serif"><sub>Yield</sub></span> parameter.
    2.  Return the result of performing DestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *assignmentPattern* with *rhsValue* as the argument.

7.  If *Initializer* is present and *v* is **undefined** and [IsAnonymousFunctionDefinition](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isanonymousfunctiondefinition)(*Initializer)* and IsIdentifierRef of *DestructuringAssignmentTarget* are both **true**, then
    1.  Let *hasNameProperty* be [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty)(*rhsValue*, `"name"`).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*hasNameProperty*).
    3.  If *hasNameProperty* is **false**, perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*rhsValue*, [GetReferencedName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-reference-specification-type)(*lref*)).

8.  Return [PutValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-putvalue)(*lref*, *rhsValue*).

<span id="sec-12.15" class="secnum">[12.15](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-comma-operator "link to this section")</span> Comma Operator ( `, )`

<span id="sec-12.15.3" class="secnum">[12.15.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-comma-operator-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*Expression* <span class="geq">:</span> *Expression* `,` *AssignmentExpression*

1.  Let *lref* be the result of evaluating *Expression*.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)([GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*lref*))
3.  Let *rref* be the result of evaluating *AssignmentExpression*.
4.  Return [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*rref*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue) must be called even though its value is not used because it may have observable side-effects.

===============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

------

*Statement*<sub>\[Yield,\\ Return\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*LabelledStatement*<sub>\[?Yield,\\ ?Return\]</sub>

*ThrowStatement*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With argument labelSet.

See also: [13.6.1.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-do-while-statement-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation), [13.6.2.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-while-statement-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation), [13.6.3.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-statement-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation), [13.6.4.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation), [13.12.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-statements-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation).

*BreakableStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> *IterationStatement*

1.  Let *stmtResult* be the result of performing LabelledEvaluation of *IterationStatement* with argument *labelSet*.
2.  If *stmtResult*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">break</span>, then
    1.  If *stmtResult*.\[\[target\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, then
        1.  If *stmtResult*.\[\[value\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, let *stmtResult* be [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).
        2.  Else, let *stmtResult* be [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(*stmtResult*.\[\[value\]\]).

3.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*stmtResult*).

*BreakableStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> *SwitchStatement*

1.  Let *stmtResult* be the result of evaluating *SwitchStatement*.
2.  If *stmtResult*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">break</span>, then
    1.  If *stmtResult*.\[\[target\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, then
        1.  If *stmtResult*.\[\[value\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, let *stmtResult* be [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).
        2.  Else, let *stmtResult* be [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(*stmtResult*.\[\[value\]\]).

3.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*stmtResult*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> A *BreakableStatement* is one that can be exited via an unlabelled *BreakStatement.*

=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================
