See also: [13.0.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-statement-semantics-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation), [13.6.1.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-do-while-statement-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation), [13.6.2.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-while-statement-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation), [13.6.4.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation), [13.12.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-statements-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation).

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` *Expression*<sub>opt</sub> `;` *Expression*<sub>opt</sub> `;` *Expression*<sub>opt</sub> `)` *Statement*

1.  If the first *Expression* is present, then
    1.  Let *exprRef* be the result of evaluating the first *Expression*.
    2.  Let *exprValue* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*exprRef*).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*exprValue*).

2.  Return [ForBodyEvaluation](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-forbodyevaluation)(the second *Expression*, the third *Expression*, *Statement*, « », *labelSet*).

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` `var` *VariableDeclarationList* `;` *Expression*<sub>opt</sub> `;` *Expression*<sub>opt</sub> `)` *Statement*

1.  Let *varDcl* be the result of evaluating *VariableDeclarationList*.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*varDcl*).
3.  Return [ForBodyEvaluation](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-forbodyevaluation)(the first *Expression*, the second *Expression*, *Statement*, « », *labelSet*).

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` *LexicalDeclaration* *Expression*<sub>opt</sub> `;` *Expression*<sub>opt</sub> `)` *Statement*

1.  Let *oldEnv* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
2.  Let *loopEnv* be [NewDeclarativeEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newdeclarativeenvironment)(*oldEnv*).
3.  Let *isConst* be the result of performing IsConstantDeclaration of *LexicalDeclaration*.
4.  Let *boundNames* be the BoundNames of *LexicalDeclaration*.
5.  For each element *dn* of *boundNames* do
    1.  If *isConst* is **true**, then
        1.  Perform *loopEnv*.CreateImmutableBinding(*dn*, **true**).

    2.  Else,
        1.  Perform *loopEnv*.CreateMutableBinding(*dn,* **false**).
        2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): The above call to CreateMutableBinding will never return an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).

6.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *loopEnv*.
7.  Let *forDcl* be the result of evaluating *LexicalDeclaration*.
8.  If *forDcl* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), then
    1.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *oldEnv*.
    2.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*forDcl*).

9.  If *isConst* is **false**, let *perIterationLets* be *boundNames* otherwise let *perIterationLets* be « ».
10. Let *bodyResult* be [ForBodyEvaluation](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-forbodyevaluation)(the first *Expression*, the second *Expression*, *Statement*, *perIterationLets*, *labelSet*).
11. Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *oldEnv*.
12. Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*bodyResult*).

<span id="sec-13.6.3.8" class="secnum">[13.6.3.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-forbodyevaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: ForBodyEvaluation( test, increment, stmt, perIterationBindings, labelSet )
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation ForBodyEvaluation with arguments test, increment, stmt, perIterationBindings, and labelSet is performed as follows:

1.  Let *V* = **undefined**.
2.  Let *status* be [CreatePerIterationEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createperiterationenvironment)(*perIterationBindings*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
4.  Repeat
    1.  If *test* is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">\[empty\]</span>, then
        1.  Let *testRef* be the result of evaluating *test*.
        2.  Let *testValue* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*testRef*).
        3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*testValue*).
        4.  If [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)(*testValue*) is **false**, return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(*V*).

    2.  Let *result* be the result of evaluating *stmt*.
    3.  If [LoopContinues](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-loopcontinues)(*result*, *labelSet*) is **false**, return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*result*).
    4.  If *result*.\[\[value\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, let *V* = *result*.\[\[value\]\].
    5.  Let *status* be [CreatePerIterationEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createperiterationenvironment)(*perIterationBindings*).
    6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
    7.  If *increment* is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">\[empty\]</span>, then
        1.  Let *incRef* be the result of evaluating *increment*.
        2.  Let *incValue* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*incRef*).
        3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*incValue*).

<span id="sec-13.6.3.9" class="secnum">[13.6.3.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createperiterationenvironment "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: CreatePerIterationEnvironment( perIterationBindings )
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation CreatePerIterationEnvironment with argument perIterationBindings is performed as follows:

1.  If *perIterationBindings* has any elements, then
    1.  Let *lastIterationEnv* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
    2.  Let *outer* be *lastIterationEnv*’s [outer environment reference](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
    3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *outer* is not **null**.
    4.  Let *thisIterationEnv* be [NewDeclarativeEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newdeclarativeenvironment)(*outer*).
    5.  For each element *bn* of *perIterationBindings* do,
        1.  Let *status* be *thisIterationEnv*.CreateMutableBinding(*bn*, **false**).
        2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is never an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
        3.  Let *lastValue* be *lastIterationEnv*.GetBindingValue(*bn*, **true**).
        4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lastValue*).
        5.  Perform *thisIterationEnv*.InitializeBinding(*bn*, *lastValue*).

    6.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *thisIterationEnv.*

2.  Return **undefined**

<span id="sec-13.6.4" class="secnum">[13.6.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements "link to this section")</span> The `for`-`in` and `for`-`of` Statements
============================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-13.6.4.1" class="secnum">[13.6.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-static-semantics-early-errors "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Early Errors
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span>

`for` `(` *LeftHandSideExpression* `in` *Expression* `)` *Statement*

`for` `(` *LeftHandSideExpression* `of` *AssignmentExpression* `)` *Statement*

-   It is a Syntax Error if *LeftHandSideExpression* is either an *ObjectLiteral* or an *ArrayLiteral* and if the lexical token sequence matched by *LeftHandSideExpression* cannot be parsed with no tokens left over using *AssignmentPattern* as the goal symbol.

If *LeftHandSideExpression* is either an *ObjectLiteral* or an *ArrayLiteral* and if the lexical token sequence matched by *LeftHandSideExpression* can be parsed with no tokens left over using *AssignmentPattern* as the goal symbol then the following rules are not applied. Instead, the Early Error rules for *AssignmentPattern* are used.

-   It is a Syntax Error if <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">IsValidSimpleAssignmentTarget</span> of *LeftHandSideExpression* is <span class="value">false</span>.

-   It is a Syntax Error if the *LeftHandSideExpression* is <span class="prod">*CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList* <span class="geq">:</span> `(` *Expression* `)`</span> and *Expression* derives a production that would produce a Syntax Error according to these rules if that production is substituted for *LeftHandSideExpression*. This rule is recursively applied.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The last rule means that the other rules are applied even if parentheses surround *Expression*.

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span>

`for` `(` *ForDeclaration* `in` *Expression* `)` *Statement*

`for` `(` *ForDeclaration* `of` *AssignmentExpression* `)` *Statement*

-   It is a Syntax Error if the BoundNames of *ForDeclaration* contains `"let"`.

-   It is a Syntax Error if any element of the BoundNames of *ForDeclaration* also occurs in the VarDeclaredNames of *Statement*.

-   It is a Syntax Error if the BoundNames of *ForDeclaration* contains any duplicate entries.

<span id="sec-13.6.4.2" class="secnum">[13.6.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-static-semantics-boundnames "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: BoundNames
================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

See also: [12.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-identifiers-static-semantics-boundnames), [13.2.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-let-and-const-declarations-static-semantics-boundnames), [13.2.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-variable-statement-static-semantics-boundnames), [13.2.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-destructuring-binding-patterns-static-semantics-boundnames), [14.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions-static-semantics-boundnames), [14.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrow-function-definitions-static-semantics-boundnames), [14.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions-static-semantics-boundnames), [14.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-class-definitions-static-semantics-boundnames), [15.2.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-imports-static-semantics-boundnames), [15.2.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-exports-static-semantics-boundnames).

1.  Return the BoundNames of *ForBinding*.

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` *ForDeclaration* `in` *Expression* `)` *Statement*

1.  Return the VarDeclaredNames of *Statement*.

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` *LeftHandSideExpression* `of` *AssignmentExpression* `)` *Statement*

1.  Return the VarDeclaredNames of *Statement*.

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` `var` *ForBinding* `of` *AssignmentExpression* `)` *Statement*

1.  Let *names* be the BoundNames of *ForBinding*.
2.  Append to *names* the elements of the VarDeclaredNames of *Statement.*
3.  Return *names.*

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` *ForDeclaration* `of` *AssignmentExpression* `)` *Statement*

1.  Return the VarDeclaredNames of *Statement*.

<span id="sec-13.6.4.8" class="secnum">[13.6.4.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: VarScopedDeclarations
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

See also: [13.0.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-statement-semantics-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.1.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-block-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.2.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-variable-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.5.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-if-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.6.1.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-do-while-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.6.2.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-while-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.6.3.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.10.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-with-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.11.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-switch-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.12.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-statements-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.14.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-try-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [14.1.16](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [14.2.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrow-function-definitions-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [15.1.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-scripts-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [15.2.1.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-vardeclarednames).

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` *LeftHandSideExpression* `in` *Expression* `)` *Statement*

1.  Return the VarScopedDeclarations of *Statement*.

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` `var` *ForBinding* `in` *Expression* `)` *Statement*

1.  Let *declarations* be a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing *ForBinding*.
2.  Append to *declarations* the elements of the VarScopedDeclarations of *Statement.*
3.  Return *declarations.*

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` *ForDeclaration* `in` *Expression* `)` *Statement*

1.  Return the VarScopedDeclarations of *Statement*.

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` *LeftHandSideExpression* `of` *AssignmentExpression* `)` *Statement*

1.  Return the VarScopedDeclarations of *Statement*.

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` `var` *ForBinding* `of` *AssignmentExpression* `)` *Statement*

1.  Let *declarations* be a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing *ForBinding*.
2.  Append to *declarations* the elements of the VarScopedDeclarations of *Statement.*
3.  Return *declarations.*

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` *ForDeclaration* `of` *AssignmentExpression* `)` *Statement*

1.  Return the VarScopedDeclarations of *Statement*.

<span id="sec-13.6.4.9" class="secnum">[13.6.4.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-runtime-semantics-bindinginitialization "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: BindingInitialization
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With arguments value and environment.

See also: [12.1.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-identifiers-runtime-semantics-bindinginitialization), [13.2.3.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-destructuring-binding-patterns-runtime-semantics-bindinginitialization).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> **undefined** is passed for *environment* to indicate that a [PutValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-putvalue) operation should be used to assign the initialization value. This is the case for `var` statements and the formal parameter lists of some non-strict functions ([see 9.2.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functiondeclarationinstantiation)). In those cases a lexical binding is hoisted and preinitialized prior to evaluation of its initializer.

*ForDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> *LetOrConst* *ForBinding*

1.  Return the result of performing BindingInitialization for *ForBinding* passing *value* and *environment* as the arguments.

<span id="sec-13.6.4.10" class="secnum">[13.6.4.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-runtime-semantics-bindinginstantiation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: BindingInstantiation
===========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With argument environment.

*ForDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> *LetOrConst* *ForBinding*

1.  For each element *name* of the BoundNames of *ForBinding* do
    1.  If IsConstantDeclaration of *LetOrConst* is **true**, then
        1.  Perform *environment*.CreateImmutableBinding(*name*, **true**).

    2.  Else,
        1.  Perform *environment*.CreateMutableBinding(*name*).
        2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): The above call to CreateMutableBinding will never return an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).

<span id="sec-13.6.4.11" class="secnum">[13.6.4.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: LabelledEvaluation
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With argument labelSet.

See also: [13.0.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-statement-semantics-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation), [13.6.1.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-do-while-statement-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation), [13.6.2.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-while-statement-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation), [13.6.3.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-statement-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation), [13.12.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-statements-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation).

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` *LeftHandSideExpression* `in` *Expression* `)` *Statement*

1.  Let *keyResult* be ForIn/OfHeadEvaluation( « », *Expression*, <span style="font-family:
                  sans-serif">enumerate</span>, *labelSet*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*keyResult*).
3.  Return ForIn/OfBodyEvaluation(*LeftHandSideExpression*, *Statement*, *keyResult*, <span style="font-family: sans-serif">assignment</span>, *labelSet*).

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` `var` *ForBinding* `in` *Expression* `)` *Statement*

1.  Let *keyResult* be ForIn/OfHeadEvaluation( « », *Expression*, <span style="font-family:
                  sans-serif">enumerate</span>, *labelSet*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*keyResult*).
3.  Return ForIn/OfBodyEvaluation(*ForBinding*, *Statement*, *keyResult*, <span style="font-family:
                  sans-serif">varBinding</span>, *labelSet*).

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` *ForDeclaration* `in` *Expression* `)` *Statement*

1.  Let *keyResult* be the result of performing ForIn/OfHeadEvaluation(BoundNames of *ForDeclaration,* *Expression*, <span style="font-family: sans-serif">enumerate</span>, *labelSet*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*keyResult*).
3.  Return ForIn/OfBodyEvaluation(*ForDeclaration*, *Statement*, *keyResult*, <span style="font-family:
                  sans-serif">lexicalBinding</span>, *labelSet*).

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` *LeftHandSideExpression* `of` *AssignmentExpression* `)` *Statement*

1.  Let *keyResult* be the result of performing ForIn/OfHeadEvaluation( « », *AssignmentExpression*, <span style="font-family: sans-serif">iterate</span>, *labelSet*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*keyResult*).
3.  Return ForIn/OfBodyEvaluation(*LeftHandSideExpression*, *Statement*, *keyResult*, <span style="font-family: sans-serif">assignment</span>, *labelSet*).

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` `var` *ForBinding* `of` *AssignmentExpression* `)` *Statement*

1.  Let *keyResult* be the result of performing ForIn/OfHeadEvaluation( « », *AssignmentExpression*, <span style="font-family: sans-serif">iterate</span>, *labelSet*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*keyResult*).
3.  Return ForIn/OfBodyEvaluation(*ForBinding*, *Statement*, *keyResult*, <span style="font-family:
                  sans-serif">varBinding</span>, *labelSet*).

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `for` `(` *ForDeclaration* `of` *AssignmentExpression* `)` *Statement*

1.  Let *keyResult* be the result of performing ForIn/OfHeadEvaluation( BoundNames of *ForDeclaration*, *AssignmentExpression*, <span style="font-family: sans-serif">iterate</span>, *labelSet*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*keyResult*).
3.  Return ForIn/OfBodyEvaluation(*ForDeclaration*, *Statement*, *keyResult*, <span style="font-family:
                  sans-serif">lexicalBinding</span>, *labelSet*).

<span id="sec-13.6.4.12" class="secnum">[13.6.4.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-runtime-semantics-forin-div-ofheadevaluation-tdznames-expr-iterationkind-labelset "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: ForIn/OfHeadEvaluation ( TDZnames, expr, iterationKind, labelSet)


The abstract operation ForIn/OfHeadEvaluation is called with arguments *TDZnames*, expr, iterationKind, and <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*labelSet*.</span> The value of iterationKind is either **enumerate** or **iterate**.

1.  Let *oldEnv* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
2.  If *TDZnames* is not an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type), then
    1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *TDZnames* has no duplicate entries.
    2.  Let *TDZ* be [NewDeclarativeEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newdeclarativeenvironment)(*oldEnv*).
    3.  For each string *name* in *TDZnames*, do
        1.  Let *status* be *TDZ*.CreateMutableBinding(*name*, **false**).
        2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is never an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).

    4.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *TDZ*.

3.  Let *exprRef* be the result of evaluating the production that is *expr*.
4.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *oldEnv*.
5.  Let *exprValue* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*exprRef*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*exprValue*).
7.  If *iterationKind* is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">enumerate</span>, then
    1.  If *exprValue*.\[\[value\]\] is **null** or **undefined**, then
        1.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: <span style="font-family: sans-serif">break</span>, \[\[value\]\]: <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty,</span> \[\[target\]\]: <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>}.

    2.  Let *obj* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(*exprValue*).
    3.  Return *obj*.\[\[Enumerate\]\]().

8.  Else,
    1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *iterationKind* is <span style="font-family:
                          sans-serif">iterate</span>.
    2.  Return [GetIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getiterator)(*exprValue*).

<span id="sec-13.6.4.13" class="secnum">[13.6.4.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-runtime-semantics-forin-div-ofbodyevaluation-lhs-stmt-iterator-lhskind-labelset "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: ForIn/OfBodyEvaluation ( lhs, stmt, iterator, lhsKind, labelSet )


The abstract operation ForIn/OfBodyEvaluation is called with arguments lhs, stmt, iterator, lhsKind, and labelSet. The value of lhsKind is either **assignment**, **varBinding** or **lexicalBinding**.

1.  Let *oldEnv* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
2.  Let *V* = **undefined** .
3.  Let *destructuring* be IsDestructuring of *lhs*.
4.  If *destructuring* is **true** and if *lhsKind* is <span style="font-family:
                  sans-serif">assignment</span>, then
    1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *lhs* is a *LeftHandSideExpression*.
    2.  Let *assignmentPattern* be the parse of the source text corresponding to *lhs* using *AssignmentPattern* as the goal symbol.

5.  Repeat
    1.  If *lhsKind* is either <span style="font-family: sans-serif">assignment</span> or <span style="font-family:
                          sans-serif">varBinding</span>, then
        1.  If *destructuring* is **false**, then
            1.  Let *lhsRef* be the result of evaluating *lhs* ( it may be evaluated repeatedly).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lhsRef*).

    2.  Else
        1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *lhsKind* is <span style="font-family:
                                  sans-serif">lexicalBinding</span>.
        2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *lhs* is a *ForDeclaration*.
        3.  Let *iterationEnv* be [NewDeclarativeEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newdeclarativeenvironment)(*oldEnv*).
        4.  Perform BindingInstantiation for *lhs* passing *iterationEnv* as the argument.
        5.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *iterationEnv*.
        6.  If *destructuring* is **false**, then
            1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *lhs* binds a single name.
            2.  Let *lhsName* be the sole element of BoundNames of *lhs.*
            3.  Let *lhsRef* be [ResolveBinding](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-resolvebinding)(*lhsName*).
            4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *lhsRef* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).

    3.  Let *nextResult* be [IteratorStep](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorstep)(*iterator*).
    4.  If *nextResult* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), then
        1.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *oldEnv*.
        2.  Return *nextResult*.

    5.  If *nextResult* is **false**, then
        1.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *oldEnv*.
        2.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(*V*).

    6.  Let *nextValue* be [IteratorValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorvalue)(*nextResult*).
    7.  If *nextValue* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), then
        1.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *oldEnv*.
        2.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*nextValue*).

    8.  If *destructuring* is **false**, then
        1.  If *lhsKind* is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">lexicalBinding</span>, then
            1.  Let *status* be [InitializeReferencedBinding](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-initializereferencedbinding)(*lhsRef*, *nextValue*).

        2.  Else,
            1.  Let *status* be [PutValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-putvalue)(*lhsRef*, *nextValue*).

    9.  Else,
        1.  If *lhsKind* is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">assignment</span>, then
            1.  Let *status* be the result of performing DestructuringAssignmentEvaluation of *assignmentPattern* using *nextValue* as the argument.

        2.  Else if *lhsKind* is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">varBinding</span>, then
            1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *lhs* is a *ForBinding*.
            2.  Let *status* be the result of performing BindingInitialization for *lhs* passing *nextValue* and **undefined** as the arguments.

        3.  Else,
            1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *lhsKind* is <span style="font-family:
                                          sans-serif">lexicalBinding</span>.
            2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *lhs* is a *ForDeclaration*.
            3.  Let *status* be the result of performing BindingInitialization for *lhs* passing *nextValue* and *iterationEnv* as arguments.

    10. If *status* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), then
        1.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *oldEnv*.
        2.  Return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iterator*, *status*).

    11. Let *status* be the result of evaluating *stmt*.
    12. If *status*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">normal</span> and *status*.\[\[value\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, then
        1.  Let *V* = *status*.\[\[value\]\].

    13. Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *oldEnv*.
    14. If [LoopContinues](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-loopcontinues)(*status*, *labelSet*) is **false**, then
        1.  Return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iterator*, *status*).

<span id="sec-13.6.4.14" class="secnum">[13.6.4.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*ForBinding* <span class="geq">:</span> *BindingIdentifier*

1.  Let *bindingId* be StringValue of *BindingIdentifier.*
2.  Return [ResolveBinding](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-resolvebinding)(*bindingId*)

<span id="sec-13.7" class="secnum">[13.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-continue-statement "link to this section")</span> The `continue` Statement
==============================================================================================================================================================================

Syntax
------

*ContinueStatement*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`continue` `;`

`continue` <span class="grhsannot">\[no *LineTerminator* here\]</span> *LabelIdentifier*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `;`

<span id="sec-13.7.1" class="secnum">[13.7.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-continue-statement-static-semantics-early-errors "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Early Errors
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span class="prod">*ContinueStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `continue` `;`</span>

*ContinueStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `continue` *LabelIdentifier* `;`

-   It is a Syntax Error if this production is not nested, directly or indirectly (but not crossing function boundaries), within an *IterationStatement*.

<span id="sec-13.7.2" class="secnum">[13.7.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-continue-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedcontinuetarget "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: ContainsUndefinedContinueTarget
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With arguments iterationSet and labelSet.

<span id="sec-13.9" class="secnum">[13.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-return-statement "link to this section")</span> The `return` Statement
==========================================================================================================================================================================

Syntax
------

*ReturnStatement*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`return` `;`

`return` <span class="grhsannot">\[no *LineTerminator* here\]</span> *Expression*<sub>\[In,\\ ?Yield\]</sub> `;`

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> A `return` statement causes a function to cease execution and return a value to the caller. If *Expression* is omitted, the return value is **undefined**. Otherwise, the return value is the value of *Expression*.

<span id="sec-13.9.1" class="secnum">[13.9.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-return-statement-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*ReturnStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `return` `;`

1.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: <span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">return</span>, \[\[value\]\]: **undefined**, \[\[target\]\]: <span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">empty</span>}.

*ReturnStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `return` *Expression* `;`

1.  Let *exprRef* be the result of evaluating *Expression*.
2.  Let *exprValue* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*exprRef*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*exprValue*).
4.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: <span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">return</span>, \[\[value\]\]: *exprValue*, \[\[target\]\]: <span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">empty</span>}.

<span id="sec-13.10" class="secnum">[13.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-with-statement "link to this section")</span> The `with` Statement
========================================================================================================================================================================

Syntax
------

*WithStatement*<sub>\[Yield,\\ Return\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`with` `(` *Expression*<sub>\[In,\\ ?Yield\]</sub> `)` *Statement*<sub>\[?Yield,\\ ?Return\]</sub>

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `with` statement adds an object [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) for a computed object to the [lexical environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) of [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts). It then executes a statement using this augmented [lexical environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments). Finally, it restores the original [lexical environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).

<span id="sec-13.10.1" class="secnum">[13.10.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-with-statement-static-semantics-early-errors "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Early Errors
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*WithStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `with` `(` *Expression* `)` *Statement*

-   It is a Syntax Error if the code that matches this production is contained in [strict code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code).
-   It is a Syntax Error if [IsLabelledFunction](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-islabelledfunction)(*Statement*) is <span class="value">true</span>.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> It is only necessary to apply the second rule if the extension specified in [B.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-function-declarations) is implemented.

======================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

See also: [13.0.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-statement-semantics-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.1.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-block-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.2.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-variable-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.5.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-if-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.6.1.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-do-while-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.6.2.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-while-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.6.3.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.6.4.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.11.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-switch-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.12.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-statements-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.14.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-try-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [14.1.16](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [14.2.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrow-function-definitions-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [15.1.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-scripts-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [15.2.1.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-vardeclarednames).

<span id="sec-13.10.7" class="secnum">[13.10.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-with-statement-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*WithStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `with` `(` *Expression* `)` *Statement*

1.  Let *val* be the result of evaluating *Expression*.
2.  Let *obj* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)([GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*val*)).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*obj*).
4.  Let *oldEnv* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
5.  Let *newEnv* be [NewObjectEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newobjectenvironment)(*obj*, *oldEnv*).
6.  Set the *withEnvironment* flag of *newEnv’s* [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) to **true**.
7.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *newEnv*.
8.  Let *C* be the result of evaluating *Statement*.
9.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) to *oldEnv*.
10. If *C*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">normal</span> and *C*.\[\[value\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).
11. Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*C*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> No matter how control leaves the embedded *Statement*, whether normally or by some form of [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) or exception, the [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) is always restored to its former state.

*CaseClause*<sub>\[?Yield,\\ ?Return\]</sub>

<span id="sec-13.11.1" class="secnum">[13.11.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-switch-statement-static-semantics-early-errors "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Early Errors
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*CaseBlock* <span class="geq">:</span> `{` *CaseClauses* `}`

-   It is a Syntax Error if the LexicallyDeclaredNames of *CaseClauses* contains any duplicate entries.

-   It is a Syntax Error if any element of the LexicallyDeclaredNames of *CaseClauses* also occurs in the VarDeclaredNames of *CaseClauses*.

<span id="sec-13.11.2" class="secnum">[13.11.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-switch-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: ContainsDuplicateLabels
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With argument labelSet.

See also: [13.0.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-statement-semantics-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-block-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-if-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.6.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-do-while-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.6.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-while-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.6.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.6.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.10.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-with-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.12.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-statements-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.14.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-try-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [15.2.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels).

*SwitchStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `switch` `(` *Expression* `)` *CaseBlock*

1.  Return ContainsDuplicateLabels of *CaseBlock* with argument *labelSet.*

*CaseBlock* <span class="geq">:</span> `{` `}`

1.  Return **false**.

*CaseBlock* <span class="geq">:</span> `{` *CaseClauses*<sub>opt</sub> *DefaultClause* *CaseClauses*<sub>opt</sub> `}`

1.  If the first *CaseClauses* is present, then
    1.  Let *hasDuplicates* be ContainsDuplicateLabels of the first *CaseClauses* with argument *labelSet*.
    2.  If *hasDuplicates* is **true**, return **true**.

2.  Let *hasDuplicates* be ContainsDuplicateLabels of *DefaultClause* with argument *labelSet.*
3.  If *hasDuplicates* is **true**, return **true**.
4.  If the second *CaseClauses* is not present, return **false**.
5.  Return ContainsDuplicateLabels of the second *CaseClauses* with argument *labelSet*.

*CaseClauses* <span class="geq">:</span> *CaseClauses* *CaseClause*

1.  Let *hasDuplicates* be ContainsDuplicateLabels of *CaseClauses* with argument *labelSet*.
2.  If *hasDuplicates* is **true**, return **true**.
3.  Return ContainsDuplicateLabels of *CaseClause* with argument *labelSet.*

*CaseClause* <span class="geq">:</span> `case` *Expression* `:` *StatementList*<sub>opt</sub>

1.  If the *StatementList* is present, return ContainsDuplicateLabels of *StatementList* with argument *labelSet*.
2.  Else return **false**.

*DefaultClause* <span class="geq">:</span> `default` `:` *StatementList*<sub>opt</sub>

1.  If the *StatementList* is present, return ContainsDuplicateLabels of *StatementList* with argument *labelSet*.
2.  Else return **false**.

<span id="sec-13.11.8" class="secnum">[13.11.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-switch-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: VarScopedDeclarations
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

See also: [13.0.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-statement-semantics-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.1.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-block-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.2.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-variable-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.5.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-if-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.6.1.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-do-while-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.6.2.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-while-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.6.3.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.6.4.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.10.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-with-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.12.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-statements-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [13.14.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-try-statement-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [14.1.16](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [14.2.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrow-function-definitions-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [15.1.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-scripts-static-semantics-varscopeddeclarations), [15.2.1.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-vardeclarednames).

*SwitchStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `switch` `(` *Expression* `)` *CaseBlock*

1.  Return the VarScopedDeclarations of *CaseBlock*.

*CaseBlock* <span class="geq">:</span> `{` `}`

1.  Return a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).

*CaseBlock* <span class="geq">:</span> `{` *CaseClauses*<sub>opt</sub> *DefaultClause* *CaseClauses*<sub>opt</sub> `}`

1.  If the first *CaseClauses* is present, let *declarations* be the VarScopedDeclarations of the first *CaseClauses*.
2.  Else let *declarations* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
3.  Append to *declarations* the elements of the VarScopedDeclarations of the *DefaultClause.*
4.  If the second *CaseClauses* is not present, return *declarations*.
5.  Else return the result of appending to *declarations* the elements of the VarScopedDeclarations of the second *CaseClauses*.

*CaseClauses* <span class="geq">:</span> *CaseClauses* *CaseClause*

1.  Let *declarations* be VarScopedDeclarations of *CaseClauses*.
2.  Append to *declarations* the elements of the VarScopedDeclarations of *CaseClause.*
3.  Return *declarations*.

*CaseClause* <span class="geq">:</span> `case` *Expression* `:` *StatementList*<sub>opt</sub>

1.  If the *StatementList* is present, return the VarScopedDeclarations of *StatementList*.
2.  Else return a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).

*DefaultClause* <span class="geq">:</span> `default` `:` *StatementList*<sub>opt</sub>

1.  If the *StatementList* is present, return the VarScopedDeclarations of *StatementList*.
2.  Else return a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).

<span id="sec-13.11.9" class="secnum">[13.11.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-runtime-semantics-caseblockevaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: CaseBlockEvaluation
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With argument input.

*CaseBlock* <span class="geq">:</span> `{` `}`

1.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).

*CaseBlock* <span class="geq">:</span> `{` *CaseClauses* `}`

1.  Let *V* = **undefined**.
2.  Let *A* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of *CaseClause* items in *CaseClauses*, in source text order.
3.  Let *found* be **false**.
4.  Repeat for each *CaseClause* *C* in *A*,
    1.  If *found* is **false**, then
        1.  Let *clauseSelector* be the result of CaseSelectorEvaluation of *C*.
        2.  If *clauseSelector* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), then
            1.  If *clauseSelector*.\[\[value\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: *clauseSelector*.\[\[type\]\], \[\[value\]\]: **undefined**, \[\[target\]\]: *clauseSelector*.\[\[target\]\]}.
            2.  Else, return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*clauseSelector*).

        3.  Let *found* be the result of performing Strict Equality Comparison *input* === *clauseSelector*.\[\[value\]\].

    2.  If *found* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *R* be the result of evaluating *C*.
        2.  If *R*.\[\[value\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, let *V* = *R*.\[\[value\]\].
        3.  If *R* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: *R*.\[\[type\]\], \[\[value\]\]: *V*, \[\[target\]\]: *R*.\[\[target\]\]}.

5.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(*V*).

*CaseBlock* <span class="geq">:</span> `{` *CaseClauses*<sub>opt</sub> *DefaultClause* *CaseClauses*<sub>opt</sub> `}`

1.  Let *V* = **undefined**.
2.  Let *A* be the list of *CaseClause* items in the first *CaseClauses*, in source text order. If the first *CaseClauses* is not present *A* is « ».
3.  Let *found* be **false**.
4.  Repeat for each *CaseClause* *C* in *A*
    1.  If *found* is **false**, then
        1.  Let *clauseSelector* be the result of CaseSelectorEvaluation of *C*.
        2.  If *clauseSelector* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), then
            1.  If *clauseSelector*.\[\[value\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: *clauseSelector*.\[\[type\]\], \[\[value\]\]: **undefined**, \[\[target\]\]: *clauseSelector*.\[\[target\]\]}.
            2.  Else, return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*clauseSelector*).

        3.  Let *found* be the result of performing Strict Equality Comparison *input* === *clauseSelector*.\[\[value\]\].

    2.  If *found* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *R* be the result of evaluating *C*.
        2.  If *R*.\[\[value\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, let *V* = *R*.\[\[value\]\].
        3.  If *R* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: *R*.\[\[type\]\], \[\[value\]\]: *V*, \[\[target\]\]: *R*.\[\[target\]\]}.

5.  Let *foundInB* be **false**.
6.  Let *B* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the *CaseClause* items in the second *CaseClauses*, in source text order. If the second *CaseClauses* is not present *B* is « ».
7.  If *found* is **false**, then
    1.  Repeat for each *CaseClause C* in *B*
        1.  If *foundInB* is **false**, then
            1.  Let *clauseSelector* be the result of CaseSelectorEvaluation of *C*.
            2.  If *clauseSelector* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), then
                1.  If *clauseSelector*.\[\[value\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: *clauseSelector*.\[\[type\]\], \[\[value\]\]: **undefined**, \[\[target\]\]: *clauseSelector*.\[\[target\]\]}.
                2.  Else, return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*clauseSelector*).

            3.  Let *foundInB* be the result of performing Strict Equality Comparison *input* === *clauseSelector*.\[\[value\]\].

        2.  If *foundInB* is **true**, then
            1.  Let *R* be the result of evaluating *CaseClause C*.
            2.  If *R*.\[\[value\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, let *V* = *R*.\[\[value\]\].
            3.  If *R* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: *R*.\[\[type\]\], \[\[value\]\]: *V*, \[\[target\]\]: *R*.\[\[target\]\]}.

8.  If *foundInB* is **true**, return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(*V*).
9.  Let *R* be the result of evaluating *DefaultClause*.
10. If *R*.\[\[value\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, let *V* = *R*.\[\[value\]\].
11. If *R* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: *R*.\[\[type\]\], \[\[value\]\]: *V*, \[\[target\]\]: *R*.\[\[target\]\]}.
12. Repeat for each *CaseClause C* in *B* (NOTE this is another complete iteration of the second *CaseClauses*)
    1.  Let *R* be the result of evaluating *CaseClause* *C*.
    2.  If *R*.\[\[value\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, let *V* = *R*.\[\[value\]\].
    3.  If *R* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: *R*.\[\[type\]\], \[\[value\]\]: *V*, \[\[target\]\]: *R*.\[\[target\]\]}.

13. Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(*V*).

<span id="sec-13.11.10" class="secnum">[13.11.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-runtime-semantics-caseselectorevaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: CaseSelectorEvaluation
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*CaseClause* <span class="geq">:</span> `case` *Expression* `:` *StatementList*<sub>opt</sub>

1.  Let *exprRef* be the result of evaluating *Expression*.
2.  Return [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*exprRef*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> CaseSelectorEvaluation does not execute the associated *StatementList*. It simply evaluates the *Expression* and returns the value, which the *CaseBlock* algorithm uses to determine which *StatementList* to start executing.

<span id="sec-13.11.11" class="secnum">[13.11.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-switch-statement-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*SwitchStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `switch` `(` *Expression* `)` *CaseBlock*

1.  Let *exprRef* be the result of evaluating *Expression*.
2.  Let *switchValue* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*exprRef*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*switchValue*).
4.  Let *oldEnv* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
5.  Let *blockEnv* be [NewDeclarativeEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newdeclarativeenvironment)(*oldEnv*).
6.  Perform [BlockDeclarationInstantiation](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-blockdeclarationinstantiation)(*CaseBlock,* *blockEnv*).
7.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *blockEnv*.
8.  Let *R* be the result of performing CaseBlockEvaluation of *CaseBlock* with argument *switchValue*.
9.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *oldEnv*.
10. Return *R*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> No matter how control leaves the *SwitchStatement* the [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) is always restored to its former state.

*CaseClause* <span class="geq">:</span> `case` *Expression* `:`

1.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>).

*CaseClause* <span class="geq">:</span> `case` *Expression* `:` *StatementList*

1.  Return the result of evaluating *StatementList*.

*DefaultClause* <span class="geq">:</span> `default` `:`

1.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>).

*DefaultClause* <span class="geq">:</span> `default` `:` *StatementList*

1.  Return the result of evaluating *StatementList*.

<span id="sec-13.12" class="secnum">[13.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-statements "link to this section")</span> Labelled Statements
============================================================================================================================================================================

Syntax
------

*LabelledStatement*<sub>\[Yield,\\ Return\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*LabelIdentifier*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `:` *LabelledItem*<sub>\[?Yield,\\ ?Return\]</sub>

*LabelledItem*<sub>\[Yield,\\ Return\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*Statement*<sub>\[?Yield,\\ ?Return\]</sub>

*FunctionDeclaration*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> A *Statement* may be prefixed by a label. Labelled statements are only used in conjunction with labelled `break` and `continue` statements. ECMAScript has no `goto` statement. A *Statement* can be part of a *LabelledStatement*, which itself can be part of a *LabelledStatement*, and so on. The labels introduced this way are collectively referred to as the “current label set” when describing the semantics of individual statements. A *LabelledStatement* has no semantic meaning other than the introduction of a label to a *label set*.

<span id="sec-13.12.1" class="secnum">[13.12.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-statements-static-semantics-early-errors "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Early Errors
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*LabelledItem* <span class="geq">:</span> *FunctionDeclaration*

-   It is a Syntax Error if any source text matches this rule.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> An alternative definition for this rule is provided in [B.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-function-declarations).

<span id="sec-13.12.2" class="secnum">[13.12.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-statements-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: ContainsDuplicateLabels
===============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With argument labelSet.

See also: [13.0.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-statement-semantics-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-block-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-if-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.6.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-do-while-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.6.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-while-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.6.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.6.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.10.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-with-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.11.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-switch-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.14.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-try-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [15.2.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels).

*LabelledStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> *LabelIdentifier* `:` *LabelledItem*

1.  Let *label* be the StringValue of *LabelIdentifier*.
2.  If *label* is an element of *labelSet*, return **true**.
3.  Let *newLabelSet* be a copy of *labelSet* with *label* appended.
4.  Return ContainsDuplicateLabels of *LabelledItem* with argument *newLabelSet.*

*LabelledItem* <span class="geq">:</span> *FunctionDeclaration*

1.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-13.12.3" class="secnum">[13.12.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-statements-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: ContainsUndefinedBreakTarget
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With argument labelSet.

See also: [13.0.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-statement-semantics-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-block-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-if-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.6.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-do-while-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.6.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-while-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.6.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.6.4.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.8.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-break-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.10.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-with-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.11.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-switch-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.14.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-try-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [15.2.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget).

*LabelledStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> *LabelIdentifier* `:` *LabelledItem*

1.  Let *label* be the StringValue of *LabelIdentifier*.
2.  Let *newLabelSet* be a copy of *labelSet* with *label* appended.
3.  Return ContainsUndefinedBreakTarget of *LabelledItem* with argument *newLabelSet.*

*LabelledItem* <span class="geq">:</span> *FunctionDeclaration*

1.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-13.12.4" class="secnum">[13.12.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-statements-static-semantics-containsundefinedcontinuetarget "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: ContainsUndefinedContinueTarget
===============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With arguments iterationSet and labelSet.

See also: [13.0.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-statement-semantics-static-semantics-containsundefinedcontinuetarget), [13.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-block-static-semantics-containsundefinedcontinuetarget), [13.5.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-if-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedcontinuetarget), [13.6.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-do-while-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedcontinuetarget), [13.6.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-while-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedcontinuetarget), [13.6.3.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedcontinuetarget), [13.6.4.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-static-semantics-containsundefinedcontinuetarget), [13.7.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-continue-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedcontinuetarget), [13.10.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-with-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedcontinuetarget), [13.11.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-switch-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedcontinuetarget), [13.14.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-try-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedcontinuetarget), [15.2.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-containsundefinedcontinuetarget).

*LabelledStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> *LabelIdentifier* `:` *LabelledItem*

1.  Let *label* be the StringValue of *LabelIdentifier*.
2.  Let *newLabelSet* be a copy of *labelSet* with *label* appended.
3.  Return ContainsUndefinedContinueTarget of *LabelledItem* with arguments *iterationSet* and *newLabelSet.*

*LabelledItem* <span class="geq">:</span> *FunctionDeclaration*

1.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-13.12.5" class="secnum">[13.12.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-islabelledfunction "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: IsLabelledFunction ( stmt )
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IsLabelledFunction with argument stmt performs the following steps:

1.  If *stmt* is not a *LabelledStatement*, return **false**.
2.  Let *item* be the *LabelledItem* component of *stmt*.
3.  If *item* is <span class="prod">*LabelledItem* <span class="geq">:</span> *FunctionDeclaration*</span> , return **true**.
4.  Let *subStmt* be the *Statement* component of *item*.
5.  Return IsLabelledFunction(*subStmt*).
