<span id="sec-13.12.14" class="secnum">[13.12.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-statements-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: LabelledEvaluation
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With argument labelSet.

See also: [13.0.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-statement-semantics-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation), [13.6.1.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-do-while-statement-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation), [13.6.2.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-while-statement-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation), [13.6.3.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-statement-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation), [13.6.4.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-runtime-semantics-labelledevaluation).

*LabelledStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> *LabelIdentifier* `:` *LabelledItem*

1.  Let *label* be the StringValue of *LabelIdentifier*.
2.  Append *label* as an element of *labelSet*.
3.  Let *stmtResult* be LabelledEvaluation of *LabelledItem* with argument *labelSet*.
4.  If *stmtResult*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">break</span> and [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*stmtResult*.\[\[target\]\], *label*), then
    1.  If *stmtResult*.\[\[value\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, let *stmtResult* be [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).
    2.  Else, let *stmtResult* be [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(*stmtResult*.\[\[value\]\]).

5.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*stmtResult*).

*LabelledItem* <span class="geq">:</span> *Statement*

1.  If *Statement* is either a *LabelledStatement* or a *BreakableStatement*, then
    1.  Return LabelledEvaluation of *Statement* with argument *labelSet*.

2.  Else,
    1.  Return the result of evaluating *Statement*.

<span class="prod">*LabelledItem* <span class="geq">:</span> *FunctionDeclaration*</span>

1.  Return the result of evaluating *FunctionDeclaration*.

<span id="sec-13.12.15" class="secnum">[13.12.15](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-statements-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*LabelledStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> *LabelIdentifier* `:` *LabelledItem*

1.  Let *newLabelSet* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
2.  Return LabelledEvaluation of *LabelledItem* with argument *newLabelSet*.

<span id="sec-13.13" class="secnum">[13.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-throw-statement "link to this section")</span> The `throw` Statement
==========================================================================================================================================================================

Syntax
------

*ThrowStatement*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`throw` <span class="grhsannot">\[no *LineTerminator* here\]</span> *Expression*<sub>\[In,\\ ?Yield\]</sub> `;`

<span id="sec-13.13.1" class="secnum">[13.13.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-throw-statement-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
===================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*ThrowStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `throw` *Expression* `;`

1.  Let *exprRef* be the result of evaluating *Expression*.
2.  Let *exprValue* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*exprRef*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*exprValue*).
4.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: <span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">throw</span>, \[\[value\]\]: *exprValue*, \[\[target\]\]: <span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">empty</span>}.

<span id="sec-13.14" class="secnum">[13.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-try-statement "link to this section")</span> The `try` Statement
======================================================================================================================================================================

Syntax
------

*TryStatement*<sub>\[Yield,\\ Return\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`try` *Block*<sub>\[?Yield,\\ ?Return\]</sub> *Catch*<sub>\[?Yield,\\ ?Return\]</sub>

`try` *Block*<sub>\[?Yield,\\ ?Return\]</sub> *Finally*<sub>\[?Yield,\\ ?Return\]</sub>

`try` *Block*<sub>\[?Yield,\\ ?Return\]</sub> *Catch*<sub>\[?Yield,\\ ?Return\]</sub> *Finally*<sub>\[?Yield,\\ ?Return\]</sub>

*Catch*<sub>\[Yield,\\ Return\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`catch` `(` *CatchParameter*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `)` *Block*<sub>\[?Yield,\\ ?Return\]</sub>

*Finally*<sub>\[Yield,\\ Return\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`finally` *Block*<sub>\[?Yield,\\ ?Return\]</sub>

*CatchParameter*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*BindingIdentifier*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*BindingPattern*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `try` statement encloses a block of code in which an exceptional condition can occur, such as a runtime error or a `throw` statement. The `catch` clause provides the exception-handling code. When a catch clause catches an exception, its *CatchParameter* is bound to that exception.

<span id="sec-13.14.1" class="secnum">[13.14.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-try-statement-static-semantics-early-errors "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Early Errors
===================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*Catch* <span class="geq">:</span> `catch` `(` *CatchParameter* `)` *Block*

-   It is a Syntax Error if BoundNames <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">of *CatchParameter*</span> contains any duplicate elements.

-   It is a Syntax Error if any element of the BoundNames of *CatchParameter* also occurs in the LexicallyDeclaredNames of *Block*.

-   It is a Syntax Error if any element of the BoundNames of *CatchParameter* also occurs in the VarDeclaredNames of *Block*.

*NOTE An alternative static semantics for this production is given in [B.3.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-variablestatements-in-catch-blocks).*

<span id="sec-13.14.2" class="secnum">[13.14.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-try-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: ContainsDuplicateLabels
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With argument labelSet.

See also: [13.0.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-statement-semantics-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-block-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-if-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.6.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-do-while-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.6.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-while-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.6.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.6.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.10.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-with-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.11.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-switch-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.12.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-statements-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [15.2.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels).

*TryStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `try` *Block* *Catch*

1.  Let *hasDuplicates* be ContainsDuplicateLabels of *Block* with argument *labelSet*.
2.  If *hasDuplicates* is **true**, return **true**.
3.  Return ContainsDuplicateLabels of *Catch* with argument *labelSet.*

*TryStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `try` *Block* *Finally*

1.  Let *hasDuplicates* be ContainsDuplicateLabels of *Block* with argument *labelSet*.
2.  If *hasDuplicates* is **true**, return **true**.
3.  Return ContainsDuplicateLabels of *Finally* with argument *labelSet.*

*TryStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `try` *Block* *Catch* *Finally*

1.  Let *hasDuplicates* be ContainsDuplicateLabels of *Block* with argument *labelSet*.
2.  If *hasDuplicates* is **true**, return **true**.
3.  Let *hasDuplicates* be ContainsDuplicateLabels of *Catch* with argument *labelSet*.
4.  If *hasDuplicates* is **true**, return **true**.
5.  Return ContainsDuplicateLabels of *Finally* with argument *labelSet.*

*Catch* <span class="geq">:</span> `catch` `(` *CatchParameter* `)` *Block*

1.  Return ContainsDuplicateLabels of *Block* with argument *labelSet.*

<span id="sec-13.14.3" class="secnum">[13.14.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-try-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: ContainsUndefinedBreakTarget
===================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With argument labelSet.

See also: [13.0.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-statement-semantics-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-block-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-if-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.6.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-do-while-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.6.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-while-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.6.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.6.4.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.8.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-break-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.10.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-with-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.11.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-switch-statement-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [13.12.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-statements-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget), [15.2.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-containsundefinedbreaktarget).

*TryStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `try` *Block* *Catch*

1.  Let *hasUndefinedLabels* be ContainsUndefinedBreakTarget of *Block* with argument *labelSet*.
2.  If *hasUndefinedLabels* is **true**, return **true**.
3.  Return ContainsUndefinedBreakTarget of *Catch* with argument *labelSet.*

*TryStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `try` *Block* *Finally*

1.  Let *hasUndefinedLabels* be ContainsUndefinedBreakTarget of *Block* with argument *labelSet*.
2.  If *hasUndefinedLabels* is **true**, return **true**.

<span id="sec-13.14.7" class="secnum">[13.14.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-runtime-semantics-catchclauseevaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: CatchClauseEvaluation
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

with parameter thrownValue

*Catch* <span class="geq">:</span> `catch` `(` *CatchParameter* `)` *Block*

1.  Let *oldEnv* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
2.  Let *catchEnv* be [NewDeclarativeEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newdeclarativeenvironment)(*oldEnv*).
3.  For each element *argName* of the BoundNames of *CatchParameter*, do
    1.  Perform *catchEnv*.CreateMutableBinding(*argName*).
    2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): The above call to CreateMutableBinding will never return an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).

4.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *catchEnv*.
5.  Let *status* be the result of performing BindingInitialization for *CatchParameter* passing *thrownValue* and *catchEnv* as arguments.
6.  If *status* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), then
    1.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *oldEnv*.
    2.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*status*).

7.  Let *B* be the result of evaluating *Block*.
8.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *oldEnv*.
9.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*B*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> No matter how control leaves the *Block* the [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) is always restored to its former state.

<span id="sec-13.14.8" class="secnum">[13.14.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-try-statement-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*TryStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `try` *Block* *Catch*

1.  Let *B* be the result of evaluating *Block*.
2.  If *B*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">throw</span>, then
    1.  Let *C* be CatchClauseEvaluation of *Catch* with parameter *B*.\[\[value\]\].

3.  Else *B*.\[\[type\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">throw</span>**,**
    1.  Let *C* be *B*.

4.  If *C*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">return</span>, or *C*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">throw</span>, return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*C*).
5.  If *C*.\[\[value\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*C*).
6.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: *C*.\[\[type\]\], \[\[value\]\]: **undefined**, \[\[target\]\]: *C*.\[\[target\]\]}.

*TryStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `try` *Block* *Finally*

1.  Let *B* be the result of evaluating *Block*.
2.  Let *F* be the result of evaluating *Finally*.
3.  If *F*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">normal</span>, let *F* be *B.*
4.  If *F*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">return</span>, or *F*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">throw</span>, return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*F*).
5.  If *F*.\[\[value\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*F*).
6.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: *F*.\[\[type\]\], \[\[value\]\]: **undefined**, \[\[target\]\]: *F*.\[\[target\]\]}.

*TryStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `try` *Block* *Catch* *Finally*

1.  Let *B* be the result of evaluating *Block*.
2.  If *B*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">throw</span>, then
    1.  Let *C* be CatchClauseEvaluation of *Catch* with parameter *B*.\[\[value\]\].

3.  Else *B*.\[\[type\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">throw</span>**,** let *C* be *B*.
4.  Let *F* be the result of evaluating *Finally*.
5.  If *F*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">normal</span>, let *F* be *C*.
6.  If *F*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">return</span>, or *F*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">throw</span>, return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*F*).
7.  If *F*.\[\[value\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(*F*.\[\[value\]\]).
8.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: *F*.\[\[type\]\], \[\[value\]\]: **undefined**, \[\[target\]\]: *F*.\[\[target\]\]}.

<span id="sec-13.15" class="secnum">[13.15](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-debugger-statement "link to this section")</span> The `debugger` statement
================================================================================================================================================================================

Syntax
------

*DebuggerStatement* <span class="geq">:</span>

`debugger` `;`

<span id="sec-13.15.1" class="secnum">[13.15.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-debugger-statement-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Evaluating the *DebuggerStatement* production may allow an implementation to cause a breakpoint when run under a debugger. If a debugger is not present or active this statement has no observable effect.

*DebuggerStatement* <span class="geq">:</span> `debugger` `;`

1.  If an implementation defined debugging facility is available and enabled, then
    1.  Perform an implementation defined debugging action.
    2.  Let *result* be an implementation defined [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) value.

2.  Else
    1.  Let *result* be [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family:
                        sans-serif">empty</span>).

3.  Return *result.*

<span id="sec-14" class="secnum">[14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-functions-and-classes "link to this section")</span> ECMAScript Language: Functions and Classes

<span id="sec-14.1.1" class="secnum">[14.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-directive-prologues-and-the-use-strict-directive "link to this section")</span> Directive Prologues and the Use Strict Directive
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

A Directive Prologue is the longest sequence of *ExpressionStatement* productions occurring as the initial *StatementListItem* or *ModuleItem* productions of a *FunctionBody*, a *ScriptBody*, or a *ModuleBody* and where each *ExpressionStatement* in the sequence consists entirely of a *StringLiteral* token followed by a semicolon<span style="font-family: Times New Roman">.</span> The semicolon may appear explicitly or may be inserted by [automatic semicolon insertion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-automatic-semicolon-insertion). A Directive Prologue may be an empty sequence.

A Use Strict Directive is an *ExpressionStatement* in a Directive Prologue whose *StringLiteral* is either the exact code unit sequences `"use` `strict"` or `'use` `strict'`. A Use Strict Directive may not contain an *EscapeSequence* or *LineContinuation*.

A Directive Prologue may contain more than one Use Strict Directive. However, an implementation may issue a warning if this occurs.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The *ExpressionStatement* productions of a Directive Prologue are evaluated normally during evaluation of the containing production. Implementations may define implementation specific meanings for *ExpressionStatement* productions which are not a Use Strict Directive and which occur in a Directive Prologue. If an appropriate notification mechanism exists, an implementation should issue a warning if it encounters in a Directive Prologue an *ExpressionStatement* that is not a Use Strict Directive and which does not have a meaning defined by the implementation.

<span id="sec-14.1.2" class="secnum">[14.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions-static-semantics-early-errors "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Early Errors
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span class="prod">*FunctionDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `function` *BindingIdentifier* `(` *FormalParameters* `)` `{` *FunctionBody* `}`</span>
<span class="prod">*FunctionDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `function` `(` *FormalParameters* `)` `{` *FunctionBody* `}`</span>
<span class="prod">*FunctionExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `function` *BindingIdentifier*<sub>opt</sub> `(` *FormalParameters* `)` `{` *FunctionBody* `}`</span>

-   If the source code matching this production is [strict code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), the Early Error rules for <span class="prod">*StrictFormalParameters* <span class="geq">:</span> *FormalParameters*</span> are applied.

-   If the source code matching this production is [strict code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), it is a Syntax Error if *BindingIdentifier* is the *IdentifierName* `eval` or the *IdentifierName* `arguments`.

-   It is a Syntax Error if any element of the <span style="font-family: sans-serif">BoundNames</span> of *FormalParameters* also occurs in the <span style="font-family: sans-serif">LexicallyDeclaredNames</span> of *FunctionBody*.

-   It is a Syntax Error if *FormalParameters* Contains *SuperProperty* is ***true***.

-   It is a Syntax Error if *FunctionBody* Contains *SuperProperty* is ***true***.

-   It is a Syntax Error if *FormalParameters* Contains *SuperCall* is ***true***.

-   It is a Syntax Error if *FunctionBody* Contains *SuperCall* is ***true***.

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> The LexicallyDeclaredNames of a *FunctionBody* does not include identifiers bound using var or function declarations.

*StrictFormalParameters* <span class="geq">:</span> *FormalParameters*

-   It is a Syntax Error if BoundNames of *FormalParameters* contains any duplicate elements.

*FormalParameters* <span class="geq">:</span> *FormalParameterList*

-   It is a Syntax Error if IsSimpleParameterList of *FormalParameterList* is **false** and BoundNames of *FormalParameterList* contains any duplicate elements.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> Multiple occurrences of the same *BindingIdentifier* in a *FormalParameterList* is only allowed for functions and generator functions which have simple parameter lists and which are not defined in [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code).

*FunctionBody* <span class="geq">:</span> *FunctionStatementList*

-   It is a Syntax Error if the LexicallyDeclaredNames of *FunctionStatementList* contains any duplicate entries.

-   It is a Syntax Error if any element of the LexicallyDeclaredNames of *FunctionStatementList* also occurs in the VarDeclaredNames of *FunctionStatementList*.

-   It is a Syntax Error if ContainsDuplicateLabels of *FunctionStatementList* with argument « » is **true**.

-   It is a Syntax Error if ContainsUndefinedBreakTarget of *FunctionStatementList* with argument « » is **true**.

-   It is a Syntax Error if ContainsUndefinedContinueTarget of *FunctionStatementList* with arguments « » and « » is **true**.

1.  Return the ExpectedArgumentCount of *FormalsList*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The ExpectedArgumentCount of a *FormalParameterList* is the number of *FormalParameters* to the left of either the rest parameter or the first *FormalParameter* with an Initializer. A *FormalParameter* without an initializer is allowed after the first parameter with an initializer but such parameters are considered to be optional with **undefined** as their default value.

*FormalsList* <span class="geq">:</span> *FormalParameter*

1.  If HasInitializer of *FormalParameter* is **true** return 0
2.  Return 1.

*FormalsList* <span class="geq">:</span> *FormalsList* `,` *FormalParameter*

1.  Let *count* be the ExpectedArgumentCount of *FormalsList.*
2.  If HasInitializer of *FormalsList* is **true** or HasInitializer of *FormalParameter* is **true**, return *count*.
3.  Return *count*+1.

<span id="sec-14.1.9" class="secnum">[14.1.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isanonymousfunctiondefinition "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: IsAnonymousFunctionDefinition ( production )
===================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IsAnonymousFunctionDefinition determines if its argument is a function definition that does not bind a name. The argument production is the result of parsing an *AssignmentExpression* or *Initializer*. The following steps are taken:

1.  If IsFunctionDefinition of *production* is **false**, return **false**.
2.  Let *hasName* be the result of HasName of *production*.
3.  If *hasName* is **true**, return **false**.
4.  Return **true**.

<span id="sec-14.1.18" class="secnum">[14.1.18](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions-runtime-semantics-iteratorbindinginitialization "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: IteratorBindingInitialization
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With parameters iteratorRecord and environment.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> When **undefined** is passed for environment it indicates that a [PutValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-putvalue) operation should be used to assign the initialization value. This is the case for formal parameter lists of non-strict functions. In that case the formal parameter bindings are preinitialized in order to deal with the possibility of multiple parameters with the same name.

See also: [13.2.3.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-destructuring-binding-patterns-runtime-semantics-iteratorbindinginitialization), [14.2.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrow-function-definitions-runtime-semantics-iteratorbindinginitialization).

*FormalParameters* <span class="geq">:</span> <span class="grhsannot">\[empty\]</span>

1.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>).

*FormalParameterList* <span class="geq">:</span> *FormalsList* `,` *FunctionRestParameter*

1.  Let *restIndex* be the result of performing IteratorBindingInitialization for *FormalsList* using *iteratorRecord*, and *environment* as the arguments.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*restIndex*).
3.  Return the result of performing IteratorBindingInitialization for *FunctionRestParameter* using *iteratorRecord* and *environment* as the arguments.

*FormalsList* <span class="geq">:</span> *FormalsList* `,` *FormalParameter*

1.  Let *status* be the result of performing IteratorBindingInitialization for *FormalsList* using *iteratorRecord* and *environment* as the arguments.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
3.  Return the result of performing IteratorBindingInitialization for *FormalParameter* using *iteratorRecord* and *environment* as the arguments.

*FormalParameter* <span class="geq">:</span> *BindingElement*

1.  If HasInitializer of *BindingElement* is **false**, return the result of performing IteratorBindingInitialization for *BindingElement* using *iteratorRecord* and *environment* as the arguments.
2.  Let *currentContext* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
3.  Let *originalEnv* be the [VariableEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of *currentContext*.
4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): The [VariableEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) and [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of *currentContext* are the same.
5.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *environment* and *originalEnv* are the same.
6.  Let *paramVarEnv* be [NewDeclarativeEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newdeclarativeenvironment)(*originalEnv*).
7.  Set the [VariableEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of *currentContext* to *paramVarEnv*.
8.  Set the [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of *currentContext* to *paramVarEnv*.
9.  Let *result* be the result of performing IteratorBindingInitialization for *BindingElement* using *iteratorRecord* and *environment* as the arguments.
10. Set the [VariableEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of *currentContext* to *originalEnv*.
11. Set the [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of *currentContext* to *originalEnv*.
12. Return *result*.

The new [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records) created in step 5 is only used if the *<span style="font-family: Times New Roman">BindElement</span>’*s *Initializer* contains a direct eval.

<span id="sec-14.1.19" class="secnum">[14.1.19](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions-runtime-semantics-instantiatefunctionobject "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: InstantiateFunctionObject
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With parameter scope.

See also: [14.4.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions-runtime-semantics-instantiatefunctionobject).

*FunctionDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `function` *BindingIdentifier* `(` *FormalParameters* `)` `{` *FunctionBody* `}`

1.  If the function code for *FunctionDeclaration* is [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), let *strict* be **true**. Otherwise let *strict* be **false**.
2.  Let *name* be StringValue of *BindingIdentifier.*
3.  Let *F* be [FunctionCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functioncreate)(<span style="font-family: sans-serif">Normal</span>, *FormalParameters*, *FunctionBody, scope*, *strict*).
4.  Perform [MakeConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makeconstructor)(*F*).
5.  Perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*F*, *name*).
6.  Return *F*.

*FunctionDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `function` `(` *FormalParameters* `)` `{` *FunctionBody* `}`

1.  If the function code for *FunctionDeclaration* is [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), let *strict* be **true**. Otherwise let *strict* be **false**.
2.  Let *F* be [FunctionCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functioncreate)(<span style="font-family: sans-serif">Normal</span>, *FormalParameters*, *FunctionBody, scope*, *strict*).
3.  Perform [MakeConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makeconstructor)(*F*).
4.  Perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*F*, `"default"`).
5.  Return *F*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> An anonymous *FunctionDeclaration* can only occur as part of an `export         default` declaration.

<span id="sec-14.1.20" class="secnum">[14.1.20](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*FunctionDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `function` *BindingIdentifier* `(` *FormalParameters* `)` `{` *FunctionBody* `}`

1.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>).

``` Note
NOTE    An alternative semantics is provided in B.3.3.
```

*FunctionDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `function` `(` *FormalParameters* `)` `{` *FunctionBody* `}`

1.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>).

*FunctionExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `function` `(` *FormalParameters* `)` `{` *FunctionBody* `}`

1.  If the function code for *FunctionExpression* is [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), let *strict* be **true**. Otherwise let *strict* be **false**.
2.  Let *scope* be the [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
3.  Let *closure* be [FunctionCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functioncreate)(<span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">Normal</span>, *FormalParameters*, *FunctionBody, scope*, *strict*).
4.  Perform [MakeConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makeconstructor)(*closure*).
5.  Return *closure*.

*FunctionExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `function` *BindingIdentifier* `(` *FormalParameters* `)` `{` *FunctionBody* `}`

1.  If the function code for *FunctionExpression* is [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), let *strict* be **true**. Otherwise let *strict* be **false**.
2.  Let *runningContext* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
3.  Let *funcEnv* be [NewDeclarativeEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newdeclarativeenvironment)(*runningContext* ).
4.  Let *envRec* be *funcEnv’s* [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
5.  Let *name* be StringValue of *BindingIdentifier*.
6.  Perform *envRec.*CreateImmutableBinding(*name*).
7.  Let *closure* be [FunctionCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functioncreate)(<span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">Normal</span>, *FormalParameters*, *FunctionBody, funcEnv*, *strict*).
8.  Perform [MakeConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makeconstructor)(*closure*).
9.  Perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*closure*, *name*).
10. Perform *envRec*.InitializeBinding(*name,* *closure*).
11. Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(*closure*).

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> The *BindingIdentifier* in a *FunctionExpression* can be referenced from inside the *FunctionExpression's* *FunctionBody* to allow the function to call itself recursively. However, unlike in a *FunctionDeclaration*, the *BindingIdentifier* in a *FunctionExpression* cannot be referenced from and does not affect the scope enclosing the *FunctionExpression*.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> A `prototype` property is automatically created for every function defined using a *FunctionDeclaration* or *FunctionExpression*, to allow for the possibility that the function will be used as a constructor.

*FunctionStatementList* <span class="geq">:</span> <span class="grhsannot">\[empty\]</span>

1.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).

<span id="sec-14.2" class="secnum">[14.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrow-function-definitions "link to this section")</span> Arrow Function Definitions
========================================================================================================================================================================================

Syntax
------

*ArrowFunction*<sub>\[In,\\ Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*ArrowParameters*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> <span class="grhsannot">\[no *LineTerminator* here\]</span> `=>` *ConciseBody*<sub>\[?In\]</sub>

*ArrowParameters*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*BindingIdentifier*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*ConciseBody*<sub>\[In\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

<span class="grhsannot">\[lookahead ≠ { \]</span> *AssignmentExpression*<sub>\[?In\]</sub>

`{` *FunctionBody* `}`

Supplemental Syntax
-------------------

When the production

*ArrowParameters*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> **:** *CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

is recognized the following grammar is used to refine the interpretation of <span class="prod">*CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList* <span class="geq">:</span></span>

*ArrowFormalParameters*<sub>\[Yield,\\ GeneratorParameter\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`(` *StrictFormalParameters*<sub>\[?Yield,\\ ?GeneratorParameter\]</sub> `)`

<span id="sec-14.2.1" class="secnum">[14.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrow-function-definitions-static-semantics-early-errors "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Early Errors
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*ArrowFunction* <span class="geq">:</span> *ArrowParameters* `=>` *ConciseBody*

-   It is a Syntax Error if any element of the BoundNames of *ArrowParameters* also occurs in the LexicallyDeclaredNames of *ConciseBody*.

*ArrowParameters*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> **:** *CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

-   If the <sub>\[Yield\]</sub> grammar parameter is present on *ArrowParameters*, it is a Syntax Error if the lexical token sequence matched by *CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> cannot be parsed with no tokens left over using *ArrowFormalParameters*<sub>\[Yield,\\ GeneratorParameter\]</sub> as the goal symbol.

-   If the <sub>\[Yield\]</sub> grammar parameter is not present on *ArrowParameters*, it is a Syntax Error if the lexical token sequence matched by *CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> cannot be parsed with no tokens left over using *ArrowFormalParameters* as the goal symbol.

-   All early errors rules for *ArrowFormalParameters* and its derived productions also apply to CoveredFormalsList of *CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `yield` operator cannot be used within expressions that are part of an *ArrowFormalParameters*<span style="font-family: sans-serif">.</span>

<span id="sec-14.2.2" class="secnum">[14.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrow-function-definitions-static-semantics-boundnames "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: BoundNames
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

See also: [12.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-identifiers-static-semantics-boundnames), [13.2.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-let-and-const-declarations-static-semantics-boundnames), [13.2.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-variable-statement-static-semantics-boundnames), [13.2.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-destructuring-binding-patterns-static-semantics-boundnames), [13.6.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-static-semantics-boundnames), [14.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions-static-semantics-boundnames), [14.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions-static-semantics-boundnames), [14.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-class-definitions-static-semantics-boundnames), [15.2.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-imports-static-semantics-boundnames), [15.2.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-exports-static-semantics-boundnames).

*ArrowParameters* <span class="geq">:</span> *CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList*

1.  Let *formals* be CoveredFormalsList of *CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList*.
2.  Return the BoundNames of *formals*.

<span id="sec-14.2.14" class="secnum">[14.2.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrow-function-definitions-runtime-semantics-iteratorbindinginitialization "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: IteratorBindingInitialization
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With parameters iteratorRecord and environment.

See also: [13.2.3.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-destructuring-binding-patterns-runtime-semantics-iteratorbindinginitialization), [14.1.18](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions-runtime-semantics-iteratorbindinginitialization).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> When **undefined** is passed for environment it indicates that a [PutValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-putvalue) operation should be used to assign the initialization value. This is the case for formal parameter lists of non-strict functions. In that case the formal parameter bindings are preinitialized in order to deal with the possibility of multiple parameters with the same name.

*ArrowParameters* <span class="geq">:</span> *BindingIdentifier*

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] is **false.**
2.  Let *next* be [IteratorStep](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorstep)(*iteratorRecord*.\[\[iterator\]\]).
3.  If *next* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), set *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] to **true**.
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*next*).
5.  If *next* is **false**, set *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] to **true**
6.  Else
    1.  Let *v* be [IteratorValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorvalue)(*next*).
    2.  If *v* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), set *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] to **true**.
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*v*).

7.  If *iteratorRecord*.\[\[done\]\] is **true**, let *v* be **undefined**.
8.  Return the result of performing BindingInitialization for *BindingIdentifier* using *v* and *environment* as the arguments.

*ArrowParameters* <span class="geq">:</span> *CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList*

1.  Let *formals* be CoveredFormalsList of *CoverParenthesizedExpressionAndArrowParameterList*.
2.  Return the result of performing IteratorBindingInitialization of *formals* with arguments *iteratorRecord* and *environment*.

<span id="sec-14.2.15" class="secnum">[14.2.15](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrow-function-definitions-runtime-semantics-evaluatebody "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: EvaluateBody
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With parameter functionObject.

See also: [14.1.17](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions-runtime-semantics-evaluatebody), [14.4.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions-runtime-semantics-evaluatebody).

*ConciseBody* <span class="geq">:</span> *AssignmentExpression*

1.  Let *exprRef* be the result of evaluating *AssignmentExpression*.
2.  Let *exprValue* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*exprRef*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*exprValue*).
4.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: <span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">return</span>, \[\[value\]\]: *exprValue*, \[\[target\]\]: <span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">empty</span>}.

<span id="sec-14.2.16" class="secnum">[14.2.16](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrow-function-definitions-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*ArrowFunction* <span class="geq">:</span> *ArrowParameters* `=>` *ConciseBody*

1.  If the function code for this *ArrowFunction* is [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code) ([10.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code)), let *strict* be **true**. Otherwise let *strict* be **false**.
2.  Let *scope* be the [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
3.  Let *parameters* be CoveredFormalsList of *ArrowParameters*.
4.  Let *closure* be [FunctionCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functioncreate)(<span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">Arrow</span>, *parameters*, *ConciseBody, scope*, *strict*).
5.  Return *closure*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> An *ArrowFunction* does not define local bindings for `arguments`, `super`, `this`, or `new.target`. Any reference to `arguments`, `super`, or `this` within an *ArrowFunction* must resolve to a binding in a lexically enclosing environment. Typically this will be the Function Environment of an immediately enclosing function. Even though an *ArrowFunction* may contain references to `super`, the function object created in step 4 is not made into a method by performing [MakeMethod](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makemethod). An *ArrowFunction* that references `super` is always contained within a non-*ArrowFunction* and the necessary state to implement `super` is accessible via the *scope* that is captured by the function object of the *ArrowFunction*.

<span id="sec-14.3.8" class="secnum">[14.3.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-runtime-semantics-definemethod "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: DefineMethod

With parameters object and optional parameter <span style="font-family: Times New
      Roman">*functionPrototype*.</span>

*MethodDefinition* <span class="geq">:</span> *PropertyName* `(` *StrictFormalParameters* `)` `{` *FunctionBody* `}`

1.  Let *propKey* be the result of evaluating *PropertyName*.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*propKey*).
3.  If the function code for this *MethodDefinition* is [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), let *strict* be **true**. Otherwise let *strict* be **false**.
4.  Let *scope* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
5.  If *functionPrototype* was passed as a parameter, let *kind* be <span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">Normal</span>; otherwise let *kind* be <span style="font-family: sans-serif">Method</span>.
6.  Let *closure* be [FunctionCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functioncreate)(*kind*, *StrictFormalParameters*, *FunctionBody, scope*, *strict*). If *functionPrototype* was passed as a parameter then pass its value as the *functionPrototype* optional argument of [FunctionCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functioncreate).
7.  Perform [MakeMethod](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makemethod)(*closure*, *object*).
8.  Return the Record{\[\[key\]\]: *propKey*, \[\[closure\]\]: *closure*}.

*MethodDefinition* <span class="geq">:</span> *PropertyName* `(` *StrictFormalParameters* `)` `{` *FunctionBody* `}`

1.  Let *methodDef* be DefineMethod of *MethodDefinition* with argument *object*.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*methodDef*).
3.  Perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*methodDef*.\[\[closure\]\], *methodDef*.\[\[key\]\]).
4.  Let *desc* be the [Property Descriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-property-descriptor-specification-type){\[\[Value\]\]: *methodDef*.\[\[closure\]\], \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: *enumerable*, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true**}.
5.  Return [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*object*, *methodDef*.\[\[key\]\], *desc*).

*MethodDefinition* <span class="geq">:</span> *GeneratorMethod*

See [14.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions).

*MethodDefinition* <span class="geq">:</span> `get` *PropertyName* `(` `)` `{` *FunctionBody* `}`

1.  Let *propKey* be the result of evaluating *PropertyName*.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*propKey*).
3.  If the function code for this *MethodDefinition* is [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), let *strict* be **true**. Otherwise let *strict* be **false**.
4.  Let *scope* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
5.  Let *formalParameterList* be the production <span class="prod">*FormalParameters* <span class="geq">:</span> <span class="grhsannot">\[empty\]</span></span>
6.  Let *closure* be [FunctionCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functioncreate)(<span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">Method</span>, *formalParameterList*, *FunctionBody, scope*, *strict*).
7.  Perform [MakeMethod](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makemethod)(*closure*, *object*).
8.  Perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*closure*, *propKey*, `"get"`).
9.  Let *desc* be the PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Get\]\]: *closure*, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: *enumerable*, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true**}
10. Return [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*object*, *propKey*, *desc*).

*MethodDefinition* <span class="geq">:</span> `set` *PropertyName* `(` *PropertySetParameterList* `)` `{` *FunctionBody* `}`

1.  Let *propKey* be the result of evaluating *PropertyName*.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*propKey*).
3.  If the function code for this *MethodDefinition* is [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), let *strict* be **true**. Otherwise let *strict* be **false**.
4.  Let *scope* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
5.  Let *closure* be [FunctionCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functioncreate)(<span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">Method</span>, *PropertySetParameterList*, *FunctionBody, scope*, *strict*).
6.  Perform [MakeMethod](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makemethod)(*closure*, *object*).
7.  Perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*closure*, *propKey*, `"set"`).
8.  Let *desc* be the PropertyDescriptor{\[\[Set\]\]: *closure*, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: *enumerable*, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true**}
9.  Return [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*object*, *propKey*, *desc*).

<span id="sec-14.4" class="secnum">[14.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions "link to this section")</span> Generator Function Definitions
================================================================================================================================================================================================

Syntax
------

*GeneratorMethod*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`*` *PropertyName*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `(` *StrictFormalParameters*<sub>\[Yield,GeneratorParameter\]</sub> `)` `{` *GeneratorBody* `}`

*GeneratorDeclaration*<sub>\[Yield,\\ Default\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`function` `*` *BindingIdentifier*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> `(` *FormalParameters*<sub>\[Yield,GeneratorParameter\]</sub> `)` `{` *GeneratorBody* `}`

<span class="grhsannot">\[+Default\]</span> `function` `*` `(` *FormalParameters*<sub>\[Yield,GeneratorParameter\]</sub> `)` `{` *GeneratorBody* `}`

*GeneratorExpression* <span class="geq">:</span>

`function` `*` *BindingIdentifier*<sub>\[Yield\]opt</sub> `(` *FormalParameters*<sub>\[Yield,GeneratorParameter\]</sub> `)` `{` *GeneratorBody* `}`

*GeneratorBody* <span class="geq">:</span>

*FunctionBody*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub>

*YieldExpression*<sub>\[In\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`yield`

`yield` <span class="grhsannot">\[no *LineTerminator* here\]</span> *AssignmentExpression*<sub>\[?In,\\ Yield\]</sub>

`yield` <span class="grhsannot">\[no *LineTerminator* here\]</span> `*` *AssignmentExpression*<sub>\[?In,\\ Yield\]</sub>

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> The syntactic context immediately following `yield` requires use of the *InputElementRegExpOrTemplateTail* lexical goal.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> *YieldExpression* cannot be used within the *FormalParameters* of a generator function because any expressions that are part of *FormalParameters* are evaluated before the resulting generator object is in a resumable state.

<span class="nh">NOTE 3</span> Abstract operations relating to generator objects are defined in [25.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-abstract-operations).

<span id="sec-14.4.1" class="secnum">[14.4.1](./ECMAScript%20Language%20Specification%20ECMA-262%206th%20Edition%20–%20DRAFT_files/ECMAScript%20Language%20Specification%20ECMA-262%206th%20Edition%20–%20DRAFT.html "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Early Errors
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*GeneratorMethod* <span class="geq">:</span> `*` *PropertyName* `(` *StrictFormalParameters* `)` `{` *GeneratorBody* `}`

-   It is a Syntax Error if HasDirectSuper of *GeneratorMethod* is ***true*** .

-   It is a Syntax Error if any element of the BoundNames of *StrictFormalParameters* also occurs in the LexicallyDeclaredNames of *GeneratorBody*.

*GeneratorDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `function` `*` *BindingIdentifier* `(` *FormalParameters* `)` `{` *GeneratorBody* `}`

-   It is a Syntax Error if HasDirectSuper of *GeneratorDeclaration* is ***true*** .

*GeneratorExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `function` `*` *BindingIdentifier*<sub>opt</sub> `(` *FormalParameters* `)` `{` *GeneratorBody* `}`

-   It is a Syntax Error if HasDirectSuper of *GeneratorExpression* is ***true*** .

<span class="prod">*GeneratorDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `function` `*` *BindingIdentifier* `(` *FormalParameters* `)` `{` *GeneratorBody* `}`</span>
<span class="prod">*GeneratorExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `function` `*` *BindingIdentifier*<sub>opt</sub> `(` *FormalParameters* `)` `{` *GeneratorBody* `}`</span>

-   If the source code matching this production is [strict code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), the Early Error rules for <span class="prod">*StrictFormalParameters* <span class="geq">:</span> *FormalParameters*</span> are applied.

-   If the source code matching this production is [strict code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), it is a Syntax Error if *BindingIdentifier* is the *IdentifierName* `eval` or the *IdentifierName* `arguments`.

-   It is a Syntax Error if any element of the BoundNames of *FormalParameters* also occurs in the LexicallyDeclaredNames of *GeneratorBody*.

-   It is a Syntax Error if *FormalParameters* Contains *SuperProperty* is ***true***.

-   It is a Syntax Error if *GeneratorBody* Contains *SuperProperty* is ***true***.

4.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: <span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">return</span>, \[\[value\]\]: *G*, \[\[target\]\]: <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>}.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> If the generator was invoked using \[\[Call\]\], the `this` binding will have already been initialized in the normal manner. If the generator was invoked using \[\[Construct\]\], the `this` bind is not initialized and any references to `this` within the *FunctionBody* will produce a **ReferenceError** exception.
