6.  Perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*F*, *name*).
7.  Return *F*.

*GeneratorDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `function` `*` `(` *FormalParameters* `)` `{` *GeneratorBody* `}`

1.  If the function code for *GeneratorDeclaration* is [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), let *strict* be **true**. Otherwise let *strict* be **false**.
2.  Let *F* be [GeneratorFunctionCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorfunctioncreate)(<span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">Normal</span>, *FormalParameters*, *GeneratorBody*, *scope*, *strict*).
3.  Let *prototype* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(<span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">%GeneratorPrototype%</span>).
4.  Perform [MakeConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makeconstructor)(*F*, **true**, *prototype*).
5.  Perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*F*, `"default"`).
6.  Return *F*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> An anonymous *GeneratorDeclaration* can only occur as part of an `export         default` declaration.

<span id="sec-14.4.13" class="secnum">[14.4.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions-runtime-semantics-propertydefinitionevaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: PropertyDefinitionEvaluation
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With parameter object and <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*enumerable*.</span>

See also: [12.2.5.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-initializer-runtime-semantics-propertydefinitionevaluation), [14.3.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-method-definitions-runtime-semantics-propertydefinitionevaluation), B.3.1

*GeneratorMethod* <span class="geq">:</span> `*` *PropertyName* `(` *StrictFormalParameters* `)` `{` *GeneratorBody* `}`

1.  Let *propKey* be the result of evaluating *PropertyName*.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*propKey*).
3.  If the function code for this *GeneratorMethod* is [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), let *strict* be **true**. Otherwise let *strict* be **false**.
4.  Let *scope* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
5.  Let *closure* be [GeneratorFunctionCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorfunctioncreate)(<span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">Method</span>, *StrictFormalParameters*, *GeneratorBody, scope*, *strict*).
6.  Perform [MakeMethod](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makemethod)(*closure*, *object*).
7.  Let *prototype* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(<span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">%GeneratorPrototype</span>%).
8.  Perform [MakeConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makeconstructor)(*closure*, **true**, *prototype*).
9.  Perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*closure*, *propKey*).
10. Let *desc* be the [Property Descriptor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-property-descriptor-specification-type){\[\[Value\]\]: *closure*, \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: *enumerable*, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true**}.
11. Return [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*object*, *propKey*, *desc*).

<span id="sec-14.4.14" class="secnum">[14.4.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*GeneratorExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `function` `*` `(` *FormalParameters* `)` `{` *GeneratorBody* `}`

1.  If the function code for this *GeneratorExpression* is [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), let *strict* be **true**. Otherwise let *strict* be **false**.
2.  Let *scope* be the [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
3.  Let *closure* be [GeneratorFunctionCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorfunctioncreate)(<span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">Normal</span>, *FormalParameters*, *GeneratorBody, scope*, *strict*).
4.  Let *prototype* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(<span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">%GeneratorPrototype%</span>).
5.  Perform [MakeConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makeconstructor)(*closure*, **true**, *prototype*).
6.  Return *closure*.

*GeneratorExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `function` `*` *BindingIdentifier* `(` *FormalParameters* `)` `{` *GeneratorBody* `}`

1.  If the function code for this *GeneratorExpression* is [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), let *strict* be **true**. Otherwise let *strict* be **false**.
2.  Let *runningContext* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
3.  Let *funcEnv* be [NewDeclarativeEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newdeclarativeenvironment)(*runningContext*).
4.  Let *envRec* be *funcEnv’s* [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
5.  Let *name* be StringValue of *BindingIdentifier*.
6.  Perform *envRec.*CreateImmutableBinding(*name*).
7.  Let *closure* be [GeneratorFunctionCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorfunctioncreate)(<span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">Normal</span>, *FormalParameters*, *GeneratorBody, funcEnv*, *strict*).
8.  Let *prototype* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(<span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">%GeneratorPrototype%</span>).
9.  Perform [MakeConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makeconstructor) (*closure*, **true**, *prototype*).
10. Perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*closure*, *name*).
11. Perform *envRec.*InitializeBinding(*name,* *closure*).
12. Return *closure*.

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> The *BindingIdentifier* in a *GeneratorExpression* can be referenced from inside the *GeneratorExpression's* *FunctionBody* to allow the generator code to call itself recursively. However, unlike in a *GeneratorDeclaration*, the *BindingIdentifier* in a *GeneratorExpression* cannot be referenced from and does not affect the scope enclosing the *GeneratorExpression*.

*YieldExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `yield`

1.  Return [GeneratorYield](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatoryield)([CreateIterResultObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject)(**undefined**, **false**)).

*YieldExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `yield` *AssignmentExpression*

1.  Let *exprRef* be the result of evaluating *AssignmentExpression*.
2.  Let *value* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*exprRef*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*value*).
4.  Return [GeneratorYield](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatoryield)([CreateIterResultObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject)(*value*, **false**)).

*YieldExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `yield` `*` *AssignmentExpression*

1.  Let *exprRef* be the result of evaluating *AssignmentExpression*.
2.  Let *value* be [GetValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvalue)(*exprRef*).
3.  Let *iterator* be [GetIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getiterator)(*value*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*iterator*)*.*
5.  Let *received* be [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).
6.  Repeat
    1.  If *received*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">normal</span>, then
        1.  Let *innerResult* be [IteratorNext](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratornext)(*iterator*, *received*.\[\[value\]\]).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*innerResult*).
        3.  Let *done* be [IteratorComplete](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorcomplete)(*innerResult*).
        4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*done*).
        5.  If *done* is **true**, then
            1.  Return [IteratorValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorvalue) (*innerResult*).

        6.  Let *received* be [GeneratorYield](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatoryield)(*innerResult*).

    2.  Else if *received*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">throw</span>, then
        1.  Let *throw* be [GetMethod](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getmethod)(*iterator*, `"throw"`).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*throw*)<span style="font-family:
                                sans-serif">.</span>
        3.  If *throw* is not **undefined**, then
            1.  Let *innerResult* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*throw*, *iterator*, «‍*received*.\[\[value\]\]»).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*innerResult*)<span style="font-family:
                                        sans-serif">.</span>
            3.  NOTE: Exceptions from the inner iterator `throw` method are propagated. Normal completions from an inner `throw` method are processed similarly to an inner `next`.
            4.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*innerResult*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
            5.  Let *done* be [IteratorComplete](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorcomplete)(*innerResult*).
            6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*done*).
            7.  If *done* is **true**, then
                1.  Let *value* be [IteratorValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorvalue)(*innerResult*).
                2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*value*).
                3.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: <span style="font-family: sans-serif">return</span> , \[\[value\]\]:*value*, \[\[target\]\]:<span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>}.

            8.  Let *received* be [GeneratorYield](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatoryield)(*innerResult*).

        4.  Else,
            1.  NOTE: If iterator does not have a `throw` method, this throw is going to terminate the `yield*` loop. But first we need to give iterator a chance to clean up.
            2.  Let *closeResult* be [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iterator*, [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: <span style="font-family:
                                        sans-serif">normal</span> , \[\[value\]\]: <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, \[\[target\]\]:<span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>}).
            3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*closeResult*).
            4.  NOTE: Next throw a <span class="value">TypeError</span> to indicate that there was an `yield*` protocol violation: <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*iterator*</span> does not have a `throw` method.
            5.  Throw a **TypeError** exception.

    3.  Else,
        1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *received*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family:
                                sans-serif">return</span>.
        2.  Let *return* be [GetMethod](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getmethod)(*iterator*, `"return"`).
        3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*return*)<span style="font-family:
                                sans-serif">.</span>
        4.  If *return* is **undefined**, return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*received*).
        5.  Let *innerReturnResult* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*return*, *iterator*, «‍*received*.\[\[value\]\]»).
        6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*innerReturnResult*)<span style="font-family:
                                sans-serif">.</span>
        7.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*innerReturnResult*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
        8.  Let *done* be [IteratorComplete](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorcomplete)(*innerReturnResult*).
        9.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*done*).
        10. If *done* is **true**, then
            1.  Let *value* be [IteratorValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorvalue)(*innerReturnResult*).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*value*).
            3.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: <span style="font-family: sans-serif">return</span> , \[\[value\]\]: *value*, \[\[target\]\]:<span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>}.

        11. Let *received* be [GeneratorYield](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatoryield)(*innerReturnResult*).

<span id="sec-14.5" class="secnum">[14.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-class-definitions "link to this section")</span> Class Definitions
======================================================================================================================================================================

Syntax
------

*ClassDeclaration*<sub>\[Yield,\\ Default\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`class` *BindingIdentifier*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> *ClassTail*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

<span class="grhsannot">\[+Default\]</span> `class` *ClassTail*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*ClassExpression*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`class` *BindingIdentifier*<sub>\[?Yield\]opt</sub> *ClassTail*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*ClassTail*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*ClassHeritage*<sub>\[?Yield\]opt</sub> `{` *ClassBody*<sub>\[?Yield\]opt</sub> `}`

*ClassHeritage*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

`extends` *LeftHandSideExpression*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*ClassBody*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*ClassElementList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*ClassElementList*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*ClassElement*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*ClassElementList*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub> *ClassElement*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

*ClassElement*<sub>\[Yield\]</sub> <span class="geq">:</span>

*MethodDefinition*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

`static` *MethodDefinition*<sub>\[?Yield\]</sub>

`;`

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> A *ClassBody* is always [strict code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code).

<span id="sec-14.5.1" class="secnum">[14.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-class-definitions-static-semantics-early-errors "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Early Errors
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*ClassTail* <span class="geq">:</span> *ClassHeritage*<sub>opt</sub> `{` *ClassBody* `}`

-   It is a Syntax Error if *ClassHeritage* <span style="font-family: sans-serif">is not present</span> *and the following algorithm evaluates to **true**:*

    1.  Let *constructor* be ConstructorMethod of *ClassBody*.
    2.  If *constructor* is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, return **false**.
    3.  Return HasDirectSuper of *constructor*.

*ClassBody* <span class="geq">:</span> *ClassElementList*

-   It is a Syntax Error if PrototypePropertyNameList of *ClassElementList* *contains more than one occurrence of* `"constructor"`.

*ClassElement* <span class="geq">:</span> *MethodDefinition*

-   It is a Syntax Error if PropName of *MethodDefinition* is not `"constructor"` *and* HasDirectSuper of *MethodDefinition* is ***true***.

-   It is a Syntax Error if PropName of *MethodDefinition* is `"constructor"` *and SpecialMethod of* *MethodDefinition* *is* ***true**.*

*ClassElement* <span class="geq">:</span> `static` *MethodDefinition*

-   It is a Syntax Error if HasDirectSuper of *MethodDefinition* is ***true***.
-   It is a Syntax Error if PropName of *MethodDefinition* *is* `"prototype"`*.*

<span id="sec-14.5.2" class="secnum">[14.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-class-definitions-static-semantics-boundnames "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: BoundNames
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================

See also: [12.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-identifiers-static-semantics-boundnames), [13.2.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-let-and-const-declarations-static-semantics-boundnames), [13.2.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-variable-statement-static-semantics-boundnames), [13.2.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-destructuring-binding-patterns-static-semantics-boundnames), [13.6.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-static-semantics-boundnames), [14.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions-static-semantics-boundnames), [14.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrow-function-definitions-static-semantics-boundnames), [14.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions-static-semantics-boundnames), [15.2.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-imports-static-semantics-boundnames), [15.2.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-exports-static-semantics-boundnames).

*ClassDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `class` *BindingIdentifier* *ClassTail*

1.  Return the BoundNames of *BindingIdentifier*.

*ClassDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `class` *ClassTail*

1.  Return «`"*default*"`».

<span id="sec-14.5.3" class="secnum">[14.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-static-semantics-constructormethod "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: ConstructorMethod
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================

*ClassElementList* <span class="geq">:</span> *ClassElement*

1.  If *ClassElement* is the production <span class="prod">*ClassElement* <span class="geq">:</span> `;`</span> , return <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>.
2.  If IsStatic of *ClassElement* is **true**, return <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>.
3.  If PropName of *ClassElement* is not `"constructor"`, return <span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">empty</span>.
4.  Return *ClassElement*.

*ClassElementList* <span class="geq">:</span> *ClassElementList* *ClassElement*

1.  Let *head* be ConstructorMethod of *ClassElementList.*
2.  If *head* is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, return *head*.
3.  If *ClassElement* is the production <span class="prod">*ClassElement* <span class="geq">:</span> `;`</span> , return <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>.
4.  If IsStatic of *ClassElement* is **true**, return <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>.
5.  If PropName of *ClassElement* is not `"constructor"`, return <span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">empty</span>.
6.  Return *ClassElement*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Early Error rules ensure that there is only one method definition named `"constructor"` and that it is not an accessor property or generator definition.

<span id="sec-14.5.4" class="secnum">[14.5.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-class-definitions-static-semantics-contains "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Contains
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================

With parameter symbol.

See also: [5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-static-semantic-rules), [12.2.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-initializer-static-semantics-contains), [12.3.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-static-semantics-static-semantics-contains), [14.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions-static-semantics-contains), [14.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrow-function-definitions-static-semantics-contains), [14.4.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions-static-semantics-contains)

*ClassTail* <span class="geq">:</span> *ClassHeritage*<sub>opt</sub> `{` *ClassBody* `}`

1.  If *symbol* is *ClassBody*, return **true**.
2.  If *symbol* is *ClassHeritage*, then
    1.  If *ClassHeritage* is present, return **true** otherwise return **false**.

3.  Let *inHeritage* be *ClassHeritage* Contains *symbol*.
4.  If *inHeritage* is **true**, return **true**.
5.  Return the result of ComputedPropertyContains for *ClassBody* with argument *symbol*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Static semantic rules that depend upon substructure generally do not look into class bodies except for *PropertyName* productions.

<span id="sec-14.5.5" class="secnum">[14.5.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-class-definitions-static-semantics-computedpropertycontains "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: ComputedPropertyContains
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With parameter symbol.

See also: [12.2.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-initializer-static-semantics-computedpropertycontains), [14.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-method-definitions-static-semantics-computedpropertycontains), [14.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions-static-semantics-computedpropertycontains).

*ClassElementList* <span class="geq">:</span> *ClassElementList* *ClassElement*

1.  Let *inList* be the result of ComputedPropertyContains for *ClassElementList* with argument *symbol.*
2.  If *inList* is **true**, return **true**.
3.  Return the result of ComputedPropertyContains for *ClassElement* with argument *symbol*.

*ClassElement* <span class="geq">:</span> *MethodDefinition*

1.  Return the result of ComputedPropertyContains for *MethodDefinition* with argument *symbol*.

*ClassElement* <span class="geq">:</span> `static` *MethodDefinition*

<span id="sec-14.5.14" class="secnum">[14.5.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-runtime-semantics-classdefinitionevaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: ClassDefinitionEvaluation
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With parameter className.

*ClassTail* <span class="geq">:</span> *ClassHeritage*<sub>opt</sub> `{` *ClassBody*<sub>opt</sub> `}`

1.  Let *lex* be the [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
2.  Let *classScope* be [NewDeclarativeEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newdeclarativeenvironment)(*lex*).
3.  Let *classScopeEnvRec* be *classScope*’s [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
4.  If *className* is not **undefined**, then
    1.  Perform *classScopeEnvRec.*CreateImmutableBinding(*className*, **true**).

5.  If *ClassHeritage*<sub>opt</sub> is not present, then
    1.  Let *protoParent* be the intrinsic object %ObjectPrototype%.
    2.  Let *constructorParent* be the intrinsic object %FunctionPrototype%.

6.  Else
    1.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *classScope*.
    2.  Let *superclass* be the result of evaluating *ClassHeritage*.
    3.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *lex*.
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*superclass*).
    5.  If *superclass* is **null**, then
        1.  Let *protoParent* be **null**.
        2.  Let *constructorParent* be the intrinsic object %FunctionPrototype%.

    6.  Else if [IsConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor)(*superclass*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    7.  Else
        1.  If *superclass* has a \[\[FunctionKind\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) whose value is `"generator"`, throw a **TypeError** exception.
        2.  Let *protoParent* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*superclass*, `"prototype"`).
        3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*protoParent*).
        4.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*protoParent*) is neither Object nor Null, throw a **TypeError** exception.
        5.  Let *constructorParent* be *superclass*.

7.  Let *proto* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(*protoParent*).
8.  If *ClassBody*<sub>opt</sub> is not present, let *constructor* be <span style="font-family:
                sans-serif">empty</span>.
9.  Else, let *constructor* be ConstructorMethod of *ClassBody*.
10. If *constructor* is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, then,
    1.  If *ClassHeritage*<sub>opt</sub> is present, then
        1.  Let *constructor* be the result of parsing the String `"constructor(... args){ super` `(...args);}"` using the syntactic grammar with the goal symbol *MethodDefinition.*

    2.  Else,
        1.  Let *constructor* be the result of parsing the String `"constructor( ){ }"` using the syntactic grammar with the goal symbol *MethodDefinition.*

11. Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *classScope*.
12. Let *constructorInfo* be the result of performing DefineMethod for *constructor* with arguments *proto* and *constructorParent* as the optional *functionPrototype* argument.
13. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *constructorInfo* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
14. Let *F* be *constructorInfo*.\[\[closure\]\]
15. If *ClassHeritage*<sub>opt</sub> is present, set *F*’s \[\[ConstructorKind\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to `"derived"`.
16. Perform [MakeConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makeconstructor)(*F*, **false**, *proto*).
17. Perform [MakeClassConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makeclassconstructor)(*F*).
18. Perform [CreateMethodProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createmethodproperty)(*proto*, `"constructor"`, *F*)*.*
19. If *ClassBody*<sub>opt</sub> is not present, let *methods* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
20. Else, let *methods* be NonConstructorMethodDefinitions of *ClassBody*.
21. For each *ClassElement* *m* in order from *methods*
    1.  If IsStatic of *m* is **false**, then
        1.  Let *status* be the result of performing PropertyDefinitionEvaluation for *m* with arguments *proto* and **false**.

    2.  Else,
        1.  Let *status* be the result of performing PropertyDefinitionEvaluation for *m* with arguments *F* and **false**.

    3.  If *status* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), then
        1.  Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *lex*.
        2.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*status*).

22. Set [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) to *lex*.
23. If *className* is not **undefined**, then
    1.  Perform *classScopeEnvRec.*InitializeBinding(*className*, *F*).

24. Return *F*.

<span id="sec-14.5.15" class="secnum">[14.5.15](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-runtime-semantics-bindingclassdeclarationevaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: BindingClassDeclarationEvaluation
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*ClassDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `class` *BindingIdentifier* *ClassTail*

1.  Let *className* be StringValue of *BindingIdentifier*.
2.  Let *value* be the result of ClassDefinitionEvaluation of *ClassTail* with argument *className.*
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*value*).
4.  Let *hasNameProperty* be [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty)(*value*, `"name"`).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*hasNameProperty*).
6.  If *hasNameProperty* is **false**, then perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*value*, *className*).
7.  Let *env* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
8.  Let *status* be [InitializeBoundName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-initializeboundname)(*className*, *value*, *env*).
9.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
10. Return *value*.

*ClassDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `class` *ClassTail*

1.  Return the result of ClassDefinitionEvaluation of *ClassTail* with argument **undefined***.*

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> <span class="prod">*ClassDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `class` *ClassTail* `only` `occurs` `as` `part` `of` `an` *ExportDeclaration*</span> <span style="font-family: sans-serif">and the setting of a name property and establishing its binding are handled as part of the evaluation action for that production. See [15.2.3.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-exports-runtime-semantics-evaluation).</span>

<span id="sec-14.5.16" class="secnum">[14.5.16](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-class-definitions-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*ClassDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `class` *BindingIdentifier* *ClassTail*

1.  Let *status* be the result of BindingClassDeclarationEvaluation of this *ClassDeclaration.*
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
3.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>).

*NOTE ClassDeclaration* **: `class`** *ClassTail only occurs as part of an ExportDeclaration* <span style="font-family: sans-serif">and is never directly evaluated.</span>

*ClassExpression* <span class="geq">:</span> `class` *BindingIdentifier*<sub>opt</sub> *ClassTail*

1.  If *BindingIdentifier*<sub>opt</sub> is not present, let *className* be **undefined**.
2.  Else, let *className* be StringValue of *BindingIdentifier*.
3.  Let *value* be the result of ClassDefinitionEvaluation of *ClassTail* with argument *className*.
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*value*).
5.  If *className* is not **undefined**, then
    1.  Let *hasNameProperty* be [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty)(*value*, `"name"`).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*hasNameProperty*).
    3.  If *hasNameProperty* is **false**, then
        1.  Perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*value*, *className*).

6.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(*value*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> If the class definition included a `"name"` static method then that method is not over-written with a `"name"` data property for the class name.

<span id="sec-14.6" class="secnum">[14.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tail-position-calls "link to this section")</span> Tail Position Calls
==========================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-14.6.1" class="secnum">[14.6.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isintailposition "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: IsInTailPosition(nonterminal)
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IsInTailPosition with argument nonterminal performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *nonterminal* is a parsed grammar production.
2.  If the source code matching *nonterminal* is not [strict code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code), return **false.**
3.  If *nonterminal* is not contained within a *FunctionBody* or *ConciseBody*, return **false**.
4.  Let *body* be the *FunctionBody* or *ConciseBody* that most closely contains *nonterminal*.
5.  If *body* is the *FunctionBody* of a *GeneratorBody*, return **false**.
6.  Return the result of HasProductionInTailPosition of *body* with argument *nonterminal*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Tail Position calls are only defined in [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code) because of a common non-standard language extension ([see 9.2.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-addrestrictedfunctionproperties)) that enables observation of the chain of caller contexts.

<span id="sec-14.6.2" class="secnum">[14.6.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-static-semantics-hasproductionintailposition "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: HasProductionInTailPosition
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With parameter nonterminal.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> *nonterminal* is a parsed grammar production that represent a specific range of source text. When the following algorithms compare *nonterminal* to other grammar symbols they are testing whether the same source text was matched by both symbols.

<span id="sec-14.6.2.1" class="secnum">[14.6.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-statement-rules "link to this section")</span> Statement Rules
==========================================================================================================================================================================

*ConciseBody* <span class="geq">:</span> *AssignmentExpression*

1.  Return HasProductionInTailPosition of *AssignmentExpression* with argument *nonterminal*.

*StatementList* <span class="geq">:</span> *StatementList* *StatementListItem*

1.  Let *has* be HasProductionInTailPosition of *StatementList* with argument *nonterminal*.
2.  If *has* is **true**, return **true**.
3.  Return HasProductionInTailPosition of *StatementListItem* with argument *nonterminal*.

<span class="prod">*FunctionStatementList* <span class="geq">:</span> <span class="grhsannot">\[empty\]</span></span>

<span class="prod">*StatementListItem* <span class="geq">:</span> *Declaration*</span>

*Statement* <span class="geq">:</span>

*VariableStatement*

*EmptyStatement*

*ExpressionStatement*

*ContinueStatement*

*BreakStatement*

*ThrowStatement*

*DebuggerStatement*

*Block* `:` `{` `}`

*ReturnStatement* `:` `return` `;`

*LabelledItem* `:` *FunctionDeclaration*

*IterationStatement* <span class="geq">:</span>

`for` `(` *LeftHandSideExpression* `in` *Expression* `)` *Statement*

`for` `(` `var` *ForBinding* `in` *Expression* `)` *Statement*

`for` `(` *ForDeclaration* `in` *Expression* `)` *Statement*

<span id="sec-14.6.3" class="secnum">[14.6.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-preparefortailcall "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: PrepareForTailCall ( )
===================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation PrepareForTailCall performs the following steps:

1.  Let *leafContext* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
2.  [Suspend](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) *leafContext*.
3.  Pop *leafContext* from [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts). The [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) now on the top of the stack becomes [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *leafContext* has no further use. It will never be activated as [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).

A tail position call must either release any transient internal resources associated with the currently executing function [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) before invoking the target function or reuse those resources in support of the target function.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> For example, a tail position call should only grow an implementation’s activation record stack by the amount that the size of the target function’s activation record exceeds the size of the calling function’s activation record. If the target function’s activation record is smaller, then the total size of the stack should decrease.

*ScriptBody* <span class="geq">:</span> *StatementList*

-   It is a Syntax Error if the LexicallyDeclaredNames of *StatementList* contains any duplicate entries.

-   It is a Syntax Error if any element of the <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">LexicallyDeclaredNames</span> of *StatementList* also occurs in the <span style="font-family: Times New
              Roman">VarDeclaredNames</span> of *StatementList*.

-   It is a Syntax Error if *StatementList* <span style="font-family: Times New
              Roman">Contains</span> `super` unless the source code containing `super` is eval code that is being processed by a direct `eval` that is contained in function code that is not the function code of an *ArrowFunction*.

-   It is a Syntax Error if *StatementList* <span style="font-family: Times New
              Roman">Contains</span> *NewTarget* unless the source code containing *NewTarget* is eval code that is being processed by a direct `eval` that is contained in function code that is not the function code of an *ArrowFunction*.

-   It is a Syntax Error if ContainsDuplicateLabels of *StatementList* <span style="font-family:
              Times New Roman">with argument «</span> <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">» is **true**.</span>

-   It is a Syntax Error if ContainsUndefinedBreakTarget of *StatementList* <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">with argument «</span> <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">» is **true**.</span>

-   It is a Syntax Error if ContainsUndefinedContinueTarget of <span style="font-family: Times New
              Roman">*StatementList* with arguments « » and « » is **true**.</span>

<span id="sec-15.1.7" class="secnum">[15.1.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-runtime-semantics-scriptevaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: ScriptEvaluation
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================

With argument realm.

*Script* <span class="geq">:</span> *ScriptBody*<sub>opt</sub>

1.  If *ScriptBody* is not present, return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>).
2.  Let *globalEnv* be *realm*.\[\[globalEnv\]\].
3.  Let *scriptCxt* be a new [ECMAScript code execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
4.  Set the Function of *scriptCxt* to **null**.
5.  Set the [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) of *scriptCxt* to *realm*.
6.  Set the [VariableEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of *scriptCxt* to *globalEnv*.
7.  Set the [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of *scriptCxt* to *globalEnv*.
8.  [Suspend](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) [the currently running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
9.  Push *scriptCxt* on to [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts); *scriptCxt* is now [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
10. Let *result* be [GlobalDeclarationInstantiation](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-globaldeclarationinstantiation)(*ScriptBody*, *globalEnv*).
11. If *result*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">normal</span>, then
    1.  Let *result* be the result of evaluating *ScriptBody*.

12. If *result*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">normal</span> and *result*.\[\[value\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, then
    1.  Let *result* be [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).

13. [Suspend](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) *scriptCxt* and remove it from [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
14. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) is not empty.
15. Resume the context that is now on the top of [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) as [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
16. Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*result*).

<span id="sec-15.1.8" class="secnum">[15.1.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-globaldeclarationinstantiation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: GlobalDeclarationInstantiation (script, env)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> When an [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) is established for evaluating scripts, declarations are instantiated in the current global environment. Each global binding declared in the code is instantiated.

GlobalDeclarationInstantiation is performed as follows using arguments script and env. script is the *ScriptBody* for which the [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) is being established. env is the global [lexical environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) in which bindings are to be created.

1.  Let *envRec* be *env*’s [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *envRec* is a global [Environment Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-environment-records).
3.  Let *lexNames* be the LexicallyDeclaredNames of *script*.
4.  Let *varNames* be the VarDeclaredNames of *script*.
5.  For each *name* in *lexNames*, do
    1.  If *envRec.*[HasVarDeclaration](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasvardeclaration)(*name*) is **true**, throw a **SyntaxError** exception.
    2.  If *envRec.*[HasLexicalDeclaration](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-haslexicaldeclaration)(*name*) is **true**, throw a **SyntaxError** exception.
    3.  If *envRec.*[HasRestrictedGlobalProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasrestrictedglobalproperty)(*name*) is **true**, throw a **SyntaxError** exception.

6.  For each *name* in *varNames*, do
    1.  If *envRec.*[HasLexicalDeclaration](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-haslexicaldeclaration)(*name*) is **true**, throw a **SyntaxError** exception.

7.  Let *varDeclarations* be the VarScopedDeclarations of *script*.
8.  Let *functionsToInitialize* be an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
9.  Let *declaredFunctionNames* be an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
10. For each *d* in *varDeclarations*, in reverse list order do
    1.  If *d* is neither a *VariableDeclaration* or a *ForBinding*, then
        1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *d* is either a *FunctionDeclaration* or a *GeneratorDeclaration*.
        2.  NOTE If there are multiple <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*FunctionDeclarations*</span> for the same name, the last declaration is used.
        3.  Let *fn* be the sole element of the BoundNames of *d.*
        4.  If *fn* is not an element of *declaredFunctionNames*, then
            1.  Let *fnDefinable* be *envRec.*[CanDeclareGlobalFunction](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-candeclareglobalfunction)(*fn*).
            2.  If *fnDefinable* is **false**, throw **TypeError** exception.
            3.  Append *fn* to *declaredFunctionNames*.
            4.  Insert *d* as the first element of *functionsToInitialize*.

11. Let *declaredVarNames* be an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
12. For each *d* in *varDeclarations*, do
    1.  If *d* is a *VariableDeclaration* or a *ForBinding*, then
        1.  For each String *vn* in the BoundNames of *d*, do
            1.  If *vn* is not an element of *declaredFunctionNames*, then
                1.  Let *vnDefinable* be *envRec.*[CanDeclareGlobalVar](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-candeclareglobalvar)(*vn*).
                2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*vnDefinable*).
                3.  If *vnDefinable* is **false**, throw **TypeError** exception.
                4.  If *vn* is not an element of *declaredVarNames*, then
                    1.  Append *vn* to *declaredVarNames*.

13. NOTE: No abnormal terminations occur after this algorithm step if the global object is an ordinary object. However, if the global object is a Proxy exotic object it may exhibit behaviours that cause abnormal terminations in some of the following steps.
14. Let *lexDeclarations* be the LexicallyScopedDeclarations of *script*.
15. For each element *d* in *lexDeclarations* do
    1.  NOTE Lexically declared names are only instantiated here but not initialized.
    2.  For each element *dn* of the BoundNames of *d* do
        1.  If IsConstantDeclaration of *d* is **true**, then
            1.  Let *status* be *envRec*.CreateImmutableBinding(*dn*, **true**).

        2.  Else,
            1.  Let *status* be *envRec*.CreateMutableBinding(*dn*, **false**).

        3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).

16. For each production *f* in *functionsToInitialize*, do
    1.  Let *fn* be the sole element of the BoundNames of *f.*
    2.  Let *fo* be the result of performing InstantiateFunctionObject for *f* with argument *env*.
    3.  Let *status* be *envRec*.[CreateGlobalFunctionBinding](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createglobalfunctionbinding)(*fn*, *fo*, **false**).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).

17. For each String *vn* in *declaredVarNames*, in list order do
    1.  Let *status* be *envRec.*[CreateGlobalVarBinding](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createglobalvarbinding)(*vn*, **false**).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).

18. Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>)

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Early errors specified in [15.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-scripts-static-semantics-early-errors) prevent name conflicts between function/var declarations and let/const/class declarations as well as redeclaration of let/const/class bindings for declaration contained within a single *Script*. However, such conflicts and redeclarations that span more than one *Script* are detected as runtime errors during GlobalDeclarationInstantiation. If any such errors are detected, no bindings are instantiated for the script. However, if the global object is defined using Proxy exotic objects then the runtime tests for conflicting declarations may be unreliable resulting in an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) and some global declarations not being instantiated. If this occurs, the code for the *Script* is not evaluated.

Unlike explicit var or function declarations, properties that are directly created on the global object result in global bindings that may be shadowed by let/const/class declarations.

<span id="sec-15.1.9" class="secnum">[15.1.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-scriptevaluationjob "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: ScriptEvaluationJob ( <span style="font-family: sans-serif">sourceText</span> )
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The job ScriptEvaluationJob with parameter sourceText parses, validates, and evaluates sourceText as a *Script*.

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *sourceText* is an ECMAScript source text (see [clause 10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-source-code)).
2.  Parse *sourceText* using *Script* as the goal symbol and analyze the parse result for any Early Error conditions. If the parse was successful and no early errors were found, let *code* be the resulting parse tree. Otherwise, let *code* be an indication of one or more parsing errors and/or early errors. Parsing and early error detection may be interweaved in an implementation dependent manner. If more than one parse or early error is present, the number and ordering of reported errors is implementation dependent but at least one error must be reported.
3.  If *code* is an error indication, then
    1.  Report or log the error(s) in an implementation dependent manner.
    2.  Let *status* be [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).

4.  Else,
    1.  Let *realm* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms).
    2.  Let *status* be the result of ScriptEvaluation of *code* with argument *realm*.

5.  NextJob [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*status*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> An implementation may parse a *sourceText* as a *Script* and analyze it for Early Error conditions prior to the execution of the ScriptEvaluationJob for that *sourceText*. However, the reporting of any errors must be deferred until the ScriptEvaluationJob is actually executed.

<span id="sec-15.2.1" class="secnum">[15.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics "link to this section")</span> Module Semantics
========================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-15.2.1.1" class="secnum">[15.2.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-early-errors "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Early Errors
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*ModuleBody* <span class="geq">:</span> *ModuleItemList*

-   It is a Syntax Error if the LexicallyDeclaredNames of *ModuleItemList* contains any duplicate entries.

-   It is a Syntax Error if any element of the LexicallyDeclaredNames of *ModuleItemList* also occurs in the VarDeclaredNames of *ModuleItemList*.

-   It is a Syntax Error if the ExportedNames of *ModuleItemList* contains any duplicate entries.

-   It is a Syntax Error if any element of the ExportedBindings of *ModuleItemList* does not also occur in either the VarDeclaredNames of ModuleItemList, or the LexicallyDeclaredNames of *ModuleItemList*.

-   It is a Syntax Error if *ModuleItemList* Contains `super`.

-   It is a Syntax Error if <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*ModuleItemList* Contains *NewTarget*</span>

-   It is a Syntax Error if ContainsDuplicateLabels of *ModuleItemList* <span style="font-family:
                Times New Roman">with argument «</span> <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">» is **true**.</span>

-   It is a Syntax Error if ContainsUndefinedBreakTarget of *ModuleItemList* <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">with argument «</span> <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">» is **true**.</span>

-   It is a Syntax Error if ContainsUndefinedContinueTarget of *ModuleItemList* <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">with arguments « » and « » is **true**.</span>

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The duplicate ExportedNames rule implies that multiple `export default` *ExportDeclaration* items within a *ModuleBody* is a Syntax Error. Additional error conditions relating to conflicting or duplicate declarations are checked during module linking prior to evaluation of a *Module*. If any such errors are detected the *Module* is not evaluated.

<span id="sec-15.2.1.2" class="secnum">[15.2.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: ContainsDuplicateLabels
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With argument labelSet.

See also: [13.0.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-statement-semantics-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-block-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-if-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.6.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-do-while-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.6.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-while-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.6.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.6.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.10.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-with-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.11.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-switch-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.12.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-statements-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels), [13.14.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-try-statement-static-semantics-containsduplicatelabels).

*ExportDeclaration*

<span id="sec-15.2.1.9" class="secnum">[15.2.1.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-importedlocalnames "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: ImportedLocalNames ( importEntries )
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation ImportedLocalNames with argument importEntries creates a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of all of the local name bindings defined by a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of ImportEntry Records (see [Table 39](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-39)). ImportedLocalNames performs the following steps:

1.  Let *localNames* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
2.  For each ImportEntry Record *i* in *importEntries*, do
    1.  Append *i*.\[\[LocalName\]\] to *localNames*.

3.  Return *localNames*.

<span id="sec-15.2.1.10" class="secnum">[15.2.1.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-modulerequests "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: ModuleRequests
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

See also: [15.2.2.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-imports-static-semantics-modulerequests),[15.2.3.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-exports-static-semantics-modulerequests).

*Module* <span class="geq">:</span> <span class="grhsannot">\[empty\]</span>

1.  Return a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).

*ModuleItemList* <span class="geq">:</span> *ModuleItem*

1.  Return ModuleRequests of *ModuleItem*.

*ModuleItemList* <span class="geq">:</span> *ModuleItemList* *ModuleItem*

1.  Let *moduleNames* be ModuleRequests of *ModuleItemList*.
2.  Let *additionalNames* be ModuleRequests of *ModuleItem.*
3.  Append to *moduleNames* each element of *additionalNames* that is not already an element of *moduleNames.*
4.  Return *moduleNames*.

*ModuleItem* <span class="geq">:</span> *StatementListItem*

1.  Return a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).

<span id="sec-15.2.1.11" class="secnum">[15.2.1.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-lexicallydeclarednames "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: LexicallyDeclaredNames
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

See also: [13.1.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-block-static-semantics-lexicallydeclarednames), [13.11.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-switch-statement-static-semantics-lexicallydeclarednames), [13.12.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-labelled-statements-static-semantics-lexicallydeclarednames), [14.1.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions-static-semantics-lexicallydeclarednames), [14.2.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrow-function-definitions-static-semantics-lexicallydeclarednames), [15.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-scripts-static-semantics-lexicallydeclarednames).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The LexicallyDeclaredNames of a *Module* includes the names of all of its imported bindings.

*ModuleItemList* <span class="geq">:</span> *ModuleItemList* *ModuleItem*

1.  Let *names* be LexicallyDeclaredNames of *ModuleItemList*.
2.  Append to *names* the elements of the LexicallyDeclaredNames of *ModuleItem.*
3.  Return *names*.

*ModuleItem* <span class="geq">:</span> *ImportDeclaration*

1.  Return the BoundNames of *ImportDeclaration*.

*ModuleItem* <span class="geq">:</span> *ExportDeclaration*

1.  If *ExportDeclaration* is `export` *VariableStatement*<span style="font-family:
                  sans-serif">,</span> return a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
2.  Return the BoundNames of *ExportDeclaration*.

*ModuleItem* <span class="geq">:</span> *StatementListItem*

1.  Return LexicallyDeclaredNames of *StatementListItem*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> At the top level of a *Module*, function declarations are treated like lexical declarations rather than like var declarations.

<span id="sec-15.2.1.15" class="secnum">[15.2.1.15](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records "link to this section")</span> Abstract Module Records
============================================================================================================================================================================================

A Module Record encapsulates structural information about the imports and exports of a single module. This information is used to link the imports and exports of sets of connected modules. A Module Record includes four fields that are only used when evaluating a module.

For specification purposes Module Record values are values of the Record specification type and can be thought of as existing in a simple object-oriented hierarchy where Module Record is an abstract class with concrete subclasses. This specification only defines a single Module Record concrete subclass name Source Text Module Record. Other specifications and implementations may define additional Module Record subclass corresponding to alternative module definition facilities that they defined.

Module Record defines the fields listed in [Table 36](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-36). All Module Definition subclasses include at least those fields. Module Record also defines the abstract method list in [Table 37](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-37). All Module definition subclasses must provide concrete implementations of these abstract methods.

<span id="table-36">Table 36</span> — Module Record Fields

| Field Name          | Value Type                                                                                                                                   | Meaning                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|---------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| \[\[Realm\]\]       | [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) Record | <span class="value">undefined</span>                 | The [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) within which this module was created. <span class="value">undefined</span> if not yet assigned.                                                                                                                                             |
| \[\[Environment\]\] | [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) | <span class="value">undefined</span> | The [Lexical Environment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments) containing the top level bindings for this module. This field is set when the module is instantiated.                                                                                                                |
| \[\[Namespace\]\]   | Object | <span class="value">undefined</span>                                                                                                | The Module Namespace Object ([26.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-namespace-objects)) if one has been created for this module. Otherwise <span class="value">undefined</span>.                                                                                                              |
| \[\[Evaluated\]\]   | Boolean                                                                                                                                      | Initially <span class="value">false</span>, <span class="value">true</span> if evaluation of this module has started. Remains <span class="value">true</span> when evaluation completes, even if it is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type). |

<span id="table-37">Table 37</span> — Abstract Methods of Module Records
