<span id="sec-15.2.1.16" class="secnum">[15.2.1.16](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-source-text-module-records "link to this section")</span> Source Text Module Records
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

A Source Text [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) is used to represent information about a module that was defined from ECMAScript source text (10) that was parsed using the goal symbol *Module*. Its fields contain digested information about the names that are imported by the module and its concrete methods use this digest to link, instantiate, and evaluate the module.

In addition to the fields, defined in [Table 36](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-36), Source Test Module Records have the additional fields listed in [Table 38](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-38). Each of these fields initially has the value <span class="value">undefined</span>.

<span id="table-38">Table 38</span> — Additional Fields of Source Text Module Records
| Field Name                    | Value Type                                                                                                                  | Meaning                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|-------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| \[\[ECMAScriptCode\]\]        | a parse result                                                                                                              | The result of parsing the source text of this module using *Module* as the goal symbol.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| \[\[RequestedModules\]\]      | [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of String              | A [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of all the *ModuleSpecifier* strings used by the module represented by this record to request the importation of a module. The [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) is source code occurrence ordered. |
| \[\[ImportEntries\]\]         | [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of ImportEntry Records | A [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of ImportEntry records derived from the code of this module.                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| \[\[LocalExportEntries\]\]    | [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of ExportEntry Records | A [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of ExportEntry records derived from the code of this module that correspond to declarations that occur within the module.                                                                                                                                              |
| \[\[IndirectExportEntries\]\] | [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of ExportEntry Records | A [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of ExportEntry records derived from the code of this module that correspond to reexported imports that occur within the module.                                                                                                                                        |
| \[\[StarExportEntries\]\]     | [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of ExportEntry Records | A [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of ExportEntry records derived from the code of this module that correspond to export \* declarations that occur within the module.                                                                                                                                    |

An ImportEntry Record is a Record that digests information about a single declarative import. Each ImportEntry Record has the fields defined in [Table 39](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-39):

<span id="table-39">Table 39</span> — ImportEntry Record Fields
| Field Name            | Value Type | Meaning                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|-----------------------|------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| \[\[ModuleRequest\]\] | String     | String value of the *ModuleSpecifier* of the *ImportDeclaration*.                                                                                                                                      |
| \[\[ImportName\]\]    | String     | The name under which the desired binding is exported by the module identified by \[\[ModuleRequest\]\]. The value `"*"` indicates that the import request is for the target module’s namespace object. |
| \[\[LocalName\]\]     | String     | The name that is used to locally access the imported value from within the importing module.                                                                                                           |

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> [Table 40](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-40) gives examples of ImportEntry records fields used to represent the syntactic import forms:

<span id="table-40">Table 40</span> (Informative) — Import Forms Mappings to ImportEntry Records
***Import Statement Form***

**\[\[ModuleRequest\]\]**

**\[\[ImportName\]\]**

**\[\[LocalName\]\]**

`import v from "mod";`

`"mod"`

`"v"`

`"mod"`

`"ns"`

`"mod"`

An ImportEntry Record is not created.

An ExportEntry Record is a Record that digests information about a single declarative export. Each ExportEntry Record has the fields defined in [Table 41](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-41):

<span id="table-41">Table 41</span> — ExportEntry Record Fields
| Field Name            | <span style="background-color: #C0C0C0">***Value***</span> <span style="background-color: #C0C0C0">***Type***</span> | Meaning                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|-----------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| \[\[ExportName\]\]    | String                                                                                                               | The name used to export this binding by this module.                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| \[\[ModuleRequest\]\] | String | null                                                                                                        | The String value of the *ModuleSpecifier* of the *ExportDeclaration*. <span class="value">null</span> if the *ExportDeclaration* does not have a *ModuleSpecifier*.                                                                                                         |
| \[\[ImportName\]\]    | String | null                                                                                                        | The name under which the desired binding is exported by the module identified by \[\[ModuleRequest\]\]. <span class="value">null</span> if the *ExportDeclaration* does not have a *ModuleSpecifier*. `"*"` indicates that the export request is for all exported bindings. |
| \[\[LocalName\]\]     | String | null                                                                                                        | The name that is used to locally access the exported value from within the importing module. <span class="value">null</span> if the exported value is not locally accessible from within the module.                                                                        |

</tr>
<tr class="even">
<td align="left"><p><code>export {v as x} from &quot;mod&quot;;</code></p></td>
<td align="left"><p><code>&quot;x&quot;</code></p></td>
<td align="left"><p><code>&quot;mod&quot;</code></p></td>
<td align="left"><p><code>&quot;v&quot;</code></p></td>
<td align="left"><p><strong>null</strong></p></td>
</tr>
<tr class="odd">
<td align="left"><p><code>export * from &quot;mod&quot;;</code></p></td>
<td align="left"><p><strong>null</strong></p></td>
<td align="left"><p><code>&quot;mod&quot;</code></p></td>
<td align="left"><p><code>&quot;*&quot;</code></p></td>
<td align="left"><p><strong>null</strong></p></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>

The following definitions specify the required concrete methods and other abstract operations for Source Text Module Records

<span id="sec-15.2.1.16.1" class="secnum">[15.2.1.16.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-parsemodule "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: ParseModule ( sourceText )
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation ParseModule with argument sourceText creates a Source Text [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) based upon the result of parsing sourceText as a Module. ParseModule performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *sourceText* is an ECMAScript source text (see [clause 10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-source-code)).
2.  Parse *sourceText* using *Module* as the goal symbol and analyze the parse result for any Early Error conditions. If the parse was successful and no early errors were found, let *body* be the resulting parse tree. Otherwise, let *body* be an indication of one or more parsing errors and/or early errors. Parsing and early error detection may be interweaved in an implementation dependent manner. If more than one parse or early error is present, the number and ordering of reported errors is implementation dependent but at least one error must be reported.
3.  If *body* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) or error indication, then
    1.  Throw a **SyntaxError** exception.

4.  Let *requestedModules* be the ModuleRequests of *body*.
5.  Let *importEntries* be ImportEntries of *body*.
6.  Let *importedBoundNames* be [ImportedLocalNames](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-importedlocalnames)(*importEntries*).
7.  Let *indirectExportEntries* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
8.  Let *localExportEntries* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
9.  Let *starExportEntries* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
10. Let *exportEntries* be ExportEntries of *body*.
11. For each record *ee* in *exportEntries*, do
    1.  If *ee*.\[\[ModuleRequest\]\] is **null**, then
        1.  If *ee*.\[\[LocalName\]\] is not an element of *importedBoundNames*, then
            1.  Append *ee* to *localExportEntries*.

        2.  Else
            1.  Let *ie* be ImportEntryFor(*ee*.\[\[LocalName\]\]).
            2.  If *ie*.\[\[ImportName\]\] is `"*"`, then
                1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): this is a re-export of an imported module namespace object.
                2.  Append *ee* to *localExportEntries*.

            3.  Else, this is a re-export of a single name
                1.  Append to *indirectExportEntries* the Record {\[\[ModuleRequest\]\]: *ie*.\[\[ModuleRequest\]\], \[\[ImportName\]\]: *ie*. \[\[ImportName\]\], \[\[LocalName\]\]: **null**, \[\[ExportName\]\]: *ee*.\[\[ExportName }.

    2.  Else, if *ee*.\[\[ImportName\]\] is `"*"`, then
        1.  Append *ee* to *starExportEntries*.

    3.  Else,
        1.  Append *ee* to *indirectExportEntries*.

12. Return Source Text [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) {\[\[Realm\]\]: **undefined**, \[\[Environment\]\]: **undefined**, \[\[Namespace\]\]: **undefined**, \[\[Evaluated\]\]: **false**, \[\[ECMAScriptCode\]\]: *body*, \[\[RequestedModules\]\]: *requestedModules*, \[\[ImportEntries\]\]: *importEntries*, \[\[LocalExportEntries\]\]: *localExportEntries*, \[\[StarExportEntries\]\]: *starExportEntries*, \[\[IndirectExportEntries\]\]: *indirectExportEntries*}.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> An implementation may parse module source text and analyze it for Early Error conditions prior to the evaluation of ParseModule for that module source text. However, the reporting of any errors must be deferred until the point where this specification actually performs ParseModule upon that source text.

<span id="sec-15.2.1.16.2" class="secnum">[15.2.1.16.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getexportednames "link to this section")</span> GetExportedNames( exportStarSet ) Concrete Method
===================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The GetExportedNames concrete method of a Source Text [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) with argument exportStarSet performs the following steps:

1.  Let *module* be this Source Text [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records).
2.  If *exportStarSet* contains *module*, then
    1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): We’ve reached the starting point of an import \* circularity.
    2.  Return a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).

3.  Append *module* to *exportStarSet*.
4.  Let *exportedNames* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
5.  For each ExportEntry Record *e* in *module*.\[\[LocalExportEntries\]\], do
    1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *module* provides the direct binding for this export.
    2.  Append *e*.\[\[ExportName\]\] to *exportedNames*.

6.  For each ExportEntry Record *e* in *module*.\[\[IndirectExportEntries\]\], do
    1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *module* imports a specific binding for this export.
    2.  Append *e*.\[\[ExportName\]\] to *exportedNames*.

7.  For each ExportEntry Record *e* in *module*.\[\[StarExportEntries\]\], do
    1.  Let *requestedModule* be [HostResolveImportedModule](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hostresolveimportedmodule)(*module*, *e*.\[\[ModuleRequest\]\]).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*requestedModule*).
    3.  Let *starNames* be *requestedModule.*GetExportedNames(*exportStarSet*).
    4.  For each element *n* of *starNames*, do
        1.  If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*n*, `"default"`) is **false**, then
            1.  If *n* is not an element of *exportedNames*, then
                1.  Append *n* to *exportedNames*.

8.  Return *exportedNames*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> GetExportedNames does not filter out or throw an exception for names that have ambiguous star export bindings.

<span id="sec-15.2.1.16.3" class="secnum">[15.2.1.16.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-resolveexport "link to this section")</span> ResolveExport( exportName, resolveSet, exportStarSet ) Concrete Method
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The ResolveExport concrete method of a Source Text [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) with arguments exportName, resolveSet, and exportStarSet performs the following steps:

1.  Let *module* be this Source Text [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records).
2.  For each Record {\[\[module\]\], \[\[exportName\]\]} *r* in *resolveSet*, do:
    1.  If *module* and *r*.\[\[module\]\] are the same [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) and [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*exportName*, *r*.\[\[exportName\]\]) is **true**, then
        1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): this is a circular import request.
        2.  Return **null**.

3.  Append the Record {\[\[module\]\]: *module*, \[\[exportName\]\]: *exportName*} to *resolveSet*.
4.  For each ExportEntry Record *e* in *module*.\[\[LocalExportEntries\]\], do
    1.  If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*exportName*, *e*.\[\[ExportName\]\]) is **true**, then
        1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *module* provides the direct binding for this export.
        2.  Return Record{\[\[module\]\]: *module,* \[\[bindingName\]\]: *e*.\[\[LocalName\]\]}.

5.  For each ExportEntry Record *e* in *module*.\[\[IndirectExportEntries\]\], do
    1.  If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*exportName*, *e*.\[\[ExportName\]\]) is **true**, then
        1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *module* imports a specific binding for this export.
        2.  Let *importedModule* be [HostResolveImportedModule](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hostresolveimportedmodule)(*module*, *e*.\[\[ModuleRequest\]\]).
        3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*importedModule*).
        4.  Let *indirectResolution* be *importedModule.*ResolveExport(*e*.\[\[ImportName\]\], *resolveSet*, *exportStarSet*).
        5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*indirectResolution*).
        6.  If *indirectResolution* is not **null**, return *indirectResolution*.

6.  If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*exportName*, `"default"`) is **true**, then
    1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): A `default` export was not explicitly defined by this module.
    2.  Throw a **SyntaxError** exception.
    3.  NOTE A `default` export cannot be provided by an `export *`.

7.  If *exportStarSet* contains *module*, then return **null**.
8.  Append *module* to *exportStarSet*.
9.  Let *starResolution* be **null**.
10. For each ExportEntry Record *e* in *module*.\[\[StarExportEntries\]\], do
    1.  Let *importedModule* be [HostResolveImportedModule](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hostresolveimportedmodule)(*module*, *e*.\[\[ModuleRequest\]\]).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*importedModule*).
    3.  Let *resolution* be *importedModule*.ResolveExport(*exportName*, *resolveSet*, *exportStarSet*).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*resolution*).
    5.  If *resolution* is `"ambiguous"`, return `"ambiguous"`.
    6.  If *resolution* is not **null**, then
        1.  If *starResolution* is **null**, let *starResolution* be *resolution*.
        2.  Else
            1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): there is more than one \* import that includes the requested name.
            2.  If *resolution*.\[\[module\]\] and *starResolution*.\[\[module\]\] are not the same [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) or [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*resolution.*\[\[exportName\]\], *starResolution*.\[\[exportName\]\]) is **false**, return `"ambiguous"`.

11. Return *starResolution*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> ResolveExport attempts to resolve an imported binding to the actual defining module and local binding name. The defining module may be the module represented by the [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) this method was invoked on or some other module that is imported by that module. The parameter *resolveSet* is use to detect unresolved circular import/export paths. If a pair consisting of <span style="font-family: sans-serif">specific module record</span> and *exportName* is reached that is already in *resolveSet*, an import circularity has been encountered. Before recursively calling ResolveExport, a pair consisting of *module* and *exportName* is added to *resolveSet*.

If a defining module is found a Record {\[\[module\]\]*,* \[\[bindingName\]\]} is returned. This record identifies the resolved binding of the originally requested export. If no definition was found or the request is found to be circular, **null** is returned. If the request is found to be ambiguous, the string `"ambiguous"` is returned.

<span id="sec-15.2.1.16.4" class="secnum">[15.2.1.16.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-moduledeclarationinstantiation "link to this section")</span> ModuleDeclarationInstantiation( ) Concrete Method
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The ModuleDeclarationInstantiation concrete method of a Source Text [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) performs the following steps:

1.  Let *module* be this Source Text [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records).
2.  Let *realm* be *module*.\[\[Realm\]\].
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *realm* is not **undefined**.
4.  Let *code* be *module*.\[\[ECMAScriptCode\]\].
5.  If *module*.\[\[Environment\]\] is not **undefined**, return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>).
6.  Let *env* be [NewModuleEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-newmoduleenvironment)(*realm*.\[\[globalEnv\]\]).
7.  Set *module*.\[\[Environment\]\] to *env*.
8.  For each String *required* that is an element of *module*.\[\[RequestedModules\]\] do,
    1.  NOTE: Before instantiating a module, all of the modules it requested must be available. An implementation may perform this test at any time prior to this point,
    2.  Let *requiredModule* be [HostResolveImportedModule](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hostresolveimportedmodule)(*module*, *required*).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*requiredModule*).
    4.  Let *status* be *requiredModule*.ModuleDeclarationInstantiation().
    5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).

9.  For each ExportEntry Record *e* in *module*.\[\[IndirectExportEntries\]\], do
    1.  Let *resolution* be *module*.[ResolveExport](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-resolveexport)(*e*.\[\[ExportName\]\], «‍ », «‍ »).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*resolution*).
    3.  If *resolution* is **null** or *resolution* is `"ambiguous"`, throw a **SyntaxError** exception.

10. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): all named exports from *module* are resolvable.
11. Let *envRec* be *env*’s [EnvironmentRecord](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lexical-environments).
12. For each ImportEntry Record *in* in *module*.\[\[ImportEntries\]\], do
    1.  Let *importedModule* be [HostResolveImportedModule](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hostresolveimportedmodule)(*module*, *in*.\[\[ModuleRequest\]\]).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*importedModule*).
    3.  If *in*.\[\[ImportName\]\] is `"*"`, then
        1.  Let *namespace* be [GetModuleNamespace](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getmodulenamespace)(*importedModule*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*module*).
        3.  Let *status* be *envRec*.CreateImmutableBinding(*in*.\[\[LocalName\]\], **true**).
        4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
        5.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *envRec*.InitializeBinding(*in*.\[\[LocalName\]\], *namespace*).

    4.  else,
        1.  Let *resolution* be *importedModule*.[ResolveExport](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-resolveexport)(*in*.\[\[ImportName\]\], « », «‍ »).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*resolution*).
        3.  If *resolution* is **null** or *resolution* is `"ambiguous"`, throw a **SyntaxError** exception.
        4.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *envRec*.[CreateImportBinding](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createimportbinding)(*in*.\[\[LocalName\]\], *resolution*.\[\[module\]\], *resolution*.\[\[bindingName\]\]).

13. Let *varDeclarations* be the VarScopedDeclarations of *code*.
14. For each element *d* in *varDeclarations* do
    1.  For each element *dn* of the BoundNames of *d* do
        1.  Let *status* be *envRec*.CreateMutableBinding(*dn*, **false**).
        2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
        3.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *envRec*.InitializeBinding(*dn*, **undefined**).

15. Let *lexDeclarations* be the LexicallyScopedDeclarations of *code*.
16. For each element *d* in *lexDeclarations* do
    1.  For each element *dn* of the BoundNames of *d* do
        1.  If IsConstantDeclaration of *d* is **true**, then
            1.  Let *status* be *envRec*.CreateImmutableBinding(*dn*, **true**).

        2.  Else,
            1.  Let *status* be *envRec*.CreateMutableBinding(*dn*, **false**).

        3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
        4.  If *d* is a *GeneratorDeclaration* production or a *FunctionDeclaration* production, then
            1.  Let *fo* be the result of performing InstantiateFunctionObject for *d* with argument *env*.
            2.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *envRec*.InitializeBinding(*dn*, *fo*).

17. Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family:
                    sans-serif">empty</span>).

<span id="sec-15.2.1.16.5" class="secnum">[15.2.1.16.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-moduleevaluation "link to this section")</span> ModuleEvaluation() Concrete Method
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

The ModuleEvaluation concrete method of a Source Text [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) performs the following steps:

1.  Let *module* be this Source Text [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records).
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [ModuleDeclarationInstantiation](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-moduledeclarationinstantiation) has already been invoked on *module* and successfully completed.
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *module*.\[\[Realm\]\] is not **undefined**.
4.  If *module.*\[\[Evaluated\]\] is **true**, return **undefined**.
5.  Set *module.*\[\[Evaluated\]\] to **true**.
6.  For each String *required* that is an element of *module*.\[\[RequestedModules\]\] do,
    1.  Let *requiredModule* be [HostResolveImportedModule](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hostresolveimportedmodule)(*module*, *required*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*requiredModule*).
    3.  Let *status* be *requiredModule.*ModuleEvaluation().
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).

7.  Let *moduleCxt* be a new [ECMAScript code execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
8.  Set the Function of *moduleCxt* to **null**.
9.  Set the [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms) of *moduleCxt* to *module*.\[\[Realm\]\].
10. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *module* has been linked and declarations in its module environment have been instantiated.
11. Set the [VariableEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of *moduleCxt* to *module*.\[\[Environment\]\].
12. Set the [LexicalEnvironment](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of *moduleCxt* to *module*.\[\[Environment\]\].
13. [Suspend](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) [the currently running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
14. Push *moduleCxt* on to [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts); *moduleCxt* is now [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
15. Let *result* be the result of evaluating *module*.\[\[ECMAScriptCode\]\].
16. [Suspend](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) *moduleCxt* and remove it from [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
17. Resume the context that is now on the top of [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) as [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
18. Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*result*).

<span id="sec-15.2.1.17" class="secnum">[15.2.1.17](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hostresolveimportedmodule "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: HostResolveImportedModule (referencingModule, specifier )
===================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

HostResolveImportedModule is an implementation defined abstract operation that provides the concrete [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) subclass instance that corresponds to the *ModuleSpecifier* String, specifier, occurring within the context of the module represented by the [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) referencingModule.

The implementation of HostResolveImportedModule must conform to the following requirements:

-   The normal return value must be an instance of a concrete subclass of [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records).

-   If a [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) corresponding to the pair *referencingModule, specifier* does not exist or cannot be created, an exception must be thrown.

-   This operation must be idempotent if it completes normally. Each time it is called with a specific *referencingModule, specifier* pair as arguments it must return the same [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) instance.

Multiple different referencingModule, specifier pairs may map to the same [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records) instance. The actual mapping semantic is implementation defined but typically a normalization process is applied to specifier as part of the mapping process. A typical normalization process would include actions such as alphabetic case folding and expansion of relative and abbreviated path specifiers.

<span id="sec-15.2.1.18" class="secnum">[15.2.1.18](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getmodulenamespace "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: GetModuleNamespace( module )
===============================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation GetModuleNamespace called with argument module performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *module* is an instance of a concrete subclass of [Module Record](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-module-records).
2.  Let *namespace* be *module*.\[\[Namespace\]\].
3.  If *namespace* is **undefined**, then
    1.  Let *exportedNames* be *module*.[GetExportedNames](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getexportednames)(« »).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*exportedNames*).
    3.  Let *unambiguousNames* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
    4.  For each *name* that is an element of *exportedNames*,
        1.  Let *resolution* be *module*.[ResolveExport](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-resolveexport)(*name*, « », « »).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*resolution*).
        3.  If *resolution* is **null**, throw a **SyntaxError** exception.
        4.  If *resolution* is not `"ambiguous"`, append *name* to *unambiguousNames*.

    5.  Let *namespace* be [ModuleNamespaceCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-modulenamespacecreate)(*module*, *unambiguousNames*).

4.  Return *namespace*.

<span id="sec-15.2.1.19" class="secnum">[15.2.1.19](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toplevelmoduleevaluationjob "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: TopLevelModuleEvaluationJob ( <span style="font-family: sans-serif">sourceText</span>)
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

A TopLevelModuleEvaluationJob with parameter sourceText is a job that parses, validates, and evaluates sourceText as a *Module*.

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *sourceText* is an ECMAScript source text (see [clause 10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-source-code)).
2.  Let *realm* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts)’s [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms).
3.  Let *m* be [ParseModule](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-parsemodule)(*sourceText*).
4.  If *m* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) or any other implementation defined error indication, then
    1.  Report or log the error(s) in an implementation dependent manner.
    2.  NextJob [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).

5.  Set *m*.\[\[Realm\]\] to *realm*.
6.  Let *status* be *m*.[ModuleDeclarationInstantiation](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-moduledeclarationinstantiation)().
7.  If *status* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), then
    1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): all dependencies of *m* have been transitively resolved and *m* is ready for evaluation.
    2.  Let *status* be *m*.[ModuleEvaluation](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-moduleevaluation)().

8.  NextJob [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*status*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> An implementation may parse a *sourceText* as a *Module,* analyze it for Early Error conditions, and instantiate it prior to the execution of the TopLevelModuleEvaluationJob for that *sourceText*. An implementation may also resolve, pre-parse and pre-analyze, and pre-instantiate module dependencies of *sourceText*. However, the reporting of any errors detected by these actions must be deferred until the TopLevelModuleEvaluationJob is actually executed.

<span id="sec-15.2.1.20" class="secnum">[15.2.1.20](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-runtime-semantics-evaluation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Evaluation
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

*Module* <span class="geq">:</span> <span class="grhsannot">\[empty\]</span>

1.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).

*ModuleBody* <span class="geq">:</span> *ModuleItemList*

1.  Let *result* be the result of evaluating *ModuleItemList*.
2.  If *result*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">normal</span> and *result*.\[\[value\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, then
    1.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).

3.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*result*).

*ModuleItemList* <span class="geq">:</span> *ModuleItemList* *ModuleItem*

1.  Let *sl* be the result of evaluating *ModuleItemList*.
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*sl*).
3.  Let *s* be the result of evaluating *ModuleItem*.
4.  If *s*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">throw</span>, return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*s*).
5.  If *s*.\[\[value\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, let *V* = *sl*.\[\[value\]\], otherwise let *V* = *s*.\[\[value\]\].
6.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: *s*.\[\[type\]\], \[\[value\]\]: *V*, \[\[target\]\]: *s*.\[\[target\]\]}.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Steps 5 and 6 of the above algorithm ensure that the value of a *ModuleItemList* is the value of the last value producing item in the *ModuleItemList*.

*ModuleItem* <span class="geq">:</span> *ImportDeclaration*

1.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(<span style="font-family:
                  sans-serif">empty</span>).

*ImportedBinding*

`{` `}`

`from` *ModuleSpecifier*

<span id="sec-15.2.2.1" class="secnum">[15.2.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-imports-static-semantics-early-errors "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: Early Errors

-   It is a Syntax Error if the BoundNames of *ImportDeclaration* contains any duplicate entries.

<span id="sec-15.2.2.2" class="secnum">[15.2.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-imports-static-semantics-boundnames "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: BoundNames
===========================================================================================================================================================================================================

See also: [12.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-identifiers-static-semantics-boundnames), [13.2.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-let-and-const-declarations-static-semantics-boundnames), [13.2.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-variable-statement-static-semantics-boundnames), [13.2.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-destructuring-binding-patterns-static-semantics-boundnames), [13.6.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-for-in-and-for-of-statements-static-semantics-boundnames), [14.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-definitions-static-semantics-boundnames), [14.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrow-function-definitions-static-semantics-boundnames), [14.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-function-definitions-static-semantics-boundnames), [14.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-class-definitions-static-semantics-boundnames), [15.2.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-exports-static-semantics-boundnames).

*ImportDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `import` *ImportClause* *FromClause* `;`

1.  Return the BoundNames of *ImportClause*.

*ImportDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `import` *ModuleSpecifier* `;`

1.  Return a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).

*ImportClause* <span class="geq">:</span> *ImportedDefaultBinding* `,` *NameSpaceImport*

1.  Let *names* be the BoundNames of *ImportedDefaultBinding*.
2.  Append to *names* the elements of the BoundNames of *NameSpaceImport*.
3.  Return *names*.

*ImportClause* <span class="geq">:</span> *ImportedDefaultBinding* `,` *NamedImports*

1.  Let *names* be the BoundNames of *ImportedDefaultBinding*.
2.  Append to *names* the elements of the BoundNames of *NamedImports*.
3.  Return *names*.

*NamedImports* <span class="geq">:</span> `{` `}`

1.  Return a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).

*ImportsList* <span class="geq">:</span> *ImportsList* `,` *ImportSpecifier*

1.  Let *names* be the BoundNames of *ImportsList*.
2.  Append to *names* the elements of the BoundNames of *ImportSpecifier*.
3.  Return *names*.

*ImportSpecifier* <span class="geq">:</span> *IdentifierName* `as` *ImportedBinding*

<span id="sec-15.2.2.3" class="secnum">[15.2.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-imports-static-semantics-importentries "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: ImportEntries
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================

See also: [15.2.1.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-importentries).

*ImportDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `import` *ImportClause* *FromClause* `;`

1.  Let *module* be the sole element of ModuleRequests of *FromClause*.
2.  Return ImportEntriesForModule of *ImportClause* with argument *module*.

*ImportDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `import` *ModuleSpecifier* `;`

1.  Return a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).

<span id="sec-15.2.2.4" class="secnum">[15.2.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-static-semantics-importentriesformodule "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: ImportEntriesForModule
===========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With parameter module.

*ImportClause* <span class="geq">:</span> *ImportedDefaultBinding* `,` *NameSpaceImport*

1.  Let *entries* be ImportEntriesForModule of *ImportedDefaultBinding* with argument *module*.
2.  Append to *entries* the elements of the ImportEntriesForModule of *NameSpaceImport* with argument *module*.
3.  Return *entries*.

*ImportClause* <span class="geq">:</span> *ImportedDefaultBinding* `,` *NamedImports*

1.  Let *entries* be ImportEntriesForModule of *ImportedDefaultBinding* with argument *module*.
2.  Append to *entries* the elements of the ImportEntriesForModule of *NamedImports* with argument *module*.
3.  Return *entries*.

<span class="prod">*ImportedDefaultBinding* <span class="geq">:</span> *ImportedBinding*</span>

1.  Let *localName* be the sole element of BoundNames of *ImportedBinding*.
2.  Let *defaultEntry* be the Record {\[\[ModuleRequest\]\]: *module*, \[\[ImportName\]\]: `"default"`, \[\[LocalName\]\]: *localName* }.
3.  Return a new [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing *defaultEntry.*

*NameSpaceImport* <span class="geq">:</span> `*` `as` *ImportedBinding*

1.  Let *localName* be the StringValue of *ImportedBinding*.
2.  Let *entry* be the Record {\[\[ModuleRequest\]\]: *module*, \[\[ImportName\]\]: `"*"`, \[\[LocalName\]\]: *localName* }.
3.  Return a new [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing *entry*.

*NamedImports* <span class="geq">:</span> `{` `}`

1.  Return a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).

*ImportsList* <span class="geq">:</span> *ImportsList* `,` *ImportSpecifier*

1.  Let *specs* be the ImportEntriesForModule of *ImportsList* with argument *module*.
2.  Append to *specs* the elements of the ImportEntriesForModule of *ImportSpecifier* with argument *module*.
3.  Return *specs*.

*ImportSpecifier* <span class="geq">:</span> *ImportedBinding*

1.  Let *localName* be the sole element of BoundNames of *ImportedBinding*.
2.  Let *entry* be the Record {\[\[ModuleRequest\]\]: *module*, \[\[ImportName\]\]: *localName* , \[\[LocalName\]\]: *localName* }.
3.  Return a new [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing *entry*.

*ImportSpecifier* <span class="geq">:</span> *IdentifierName* `as` *ImportedBinding*

1.  Let *importName* be the StringValue of *IdentifierName*.
2.  Let *localName* be the StringValue of *ImportedBinding*.
3.  Let *entry* be the Record {\[\[ModuleRequest\]\]: *module*, \[\[ImportName\]\]: *importName*, \[\[LocalName\]\]: *localName* }.
4.  Return a new [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing *entry*.

<span id="sec-15.2.2.5" class="secnum">[15.2.2.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-imports-static-semantics-modulerequests "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: ModuleRequests
===================================================================================================================================================================================================================

See also: [15.2.1.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-importedlocalnames),[15.2.3.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-exports-static-semantics-modulerequests).

*ImportDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `import` *ImportClause* *FromClause* `;`

1.  Return ModuleRequests of *FromClause*.

*ModuleSpecifier* <span class="geq">:</span> *StringLiteral*

1.  Return a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the StringValue of *StringLiteral*.

*ExportDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `export` *ExportClause* `;`

-   For each *IdentifierName* n in ReferencedBindings of <span class="prod">*ExportClause* <span class="geq">:</span> *It* `is` `a` *Syntax* *Error* `if` *StringValue* `of`</span> n is a *ReservedWord* or if the StringValue of n is one of: `"implements"`, `"interface"`, `"let"`, `"package"`, `"private"`, `"protected"`, `"public"`, `"static"`, or `"yield"`.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The above rule means that each ReferencedBindings of *ExportClause* is treated as an *IdentifierReference*.

<span id="sec-15.2.3.2" class="secnum">[15.2.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-exports-static-semantics-boundnames "link to this section")</span> Static Semantics: BoundNames

=================================================================================================================================================================================================================

See also: [15.2.1.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-exportednames).

=================================================================================================================================================================================================================

See also: [15.2.1.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-module-semantics-static-semantics-exportentries).

*ExportDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `export` `*` *FromClause* `;`

1.  Let *module* be the sole element of ModuleRequests of *FromClause*.
2.  Let *entry* be the Record {\[\[ModuleRequest\]\]: *module*, \[\[ImportName\]\]: `"*"`, \[\[LocalName\]\]: **null**, \[\[ExportName\]\]: **null** }.
3.  Return a new [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing *entry*.

*ExportDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `export` *ExportClause* *FromClause* `;`

2.  Return ExportEntriesForModule of *ExportClause* with argument *module*.

*ExportDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `export` *ExportClause* `;`

1.  Return ExportEntriesForModule of *ExportClause* with argument **null**.

*ExportDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `export` *VariableStatement*

1.  Let *entries* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
2.  Let *names* be the BoundNames of *VariableStatement*.
3.  Repeat for each *name* in *names,*
    1.  Append to *entries* the Record {\[\[ModuleRequest\]\]: **null**, \[\[ImportName\]\]: **null**, \[\[LocalName\]\]: *name*, \[\[ExportName\]\]: *name* }.

4.  Return *entries*.

*ExportDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `export` *Declaration*

1.  Let *entries* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
2.  Let *names* be the BoundNames of *Declaration*.
3.  Repeat for each *name* in *names,*
    1.  Append to *entries* the Record {\[\[ModuleRequest\]\]: **null**, \[\[ImportName\]\]: **null**, \[\[LocalName\]\]: *name*, \[\[ExportName\]\]: *name* }.

4.  Return *entries*.

*ExportDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `export` `default` *HoistableDeclaration*

1.  Let *names* be BoundNames of *HoistableDeclaration*.
2.  Let *localName* be the sole element of *names*.
3.  Return a new [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the Record {\[\[ModuleRequest\]\]: **null**, \[\[ImportName\]\]: **null**, \[\[LocalName\]\]: *localName*, \[\[ExportName\]\]: `"default"`}.

*ExportDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `export` `default` *ClassDeclaration*

1.  Let *names* be BoundNames of *ClassDeclaration*.
2.  Let *localName* be the sole element of *names*.
3.  Return a new [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the Record {\[\[ModuleRequest\]\]: **null**, \[\[ImportName\]\]: **null**, \[\[LocalName\]\]: *localName*, \[\[ExportName\]\]: `"default"`}.

<span style="font-family: Times New Roman"><span class="prod">*ExportDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span></span></span> `export default` *AssignmentExpression*`;`

1.  Let *entry* be the Record {\[\[ModuleRequest\]\]: **null**, \[\[ImportName\]\]: **null**, \[\[LocalName\]\]: `"*default*"`, \[\[ExportName\]\]: `"default"`}.
2.  Return a new [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing *entry*.

===========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

With parameter module.

*ExportSpecifier* <span class="geq">:</span> *IdentifierName*

1.  Let *sourceName* be the StringValue of *IdentifierName*.
2.  If *module* is **null**, then
    1.  Let *localName* be *sourceName*.

3.  Else
    1.  Let *localName* be **null**.
    2.  Let *importName* be *sourceName*.

4.  Return a new [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the Record {\[\[ModuleRequest\]\]: *module*, \[\[ImportName\]\]: *importName*, \[\[LocalName\]\]: *localName*, \[\[ExportName\]\]: *sourceName* }.

    1.  Let *localName* be *sourceName*.
    2.  Let *importName* be **null**.

4.  Else

    2.  Let *importName* be *sourceName*.

5.  Return a new [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the Record {\[\[ModuleRequest\]\]: *module*, \[\[ImportName\]\]: *importName*, \[\[LocalName\]\]: *localName*, \[\[ExportName\]\]: *exportName* }.

*ExportDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `export` *VariableStatement*

*ExportDeclaration* <span class="geq">:</span> `export` *Declaration*
