==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the **getOwnPropertySymbols** function is called with argument O, the following steps are taken:

1.  Return [GetOwnPropertyKeys](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getownpropertykeys)(*O*, Symbol).

<span id="sec-19.1.2.8.1" class="secnum">[19.1.2.8.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getownpropertykeys "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: GetOwnPropertyKeys ( O, Type )
===================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation GetOwnPropertyKeys is called with arguments O and *Type* where O is an Object and *Type* is one of the ECMAScript specification types String or Symbol. The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *obj* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(*O*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*obj*).
3.  Let *keys* be *obj.*\[\[OwnPropertyKeys\]\]().
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*keys*).
5.  Let *nameList* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
6.  Repeat for each element *nextKey* of *keys* in [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) order,
    1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*nextKey*) is *Type*, then
        1.  Append *nextKey* as the last element of *nameList*.

7.  Return [CreateArrayFromList](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createarrayfromlist)(*nameList*).

<span id="sec-19.1.2.9" class="secnum">[19.1.2.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.getprototypeof "link to this section")</span> Object.getPrototypeOf ( O )
============================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `getPrototypeOf` function is called with argument O, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *obj* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(*O*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*obj*).
3.  Return *obj.*\[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\]().

<span id="sec-19.1.2.10" class="secnum">[19.1.2.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.is "link to this section")</span> Object.is ( value1, value2 )
===================================================================================================================================================================================

When the **is** function is called with arguments value1 and value2 the following steps are taken:

1.  Return [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*value1*, *value2*).

<span id="sec-19.1.2.11" class="secnum">[19.1.2.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.isextensible "link to this section")</span> Object.isExtensible ( O )
==========================================================================================================================================================================================

When the **isExtensible** function is called with argument O, the following steps are taken:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, return **false**.
2.  Return [IsExtensible](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isextensible-o)(*O*).

<span id="sec-19.1.2.12" class="secnum">[19.1.2.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.isfrozen "link to this section")</span> Object.isFrozen ( O )
==================================================================================================================================================================================

When the **isFrozen** function is called with argument O, the following steps are taken:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, return **true**.
2.  Return [TestIntegrityLevel](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-testintegritylevel)(*O*, "`frozen`").

<span id="sec-19.1.2.13" class="secnum">[19.1.2.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.issealed "link to this section")</span> Object.isSealed ( O )
==================================================================================================================================================================================

When the **isSealed** function is called with argument O, the following steps are taken:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, return **true**.
2.  Return [TestIntegrityLevel](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-testintegritylevel)(*O*, "`sealed`").

<span id="sec-19.1.2.14" class="secnum">[19.1.2.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.keys "link to this section")</span> Object.keys ( O )
==========================================================================================================================================================================

When the **keys** function is called with argument O, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *obj* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(*O*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*obj*).
3.  Let *nameList* be [EnumerableOwnNames](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-enumerableownnames)(*obj*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*nameList*).
5.  Return [CreateArrayFromList](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createarrayfromlist)(*nameList*).

If an implementation defines a specific order of enumeration for the for-in statement, the same order must be used for the elements of the array returned in step 4.

<span id="sec-19.1.2.15" class="secnum">[19.1.2.15](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.preventextensions "link to this section")</span> Object.preventExtensions ( O )
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the **preventExtensions** function is called, the following steps are taken:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, return *O*.
2.  Let *status* be *O*.\[\[PreventExtensions\]\]().
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
4.  If *status* is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
5.  Return *O*.

<span id="sec-19.1.2.16" class="secnum">[19.1.2.16](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.prototype "link to this section")</span> Object.prototype
==============================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Object.prototype` is the intrinsic object %ObjectPrototype% ([19.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-object-prototype-object)).

This property has the attributes {\[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-19.1.2.17" class="secnum">[19.1.2.17](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.seal "link to this section")</span> Object.seal ( O )
==========================================================================================================================================================================

When the **seal** function is called, the following steps are taken:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, return *O*.
2.  Let *status* be [SetIntegrityLevel](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setintegritylevel)( *O*, "`sealed`").
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
4.  If *status* is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
5.  Return *O*.

<span id="sec-19.1.2.18" class="secnum">[19.1.2.18](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.setprototypeof "link to this section")</span> Object.setPrototypeOf ( O, proto )
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `setPrototypeOf` function is called with arguments <span style="font-family: Times New
        Roman">*O* and</span> proto, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [RequireObjectCoercible](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-requireobjectcoercible)(*O*)*.*
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*proto*) is neither Object nor Null, throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, return *O*.
5.  Let *status* be *O*.\[\[SetPrototypeOf\]\](*proto*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
7.  If *status* is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
8.  Return *O*.

<span id="sec-19.1.3" class="secnum">[19.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-object-prototype-object "link to this section")</span> Properties of the Object Prototype Object
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The Object prototype object is the intrinsic object %ObjectPrototype%. The Object prototype object is an ordinary object.

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the Object prototype object is <span class="value">null</span> and the initial value of the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is <span class="value">true</span>.

<span id="sec-19.1.3.1" class="secnum">[19.1.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.prototype.constructor "link to this section")</span> Object.prototype.constructor
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Object.prototype.constructor` is the intrinsic object %Object%.

<span id="sec-19.1.3.2" class="secnum">[19.1.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.prototype.hasownproperty "link to this section")</span> Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty ( V )
================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `hasOwnProperty` method is called with argument V, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *P* be [ToPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-topropertykey)(*V*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*P*).
3.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
5.  Return [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty)(*O*, *P*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The ordering of steps 1 and 3 is chosen to ensure that any exception that would have been thrown by step 1 in previous editions of this specification will continue to be thrown even if the **this** value is **undefined** or **null**.

<span id="sec-19.1.3.3" class="secnum">[19.1.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.prototype.isprototypeof "link to this section")</span> Object.prototype.isPrototypeOf ( V )
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `isPrototypeOf` method is called with argument V, the following steps are taken:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*V*) is not Object, return **false**.
2.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
4.  Repeat
    1.  Let *V* be *V*.\[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\]().
    2.  If *V* is **null**, return **false**
    3.  If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*O*, *V*) is **true**, return **true**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The ordering of steps 1 and 2 preserves the behaviour specified by previous editions of this specification for the case where *V* is not an object and the **this** value is **undefined** or **null**.

<span id="sec-19.1.3.4" class="secnum">[19.1.3.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.prototype.propertyisenumerable "link to this section")</span> Object.prototype.propertyIsEnumerable ( V )
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `propertyIsEnumerable` method is called with argument V, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *P* be [ToPropertyKey](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-topropertykey)(*V*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*P*).
3.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
5.  Let *desc* be *O*.\[\[GetOwnProperty\]\](*P*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*desc*).
7.  If *desc* is **undefined**, return **false**.
8.  Return the value of *desc*.\[\[Enumerable\]\].

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> This method does not consider objects in the prototype chain.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> The ordering of steps 1 and 3 is chosen to ensure that any exception that would have been thrown by step 1 in previous editions of this specification will continue to be thrown even if the **this** value is **undefined** or **null**.

<span id="sec-19.1.3.5" class="secnum">[19.1.3.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.prototype.tolocalestring "link to this section")</span> Object.prototype.toLocaleString ( \[ reserved1 \[ , reserved2 \] \] )
================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the **toLocaleString** method is called, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be the **this** value.
2.  Return [Invoke](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-invoke)(*O*, `"toString"`).

The optional parameters to this function are not used but are intended to correspond to the parameter pattern used by ECMA-402 `toLocalString` functions. Implementations that do not include ECMA-402 support must not use those parameter positions for other purposes.

The `length` property of the `toLocaleString` method is **0**.

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> This function provides a generic `toLocaleString` implementation for objects that have no locale-specific `toString` behaviour. `Array`, `Number`, `Date`<span style="font-family: sans-serif">, and</span> `Typed Arrays` provide their own locale-sensitive `toLocaleString` methods.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> ECMA-402 intentionally does not provide an alternative to this default implementation.

<span id="sec-19.1.3.6" class="secnum">[19.1.3.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.prototype.tostring "link to this section")</span> Object.prototype.toString ( )
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `toString` method is called, the following steps are taken:

1.  If the **this** value is **undefined**, return `"[object Undefined]"`.
2.  If the **this** value is **null**, return `"[object Null]"`.
3.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
4.  Let *isArray* be [IsArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isarray)(*O*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*isArray*).
6.  If *isArray* is **true**, let *builtinTag* be `"Array"`.
7.  Else, if *O* is an exotic String object, let *builtinTag* be `"String"`.
8.  Else, if *O* has an \[\[ParameterMap\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), let *builtinTag* be `"Arguments"`.
9.  Else, if *O* has a \[\[Call\]\] internal method, let *builtinTag* be `"Function"`.
10. Else, if *O* has an \[\[ErrorData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), let *builtinTag* be `"Error"`.
11. Else, if *O* has a \[\[BooleanData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), let *builtinTag* be `"Boolean"`.
12. Else, if *O* has a \[\[NumberData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), let *builtinTag* be `"Number"`.
13. Else, if *O* has a \[\[DateValue\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), let *builtinTag* be `"Date"`.
14. Else, if *O* has a \[\[RegExpMatcher\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), let *builtinTag* be `"RegExp"`.
15. Else, let *builtinTag* be `"Object"`.
16. Let *tag* be Get (*O*, @@toStringTag).
17. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*tag*).
18. If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*tag*) is not String, let *tag* be *builtinTag*.
19. Return the String that is the result of concatenating `"[object "`, *tag*, and `"]"`.

This function is the %ObjProto\_toString% intrinsic object.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Historically, this function was occasionally used to access the string value of the \[\[Class\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) that was used in previous editions of this specification as a nominal type tag for various built-in objects. The above definition of `toString` preserves compatibility for legacy code that uses `toString` as a test for those specific kinds of built-in objects. It does not provide a reliable type testing mechanism for other kinds of built-in or program defined objects. In addition, programs can use @@toStringTag in ways that will invalidate the reliability of such legacy type tests.

<span id="sec-19.1.3.7" class="secnum">[19.1.3.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.prototype.valueof "link to this section")</span> Object.prototype.valueOf ( )
================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the **valueOf** method is called, the following steps are taken:

1.  Return [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).

<span id="sec-19.1.4" class="secnum">[19.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-object-instances "link to this section")</span> Properties of Object Instances
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

Object instances have no special properties beyond those inherited from the Object prototype object.

<span id="sec-19.2" class="secnum">[19.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-objects "link to this section")</span> Function Objects
====================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-19.2.1" class="secnum">[19.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-constructor "link to this section")</span> The Function Constructor
====================================================================================================================================================================================

The Function constructor is the %Function% intrinsic object and the initial value of the `Function` property of the global object. When `Function` is called as a function rather than as a constructor, it creates and initializes a new Function object. Thus the function call `Function(…)` is equivalent to the object creation expression `new Function(…)` with the same arguments.

The `Function` constructor is designed to be subclassable. It may be used as the value of an `extends` clause of a class definition. Subclass constructors that intend to inherit the specified `Function` behaviour must include a `super` call to the `Function` constructor to create and initialize a subclass instances with the internal slots necessary for built-in function behaviour. All ECMAScript syntactic forms for defining function objects create instances of `Function`. There is no syntactic means to create instances of `Function` subclasses except for the built-in Generator Function subclass.

<span id="sec-19.2.1.1" class="secnum">[19.2.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-p1-p2-pn-body "link to this section")</span> Function ( p1, p2, … , pn, body )
===================================================================================================================================================================================================

The last argument specifies the body (executable code) of a function; any preceding arguments specify formal parameters.

When the `Function` function is called with some arguments p1, p2, … , pn, body (where n might be <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">0</span>, that is, there are no “p” arguments, and where body might also not be provided), the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *C* be the active function object.
2.  Let *args* be the *argumentsList* that was passed to this function by \[\[Call\]\] or \[\[Construct\]\].
3.  Return [CreateDynamicFunction](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdynamicfunction)(*C*, NewTarget, `"normal"`, *args*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> It is permissible but not necessary to have one argument for each formal parameter to be specified. For example, all three of the following expressions produce the same result:

    new Function("a", "b", "c", "return a+b+c")

    new Function("a, b, c", "return a+b+c")

    new Function("a,b", "c", "return a+b+c")

<span id="sec-19.2.1.1.1" class="secnum">[19.2.1.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdynamicfunction "link to this section")</span> RuntimeSemantics: CreateDynamicFunction(constructor, newTarget, kind, args)
================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation CreateDynamicFunction is called with arguments constructor, newTarget, kind, and args. constructor is the constructor function that is performing this action, newTarget is the constructor that `new` was initially applied to, kind is either `"normal"` or `"generator"`, and args is a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the actual argument values that were passed to constructor. The following steps are taken:

1.  If *newTarget* is **undefined***,* let *newTarget* be *constructor*.
2.  If *kind* is `"normal"`, then
    1.  Let *goal* be the grammar symbol *FunctionBody.*
    2.  Let *parameterGoal* be the grammar symbol *FormalParameters*.
    3.  Let *fallbackProto* be `"%FunctionPrototype%"`.

3.  Else,
    1.  Let *goal* be the grammar symbol *GeneratorBody*.
    2.  Let *parameterGoal* be the grammar symbol *FormalParameters*<span style="font-family:
                            sans-serif"><sub>\[Yield,</sub></span> <span style="font-family:
                            sans-serif"><sub>GeneratorParameter\]</sub></span>.
    3.  Let *fallbackProto* be `"%Generator%"`.

4.  Let *argCount* be the number of elements in *args*.
5.  Let *P* be the empty String.
6.  If *argCount* = 0, let *bodyText* be the empty String.
7.  Else if *argCount* = 1, let *bodyText* be *args*\[0\].
8.  Else *argCount* &gt; 1,
    1.  Let *firstArg* be *args*\[0\].
    2.  Let *P* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*firstArg*).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*P*).
    4.  Let *k* be 1.
    5.  Repeat, while *k* &lt; *argCount*-1
        1.  Let *nextArg* be *args*\[*k*\].
        2.  Let *nextArgString* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*nextArg*).
        3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*nextArgString*).
        4.  Let *P* be the result of concatenating the previous value of *P*, the String `","` (a comma), and *nextArgString*.
        5.  Increase *k* by 1.

    6.  Let *bodyText* be *args*\[*k*\].

9.  Let *bodyText* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*bodyText*).
10. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*bodyText*).
11. Let *body* be the result of parsing *bodyText*, interpreted as UTF-16 encoded Unicode text as described in [6.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types-string-type)*,* using *goal* as the goal symbol. Throw a **SyntaxError** exception if the parse fails or if any static semantics errors are detected.
12. If *bodyText* is [strict mode code](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code) ([see 10.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-mode-code)) then let *strict* be **true**, else let *strict* be **false**.
13. Let *parameters* be the result of parsing *P*, interpreted as UTF-16 encoded Unicode text as described in [6.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types-string-type)*,* using *parameterGoal* as the goal symbol. Throw a **SyntaxError** exception if the parse fails or if any static semantics errors are detected. If *strict* is **true**, the Early Error rules for <span class="prod">*StrictFormalParameters* <span class="geq">:</span> *FormalParameters*</span> are applied.
14. If any element of the BoundNames of *parameters* also occurs in the LexicallyDeclaredNames of *body*, throw a **SyntaxError** exception.
15. If *body* Contains *SuperCall* is ***true**,* throw a **SyntaxError** exception.
16. If *parameters* Contains *SuperCall* is ***true**,* throw a **SyntaxError** exception.
17. If *body* Contains *SuperProperty* is ***true**,* throw a **SyntaxError** exception.
18. If *parameters* Contains *SuperProperty* is ***true**,* throw a **SyntaxError** exception.
19. If *strict* is **true**, then
    1.  If BoundNames of *parameters* contains any duplicate elements*,* throw a **SyntaxError** exception.

20. Let *proto* be [GetPrototypeFromConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getprototypefromconstructor)(*newTarget*, *fallbackProto*).
21. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*proto*).
22. Let *F* be [FunctionAllocate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functionallocate)(*proto*, *strict*, *kind*).
23. Let *realmF* be the value of *F’s* \[\[Realm\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
24. Let *scope* be *realmF*.\[\[globalEnv\]\].
25. Perform [FunctionInitialize](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-functioninitialize)(*F*, <span style="font-family:
                    sans-serif">Normal</span>, *parameters*, *body, scope*).
26. If *kind* is `"generator"` , then
    1.  Let *prototype* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(<span style="font-family:
                            sans-serif">%GeneratorPrototype%</span>).
    2.  Perform [MakeConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makeconstructor)(*F*, **true**, *prototype*).

27. Else, perform [MakeConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makeconstructor)(*F*).
28. Perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*F*, `"anonymous"`).
29. Return *F*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> A `prototype` property is automatically created for every function created using CreateDynamicFunction , to provide for the possibility that the function will be used as a constructor.

<span id="sec-19.2.2" class="secnum">[19.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-function-constructor "link to this section")</span> Properties of the Function Constructor
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The `Function` constructor is itself a built-in function object. The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the `Function` constructor is %FunctionPrototype%, the intrinsic Function prototype object ([19.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-function-prototype-object)).

The value of the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the Function constructor is **true**.

The Function constructor has the following properties:

<span id="sec-19.2.2.1" class="secnum">[19.2.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function.length "link to this section")</span> Function.length
==========================================================================================================================================================================

This is a data property with a value of 1. This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span> }.

<span id="sec-19.2.2.2" class="secnum">[19.2.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function.prototype "link to this section")</span> Function.prototype
================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of `Function.prototype` is %FunctionPrototype%, the intrinsic Function prototype object ([19.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-function-prototype-object)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span> }.

<span id="sec-19.2.3" class="secnum">[19.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-function-prototype-object "link to this section")</span> Properties of the Function Prototype Object
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The Function prototype object is the intrinsic object %FunctionPrototype%. The Function prototype object is itself a built-in function object. When invoked, it accepts any arguments and returns <span class="value">undefined</span>. It does not have a \[\[Construct\]\] internal method so it is not a constructor.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The Function prototype object is specified to be a function object to ensure compatibility with ECMAScript code that was created prior to the ECMAScript 2015 specification.

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the Function prototype object is the intrinsic object %ObjectPrototype% ([19.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-object-prototype-object)). The initial value of the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the Function prototype object is <span class="value">true</span>.

The Function prototype object does not have a `prototype` property.

The value of the `length` property of the Function prototype object is **0**.

The value of the `name` property of the Function prototype object is the empty String.

<span id="sec-19.2.3.1" class="secnum">[19.2.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function.prototype.apply "link to this section")</span> Function.prototype.apply ( thisArg, argArray )
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `apply` method is called on an object func with arguments thisArg and argArray, the following steps are taken:

1.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*func*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  If *argArray* is **null** or **undefined**, then
    1.  Return [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*func*, *thisArg*).

3.  Let *argList* be [CreateListFromArrayLike](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createlistfromarraylike)(*argArray*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*argList* ).
5.  Perform [PrepareForTailCall](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-preparefortailcall)().
6.  Return [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*func*, *thisArg*, *argList*).

The `length` property of the `apply` method is **2**.

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> The thisArg value is passed without modification as the **this** value. This is a change from Edition 3, where an **undefined** or **null** thisArg is replaced with the global object and [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject) is applied to all other values and that result is passed as the **this** value. Even though the thisArg is passed without modification, non-strict functions still perform these transformations upon entry to the function.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> If *func* is an arrow function or a [bound function](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) then the *thisArg* will be ignored by the function \[\[Call\]\] in step 6.

<span id="sec-19.2.3.2" class="secnum">[19.2.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function.prototype.bind "link to this section")</span> Function.prototype.bind ( thisArg , ...args)
===============================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `bind` method is called with argument thisArg and zero or more args, it performs the following steps:

1.  Let *Target* be the **this** value.
2.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*Target*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  Let *args* be a new (possibly empty) [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) consisting of all of the argument values provided after *thisArg* in order.
4.  Let *F* be [BoundFunctionCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-boundfunctioncreate)(*Target*, *thisArg*, *args*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*F*).
6.  Let *targetHasLength* be [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty)(*Target*, `"length"`).
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*targetHasLength*).
8.  If *targetHasLength* is **true**, then
    1.  Let *targetLen* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*Target*, `"length"`).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*targetLen*).
    3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*targetLen*) is not Number, let *L* be 0.
    4.  Else,
        1.  Let *targetLen* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*targetLen*).
        2.  Let *L* be the larger of 0 and the result of *targetLen* minus the number of elements of *args*.

9.  Else let *L* be 0.
10. Let *status* be [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*F*, `"length"`, PropertyDescriptor {\[\[Value\]\]: *L*, \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true**}).
11. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
12. Let *targetName* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*Target*, `"name"`).
13. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*targetName*).
14. If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*targetName*) is not String, let *targetName* be the empty string.
15. Perform [SetFunctionName](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setfunctionname)(*F*, *targetName*, `"bound"`).
16. Return *F*.

The `length` property of the `bind` method is **1**.

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> Function objects created using `Function.prototype.bind` are exotic objects. They also do not have a `prototype` property.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> If *Target* is an arrow function or a [bound function](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) then the *thisArg* passed to this method will not be used by subsequent calls to *F*.

<span id="sec-19.2.3.3" class="secnum">[19.2.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function.prototype.call "link to this section")</span> Function.prototype.call (thisArg , ...args)
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `call` method is called on an object func with argument, thisArg and zero or more args, the following steps are taken:

1.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*func*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  Let *argList* be an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
3.  If this method was called with more than one argument then in left to right order, starting with the second argument, append each argument as the last element of *argList*.
4.  Perform [PrepareForTailCall](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-preparefortailcall)().
5.  Return [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*func*, *thisArg*, *argList*).

The `length` property of the `call` method is **1**.

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> The thisArg value is passed without modification as the **this** value. This is a change from Edition 3, where an **undefined** or **null** thisArg is replaced with the global object and [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject) is applied to all other values and that result is passed as the **this** value. Even though the thisArg is passed without modification, non-strict functions still perform these transformations upon entry to the function.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> If *func* is an arrow function or a [bound function](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) then the *thisArg* will be ignored by the function \[\[Call\]\] in step 5.

<span id="sec-19.2.3.4" class="secnum">[19.2.3.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function.prototype.constructor "link to this section")</span> Function.prototype.constructor
========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Function.prototype.constructor` is the intrinsic object %Function%.

<span id="sec-19.2.3.5" class="secnum">[19.2.3.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function.prototype.tostring "link to this section")</span> Function.prototype.toString ( )
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `toString` method is called on an object func the following steps are taken:

1.  If *func* is a [Bound Function](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) exotic object, then
    1.  Return an implementation-dependent String source code representation of *func*. The representation must conform to the rules below. It is implementation dependent whether the representation includes [bound function](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects) information or information about the target function.

2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*func*) is Object and is either a built-in function object or has an \[\[ECMAScriptCode\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), then
    1.  Return an implementation-dependent String source code representation of *func*. The representation must conform to the rules below.

3.  Throw a **TypeError** exception.

`toString` Representation Requirements:

-   The string representation must have the syntax of a *FunctionDeclaration* *FunctionExpression*, *GeneratorDeclaration, GeneratorExpression, ClassDeclaration*, *ClassExpression*, *ArrowFunction*, *MethodDefinition*, or *GeneratorMethod* depending upon the actual characteristics of the object.

-   T<span style="font-family: Times New Roman">he use and placement of white space, line terminators, and semicolons within the representation String is implementation-dependent.</span>

-   If the object was defined using ECMAScript code and the returned string representation is not in the form of a *MethodDefinition* or *GeneratorMethod* then the representation must be such that if the string is evaluated, using `eval` in a lexical context that is equivalent to the lexical context used to create the original object, it will result in a new functionally equivalent object. In that case the returned source code must not mention freely any variables that were not mentioned freely by the original function’s source code, even if these “extra” names were originally in scope.

-   If the implementation cannot produce a source code string that meets these criteria then it must return a string for which `eval` will throw a <span style="font-family: sans-serif">**SyntaxError**</span> exception.

<span id="sec-19.2.3.6" class="secnum">[19.2.3.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function.prototype-@@hasinstance "link to this section")</span> Function.prototype\[@@hasInstance\] ( V )
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the @@hasInstance method of an object F is called with value V, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *F* be the **this** value.
2.  Return [OrdinaryHasInstance](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinaryhasinstance)(*F*, *V*).

The value of the `name` property of this function is `"[Symbol.hasInstance]"`.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span> }.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> This is the default implementation of `@@hasInstance` that most functions inherit. `@@hasInstance` is called by the `instanceof` operator to determine whether a value is an instance of a specific constructor. An expression such as

    v instanceof F

evaluates as

    F[@@hasInstance](v)

A constructor function can control which objects are recognized as its instances by `instanceof` by exposing a different `@@hasInstance` method on the function.

This property is non-writable and non-configurable to prevent tampering that could be used to globally expose the target function of a [bound function](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-bound-function-exotic-objects).

<span id="sec-19.2.4" class="secnum">[19.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-instances "link to this section")</span> Function Instances
============================================================================================================================================================================

Every function instance is an [ECMAScript function object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-function-objects) and has the internal slots listed in [Table 27](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-27). Function instances created using the `Function.prototype.bind` method ([19.2.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function.prototype.bind)) have the internal slots listed in [Table 28](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-28).

The Function instances have the following properties:

<span id="sec-19.2.4.1" class="secnum">[19.2.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-instances-length "link to this section")</span> length
===========================================================================================================================================================================

The value of the `length` property is an integer that indicates the typical number of arguments expected by the function. However, the language permits the function to be invoked with some other number of arguments. The behaviour of a function when invoked on a number of arguments other than the number specified by its `length` property depends on the function. This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true** }.

<span id="sec-19.2.4.2" class="secnum">[19.2.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-instances-name "link to this section")</span> name
=======================================================================================================================================================================

The value of the `name` property is an String that is descriptive of the function. The name has no semantic significance but is typically a variable or property name that is used to refer to the function at its point of definition in ECMAScript code. This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true** }.

Anonymous functions objects that do not have a contextual name associated with them by this specification do not have a `name` own property but inherit the `name` property of %FunctionPrototype%.

<span id="sec-19.2.4.3" class="secnum">[19.2.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-instances-prototype "link to this section")</span> prototype
=================================================================================================================================================================================

Function instances that can be used as a constructor have a `prototype` property. Whenever such a function instance is created another ordinary object is also created and is the initial value of the function’s `prototype` property. Unless otherwise specified, the value of the `prototype` property is used to initialize the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the object created when that function is invoked as a constructor.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Function objects created using `Function.prototype.bind`, or by evaluating a *MethodDefinition* (that are not a *GeneratorMethod*) or an *ArrowFunction* grammar production do not have a `prototype` property.

<span id="sec-19.3" class="secnum">[19.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-boolean-objects "link to this section")</span> Boolean Objects
==================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-19.3.1" class="secnum">[19.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-boolean-constructor "link to this section")</span> The Boolean Constructor
==================================================================================================================================================================================

The Boolean constructor is the %Boolean% intrinsic object and the initial value of the `Boolean` property of the global object. When called as a constructor it creates and initializes a new Boolean object. When `Boolean` is called as a function rather than as a constructor, it performs a type conversion.

The `Boolean` constructor is designed to be subclassable. It may be used as the value of an `extends` clause of a class definition. Subclass constructors that intend to inherit the specified `Boolean` behaviour must include a `super` call to the `Boolean` constructor to create and initialize the subclass instance with a \[\[BooleanData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

<span id="sec-19.3.1.1" class="secnum">[19.3.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-boolean-constructor-boolean-value "link to this section")</span> Boolean ( value )
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

When `Boolean` is called with argument value, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *b* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)(*value*).
2.  If NewTarget is **undefined***,* return *b*.
3.  Let *O* be [OrdinaryCreateFromConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarycreatefromconstructor)(NewTarget, `"%BooleanPrototype%"`, «\[\[BooleanData\]\]» ).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
5.  Set the value of *O’s* \[\[BooleanData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *b*.
6.  Return *O*.

<span id="sec-19.3.2" class="secnum">[19.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-boolean-constructor "link to this section")</span> Properties of the Boolean Constructor
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the Boolean constructor is the intrinsic object %FunctionPrototype% ([19.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-function-prototype-object)).

Besides the `length` property (whose value is **1**), the Boolean constructor has the following properties:

<span id="sec-19.3.2.1" class="secnum">[19.3.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-boolean.prototype "link to this section")</span> Boolean.prototype
==============================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Boolean.prototype` is the intrinsic object %BooleanPrototype% ([19.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-boolean-prototype-object)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-19.3.3" class="secnum">[19.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-boolean-prototype-object "link to this section")</span> Properties of the Boolean Prototype Object
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The Boolean prototype object is the intrinsic object %BooleanPrototype%. The Boolean prototype object is an ordinary object. It is not a Boolean instance and does not have a \[\[BooleanData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the Boolean prototype object is the intrinsic object %ObjectPrototype% ([19.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-object-prototype-object)).

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">thisBooleanValue(*value*)</span> performs the following steps:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*value*) is Boolean, return *value*.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*value*) is Object and *value* has a \[\[BooleanData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), then
    1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *value*’s \[\[BooleanData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is a Boolean value.
    2.  Return the value of *value’s* \[\[BooleanData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

3.  Throw a **TypeError** exception.

<span id="sec-19.3.3.1" class="secnum">[19.3.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-boolean.prototype.constructor "link to this section")</span> Boolean.prototype.constructor
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Boolean.prototype.constructor` is the intrinsic object %Boolean%.

<span id="sec-19.3.3.2" class="secnum">[19.3.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-boolean.prototype.tostring "link to this section")</span> Boolean.prototype.toString ( )
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *b* be thisBooleanValue(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*b*).
3.  If *b* is **true**, return `"true"`; else return `"false"`.

<span id="sec-19.3.3.3" class="secnum">[19.3.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-boolean.prototype.valueof "link to this section")</span> Boolean.prototype.valueOf ( )
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Return thisBooleanValue(**this** value).

<span id="sec-19.3.4" class="secnum">[19.3.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-boolean-instances "link to this section")</span> Properties of Boolean Instances
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

Boolean instances are ordinary objects that inherit properties from the Boolean prototype object. Boolean instances have a \[\[BooleanData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots). The \[\[BooleanData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is the Boolean value represented by this Boolean object.

<span id="sec-19.4" class="secnum">[19.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol-objects "link to this section")</span> Symbol Objects
================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-19.4.1" class="secnum">[19.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol-constructor "link to this section")</span> The Symbol Constructor
================================================================================================================================================================================

The Symbol constructor is the %Symbol% intrinsic object and the initial value of the `Symbol` property of the global object. When `Symbol` is called as a function, it returns a new Symbol value.

The `Symbol` constructor is not intended to be used with the `new` operator or to be subclassed. It may be used as the value of an `extends` clause of a class definition but a `super` call to the `Symbol` constructor will cause an exception.

<span id="sec-19.4.1.1" class="secnum">[19.4.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol-description "link to this section")</span> Symbol ( \[ description \] )
==========================================================================================================================================================================================

When `Symbol` is called with optional argument description, the following steps are taken:

1.  If NewTarget is not **undefined***,* throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  If *description* is **undefined**, let *descString* be **undefined**.
3.  Else, let *descString* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*description*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*descString*).
5.  Return a new unique Symbol value whose \[\[Description\]\] value is *descString*.

<span id="sec-19.4.2" class="secnum">[19.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-symbol-constructor "link to this section")</span> Properties of the Symbol Constructor
================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the Symbol constructor is the intrinsic object %FunctionPrototype% ([19.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-function-prototype-object)).

Besides the `length` property (whose value is **0**), the Symbol constructor has the following properties:

<span id="sec-19.4.2.1" class="secnum">[19.4.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol.for "link to this section")</span> Symbol.for ( key )
========================================================================================================================================================================

When `Symbol.for` is called with argument key it performs the following steps:

1.  Let *stringKey* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*key*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*stringKey*).
3.  For each element *e* of the GlobalSymbolRegistry [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type),
    1.  If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*e*.\[\[key\]\], *stringKey*) is **true**, return *e*.\[\[symbol\]\].

4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): GlobalSymbolRegistry does not currently contain an entry for *stringKey*.
5.  Let *newSymbol* be a new unique Symbol value whose \[\[Description\]\] value is *stringKey*.
6.  Append the record { \[\[key\]\]: *stringKey*, \[\[symbol\]\]: *newSymbol* } to the GlobalSymbolRegistry [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
7.  Return *newSymbol*.

The GlobalSymbolRegistry is a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is globally available. It is shared by all Code Realms. Prior to the evaluation of any ECMAScript code it is initialized as an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type). Elements of the GlobalSymbolRegistry are Records with the structure defined in [Table 44](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-44).

<span id="table-44">Table 44</span> — GlobalSymbolRegistry Record Fields

| Field Name     | Value    | Usage                                                                                                                   |
|----------------|----------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| \[\[key\]\]    | A String | A string key used to globally identify a Symbol.                                                                        |
| \[\[symbol\]\] | A Symbol | A symbol that can be retrieved from any [Realm](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-code-realms). |

<span id="sec-19.4.2.2" class="secnum">[19.4.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol.hasinstance "link to this section")</span> Symbol.hasInstance
================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Symbol.hasInstance` is the well known symbol @@hasInstance ([Table 1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-1)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-19.4.2.3" class="secnum">[19.4.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol.isconcatspreadable "link to this section")</span> Symbol.isConcatSpreadable
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Symbol.isConcatSpreadable` is the well known symbol @@isConcatSpreadable ([Table 1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-1)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-19.4.2.4" class="secnum">[19.4.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol.iterator "link to this section")</span> Symbol.iterator
==========================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Symbol.iterator` is the well known symbol @@iterator ([Table 1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-1)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-19.4.2.5" class="secnum">[19.4.2.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol.keyfor "link to this section")</span> Symbol.keyFor ( sym )
==============================================================================================================================================================================

When `Symbol.keyFor` is called with argument sym it performs the following steps:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*sym*) is not Symbol, throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  For each element *e* of the GlobalSymbolRegistry [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) ([see 19.4.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol.for)),
    1.  If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*e*.\[\[symbol\]\], *sym*) is **true**, return *e*.\[\[key\]\].

3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): GlobalSymbolRegistry does not currently contain an entry for *sym*.
4.  Return **undefined**.

<span id="sec-19.4.2.6" class="secnum">[19.4.2.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol.match "link to this section")</span> Symbol.match
====================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Symbol.match` is the well known symbol @@match ([Table 1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-1)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-19.4.2.7" class="secnum">[19.4.2.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol.prototype "link to this section")</span> Symbol.prototype
============================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Symbol.prototype` is the intrinsic object %SymbolPrototype% ([19.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-symbol-prototype-object)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-19.4.2.8" class="secnum">[19.4.2.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol.replace "link to this section")</span> Symbol.replace
========================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Symbol.replace` is the well known symbol @@replace ([Table 1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-1)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-19.4.2.9" class="secnum">[19.4.2.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol.search "link to this section")</span> Symbol.search
======================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Symbol.search` is the well known symbol @@search ([Table 1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-1)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-19.4.2.10" class="secnum">[19.4.2.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol.species "link to this section")</span> Symbol.species
==========================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Symbol.species` is the well known symbol @@species ([Table 1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-1)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-19.4.2.11" class="secnum">[19.4.2.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol.split "link to this section")</span> Symbol.split
======================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Symbol.split` is the well known symbol @@split ([Table 1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-1)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-19.4.2.12" class="secnum">[19.4.2.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol.toprimitive "link to this section")</span> Symbol.toPrimitive
==================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Symbol.toPrimitive` is the well known symbol @@toPrimitive ([Table 1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-1)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-19.4.2.13" class="secnum">[19.4.2.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol.tostringtag "link to this section")</span> Symbol.toStringTag
==================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Symbol.toStringTag` is the well known symbol @@toStringTag ([Table 1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-1)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-19.4.2.14" class="secnum">[19.4.2.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol.unscopables "link to this section")</span> Symbol.unscopables
==================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Symbol.unscopables` is the well known symbol @@unscopables ([Table 1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-1)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-19.4.3" class="secnum">[19.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-symbol-prototype-object "link to this section")</span> Properties of the Symbol Prototype Object
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The Symbol prototype object is the intrinsic object %SymbolPrototype%. The Symbol prototype object is an ordinary object. It is not a Symbol instance and does not have a \[\[SymbolData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the Symbol prototype object is the intrinsic object %ObjectPrototype% ([19.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-object-prototype-object)).

<span id="sec-19.4.3.1" class="secnum">[19.4.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol.prototype.constructor "link to this section")</span> Symbol.prototype.constructor
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Symbol.prototype.constructor` is the intrinsic object %Symbol%.

<span id="sec-19.4.3.2" class="secnum">[19.4.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symbol.prototype.tostring "link to this section")</span> Symbol.prototype.toString ( )
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *s* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*s*) is Symbol, let *sym* be *s*.
3.  Else,
    1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*s*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    2.  If *s* does not have a \[\[SymbolData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
    3.  Let *sym* be the value of *s’s* \[\[SymbolData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

4.  Return [SymbolDescriptiveString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symboldescriptivestring)(*sym*).

<span id="sec-19.4.3.2.1" class="secnum">[19.4.3.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-symboldescriptivestring "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: SymbolDescriptiveString ( sym )
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation SymbolDescriptiveString is called with argument sym, the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*sym*) is Symbol.
2.  Let *desc* be *sym’s* \[\[Description\]\] value.
3.  If *desc* is **undefined**, let *desc* be the empty string.
4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*desc*) is String.
5.  Return the result of concatenating the strings `"Symbol("`, *desc*, and `")"`.
