3.  If *t* is **NaN**, let *t* be **+0**.
4.  Let *y* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*year*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*y*).
6.  If *month* is not specified, let *m* be [MonthFromTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-month-number)(*t*); otherwise, let *m* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*month*).
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*m*).
8.  If *date* is not specified, let *dt* be [DateFromTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-date-number)(*t*); otherwise, let *dt* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*date*).
9.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*dt*).
10. Let *newDate* be [MakeDate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makedate)([MakeDay](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makeday)(*y*, *m*, *dt*), [TimeWithinDay](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-day-number-and-time-within-day)(*t*)).
11. Let *v* be [TimeClip](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-timeclip)(*newDate*).
12. Set the \[\[DateValue\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of this Date object to *v*.
13. Return *v*.

The `length` property of the `setUTCFullYear` method is **3**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> If *month* is not specified, this method behaves as if *month* were specified with the value `getUTCMonth()`. If *date* is not specified, it behaves as if *date* were specified with the value `getUTCDate()`.

<span id="sec-20.3.4.30" class="secnum">[20.3.4.30](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-date.prototype.setutchours "link to this section")</span> Date.prototype.setUTCHours ( hour \[ , min \[ , sec \[ , ms \] \] \] )
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are performed:

1.  Let *t* be [this time value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-date-prototype-object).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*t*).
3.  Let *h* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*hour*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*h*).
5.  If *min* is not specified, let *m* be [MinFromTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hours-minutes-second-and-milliseconds)(*t*); otherwise, let *m* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*min*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*m*).
7.  If *sec* is not specified, let *s* be [SecFromTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hours-minutes-second-and-milliseconds)(*t*); otherwise, let *s* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*sec*).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*s*).
9.  If *ms* is not specified, let *milli* be [msFromTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hours-minutes-second-and-milliseconds)(*t*); otherwise, let *milli* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*ms*).
10. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*milli*).
11. Let *newDate* be [MakeDate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makedate)([Day](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-day-number-and-time-within-day)(*t*), [MakeTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-maketime)(*h*, *m*, *s*, *milli*)).
12. Let *v* be [TimeClip](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-timeclip)(*newDate*).
13. Set the \[\[DateValue\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of this Date object to *v*.
14. Return *v*.

The `length` property of the `setUTCHours` method is **4**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> If *min* is not specified, this method behaves as if *min* were specified with the value `getUTCMinutes()`. If *sec* is not specified, it behaves as if *sec* were specified with the value `getUTCSeconds()`. If *ms* is not specified, it behaves as if *ms* were specified with the value `getUTCMilliseconds()`.

<span id="sec-20.3.4.31" class="secnum">[20.3.4.31](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-date.prototype.setutcmilliseconds "link to this section")</span> Date.prototype.setUTCMilliseconds ( ms )
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are performed:

1.  Let *t* be [this time value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-date-prototype-object).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*t*).
3.  Let *milli* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*ms*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*milli*).
5.  Let *time* be [MakeTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-maketime)([HourFromTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hours-minutes-second-and-milliseconds)(*t*), [MinFromTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hours-minutes-second-and-milliseconds)(*t*), [SecFromTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hours-minutes-second-and-milliseconds)(*t*), *milli*).
6.  Let *v* be [TimeClip](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-timeclip)([MakeDate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makedate)([Day](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-day-number-and-time-within-day)(*t*), *time*)).
7.  Set the \[\[DateValue\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of this Date object to *v*.
8.  Return *v*.

<span id="sec-20.3.4.32" class="secnum">[20.3.4.32](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-date.prototype.setutcminutes "link to this section")</span> Date.prototype.setUTCMinutes ( min \[ , sec \[, ms \] \] )
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are performed:

1.  Let *t* be [this time value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-date-prototype-object).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*t*).
3.  Let *m* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*min*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*m*).
5.  If *sec* is not specified, let *s* be [SecFromTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hours-minutes-second-and-milliseconds)(*t*).
6.  Else
    1.  Let *s* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*sec*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*s*).

7.  If *ms* is not specified, let *milli* be [msFromTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hours-minutes-second-and-milliseconds)(*t*).
8.  Else
    1.  Let *milli* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*ms*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*milli*).

9.  Let *date* be [MakeDate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makedate)([Day](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-day-number-and-time-within-day)(*t*), [MakeTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-maketime)([HourFromTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hours-minutes-second-and-milliseconds)(*t*), *m*, *s*, *milli*)).
10. Let *v* be [TimeClip](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-timeclip)(*date*).
11. Set the \[\[DateValue\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of this Date object to *v*.
12. Return *v*.

The `length` property of the `setUTCMinutes` method is **3**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> If *sec* is not specified, this method behaves as if *sec* were specified with the value `getUTCSeconds()`. If *ms* is not specified, it function behaves as if *ms* were specified with the value return by `getUTCMilliseconds()`.

<span id="sec-20.3.4.33" class="secnum">[20.3.4.33](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-date.prototype.setutcmonth "link to this section")</span> Date.prototype.setUTCMonth ( month \[ , date \] )
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*t*).
3.  Let *m* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*month*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*m*).
5.  If *date* is not specified, let *dt* be [DateFromTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-date-number)(*t*).
6.  Else
    1.  Let *dt* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*date*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*dt*).

7.  Let *newDate* be [MakeDate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makedate)([MakeDay](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makeday)([YearFromTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-year-number)(*t*), *m*, *dt*), [TimeWithinDay](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-day-number-and-time-within-day)(*t*)).
8.  Let *v* be [TimeClip](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-timeclip)(*newDate*).
9.  Set the \[\[DateValue\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of this Date object to *v*.

The `length` property of the `setUTCMonth` method is **2**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> If *date* is not specified, this method behaves as if *date* were specified with the value `getUTCDate()`.

<span id="sec-20.3.4.34" class="secnum">[20.3.4.34](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-date.prototype.setutcseconds "link to this section")</span> Date.prototype.setUTCSeconds ( sec \[ , ms \] )
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are performed:

1.  Let *t* be [this time value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-date-prototype-object).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*t*).
3.  Let *s* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*sec*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*s*).
5.  If *ms* is not specified, let *milli* be [msFromTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hours-minutes-second-and-milliseconds)(*t*).
6.  Else
    1.  Let *milli* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*ms*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*milli*).

7.  Let *date* be [MakeDate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-makedate)([Day](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-day-number-and-time-within-day)(*t*), [MakeTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-maketime)([HourFromTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hours-minutes-second-and-milliseconds)(*t*), [MinFromTime](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hours-minutes-second-and-milliseconds)(*t*), *s*, *milli*)).
