<span id="sec-21.2.2.7" class="secnum">[21.2.2.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-quantifier "link to this section")</span> Quantifier
================================================================================================================================================================

The production <span class="prod">*Quantifier* <span class="geq">::</span> *QuantifierPrefix*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Evaluate *QuantifierPrefix* to obtain the two results: an integer *min* and an integer (or ∞) *max*.
2.  Return the three results *min*, *max*, and **true**.

The production <span class="prod">*Quantifier* <span class="geq">::</span> *QuantifierPrefix* `?`</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Evaluate *QuantifierPrefix* to obtain the two results: an integer *min* and an integer (or ∞) *max*.
2.  Return the three results *min*, *max*, and **false**.

The production <span class="prod">*QuantifierPrefix* <span class="geq">::</span> `*`</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the two results 0 and ∞.

The production <span class="prod">*QuantifierPrefix* <span class="geq">::</span> `+`</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the two results 1 and ∞.

The production <span class="prod">*QuantifierPrefix* <span class="geq">::</span> `?`</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the two results 0 and 1.

The production <span class="prod">*QuantifierPrefix* <span class="geq">::</span> `{` *DecimalDigits* `}`</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Let *i* be the MV of *DecimalDigits* ([see 11.8.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-literals-numeric-literals)).
2.  Return the two results *i* and *i*.

The production <span class="prod">*QuantifierPrefix* <span class="geq">::</span> `{` *DecimalDigits* `,` `}`</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Let *i* be the MV of *DecimalDigits*.
2.  Return the two results *i* and ∞.

The production <span class="prod">*QuantifierPrefix* <span class="geq">::</span> `{` *DecimalDigits* `,` *DecimalDigits* `}`</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Let *i* be the MV of the first *DecimalDigits*.
2.  Let *j* be the MV of the second *DecimalDigits*.
3.  Return the two results *i* and *j*.

<span id="sec-21.2.2.8" class="secnum">[21.2.2.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-atom "link to this section")</span> Atom
====================================================================================================================================================

The production <span class="prod">*Atom* <span class="geq">::</span> *PatternCharacter*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Let *ch* be the character matched by *PatternCharacter*.
2.  Let *A* be a one-element CharSet containing the character *ch*.
3.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) CharacterSetMatcher(*A*, **false**) and return its Matcher result.

The production <span class="prod">*Atom* <span class="geq">::</span> `.`</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Let *A* be the set of all characters except *LineTerminator*.
2.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) CharacterSetMatcher(*A*, **false**) and return its Matcher result.

The production <span class="prod">*Atom* <span class="geq">::</span> `\` *AtomEscape*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the Matcher that is the result of evaluating *AtomEscape*.

The production <span class="prod">*Atom* <span class="geq">::</span> *CharacterClass*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Evaluate *CharacterClass* to obtain a CharSet *A* and a Boolean *invert*.
2.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) CharacterSetMatcher(*A*, *invert*) and return its Matcher result.

The production <span class="prod">*Atom* <span class="geq">::</span> `(` *Disjunction* `)`</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Evaluate *Disjunction* to obtain a Matcher *m*.
2.  Let *parenIndex* be the number of left capturing parentheses in the entire regular expression that occur to the left of this production expansion's initial left parenthesis. This is the total number of times the <span class="prod">*Atom* <span class="geq">::</span> `(` *Disjunction* `)`</span> production is expanded prior to this production's *Atom* plus the total number of <span class="prod">*Atom* <span class="geq">::</span> `(` *Disjunction* `)`</span> productions enclosing this *Atom*.
3.  Return an internal Matcher closure that takes two arguments, a State *x* and a Continuation *c*, and performs the following steps:
    1.  Create an internal Continuation closure *d* that takes one State argument *y* and performs the following steps:
        1.  Let *cap* be a fresh copy of *y*'s *captures* [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
        2.  Let *xe* be *x*'s *endIndex*.
        3.  Let *ye* be *y*'s *endIndex*.
        4.  Let *s* be a fresh [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) whose characters are the characters of *Input* at indices *xe* (inclusive) through *ye* (exclusive).
        5.  Set *cap*\[*parenIndex*+1\] to *s*.
        6.  Let *z* be the State (*ye*, *cap*).
        7.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *c*(*z*) and return its result.

    2.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *m*(*x*, *d*) and return its result.

The production <span class="prod">*Atom* <span class="geq">::</span> `(` `?` `:` *Disjunction* `)`</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the Matcher that is the result of evaluating *Disjunction*.

<span id="sec-21.2.2.8.1" class="secnum">[21.2.2.8.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-runtime-semantics-charactersetmatcher-abstract-operation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: CharacterSetMatcher Abstract Operation
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation CharacterSetMatcher takes two arguments, a CharSet A and a Boolean flag invert, and performs the following steps:

1.  Return an internal Matcher closure that takes two arguments, a State *x* and a Continuation *c*, and performs the following steps when evaluated:
    1.  Let *e* be *x*'s *endIndex*.
    2.  If *e* is *InputLength*, return **failure**.
    3.  Let *ch* be the character *Input*\[*e*\].
    4.  Let *cc* be Canonicalize(*ch*).
    5.  If *invert* is **false**, then
        1.  If there does not exist a member *a* of set *A* such that Canonicalize(*a*) is *cc*, return **failure**.

    6.  Else *invert* is **true**,
        1.  If there exists a member *a* of set *A* such that Canonicalize(*a*) is *cc*, return **failure.**

    7.  Let *cap* be *x*'s *captures* [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
    8.  Let *y* be the State (*e*+1, *cap*).
    9.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *c*(*y*) and return its result.

<span id="sec-21.2.2.8.2" class="secnum">[21.2.2.8.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-runtime-semantics-canonicalize-ch "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: Canonicalize ( ch )
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation Canonicalize takes a character parameter ch and performs the following steps:

1.  If *IgnoreCase* is **false**, return *ch*.
2.  If *Unicode* is **true**,
    1.  If the file CaseFolding.txt of the Unicode Character Database provides a simple or common case folding mapping for *ch*, return the result of applying that mapping to *ch*.
    2.  Else, return *ch.*

3.  Else,
    1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *ch* is a UTF-16 code unit.
    2.  Let *s* be the ECMAScript String value consisting of the single code unit *ch*.
    3.  Let *u* be the same result produced as if by performing the algorithm for `String.prototype.toUpperCase` using *s* as the **this** value.
    4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *u* is a String value.
    5.  If *u* does not consist of a single code unit, return *ch*.
    6.  Let *cu* be *u*’s single code unit element.
    7.  If *ch*'s code unit value ≥ 128 and *cu*'s code unit value &lt; 128, return *ch*.
    8.  Return *cu*.

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> Parentheses of the form `(` *Disjunction* `)` serve both to group the components of the *Disjunction* pattern together and to save the result of the match. The result can be used either in a backreference (`\` followed by a nonzero decimal number), referenced in a replace String, or returned as part of an array from the regular expression matching internal procedure. To inhibit the capturing behaviour of parentheses, use the form `(?:` *Disjunction* `)` instead.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> The form `(?=` *Disjunction* `)` specifies a zero-width positive lookahead. In order for it to succeed, the pattern inside *Disjunction* must match at the current position, but the current position is not advanced before matching the sequel. If *Disjunction* can match at the current position in several ways, only the first one is tried. Unlike other regular expression operators, there is no backtracking into a `(?=` form (this unusual behaviour is inherited from Perl). This only matters when the *Disjunction* contains capturing parentheses and the sequel of the pattern contains backreferences to those captures.

For example,

    /(?=(a+))/.exec("baaabac")

matches the empty String immediately after the first `b` and therefore returns the array:

    ["", "aaa"]

To illustrate the lack of backtracking into the lookahead, consider:

    /(?=(a+))a*b\1/.exec("baaabac")

This expression returns

    ["aba", "a"]

and not:

    ["aaaba", "a"]

<span class="nh">NOTE 3</span> The form `(?!` *Disjunction* `)` specifies a zero-width negative lookahead. In order for it to succeed, the pattern inside *Disjunction* must fail to match at the current position. The current position is not advanced before matching the sequel. *Disjunction* can contain capturing parentheses, but backreferences to them only make sense from within *Disjunction* itself. Backreferences to these capturing parentheses from elsewhere in the pattern always return **undefined** because the negative lookahead must fail for the pattern to succeed. For example,

    /(.*?)a(?!(a+)b\2c)\2(.*)/.exec("baaabaac")

looks for an `a` not immediately followed by some positive number n of `a`'s, a `b`, another n `a`'s (specified by the first `\2`) and a `c`. The second `\2` is outside the negative lookahead, so it matches against **undefined** and therefore always succeeds. The whole expression returns the array:

    ["baaabaac", "ba", undefined, "abaac"]

<span class="nh">NOTE 4</span> In case-insignificant matches when *Unicode* is **true**, all characters are implicitly case-folded using the simple mapping provided by the Unicode standard immediately before they are compared. The simple mapping always maps to a single code point, so it does not map, for example, `"ß"` (U+00DF) to `"SS"`. It may however map a code point outside the Basic Latin range to a character within, for example, `"`<span style="font-family: sans-serif">ſ</span>`"` (U+017F) to `"`s`"`. Such characters are not mapped if *Unicode* is **false**. This prevents Unicode code points such as U+017F and U+212A from matching regular expressions such as `/[a‑z]/i`, but they will match `/[a‑z]/ui`.

<span id="sec-21.2.2.9" class="secnum">[21.2.2.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-atomescape "link to this section")</span> AtomEscape
================================================================================================================================================================

The production <span class="prod">*AtomEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> *DecimalEscape*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Evaluate *DecimalEscape* to obtain an EscapeValue *E*.
2.  If *E* is a character, then
    1.  Let *ch* be *E*'s character.
    2.  Let *A* be a one-element CharSet containing the character *ch*.
    3.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) CharacterSetMatcher(*A*, **false**) and return its Matcher result.

3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *E* must be an integer.
4.  Let *n* be that integer.
5.  If *n*=0 or *n*&gt;*NcapturingParens*, throw a **SyntaxError** exception.
6.  Return an internal Matcher closure that takes two arguments, a State *x* and a Continuation *c*, and performs the following steps:
    1.  Let *cap* be *x*'s *captures* [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
    2.  Let *s* be *cap*\[*n*\].
    3.  If *s* is **undefined**, return *c*(*x*).
    4.  Let *e* be *x*'s *endIndex*.
    5.  Let *len* be *s*'s length.
    6.  Let *f* be *e*+*len*.
    7.  If *f*&gt;*InputLength*, return **failure**.
    8.  If there exists an integer *i* between 0 (inclusive) and *len* (exclusive) such that Canonicalize(*s*\[*i*\]) is not the same character value as Canonicalize(*Input* \[*e*+*i*\]), return **failure**.
    9.  Let *y* be the State (*f*, *cap*).
    10. [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) *c*(*y*) and return its result.

The production <span class="prod">*AtomEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> *CharacterEscape*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Evaluate *CharacterEscape* to obtain a character *ch*.
2.  Let *A* be a one-element CharSet containing the character *ch*.
3.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) CharacterSetMatcher(*A*, **false**) and return its Matcher result.

The production <span class="prod">*AtomEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> *CharacterClassEscape*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Evaluate *CharacterClassEscape* to obtain a CharSet *A*.
2.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) CharacterSetMatcher(*A*, **false**) and return its Matcher result.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> An escape sequence of the form `\` followed by a nonzero decimal number *n* matches the result of the *n*th set of capturing parentheses ([see 21.2.2.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-decimalescape)). It is an error if the regular expression has fewer than *n* capturing parentheses. If the regular expression has *n* or more capturing parentheses but the *n*th one is **undefined** because it has not captured anything, then the backreference always succeeds.

<span id="sec-21.2.2.10" class="secnum">[21.2.2.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-characterescape "link to this section")</span> CharacterEscape
============================================================================================================================================================================

The production <span class="prod">*CharacterEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> *ControlEscape*</span> evaluates by returning the character according to [Table 47](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-47).

<span id="table-47">Table 47</span> — ControlEscape Character Values

| ControlEscape | Character Value | Code Point | Unicode Name         | Symbol     |
|---------------|-----------------|------------|----------------------|------------|
| `t`           | 9               | `U+0009`   | CHARACTER TABULATION | &lt;HT&gt; |
| `n`           | 10              | `U+000A`   | LINE FEED (LF)       | &lt;LF&gt; |
| `v`           | 11              | `U+000B`   | LINE TABULATION      | &lt;VT&gt; |
| `f`           | 12              | `U+000C`   | FORM FEED (FF)       | &lt;FF&gt; |
| `r`           | 13              | `U+000D`   | CARRIAGE RETURN (CR) | &lt;CR&gt; |

The production <span class="prod">*CharacterEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> `c` *ControlLetter*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Let *ch* be the character matched by *ControlLetter*.
2.  Let *i* be *ch*'s character value.
3.  Let *j* be the remainder of dividing *i* by 32.
4.  Return the character whose character value is *j*.

The production <span class="prod">*CharacterEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> *HexEscapeSequence*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the character whose code is the SV of *HexEscapeSequence*.

The production <span class="prod">*CharacterEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> *RegExpUnicodeEscapeSequence*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the result of evaluating *RegExpUnicodeEscapeSequence*.

The production <span class="prod">*CharacterEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> *IdentityEscape*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the character matched by *IdentityEscape*.

The production <span class="prod">*RegExpUnicodeEscapeSequence* <span class="geq">::</span> `u` *LeadSurrogate* `\u` *TrailSurrogate*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Let *lead* be the result of evaluating *LeadSurrogate*.
2.  Let *trail* be the result of evaluating *TrailSurrogate*.
3.  Let *cp* be [UTF16Decode](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-utf16decode)(*lead*, *trail*).
4.  Return the character whose character value is *cp*.

The production <span class="prod">*RegExpUnicodeEscapeSequence* <span class="geq">::</span> `u` *LeadSurrogate*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the character whose code is the result of evaluating *LeadSurrogate*.

The production <span class="prod">*RegExpUnicodeEscapeSequence* <span class="geq">::</span> `u` *TailSurrogate*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the character whose code is the result of evaluating *TailSurrogate*.

The production <span class="prod">*RegExpUnicodeEscapeSequence* <span class="geq">::</span> `u` *NonSurrogate*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the character whose code is the result of evaluating *NonSurrogate*.

The production <span class="prod">*RegExpUnicodeEscapeSequence* <span class="geq">::</span> `u` *Hex4Digits*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the character whose code is the SV of *Hex4Digits*.

The production <span class="prod">*RegExpUnicodeEscapeSequence* <span class="geq">::</span> `u{` *HexDigits* `}`</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the character whose code is the MV of *HexDigits*.

The production <span class="prod">*LeadSurrogate* <span class="geq">::</span> *Hex4Digits*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the character whose code is the SV of *Hex4Digits*.

The production <span class="prod">*TrailSurrogate* <span class="geq">::</span> *Hex4Digits*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the character whose code is the SV of *Hex4Digits*.

The production <span class="prod">*NonSurrogate* <span class="geq">::</span> *Hex4Digits*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the character whose code is the SV of *Hex4Digits*.

<span id="sec-21.2.2.11" class="secnum">[21.2.2.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-decimalescape "link to this section")</span> DecimalEscape
========================================================================================================================================================================

The production <span class="prod">*DecimalEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> *DecimalIntegerLiteral*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Let *i* be the MV of *DecimalIntegerLiteral*.
2.  If *i* is zero, return the EscapeValue consisting of the character U+0000 (NULL).
3.  Return the EscapeValue consisting of the integer *i*.

The definition of “the MV of *DecimalIntegerLiteral*” is in [11.8.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-literals-numeric-literals).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> If `\` is followed by a decimal number *n* whose first digit is not `0`, then the escape sequence is considered to be a backreference. It is an error if *n* is greater than the total number of left capturing parentheses in the entire regular expression. `\0` represents the &lt;NUL&gt; character and cannot be followed by a decimal digit.

<span id="sec-21.2.2.12" class="secnum">[21.2.2.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-characterclassescape "link to this section")</span> CharacterClassEscape
======================================================================================================================================================================================

The production <span class="prod">*CharacterClassEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> `d`</span> evaluates by returning the ten-element set of characters containing the characters `0` through `9` inclusive.

The production <span class="prod">*CharacterClassEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> `D`</span> evaluates by returning the set of all characters not included in the set returned by <span class="prod">*CharacterClassEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> `d`</span> .

The production <span class="prod">*CharacterClassEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> `s`</span> evaluates by returning the set of characters containing the characters that are on the right-hand side of the *WhiteSpace* ([11.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-white-space)) or *LineTerminator* ([11.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-line-terminators)) productions.

The production <span class="prod">*CharacterClassEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> `S`</span> evaluates by returning the set of all characters not included in the set returned by <span class="prod">*CharacterClassEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> `s`</span> .

The production <span class="prod">*CharacterClassEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> `w`</span> evaluates by returning the set of characters containing the sixty-three characters:

The production <span class="prod">*CharacterClassEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> `W`</span> evaluates by returning the set of all characters not included in the set returned by <span class="prod">*CharacterClassEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> `w`</span> .

<span id="sec-21.2.2.13" class="secnum">[21.2.2.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-characterclass "link to this section")</span> CharacterClass
==========================================================================================================================================================================

The production <span class="prod">*CharacterClass* <span class="geq">::</span> `[` *ClassRanges* `]`</span> evaluates by evaluating *ClassRanges* to obtain a CharSet and returning that CharSet and the Boolean **false**.

The production <span class="prod">*CharacterClass* <span class="geq">::</span> `[` `^` *ClassRanges* `]`</span> evaluates by evaluating *ClassRanges* to obtain a CharSet and returning that CharSet and the Boolean **true**.

<span id="sec-21.2.2.14" class="secnum">[21.2.2.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-classranges "link to this section")</span> ClassRanges
====================================================================================================================================================================

The production <span class="prod">*ClassRanges* <span class="geq">::</span> <span class="grhsannot">\[empty\]</span></span> evaluates by returning the empty CharSet.

The production <span class="prod">*ClassRanges* <span class="geq">::</span> *NonemptyClassRanges*</span> evaluates by evaluating *NonemptyClassRanges* to obtain a CharSet and returning that CharSet.

<span id="sec-21.2.2.15" class="secnum">[21.2.2.15](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-nonemptyclassranges "link to this section")</span> NonemptyClassRanges
====================================================================================================================================================================================

The production <span class="prod">*NonemptyClassRanges* <span class="geq">::</span> *ClassAtom*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the CharSet that is the result of evaluating *ClassAtom*.

The production <span class="prod">*NonemptyClassRanges* <span class="geq">::</span> *ClassAtom* *NonemptyClassRangesNoDash*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Evaluate *ClassAtom* to obtain a CharSet *A*.
2.  Evaluate *NonemptyClassRangesNoDash* to obtain a CharSet *B*.
3.  Return the union of CharSets *A* and *B*.

The production <span class="prod">*NonemptyClassRanges* <span class="geq">::</span> *ClassAtom* `-` *ClassAtom* *ClassRanges*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Evaluate the first *ClassAtom* to obtain a CharSet *A*.
2.  Evaluate the second *ClassAtom* to obtain a CharSet *B*.
3.  Evaluate *ClassRanges* to obtain a CharSet *C*.
4.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) CharacterRange(*A*, *B*) and let *D* be the resulting CharSet.
5.  Return the union of CharSets *D* and *C*.

<span id="sec-21.2.2.15.1" class="secnum">[21.2.2.15.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-runtime-semantics-characterrange-abstract-operation "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: CharacterRange Abstract Operation
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation CharacterRange takes two CharSet parameters A and B and performs the following steps:

1.  If *A* does not contain exactly one character or *B* does not contain exactly one character, throw a **SyntaxError** exception.
2.  Let *a* be the one character in CharSet *A*.
3.  Let *b* be the one character in CharSet *B*.
4.  Let *i* be the character value of character *a*.
5.  Let *j* be the character value of character *b*.
6.  If *i* &gt; *j*, throw a **SyntaxError** exception.
7.  Return the set containing all characters numbered *i* through *j*, inclusive.

<span id="sec-21.2.2.16" class="secnum">[21.2.2.16](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-nonemptyclassrangesnodash "link to this section")</span> NonemptyClassRangesNoDash
================================================================================================================================================================================================

The production <span class="prod">*NonemptyClassRangesNoDash* <span class="geq">::</span> *ClassAtom*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the CharSet that is the result of evaluating *ClassAtom*.

The production <span class="prod">*NonemptyClassRangesNoDash* <span class="geq">::</span> *ClassAtomNoDash* *NonemptyClassRangesNoDash*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Evaluate *ClassAtomNoDash* to obtain a CharSet *A*.
2.  Evaluate *NonemptyClassRangesNoDash* to obtain a CharSet *B*.
3.  Return the union of CharSets *A* and *B*.

The production <span class="prod">*NonemptyClassRangesNoDash* <span class="geq">::</span> *ClassAtomNoDash* `-` *ClassAtom* *ClassRanges*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Evaluate *ClassAtomNoDash* to obtain a CharSet *A*.
2.  Evaluate *ClassAtom* to obtain a CharSet *B*.
3.  Evaluate *ClassRanges* to obtain a CharSet *C*.
4.  [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call) CharacterRange(*A*, *B*) and let *D* be the resulting CharSet.
5.  Return the union of CharSets *D* and *C*.

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> *ClassRanges* can expand into single *ClassAtoms* and/or ranges of two *ClassAtoms* separated by dashes. In the latter case the *ClassRanges* includes all characters between the first *ClassAtom* and the second *ClassAtom*, inclusive; an error occurs if either *ClassAtom* does not represent a single character (for example, if one is `\w`) or if the first *ClassAtom's* character value is greater than the second *ClassAtom's* character value.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> Even if the pattern ignores case, the case of the two ends of a range is significant in determining which characters belong to the range. Thus, for example, the pattern `/[E-F]/i` matches only the letters `E`, `F`, `e`, and `f`, while the pattern `/[E-f]/i` matches all upper and lower-case letters in the Unicode Basic Latin block as well as the symbols `[`, `\`, `]`, `^`, `_`, and `` ` ``.

<span class="nh">NOTE 3</span> A `-` character can be treated literally or it can denote a range. It is treated literally if it is the first or last character of *ClassRanges*, the beginning or end limit of a range specification, or immediately follows a range specification.

<span id="sec-21.2.2.17" class="secnum">[21.2.2.17](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-classatom "link to this section")</span> ClassAtom
================================================================================================================================================================

The production <span class="prod">*ClassAtom* <span class="geq">::</span> `-`</span> evaluates by returning the CharSet containing the one character `-`.

The production <span class="prod">*ClassAtom* <span class="geq">::</span> *ClassAtomNoDash*</span> evaluates by evaluating *ClassAtomNoDash* to obtain a CharSet and returning that CharSet.

<span id="sec-21.2.2.18" class="secnum">[21.2.2.18](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-classatomnodash "link to this section")</span> ClassAtomNoDash
============================================================================================================================================================================

The production <span class="prod">*ClassAtomNoDash* <span class="geq">::</span> *SourceCharacter* <span class="grhsmod">but not one of</span> `\` <span class="grhsmod">or</span> `]` <span class="grhsmod">or</span> `-`</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the CharSet containing the character matched by *SourceCharacter*.

The production <span class="prod">*ClassAtomNoDash* <span class="geq">::</span> `\` *ClassEscape*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the CharSet that is the result of evaluating *ClassEscape*.

<span id="sec-21.2.2.19" class="secnum">[21.2.2.19](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-classescape "link to this section")</span> ClassEscape
====================================================================================================================================================================

The production <span class="prod">*ClassEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> *DecimalEscape*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Evaluate *DecimalEscape* to obtain an EscapeValue *E*.
2.  If *E* is not a character, throw a **SyntaxError** exception.
3.  Let *ch* be *E*'s character.
4.  Return the one-element CharSet containing the character *ch*.

The production <span class="prod">*ClassEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> `b`</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the CharSet containing the single character &lt;BS&gt; U+0008 (BACKSPACE).

The production <span class="prod">*ClassEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> `-`</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the CharSet containing the single character - U+002D (HYPEN-MINUS).

The production <span class="prod">*ClassEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> *CharacterEscape*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the CharSet containing the single character that is the result of evaluating *CharacterEscape*.

The production <span class="prod">*ClassEscape* <span class="geq">::</span> *CharacterClassEscape*</span> evaluates as follows:

1.  Return the CharSet that is the result of evaluating *CharacterClassEscape*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> A *ClassAtom* can use any of the escape sequences that are allowed in the rest of the regular expression except for `\b`, `\B`, and backreferences. Inside a *CharacterClass*, `\b` means the backspace character, while `\B` and backreferences raise errors. Using a backreference inside a *ClassAtom* causes an error.

<span id="sec-21.2.3" class="secnum">[21.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexp-constructor "link to this section")</span> The RegExp Constructor
================================================================================================================================================================================

The RegExp constructor is the %RegExp% intrinsic object and the initial value of the `RegExp` property of the global object. When `RegExp` is called as a function rather than as a constructor, it creates and initializes a new RegExp object. Thus the function call `RegExp(…)` is equivalent to the object creation expression `new RegExp(…)` with the same arguments.

The `RegExp` constructor is designed to be subclassable. It may be used as the value of an `extends` clause of a class definition. Subclass constructors that intend to inherit the specified `RegExp` behaviour must include a `super` call to the `RegExp` constructor to create and initialize subclass instances with the necessary internal slots.

<span id="sec-21.2.3.1" class="secnum">[21.2.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexp-pattern-flags "link to this section")</span> RegExp ( pattern, flags )
=========================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *patternIsRegExp* be [IsRegExp](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isregexp)(*pattern*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*patternIsRegExp*).
3.  If NewTarget is not **undefined**, let *newTarget* be NewTarget.
4.  Else,
    1.  Let *newTarget* be the active function object.
    2.  If *patternIsRegExp* is **true** and *flags* is **undefined**, then
        1.  Let *patternConstructor* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*pattern*, `"constructor"`).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*patternConstructor*).
        3.  If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*newTarget*, *patternConstructor*) is **true**, return *pattern*.

5.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*pattern*) is Object and *pattern* has a \[\[RegExpMatcher\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), then
    1.  Let *P* be the value of *pattern’s* \[\[OriginalSource\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
    2.  If *flags* is **undefined**, let *F* be the value of *pattern’s* \[\[OriginalFlags\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
    3.  Else, let *F* be *flags*.

6.  Else if *patternIsRegExp* is **true**, then
    1.  Let *P* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*pattern*, `"source"`).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*P*).
    3.  If *flags* is **undefined**, then
        1.  Let *F* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*pattern*, `"flags"`).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*F*).

    4.  Else, let *F* be *flags*.

7.  Else,
    1.  Let *P* be *pattern*.
    2.  Let *F* be *flags*.

8.  Let *O* be [RegExpAlloc](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpalloc)(*newTarget*).
9.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
10. Return [RegExpInitialize](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpinitialize)(*O,* *P*, *F*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> If pattern is supplied using a *StringLiteral*, the usual escape sequence substitutions are performed before the String is processed by RegExp. If pattern must contain an escape sequence to be recognized by RegExp, any U+005C (REVERSE SOLIDUS) code points must be escaped within the *StringLiteral* to prevent them being removed when the contents of the *StringLiteral* are formed.

<span id="sec-21.2.3.2" class="secnum">[21.2.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-operations-for-the-regexp-constructor "link to this section")</span> Abstract Operations for the RegExp Constructor
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-21.2.3.2.1" class="secnum">[21.2.3.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpalloc "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: RegExpAlloc ( newTarget )
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation RegExpAlloc with argument newTarget is called, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *obj* be [OrdinaryCreateFromConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarycreatefromconstructor)(*newTarget*, `"%RegExpPrototype%"`, «‍\[\[RegExpMatcher\]\], \[\[OriginalSource\]\], \[\[OriginalFlags\]\]»).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*obj*).
3.  Let *status* be [DefinePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-definepropertyorthrow)(*obj*, `"lastIndex"`, PropertyDescriptor {\[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false**}).
4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
5.  Return *obj*.

<span id="sec-21.2.3.2.2" class="secnum">[21.2.3.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpinitialize "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: RegExpInitialize ( obj, pattern, flags )
===========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation RegExpInitialize with arguments *<span style="font-family: Times New
          Roman">obj</span>,* pattern, and flags is called, the following steps are taken:

1.  If *pattern* is **undefined**, let *P* be the empty String.
2.  Else, let *P* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*pattern*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*P*).
4.  If *flags* is **undefined**, let *F* be the empty String.
5.  Else, let *F* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*flags*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*F*).
7.  If *F* contains any code unit other than `"g"`, `"i"`, `"m"`, `"u"`, or `"y"` or if it contains the same code unit more than once, throw a **SyntaxError** exception.
8.  If *F* contains `"u"`, let *BMP* be **false**; else let *BMP* be **true**.
9.  If *BMP* is **true**, then
    1.  Parse *P* using the grammars in [21.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-patterns) and interpreting each of its 16-bit elements as a Unicode BMP code point. UTF-16 decoding is not applied to the elements. The goal symbol for the parse is *Pattern*. Throw a **SyntaxError** exception if *P* did not conform to the grammar, if any elements of *P* were not matched by the parse, or if any Early Error conditions exist.
    2.  Let *patternCharacters* be a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) whose elements are the code unit elements of *P.*

10. Else
    1.  Parse *P* using the grammars in [21.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-patterns) and interpreting *P* as UTF-16 encoded Unicode code points ([6.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types-string-type)). The goal symbol for the parse is *Pattern*<sub>\[U\]</sub>. Throw a **SyntaxError** exception if *P* did not conform to the grammar, if any elements of *P* were not matched by the parse, or if any Early Error conditions exist.
    2.  Let *patternCharacters* be a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) whose elements are the code points resulting from applying UTF-16 decoding to *P*’s sequence of elements.

11. Set the value of *obj’s* \[\[OriginalSource\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *P*.
12. Set the value of *obj’s* \[\[OriginalFlags\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *F*.
13. Set *obj’s* \[\[RegExpMatcher\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to the internal procedure that evaluates the above parse of *P* by applying the semantics provided in [21.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-pattern-semantics) using *patternCharacters* as the pattern’s [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of *SourceCharacter* values and *F* as the flag parameters.
14. Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*obj*, `"lastIndex"`, 0, **true**).
15. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
16. Return *obj*.

<span id="sec-21.2.3.2.3" class="secnum">[21.2.3.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpcreate "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: RegExpCreate ( P, F )
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation RegExpCreate with arguments P and F is called, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *obj* be [RegExpAlloc](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpalloc)(%RegExp%).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*obj*).
3.  Return [RegExpInitialize](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpinitialize)(*obj,* *P*, *F*).

<span id="sec-21.2.3.2.4" class="secnum">[21.2.3.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-escaperegexppattern "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: EscapeRegExpPattern ( P, F )
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the abstract operation EscapeRegExpPattern with arguments P and F is called, the following occurs:

1.  Let *S* be a String in the form of a *Pattern* (*Pattern*<sub>\[U\]</sub> if *F* contains `"u"`<span style="font-family: sans-serif">)</span> equivalent to *P* interpreted as UTF-16 encoded Unicode code points ([6.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types-string-type)), in which certain code points are escaped as described below. *S* may or may not be identical to *P*; however, the internal procedure that would result from evaluating *S* as a *Pattern* (*Pattern*<sub>\[U\]</sub> if *F* contains `"u"`<span style="font-family: sans-serif">)</span> must behave identically to the internal procedure given by the constructed object's \[\[RegExpMatcher\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots). Multiple calls to this abstract operation using the same values for *P* and *F* must produce identical results.
2.  The code points `/` or any *LineTerminator* occurring in the pattern shall be escaped in *S* as necessary to ensure that the String value formed by concatenating the Strings `"/"`, *S*, `"/"`, and *F* can be parsed (in an appropriate lexical context) as a *RegularExpressionLiteral* that behaves identically to the constructed regular expression. For example, if *P* is `"/"`, then *S* could be `"\/"` or `"\u002F"`, among other possibilities, but not `"/"`, because `///` followed by *F* would be parsed as a *SingleLineComment* rather than a *RegularExpressionLiteral*. If *P* is the empty String, this specification can be met by letting *S* be `"(?:)"`.
3.  Return *S*.

<span id="sec-21.2.4" class="secnum">[21.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-regexp-constructor "link to this section")</span> Properties of the RegExp Constructor
================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the RegExp constructor is the intrinsic object %FunctionPrototype% ([19.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-function-prototype-object)).

Besides the `length` property (whose value is **2**), the RegExp constructor has the following properties:

<span id="sec-21.2.4.1" class="secnum">[21.2.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexp.prototype "link to this section")</span> RegExp.prototype
============================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `RegExp.prototype` is the intrinsic object %RegExpPrototype% ([21.2.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-regexp-prototype-object)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-21.2.4.2" class="secnum">[21.2.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-regexp-@@species "link to this section")</span> get RegExp \[ @@species \]
==========================================================================================================================================================================================

`RegExp[@@species]` is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Return the **this** value.

The value of the `name` property of this function is `"get` `[Symbol.species]"`.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> RegExp prototype methods normally use their `this` object’s constructor to create a derived object. However, a subclass constructor may over-ride that default behaviour by redefining its @@species property.

<span id="sec-21.2.5" class="secnum">[21.2.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-regexp-prototype-object "link to this section")</span> Properties of the RegExp Prototype Object
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The RegExp prototype object is the intrinsic object %RegExpPrototype%. The RegExp prototype object is an ordinary object. It is not a RegExp instance and does not have a \[\[RegExpMatcher\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) or any of the other internal slots of RegExp instance objects.

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the RegExp prototype object is the intrinsic object %ObjectPrototype% ([19.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-object-prototype-object)).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The RegExp prototype object does not have a `valueOf` property of its own; however, it inherits the `valueOf` property from the Object prototype object.

<span id="sec-21.2.5.1" class="secnum">[21.2.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexp.prototype.constructor "link to this section")</span> RegExp.prototype.constructor
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `RegExp.prototype.constructor` is the intrinsic object %RegExp%.

<span id="sec-21.2.5.2" class="secnum">[21.2.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexp.prototype.exec "link to this section")</span> RegExp.prototype.exec ( string )
=================================================================================================================================================================================================

Performs a regular expression match of string against the regular expression and returns an Array object containing the results of the match, or **null** if string did not match.

The String <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">[ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*string*)</span> is searched for an occurrence of the regular expression pattern as follows:

1.  Let *R* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*R*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *R* does not have a \[\[RegExpMatcher\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *S* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*string*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*S*).
6.  Return [RegExpBuiltinExec](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpbuiltinexec)(*R*, *S*).

<span id="sec-21.2.5.2.1" class="secnum">[21.2.5.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpexec "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: RegExpExec ( R, S )
================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation RegExpExec with arguments R and S performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*R*) is Object.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*S*) is String.
3.  Let *exec* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*R*, `"exec"`).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*exec*).
5.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*exec*) is **true**, then
    1.  Let *result* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*exec*, *R*, «*S*»).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*result*).
    3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*result*) is neither Object or Null, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    4.  Return *result*.

6.  If *R* does not have a \[\[RegExpMatcher\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
7.  Return [RegExpBuiltinExec](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpbuiltinexec)(*R*, *S*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> If a callable `exec` property is not found this algorithm falls back to attempting to use the built-in RegExp matching algorithm. This provides compatible behaviour for code written for prior editions where most built-in algorithms that use regular expressions did not perform a dynamic property lookup of `exec`.

<span id="sec-21.2.5.2.2" class="secnum">[21.2.5.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpbuiltinexec "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: RegExpBuiltinExec ( R, S )
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation RegExpBuiltinExec with arguments R and S performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *R* is an initialized RegExp instance.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*S*) is String.
3.  Let *length* be the number of code units in *S*.
4.  Let *lastIndex* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*R*,`"lastIndex"`)).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lastIndex*).
6.  Let *global* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*R*, `"global"`)).
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*global*).
8.  Let *sticky* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*R*, `"sticky"`)).
9.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*sticky*).
10. If *global* is **false** and *sticky* is **false**, let *lastIndex* be 0.
11. Let *matcher* be the value of *R’s* \[\[RegExpMatcher\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
12. Let *flags* be the value of *R’s* \[\[OriginalFlags\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
13. If *flags* contains `"u"`, let *fullUnicode* be **true**, else let *fullUnicode* be **false.**
14. Let *matchSucceeded* be **false**.
15. Repeat, while *matchSucceeded* is **false**
    1.  If *lastIndex* &gt; *length*, then
        1.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*R*, `"lastIndex"`, 0, **true**).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
        3.  Return **null**.

    2.  Let *r* be *matcher*(*S*, *lastIndex*).
    3.  If *r* is **failure**, then
        1.  If *sticky* is **true**, then
            1.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*R*, `"lastIndex"`, 0, **true**).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
            3.  Return **null**.

        2.  Let *lastIndex* be [AdvanceStringIndex](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-advancestringindex)(*S*, *lastIndex*, *fullUnicode*).

    4.  Else,
        1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *r* is a State.
        2.  Set *matchSucceeded* to **true**.

16. Let *e* be *r*'s *endIndex* value.
17. If *fullUnicode* is **true**, then
    1.  *e* is an index into the *Input* character list, derived from *S*, matched by *matcher*. Let *eUTF* be the smallest index into *S* that corresponds to the character at element *e* of *Input*. If *e* is greater than or equal to the length of *Input*, then *eUTF* is the number of code units in *S.*
    2.  Let *e* be *eUTF*.

18. If *global* is **true** or *sticky* is **true**,
    1.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*R*, `"lastIndex"`, *e*, **true**).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).

19. Let *n* be the length of *r*'s *captures* [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type). (This is the same value as [21.2.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-notation)'s *NcapturingParens*.)
20. Let *A* be [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate)(*n* + 1).
21. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): The value of *A*’s `"length"` property is *n* + 1.
22. Let *matchIndex* be *lastIndex*.
23. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): The following [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty) calls will not result in an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
24. Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*A*, `"index"`, *matchIndex*).
25. Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*A*, `"input"`, *S*).
26. Let *matchedSubstr* be the matched substring (i.e. the portion of *S* between offset *lastIndex* inclusive and offset *e* exclusive).
27. Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*A*, `"0"`, *matchedSubstr*).
28. For each integer *i* such that *i* &gt; 0 and *i* ≤ *n*
    1.  Let *captureI* be *i*<sup>th</sup> element of *r*'s *captures* [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
    2.  If *captureI* is **undefined**, let *capturedValue* be **undefined**.
    3.  Else if *fullUnicode* is **true**,
        1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *captureI* is a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of code points.
        2.  Let *capturedValue* be a string whose code units are the [UTF16Encoding](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-utf16encoding) <span style="font-family: sans-serif">([10.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-utf16encoding))</span> of the code points of *captureI.*

    4.  Else, *fullUnicode* is **false**,
        1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *captureI* is a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of code units.
        2.  Let *capturedValue* be a string consisting of the code units of *captureI.*

    5.  Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*A*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*i*) , *capturedValue*).

29. Return *A*.

<span id="sec-21.2.5.2.3" class="secnum">[21.2.5.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-advancestringindex "link to this section")</span> AdvanceStringIndex ( S, index, unicode )
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation AdvanceStringIndex with arguments S, index, and unicode performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*S*) is String.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *index* is an integer such that 0≤*index*≤2<sup>53</sup>-1.
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*unicode*) is Boolean.
4.  If *unicode* is **false**, return *index*+1.
5.  Let *length* be the number of code units in *S*.
6.  If *index*+1 ≥ *length*, return *index*+1.
7.  Let *first* be the code unit value at index *index* in *S*.
8.  If *first* &lt; 0xD800 or *first* &gt; 0xDBFF, return *index*+1.
9.  Let *second* be the code unit value at index *index*+1 in *S*.
10. If *second* &lt; 0xDC00 or *second* &gt; 0xDFFF, return *index*+1.
11. Return *index*+2.

<span id="sec-21.2.5.3" class="secnum">[21.2.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-regexp.prototype.flags "link to this section")</span> get RegExp.prototype.flags
================================================================================================================================================================================================

`RegExp.prototype.flags` is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Let *R* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*R*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  Let *result* be the empty String.
4.  Let *global* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*R*, `"global"`)).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*global*).
6.  If *global* is **true**, append `"g"` as the last code unit of *result*.
7.  Let *ignoreCase* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*R*, `"ignoreCase"`)).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*ignoreCase*).
9.  If *ignoreCase* is **true**, append `"i"` as the last code unit of *result*.
10. Let *multiline* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*R*, `"multiline"`)).
11. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*multiline*).
12. If *multiline* is **true**, append `"m"` as the last code unit of *result*.
13. Let *unicode* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*R*, `"unicode"`)).
14. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*unicode*).
15. If *unicode* is **true**, append `"u"` as the last code unit of *result*.
16. Let *sticky* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*R*, `"sticky"`)).
17. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*sticky*).
18. If *sticky* is **true**, append `"y"` as the last code unit of *result*.
19. Return *result*.

<span id="sec-21.2.5.4" class="secnum">[21.2.5.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-regexp.prototype.global "link to this section")</span> get RegExp.prototype.global
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

`RegExp.prototype.global` is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Let *R* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*R*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *R* does not have an \[\[OriginalFlags\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *flags* be the value of *R’s* \[\[OriginalFlags\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  If *flags* contains the code unit `"g"`, return **true**.
6.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-21.2.5.5" class="secnum">[21.2.5.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-regexp.prototype.ignorecase "link to this section")</span> get RegExp.prototype.ignoreCase
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

`RegExp.prototype.ignoreCase` is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Let *R* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*R*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *R* does not have an \[\[OriginalFlags\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *flags* be the value of *R’s* \[\[OriginalFlags\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  If *flags* contains the code unit `"i"`, return **true**.
6.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-21.2.5.6" class="secnum">[21.2.5.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexp.prototype-@@match "link to this section")</span> RegExp.prototype \[ @@match \] ( string )
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the @@`match` method is called with argument string, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *rx* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*rx*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  Let *S* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*string*)
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*S*).
5.  Let *global* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*rx*, `"global"`)).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*global*).
7.  If *global* is **false**, then
    1.  Return [RegExpExec](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpexec)(*rx*, *S*).

8.  Else *global* is **true**,
    1.  Let *fullUnicode* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*rx*, `"unicode"`)).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*fullUnicode*).
    3.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*rx*, `"lastIndex"`, 0, **true**).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
    5.  Let *A* be [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate)(0).
    6.  Let *n* be 0.
    7.  Repeat,
        1.  Let *result* be [RegExpExec](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpexec)(*rx*, *S*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*result*).
        3.  If *result* is **null**, then
            1.  If *n*=0, return **null**.
            2.  Else, return *A*.

        4.  Else *result* is not **null**,
            1.  Let *matchStr* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*result*, `"0"`)).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*matchStr*).
            3.  Let *status* be [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*A*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*n*), *matchStr*).
            4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is **true**.
            5.  If *matchStr* is the empty String, then
                1.  Let *thisIndex* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*rx*, `"lastIndex"`)).
                2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*thisIndex*).
                3.  Let *nextIndex* be [AdvanceStringIndex](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-advancestringindex)(*S*, *thisIndex*, *fullUnicode*).
                4.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*rx*, `"lastIndex"`, *nextIndex*, **true**).
                5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).

            6.  Increment *n*.

The value of the `name` property of this function is `"[Symbol.match]"`.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The @@match property is used by the [IsRegExp](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isregexp) abstract operation to identify objects that have the basic behaviour of regular expressions. The absence of a @@match property or the existence of such a property whose value does not Boolean coerce to **true** indicates that the object is not intended to be used as a regular expression object.

<span id="sec-21.2.5.7" class="secnum">[21.2.5.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-regexp.prototype.multiline "link to this section")</span> get RegExp.prototype.multiline
========================================================================================================================================================================================================

`RegExp.prototype.multiline` is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Let *R* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*R*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *R* does not have an \[\[OriginalFlags\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *flags* be the value of *R’s* \[\[OriginalFlags\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  If *flags* contains the code unit `"m"`, return **true**.
6.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-21.2.5.8" class="secnum">[21.2.5.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexp.prototype-@@replace "link to this section")</span> RegExp.prototype \[ @@replace \] ( string, replaceValue )
===============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the @@`replace` method is called with arguments string and replaceValue the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *rx* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*rx*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  Let *S* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*string*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*S*).
5.  Let *lengthS* be the number of code unit elements in *S*.
6.  Let *functionalReplace* be [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*replaceValue*).
7.  If *functionalReplace* is **false**, then
    1.  Let *replaceValue* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*replaceValue*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*replaceValue*).

8.  Let *global* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*rx*, `"global"`)).
9.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*global*).
10. If *global* is **true**, then
    1.  Let *fullUnicode* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*rx*, `"unicode"`)).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*fullUnicode*).
    3.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*rx*, `"lastIndex"`, 0, **true**).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).

11. Let *results* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
12. Let *done* be **false**.
13. Repeat, while *done* is **false**
    1.  Let *result* be [RegExpExec](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpexec)(*rx*, *S*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*result*).
    3.  If *result* is **null**, set *done* to **true**.
    4.  Else *result* is not **null**,
        1.  Append *result* to the end of *results*.
        2.  If *global* is **false**, set *done* to **true**.
        3.  Else,
            1.  Let *matchStr* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*result*, `"0"`)).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*matchStr*).
            3.  If *matchStr* is the empty String, then
                1.  Let *thisIndex* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*rx*, `"lastIndex"`)).
                2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*thisIndex*).
                3.  Let *nextIndex* be [AdvanceStringIndex](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-advancestringindex)(*S*, *thisIndex*, *fullUnicode*).
                4.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*rx*, `"lastIndex"`, *nextIndex*, **true**).
                5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).

14. Let *accumulatedResult* be the empty String value.
15. Let *nextSourcePosition* be 0.
16. Repeat, for each *result* in *results*,
    1.  Let *nCaptures* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*result*, `"length"`)).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*nCaptures*).
    3.  Let *nCaptures* be max(*nCaptures* − 1, 0).
    4.  Let *matched* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*result*, `"0"`)).
    5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*matched*).
    6.  Let *matchLength* be the number of code units in *matched*.
    7.  Let *position* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*result*, `"index"`)).
    8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*position*).
    9.  Let *position* be max(min(*position*, *lengthS*), 0).
    10. Let *n* be 1.
    11. Let *captures* be an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
    12. Repeat while *n* ≤ *nCaptures*
        1.  Let *capN* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*result*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*n*)).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*capN*).
        3.  If *capN* is not **undefined**, then
            1.  Let *capN* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*capN*).
