            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*capN*).

        4.  Append *capN* as the last element of *captures.*
        5.  Let *n* be *n*+1

    13. If *functionalReplace* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *replacerArgs* be «*matched*».
        2.  Append in list order the elements of *captures* to the end of the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) *replacerArgs*.
        3.  Append *position* and *S* as the last two elements of *replacerArgs.*
        4.  Let *replValue* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*replaceValue*, **undefined**, *replacerArgs*).
        5.  Let *replacement* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*replValue*).

    14. Else,
        1.  Let *replacement* be [GetSubstitution](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getsubstitution)(*matched*, *S*, *position*, *captures*, *replaceValue*).

    15. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*replacement*).
    16. If *position* ≥ *nextSourcePosition*, then
        1.  NOTE <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*position*</span> should not normally move backwards. If it does, it is an indication of an ill-behaving RegExp subclass or use of an access triggered side-effect to change the global flag or other characteristics of *<span style="font-family: Times New
                                  Roman">rx</span>.* In such cases, the corresponding substitution is ignored.
        2.  Let *accumulatedResult* be the String formed by concatenating the code units of the current value of *accumulatedResult* with the substring of *S* consisting of the code units from *nextSourcePosition* (inclusive) up to *position* (exclusive) and with the code units of *replacement*.
        3.  Let *nextSourcePosition* be *position* + *matchLength*.

17. If *nextSourcePosition* ≥ *lengthS*, return *accumulatedResult*.
18. Return the String formed by concatenating the code units of *accumulatedResult* with the substring of *S* consisting of the code units from *nextSourcePosition* (inclusive) up through the final code unit of *S* (inclusive).

The value of the `name` property of this function is `"[Symbol.replace]"`.

<span id="sec-21.2.5.9" class="secnum">[21.2.5.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexp.prototype-@@search "link to this section")</span> RegExp.prototype \[ @@search \] ( string )
===============================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the @@search method is called with argument string, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *rx* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*rx*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  Let *S* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*string*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*S*).
5.  Let *previousLastIndex* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*rx*, `"lastIndex"`).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*previousLastIndex*).
7.  Let *status* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*rx*, `"lastIndex"`, 0, **true**).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
9.  Let *result* be [RegExpExec](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpexec)(*rx*, *S*).
10. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*result*).
11. Let *status* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*rx*, `"lastIndex"`, *previousLastIndex*, **true**).
12. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
13. If *result* is **null**, return –1.
14. Return [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*result*, `"index"`).

The value of the `name` property of this function is `"[Symbol.search]"`.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `lastIndex` and `global` properties of this RegExp object are ignored when performing the search. The `lastIndex` property is left unchanged.

<span id="sec-21.2.5.10" class="secnum">[21.2.5.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-regexp.prototype.source "link to this section")</span> get RegExp.prototype.source
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

`RegExp.prototype.source` is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Let *R* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*R*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *R* does not have an \[\[OriginalSource\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  If *R* does not have an \[\[OriginalFlags\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
5.  Let *src* be the value of *R’s* \[\[OriginalSource\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
6.  Let *flags* be the value of *R’s* \[\[OriginalFlags\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
7.  Return [EscapeRegExpPattern](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-escaperegexppattern)(*src*, *flags*).

<span id="sec-21.2.5.11" class="secnum">[21.2.5.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexp.prototype-@@split "link to this section")</span> RegExp.prototype \[ @@split \] ( string, limit )
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Returns an Array object into which substrings of the result of converting *string* to a String have been stored. The substrings are determined by searching from left to right for matches of the **this** value regular expression; these occurrences are not part of any substring in the returned array, but serve to divide up the String value.

The **this** value may be an empty regular expression or a regular expression that can match an empty String. In this case, <span style="font-family: sans-serif">regular expression</span> does not match the empty substring at the beginning or end of the input String, nor does it match the empty substring at the end of the previous separator match. (For example, if the regular expression matches the empty String, the String is split up into individual code unit elements; the length of the result array equals the length of the String, and each substring contains one code unit.) Only the first match at a given index of the **this** String is considered, even if backtracking could yield a non-empty-substring match at that index. (For example, `/a*?/[Symbol.split]("ab")` evaluates to the array `["a","b"]`, while `/a*/[Symbol.split]("ab")` evaluates to the array`["","b"]`.)

If the *string* is (or converts to) the empty String, the result depends on whether the regular expression can match the empty String. If it can, the result array contains no elements. Otherwise, the result array contains one element, which is the empty String.

If the regular expression that contains capturing parentheses, then each time *separator* is matched the results (including any **undefined** results) of the capturing parentheses are spliced into the output array. For example,

    /<(\/)?([^<>]+)>/[Symbol.split]("A<B>bold</B>and<CODE>coded</CODE>")

evaluates to the array

    ["A",undefined,"B","bold","/","B","and",undefined,"CODE","coded","/","CODE",""]

If *limit* is not **undefined**, then the output array is truncated so that it contains no more than *limit* elements.

When the @@`split` method is called, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *rx* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*rx*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  Let *S* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*string*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*S*).
5.  Let *C* be [SpeciesConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-speciesconstructor)(*rx*, %RegExp%).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*C*).
7.  Let *flags* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*rx*, `"flags"`)).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*flags*).
9.  If *flags* contains `"u"`, let *unicodeMatching* be **true**.
10. Else, let *unicodeMatching* be **false**.
11. If *flags* contains `"y"`, let *newFlags* be *flags*.
12. Else, let *newFlags* be the string that is the concatenation of *flags* and `"y"`.
13. Let *splitter* be [Construct](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-construct)(*C*, «*rx*, *newFlags*»).
14. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*splitter*).
15. Let *A* be [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate)(0).
16. Let *lengthA* be 0.
17. If *limit* is **undefined**, let *lim* be 2<sup>53</sup>–1; else let *lim* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)(*limit*).
18. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lim*).
19. Let *size* be the number of elements in *S*.
20. Let *p* be 0.
21. If *lim* = 0, return *A*.
22. If *size* = 0, then
    1.  Let *z* be [RegExpExec](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpexec)(*splitter*, *S*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*z*).
    3.  If *z* is not **null**, return *A*.
    4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): The following call will never result in an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
    5.  Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*A*, `"0"`, *S*).
    6.  Return *A*.

23. Let *q* be *p*.
24. Repeat, while *q* &lt; *size*
    1.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*splitter*, `"lastIndex"`, *q*, **true**).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
    3.  Let *z* be [RegExpExec](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpexec)(*splitter*, *S*).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*z*).
    5.  If *z* is **null**, let *q* be [AdvanceStringIndex](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-advancestringindex)(*S*, *q*, *unicodeMatching*).
    6.  Else *z* is not **null**,
        1.  Let *e* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*splitter*, `"lastIndex"`)).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*e*).
        3.  If *e* = *p*, let *q* be [AdvanceStringIndex](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-advancestringindex)(*S*, *q*, *unicodeMatching*).
        4.  Else *e* ≠ *p*,
            1.  Let *T* be a String value equal to the substring of *S* consisting of the elements at indices *p* (inclusive) through *q* (exclusive).
            2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): The following call will never result in an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
            3.  Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*A*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*lengthA*), *T*).
            4.  Let *lengthA* be *lengthA* +1.
            5.  If *lengthA* = *lim*, return *A*.
            6.  Let *p* be *e*.
            7.  Let *numberOfCaptures* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*z*, `"length"`)).
            8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*numberOfCaptures*).
            9.  Let *numberOfCaptures* be max(*numberOfCaptures*-1, 0).
            10. Let *i* be 1.
            11. Repeat, while *i* ≤ *numberOfCaptures*.
                1.  Let *nextCapture* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*z*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*i*)).
                2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*nextCapture*).
                3.  Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*A*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*lengthA*), *nextCapture*).
                4.  Let *i* be *i* +1.
                5.  Let *lengthA* be *lengthA* +1.
                6.  If *lengthA* = *lim*, return *A*.

            12. Let *q* be *p*.

25. Let *T* be a String value equal to the substring of *S* consisting of the elements at indices *p* (inclusive) through *size* (exclusive).
26. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): The following call will never result in an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
27. Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*A*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*lengthA*), *T* ).
28. Return *A*.

The `length` property of the @@`split` method is **2**.

The value of the `name` property of this function is `"[Symbol.split]"`.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The @@`split` method ignores the value of the `global` and `sticky` properties of this RegExp object.

<span id="sec-21.2.5.12" class="secnum">[21.2.5.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-regexp.prototype.sticky "link to this section")</span> get RegExp.prototype.sticky
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

`RegExp.prototype.sticky` is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Let *R* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*R*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *R* does not have an \[\[OriginalFlags\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *flags* be the value of *R’s* \[\[OriginalFlags\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  If *flags* contains the code unit `"y"`, return **true**.
6.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-21.2.5.13" class="secnum">[21.2.5.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexp.prototype.test "link to this section")</span> RegExp.prototype.test( S )
=============================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *R* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*R*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  Let *string* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*S*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*string*).
5.  Let *match* be [RegExpExec](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpexec)(*R*, *string*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*match*).
7.  If *match* is not **null**, return **true**; else return **false**.

<span id="sec-21.2.5.14" class="secnum">[21.2.5.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexp.prototype.tostring "link to this section")</span> RegExp.prototype.toString ( )
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

1.  Let *R* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*R*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  Let *pattern* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*R*, `"source"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*pattern*).
5.  Let *flags* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*R*, `"flags"`)).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*flags*).
7.  Let *result* be the String value formed by concatenating `"/"`, *pattern*, and `"/"`, and *flags*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The returned String has the form of a *RegularExpressionLiteral* that evaluates to another RegExp object with the same behaviour as this object.

<span id="sec-21.2.5.15" class="secnum">[21.2.5.15](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-regexp.prototype.unicode "link to this section")</span> get RegExp.prototype.unicode
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

`RegExp.prototype.unicode` is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Let *R* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*R*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *R* does not have an \[\[OriginalFlags\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *flags* be the value of *R’s* \[\[OriginalFlags\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  If *flags* contains the code unit `"u"`, return **true**.
6.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-21.2.6" class="secnum">[21.2.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-regexp-instances "link to this section")</span> Properties of RegExp Instances
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

RegExp instances are ordinary objects that inherit properties from the RegExp prototype object. RegExp instances have internal slots \[\[RegExpMatcher\]\], \[\[OriginalSource\]\], and \[\[OriginalFlags\]\]. The value of the \[\[RegExpMatcher\]\] internal slot is an implementation dependent representation of the *Pattern* of the RegExp object.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Prior to ECMAScript 2015, `RegExp` instances were specified as having the own data properties `source`, `global`, `ignoreCase`, and `multiline`. Those properties are now specified as accessor properties of [RegExp.prototype](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexp.prototype).

RegExp instances also have the following property:

<span id="sec-21.2.6.1" class="secnum">[21.2.6.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-lastindex "link to this section")</span> lastIndex
==============================================================================================================================================================

The value of the `lastIndex` property specifies the String index at which to start the next match. It is coerced to an integer when used ([see 21.2.5.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-regexpbuiltinexec)). This property shall have the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-22" class="secnum">[22](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-indexed-collections "link to this section")</span> Indexed Collections
======================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-22.1" class="secnum">[22.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array-objects "link to this section")</span> Array Objects
==============================================================================================================================================================

Array objects are exotic objects that give special treatment to a certain class of property names. See [9.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array-exotic-objects) for a definition of this special treatment.

<span id="sec-22.1.1" class="secnum">[22.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array-constructor "link to this section")</span> The Array Constructor
==============================================================================================================================================================================

The Array constructor is the %Array% intrinsic object and the initial value of the `Array` property of the global object. When called as a constructor it creates and initializes a new exotic Array object. When `Array` is called as a function rather than as a constructor, it also creates and initializes a new Array object. Thus the function call `Array(…)` is equivalent to the object creation expression `new Array(…)` with the same arguments.

The `Array` constructor is a single function whose behaviour is overloaded based upon the number and types of its arguments.

The `Array` constructor is designed to be subclassable. It may be used as the value of an `extends` clause of a class definition. Subclass constructors that intend to inherit the exotic `Array` behaviour must include a `super` call to the `Array` constructor to initialize subclass instances that are exotic Array objects. However, most of the `Array.prototype` methods are generic methods that are not dependent upon their `this` value being an exotic Array object.

The `length` property of the `Array` constructor function is **1**.

<span id="sec-22.1.1.1" class="secnum">[22.1.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array-constructor-array "link to this section")</span> Array ( )
============================================================================================================================================================================

This description applies if and only if the Array constructor is called with no arguments.

1.  Let *numberOfArgs* be the number of arguments passed to this function call.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *numberOfArgs* = 0.
3.  If NewTarget is **undefined***,* let *newTarget* be the active function object, else let *newTarget* be NewTarget.
4.  Let *proto* be [GetPrototypeFromConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getprototypefromconstructor)(*newTarget*, `"%ArrayPrototype%"`).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*proto*).
6.  Return [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate)(0, *proto*).

<span id="sec-22.1.1.2" class="secnum">[22.1.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array-len "link to this section")</span> Array (len)
================================================================================================================================================================

This description applies if and only if the Array constructor is called with exactly one argument.

1.  Let *numberOfArgs* be the number of arguments passed to this function call.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *numberOfArgs* = 1.
3.  If NewTarget is **undefined***,* let *newTarget* be the active function object, else let *newTarget* be NewTarget.
4.  Let *proto* be [GetPrototypeFromConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getprototypefromconstructor)(*newTarget*, `"%ArrayPrototype%"`).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*proto*).
6.  Let *array* be [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate)(0, *proto*).
7.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*len*) is not Number, then
    1.  Let *defineStatus* be [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*array*, `"0"`, *len*).
    2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *defineStatus* is **true**.
    3.  Let *intLen* be 1.

8.  Else,
    1.  Let *intLen* be [ToUint32](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-touint32)(*len*).
    2.  If *intLen* ≠ *len*, throw a **RangeError** exception.

9.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*array*, `"length"`, *intLen*, **true**).
10. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *setStatus* is not an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type).
11. Return *array*.

<span id="sec-22.1.1.3" class="secnum">[22.1.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array-items "link to this section")</span> Array (...items )
========================================================================================================================================================================

This description applies if and only if the Array constructor is called with at least two arguments.

When the `Array` function is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *numberOfArgs* be the number of arguments passed to this function call.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *numberOfArgs* ≥ 2.
3.  If NewTarget is **undefined***,* let *newTarget* be the active function object, else let *newTarget* be NewTarget.
4.  Let *proto* be [GetPrototypeFromConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getprototypefromconstructor)(*newTarget*, `"%ArrayPrototype%"`).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*proto*).
6.  Let *array* be [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate)(*numberOfArgs*, *proto*).
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*array*).
8.  Let *k* be 0.
9.  Let *items* be a zero-origined [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the argument items in order.
10. Repeat, while *k* &lt; *numberOfArgs*
    1.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
    2.  Let *itemK* be *items*\[*k*\].
    3.  Let *defineStatus* be [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*array*, *Pk*, *itemK*).
    4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *defineStatus* is **true**.
    5.  Increase *k* by 1.

11. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): the value of *array*’s `length` property is *numberOfArgs*.
12. Return *array*.

<span id="sec-22.1.2" class="secnum">[22.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-array-constructor "link to this section")</span> Properties of the Array Constructor
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the Array constructor is the intrinsic object %FunctionPrototype% ([19.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-function-prototype-object)).

Besides the `length` property (whose value is **1**), the Array constructor has the following properties:

<span id="sec-22.1.2.1" class="secnum">[22.1.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.from "link to this section")</span> Array.from ( items \[ , mapfn \[ , thisArg \] \] )
========================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `from` method is called with argument items and optional arguments mapfn and thisArg the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *C* be the **this** value.
2.  If *mapfn* is **undefined**, let *mapping* be **false.**
3.  else
    1.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*mapfn*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    2.  If *thisArg* was supplied, let *T* be *thisArg*; else let *T* be **undefined**.
    3.  Let *mapping* be **true**

4.  Let *usingIterator* be [GetMethod](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getmethod)(*items*, @@iterator).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*usingIterator*).
6.  If *usingIterator* is not **undefined**, then
    1.  If [IsConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor)(*C*) is **true**, then
        1.  Let *A* be [Construct](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-construct)(*C*).

    2.  Else,
        1.  Let *A* be [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate)(0).

    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*A*).
    4.  Let *iterator* be [GetIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getiterator)(*items*, *usingIterator*).
    5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*iterator*).
    6.  Let *k* be 0.
    7.  Repeat
        1.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
        2.  Let *next* be [IteratorStep](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorstep)(*iterator*).
        3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*next*).
        4.  If *next* is **false**, then
            1.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*A*, `"length"`, *k*, **true**).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
            3.  Return *A*.

        5.  Let *nextValue* be [IteratorValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorvalue)(*next*).
        6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*nextValue*).
        7.  If *mapping* is **true**, then
            1.  Let *mappedValue* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*mapfn*, *T*, «*nextValue*, *k*»).
            2.  If *mappedValue* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iterator*, *mappedValue*).
            3.  Let *mappedValue* be *mappedValue*.\[\[value\]\].

        8.  Else, let *mappedValue* be *nextValue*.
        9.  Let *defineStatus* be [CreateDataPropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdatapropertyorthrow)(*A*, *Pk*, *mappedValue*).
        10. If *defineStatus* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iterator*, *defineStatus*).
        11. Increase *k* by 1.

7.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *items* is not an Iterable so assume it is an array-like object.
8.  Let *arrayLike* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(*items*).
9.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*arrayLike*).
10. Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*arrayLike*, `"length"`)).
11. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
12. If [IsConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor)(*C*) is **true**, then
    1.  Let *A* be [Construct](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-construct)(*C*, «*len*»).

13. Else,
    1.  Let *A* be [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate)(*len*).

14. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*A*).
15. Let *k* be 0.
16. Repeat, while *k* &lt; *len*
    1.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
    2.  Let *kValue* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*arrayLike*, *Pk*).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kValue*).
    4.  If *mapping* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *mappedValue* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*mapfn*, *T*, «*kValue*, *k*»).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*mappedValue*).

    5.  Else, let *mappedValue* be *kValue*.
    6.  Let *defineStatus* be [CreateDataPropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdatapropertyorthrow)(*A*, *Pk*, *mappedValue*).
    7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*defineStatus*).
    8.  Increase *k* by 1.

17. Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*A*, `"length"`, *len*, **true**).
18. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
19. Return *A*.

The `length` property of the `from` method is **1**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `from` function is an intentionally generic factory method; it does not require that its **this** value be the Array constructor. Therefore it can be transferred to or inherited by any other constructors that may be called with a single numeric argument.

<span id="sec-22.1.2.2" class="secnum">[22.1.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.isarray "link to this section")</span> Array.isArray ( arg )
==============================================================================================================================================================================

The `isArray` function takes one argument arg, and performs the following steps:

1.  Return [IsArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isarray)(*arg*).

<span id="sec-22.1.2.3" class="secnum">[22.1.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.of "link to this section")</span> Array.of ( ...items )
=========================================================================================================================================================================

When the `of` method is called with any number of arguments, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *len* be the actual number of arguments passed to this function.
2.  Let *items* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of arguments passed to this function.
3.  Let *C* be the **this** value.
4.  If [IsConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor)(*C*) is **true**, then
    1.  Let *A* be [Construct](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-construct)(*C*, «*len*»).

5.  Else,
    1.  Let *A* be [ArrayCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraycreate)(*len*).

6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*A*).
7.  Let *k* be 0.
8.  Repeat, while *k* &lt; *len*
    1.  Let *kValue* be *items*\[*k*\].
    2.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
    3.  Let *defineStatus* be [CreateDataPropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdatapropertyorthrow)(*A*,*Pk*, *kValue*).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*defineStatus*).
    5.  Increase *k* by 1.

9.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*A*, `"length"`, *len*, **true**).
10. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
11. Return *A*.

The `length` property of the `of` method is **0**.

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> The *items* argument is assumed to be a well-formed rest argument value.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> The `of` function is an intentionally generic factory method; it does not require that its **this** value be the Array constructor. Therefore it can be transferred to or inherited by other constructors that may be called with a single numeric argument.

<span id="sec-22.1.2.4" class="secnum">[22.1.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype
==========================================================================================================================================================================

The value of `Array.prototype` is %ArrayPrototype%, the intrinsic Array prototype object ([22.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-array-prototype-object)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-22.1.2.5" class="secnum">[22.1.2.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-array-@@species "link to this section")</span> get Array \[ @@species \]
========================================================================================================================================================================================

`Array[@@species]` is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Return the **this** value.

The value of the `name` property of this function is `"get [Symbol.species]"`.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Array prototype methods normally use their `this` object’s constructor to create a derived object. However, a subclass constructor may over-ride that default behaviour by redefining its @@species property.

<span id="sec-22.1.3" class="secnum">[22.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-array-prototype-object "link to this section")</span> Properties of the Array Prototype Object
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The Array prototype object is the intrinsic object %ArrayPrototype%. The Array prototype object is an Array exotic objects and has the internal methods specified for such objects. It has a `length` property whose initial value is 0 and whose attributes are <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">{ \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }</span>.

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the Array prototype object is the intrinsic object %ObjectPrototype%.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The Array prototype object is specified to be an [Array exotic object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array-exotic-objects) to ensure compatibility with ECMAScript code that was created prior to the ECMAScript 2015 specification.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.1" class="secnum">[22.1.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.concat "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.concat ( ...arguments )
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `concat` method is called with zero or more arguments, it returns an array containing the array elements of the object followed by the array elements of each argument in order.

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Let *A* be [ArraySpeciesCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrayspeciescreate)(*O*, 0).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*A*).
5.  Let *n* be 0.
6.  Let *items* be a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) whose first element is *O* and whose subsequent elements are, in left to right order, the arguments that were passed to this function invocation.
7.  Repeat, while *items* is not empty
    1.  Remove the first element from *items* and let *E* be the value of the element.
    2.  Let *spreadable* be [IsConcatSpreadable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconcatspreadable)(*E*).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*spreadable*).
    4.  If *spreadable* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *k* be 0.
        2.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*E*, `"length"`)).
        3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
        4.  If *n* + *len* &gt; 2<sup>53</sup>-1, throw a **TypeError** exception.
        5.  Repeat, while *k* &lt; *len*
            1.  Let *P* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
            2.  Let *exists* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*E*, *P*).
            3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*exists*).
            4.  If *exists* is **true**, then
                1.  Let *subElement* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*E*, *P*).
                2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*subElement*).
                3.  Let *status* be [CreateDataPropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdatapropertyorthrow) (*A*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*n*), *subElement*).
                4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).

            5.  Increase *n* by 1.
            6.  Increase *k* by 1.

    5.  Else *E* is added as a single item rather than spread,
        1.  If *n*≥2<sup>53</sup>-1, throw a **TypeError** exception.
        2.  Let *status* be [CreateDataPropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdatapropertyorthrow) (*A*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*n*), *E*).
        3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
        4.  Increase *n* by 1.

8.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*A*, `"length"`, *n*, **true**).
9.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
10. Return *A*.

The `length` property of the `concat` method is **1**.

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> The explicit setting of the `length` property in step 8 is necessary to ensure that its value is correct in situations where the trailing elements of the result Array are not present.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> The `concat` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.1.1" class="secnum">[22.1.3.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconcatspreadable "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: IsConcatSpreadable ( O )
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IsConcatSpreadable with argument *O* performs the following steps:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, return **false**.
2.  Let *spreadable* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, @@isConcatSpreadable).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*spreadable*).
4.  If *spreadable* is not **undefined**, return [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)(*spreadable*).
5.  Return [IsArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isarray)(*O*).

<span id="sec-22.1.3.2" class="secnum">[22.1.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.constructor "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.constructor
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Array.prototype.constructor` is the intrinsic object %Array%.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.3" class="secnum">[22.1.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.copywithin "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.copyWithin (target, start \[ , end \] )
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The `copyWithin` method takes up to three arguments target, start and end.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The *end* argument is optional with the length of the **this** object as its default value. If *target* is negative, it is treated as *length*+*target* where *length* is the length of the array. If *start* is negative, it is treated as *length*+*start*. If *end* is negative, it is treated as *length*+*end*.

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"length"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
5.  Let *relativeTarget* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*target*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*relativeTarget*).
7.  If *relativeTarget* &lt; 0, let *to* be max((*len* + *relativeTarget*),0); else let *to* be min(*relativeTarget*, *len*).
8.  Let *relativeStart* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*start*).
9.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*relativeStart*).
10. If *relativeStart* &lt; 0, let *from* be max((*len* + *relativeStart*),0); else let *from* be min(*relativeStart*, *len*).
11. If *end* is **undefined**, let *relativeEnd* be *len*; else let *relativeEnd* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*end*).
12. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*relativeEnd*).
13. If *relativeEnd* &lt; 0, let *final* be max((*len* + *relativeEnd*),0); else let *final* be min(*relativeEnd*, *len*).
14. Let *count* be min(*final*-*from*, *len*-*to*).
15. If *from*&lt;*to* and *to*&lt;*from*+*count*
    1.  Let *direction* be -1.
    2.  Let *from* be *from* + *count* -1.
    3.  Let *to* be *to* + *count* -1.

16. Else,
    1.  Let *direction* = 1.

17. Repeat, while *count* &gt; 0
    1.  Let *fromKey* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*from*).
    2.  Let *toKey* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*to*).
    3.  Let *fromPresent* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, *fromKey*).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*fromPresent*).
    5.  If *fromPresent* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *fromVal* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, *fromKey*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*fromVal*).
        3.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, *toKey*, *fromVal*, **true**).
        4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).

    6.  Else *fromPresent* is **false**,
        1.  Let *deleteStatus* be [DeletePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-deletepropertyorthrow)(*O*, *toKey*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*deleteStatus*).

    7.  Let *from* be *from* + *direction*.
    8.  Let *to* be *to* + *direction*.
    9.  Let *count* be *count* − 1.

18. Return *O*.

The `length` property of the `copyWithin` method is **2**.

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> The `copyWithin` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.4" class="secnum">[22.1.3.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.entries "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.entries ( )
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Return [CreateArrayIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createarrayiterator)(*O*, `"key+value"`).

<span id="sec-22.1.3.5" class="secnum">[22.1.3.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.every "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.every ( callbackfn \[ , thisArg\] )
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE</span> *callbackfn* should be a function that accepts three arguments and returns a value that is coercible to the Boolean value **true** or **false**. `every` calls *callbackfn* once for each element present in the array, in ascending order, until it finds one where *callbackfn* returns **false**. If such an element is found, `every` immediately returns **false**. Otherwise, if *callbackfn* returned **true** for all elements, `every` will return **true**. *callbackfn* is called only for elements of the array which actually exist; it is not called for missing elements of the array.

If a *thisArg* parameter is provided, it will be used as the **this** value for each invocation of *callbackfn*. If it is not provided, **undefined** is used instead.

*callbackfn* is called with three arguments: the value of the element, the index of the element, and the object being traversed.

`every` does not directly mutate the object on which it is called but the object may be mutated by the calls to *callbackfn*.

The range of elements processed by `every` is set before the first call to *callbackfn*. Elements which are appended to the array after the call to `every` begins will not be visited by *callbackfn*. If existing elements of the array are changed, their value as passed to *callbackfn* will be the value at the time `every` visits them; elements that are deleted after the call to `every` begins and before being visited are not visited. `every` acts like the "for all" quantifier in mathematics. In particular, for an empty array, it returns **true**.

When the `every` method is called with one or two arguments, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"length"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
5.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*callbackfn*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
6.  If *thisArg* was supplied, let *T* be *thisArg*; else let *T* be **undefined**.
7.  Let *k* be 0.
8.  Repeat, while *k* &lt; *len*
    1.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
    2.  Let *kPresent* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, *Pk*).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kPresent*).
    4.  If *kPresent* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *kValue* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, *Pk*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kValue*).
        3.  Let *testResult* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*callbackfn*, *T*, «*kValue*, *k*, *O*»)).
        4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*testResult*).
        5.  If *testResult* is **false**, return **false**.

    5.  Increase *k* by 1.

9.  Return **true**.

The `length` property of the `every` method is **1**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `every` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.6" class="secnum">[22.1.3.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.fill "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.fill (value \[ , start \[ , end \] \] )
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The `fill` method takes up to three arguments value, start and end.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The *start* and *end* arguments are optional with default values of 0 and the length of the **this** object. If *start* is negative, it is treated as *length*+*start* where *length* is the length of the array. If *end* is negative, it is treated as *length*+*end*.

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"length"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
5.  Let *relativeStart* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*start*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*relativeStart*).
7.  If *relativeStart* &lt; 0, let *k* be max((*len* + *relativeStart*),0); else let *k* be min(*relativeStart*, *len*).
8.  If *end* is **undefined**, let *relativeEnd* be *len*; else let *relativeEnd* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*end*).
9.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*relativeEnd*).
10. If *relativeEnd* &lt; 0, let *final* be max((*len* + *relativeEnd*),0); else let *final* be min(*relativeEnd*, *len*).
11. Repeat, while *k* &lt; *final*
    1.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
    2.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, *Pk*, *value*, **true**).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
    4.  Increase *k* by 1.

12. Return *O*.

The `length` property of the `fill` method is **1**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `fill` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.7" class="secnum">[22.1.3.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.filter "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.filter ( callbackfn \[ , thisArg \] )
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE</span> *callbackfn* should be a function that accepts three arguments and returns a value that is coercible to the Boolean value **true** or **false**. `filter` calls *callbackfn* once for each element in the array, in ascending order, and constructs a new array of all the values for which *callbackfn* returns **true**. *callbackfn* is called only for elements of the array which actually exist; it is not called for missing elements of the array.

If a *thisArg* parameter is provided, it will be used as the **this** value for each invocation of *callbackfn*. If it is not provided, **undefined** is used instead.

*callbackfn* is called with three arguments: the value of the element, the index of the element, and the object being traversed.

`filter` does not directly mutate the object on which it is called but the object may be mutated by the calls to *callbackfn*.

The range of elements processed by `filter` is set before the first call to *callbackfn*. Elements which are appended to the array after the call to `filter` begins will not be visited by *callbackfn*. If existing elements of the array are changed their value as passed to *callbackfn* will be the value at the time `filter` visits them; elements that are deleted after the call to `filter` begins and before being visited are not visited.

When the `filter` method is called with one or two arguments, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"length"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
5.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*callbackfn*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
6.  If *thisArg* was supplied, let *T* be *thisArg*; else let *T* be **undefined**.
7.  Let *A* be [ArraySpeciesCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrayspeciescreate)(*O*, 0).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*A*).
9.  Let *k* be 0.
10. Let *to* be 0.
11. Repeat, while *k* &lt; *len*
    1.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
    2.  Let *kPresent* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, *Pk*).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kPresent*).
    4.  If *kPresent* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *kValue* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, *Pk*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kValue*).
        3.  Let *selected* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*callbackfn*, *T*, «*kValue*, *k*, *O*»)).
        4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*selected*).
        5.  If *selected* is **true**, then
            1.  Let *status* be [CreateDataPropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdatapropertyorthrow) (*A*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*to*), *kValue*).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
            3.  Increase *to* by 1.

    5.  Increase *k* by 1.

12. Return *A*.

The `length` property of the `filter` method is **1**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `filter` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.8" class="secnum">[22.1.3.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.find "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.find ( predicate \[ , thisArg \] )
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The `find` method is called with one or two arguments, predicate and thisArg.

<span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE</span> *predicate* should be a function that accepts three arguments and returns a value that is coercible to a Boolean value. `find` calls *predicate* once for each element of the array, in ascending order, until it finds one where *predicate* returns **true**. If such an element is found, `find` immediately returns that element value. Otherwise, `find` returns **undefined**.

If a *thisArg* parameter is provided, it will be used as the **this** value for each invocation of *predicate*. If it is not provided, **undefined** is used instead.

*predicate* is called with three arguments: the value of the element, the index of the element, and the object being traversed.

`find` does not directly mutate the object on which it is called but the object may be mutated by the calls to *predicate*.

The range of elements processed by `find` is set before the first call to *callbackfn*. Elements that are appended to the array after the call to `find` begins will not be visited by *callbackfn*. If existing elements of the array are changed, their value as passed to *predicate* will be the value at the time that `find` visits them.

When the `find` method is called, the following steps are taken:

<span id="sec-22.1.3.11" class="secnum">[22.1.3.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.indexof "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.indexOf ( searchElement \[ , fromIndex \] )
================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE</span> `indexOf` compares *searchElement* to the elements of the array, in ascending order, using the Strict Equality Comparison algorithm ([7.2.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-equality-comparison)), and if found at one or more indices, returns the smallest such index; otherwise, −1 is returned.

The optional second argument *fromIndex* defaults to 0 (i.e. the whole array is searched). If it is greater than or equal to the length of the array, −1 is returned, i.e. the array will not be searched. If it is negative, it is used as the offset from the end of the array to compute *fromIndex*. If the computed index is less than 0, the whole array will be searched.

When the `indexOf` method is called with one or two arguments, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"length"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
5.  If *len* is 0, return −1.
6.  If argument *fromIndex* was passed let *n* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*fromIndex*); else let *n* be 0.
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*n*).
8.  If *n* ≥ *len*, return −1.
9.  If *n* ≥ 0, then
    1.  Let *k* be *n*.

10. Else *n*&lt;0,
    1.  Let *k* be *len* - [abs](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions)(*n*).
    2.  If *k* &lt; 0, let *k* be 0.

11. Repeat, while *k*&lt;*len*
    1.  Let *kPresent* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*)).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kPresent*).
    3.  If *kPresent* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *elementK* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*)).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*elementK*).
        3.  Let *same* be the result of performing Strict Equality Comparison *searchElement* === *elementK*.
        4.  If *same* is **true,** return *k*.

    4.  Increase *k* by 1.

12. Return -1.

The `length` property of the `indexOf` method is **1**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `indexOf` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.12" class="secnum">[22.1.3.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.join "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.join (separator)
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE</span> The elements of the array are converted to Strings, and these Strings are then concatenated, separated by occurrences of the *separator*. If no separator is provided, a single comma is used as the separator.

The `join` method takes one argument, separator, and performs the following steps:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"length"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
5.  If *separator* is **undefined**, let *separator* be the single-element String `","`.
6.  Let *sep* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*separator*).
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*sep*).
8.  If *len* is zero, return the empty String.
9.  Let *element0* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"0"`).
10. If *element0* is **undefined** or **null**, let *R* be the empty String; otherwise, let *R* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*element0*).
11. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*R*).
12. Let *k* be `1`.
13. Repeat, while *k* &lt; *len*
    1.  Let *S* be the String value produced by concatenating *R* and *sep*.
    2.  Let *element* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*)).
    3.  If *element* is **undefined** or **null**, let *next* be the empty String; otherwise, let *next* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*element*).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*next*).
    5.  Let *R* be a String value produced by concatenating *S* and *next*.
    6.  Increase *k* by 1.

14. Return *R*.

The `length` property of the `join` method is **1**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `join` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore, it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.14" class="secnum">[22.1.3.14](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.lastindexof "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.lastIndexOf ( searchElement \[ , fromIndex \] )
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE</span> `lastIndexOf` compares *searchElement* to the elements of the array in descending order using the Strict Equality Comparison algorithm ([7.2.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-strict-equality-comparison)), and if found at one or more indices, returns the largest such index; otherwise, −1 is returned.

The optional second argument *fromIndex* defaults to the array's length minus one (i.e. the whole array is searched). If it is greater than or equal to the length of the array, the whole array will be searched. If it is negative, it is used as the offset from the end of the array to compute *fromIndex*. If the computed index is less than 0, −1 is returned.

When the `lastIndexOf` method is called with one or two arguments, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"length"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
5.  If *len* is 0, return -1.
6.  If argument *fromIndex* was passed let *n* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*fromIndex*); else let *n* be *len*-1.
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*n*).
8.  If *n* ≥ 0, let *k* be min(*n*, *len* – 1).
9.  Else *n* &lt; 0,
    1.  Let *k* be *len* - [abs](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions)(*n*).

10. Repeat, while *k*≥ 0
    1.  Let *kPresent* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*)).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kPresent*).
    3.  If *kPresent* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *elementK* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*)).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*elementK*).
        3.  Let *same* be the result of performing Strict Equality Comparison
            *searchElement* === *elementK*.
        4.  If *same* is **true,** return *k*.

    4.  Decrease *k* by 1.

11. Return -1.

The `length` property of the `lastIndexOf` method is **1**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `lastIndexOf` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.15" class="secnum">[22.1.3.15](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.map "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.map ( callbackfn \[ , thisArg \] )

If existing elements of the array are changed, their value as passed to *callbackfn* will be the value at the time `map` visits them; elements that are deleted after the call to `map` begins and before being visited are not visited.

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).

5.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*callbackfn*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
