7.  Let *A* be [ArraySpeciesCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrayspeciescreate)(*O*, *len*).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*A*).
9.  Let *k* be 0.
10. Repeat, while *k* &lt; *len*
    1.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
    2.  Let *kPresent* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, *Pk*).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kPresent*).
    4.  If *kPresent* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *kValue* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, *Pk*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kValue*).
        3.  Let *mappedValue* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*callbackfn*, *T*, «*kValue*, *k*, *O*»).
        4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*mappedValue*).
        5.  Let *status* be [CreateDataPropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdatapropertyorthrow) (*A*, *Pk*, *mappedValue*).
        6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).

11. Return *A*.

The `length` property of the `map` method is **1**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `map` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.16" class="secnum">[22.1.3.16](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.pop "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.pop ( )
========================================================================================================================================================================================

<span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE</span> The last element of the array is removed from the array and returned.

When the `pop` method is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"length"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
5.  If *len* is zero,
    1.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, `"length"`, 0, **true**).

    3.  Let *element* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, *indx*).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*element*).
    5.  Let *deleteStatus* be [DeletePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-deletepropertyorthrow)(*O*, *indx*).
    6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*deleteStatus*).
    7.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, `"length"`, *newLen*, **true**).
    8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
    9.  Return *element*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `pop` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.17" class="secnum">[22.1.3.17](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.push "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.push ( ...items )
===================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE</span> The arguments are appended to the end of the array, in the order in which they appear. The new length of the array is returned as the result of the call.

When the `push` method is called with zero or more arguments the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"length"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
5.  Let *items* be a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) whose elements are, in left to right order, the arguments that were passed to this function invocation.
6.  Let *argCount* be the number of elements in *items*.
7.  If *len* + *argCount* &gt; 2<sup>53</sup>-1, throw a **TypeError** exception.
8.  Repeat, while *items* is not empty
    1.  Remove the first element from *items* and let *E* be the value of the element.
    2.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*len*), *E*, **true**).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
    4.  Let *len* be *len*+1.

9.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, `"length"`, *len*, **true**).
10. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
11. Return *len*.

The `length` property of the `push` method is **1**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `push` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.18" class="secnum">[22.1.3.18](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.reduce "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.reduce ( callbackfn \[ , initialValue \] )
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE</span> *callbackfn* should be a function that takes four arguments. `reduce` calls the callback, as a function, once for each element present in the array, in ascending order.

*callbackfn* is called with four arguments: the *previousValue* (value from the previous call to *callbackfn*), the *currentValue* (value of the current element), the *currentIndex*, and the object being traversed. The first time that callback is called, the *previousValue* and *currentValue* can be one of two values. If an *initialValue* was provided in the call to `reduce`, then *previousValue* will be equal to *initialValue* and *currentValue* will be equal to the first value in the array. If no *initialValue* was provided, then *previousValue* will be equal to the first value in the array and *currentValue* will be equal to the second. It is a **TypeError** if the array contains no elements and *initialValue* is not provided.

`reduce` does not directly mutate the object on which it is called but the object may be mutated by the calls to *callbackfn*.

The range of elements processed by `reduce` is set before the first call to *callbackfn*. Elements that are appended to the array after the call to `reduce` begins will not be visited by *callbackfn*. If existing elements of the array are changed, their value as passed to *callbackfn* will be the value at the time `reduce` visits them; elements that are deleted after the call to `reduce` begins and before being visited are not visited.

When the `reduce` method is called with one or two arguments, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"length"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
5.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*callbackfn*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
6.  If *len* is 0 and *initialValue* is not present, throw a **TypeError** exception.
7.  Let *k* be 0.
8.  If *initialValue* is present, then
    1.  Set *accumulator* to *initialValue*.

9.  Else *initialValue* is not present,
    1.  Let *kPresent* be **false**.
    2.  Repeat, while *kPresent* is **false** and *k* &lt; *len*
        1.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
        2.  Let *kPresent* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, *Pk*).
        3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kPresent*).
        4.  If *kPresent* is **true**, then
            1.  Let *accumulator* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, *Pk*).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*accumulator*).

        5.  Increase *k* by 1.

    3.  If *kPresent* is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.

10. Repeat, while *k* &lt; *len*
    1.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
    2.  Let *kPresent* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, *Pk*).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kPresent*).
    4.  If *kPresent* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *kValue* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, *Pk*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kValue*).
        3.  Let *accumulator* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*callbackfn*, **undefined**, «*accumulator*, *kValue*, *k*, *O*»).
        4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*accumulator*).

    5.  Increase *k* by 1.

11. Return *accumulator*.

The `length` property of the `reduce` method is **1**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `reduce` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.19" class="secnum">[22.1.3.19](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.reduceright "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.reduceRight ( callbackfn \[ , initialValue \] )
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE</span> *callbackfn* should be a function that takes four arguments. `reduceRight` calls the callback, as a function, once for each element present in the array, in descending order.

*callbackfn* is called with four arguments: the *previousValue* (value from the previous call to *callbackfn*), the *currentValue* (value of the current element), the *currentIndex*, and the object being traversed. The first time the function is called, the *previousValue* and *currentValue* can be one of two values. If an *initialValue* was provided in the call to `reduceRight`, then *previousValue* will be equal to *initialValue* and *currentValue* will be equal to the last value in the array. If no *initialValue* was provided, then *previousValue* will be equal to the last value in the array and *currentValue* will be equal to the second-to-last value. It is a **TypeError** if the array contains no elements and *initialValue* is not provided.

`reduceRight` does not directly mutate the object on which it is called but the object may be mutated by the calls to *callbackfn*.

The range of elements processed by `reduceRight` is set before the first call to *callbackfn*. Elements that are appended to the array after the call to `reduceRight` begins will not be visited by *callbackfn*. If existing elements of the array are changed by *callbackfn*, their value as passed to *callbackfn* will be the value at the time `reduceRight` visits them; elements that are deleted after the call to `reduceRight` begins and before being visited are not visited.

When the `reduceRight` method is called with one or two arguments, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"length"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
5.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*callbackfn*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
6.  If *len* is 0 and *initialValue* is not present, throw a **TypeError** exception.
7.  Let *k* be *len*-1.
8.  If *initialValue* is present, then
    1.  Set *accumulator* to *initialValue*.

9.  Else *initialValue* is not present,
    1.  Let *kPresent* be **false**.
    2.  Repeat, while *kPresent* is **false** and *k* ≥ 0
        1.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
        2.  Let *kPresent* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, *Pk*).
        3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kPresent*).
        4.  If *kPresent* is **true**, then
            1.  Let *accumulator* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, *Pk*).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*accumulator*).

        5.  Decrease *k* by 1.

    3.  If *kPresent* is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.

10. Repeat, while *k* ≥ 0
    1.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
    2.  Let *kPresent* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, *Pk*).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kPresent*).
    4.  If *kPresent* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *kValue* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, *Pk*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kValue*).
        3.  Let *accumulator* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*callbackfn*, **undefined**, «*accumulator*, *kValue*, *k*, »).
        4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*accumulator*).

    5.  Decrease *k* by 1.

11. Return *accumulator*.

The `length` property of the `reduceRight` method is **1**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `reduceRight` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its this value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.20" class="secnum">[22.1.3.20](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.reverse "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.reverse ( )
================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE</span> The elements of the array are rearranged so as to reverse their order. The object is returned as the result of the call.

When the `reverse` method is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"length"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
5.  Let *middle* be [floor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions)(*len*/2).
6.  Let *lower* be **0**.
7.  Repeat, while *lower* ≠ *middle*
    1.  Let *upper* be *len*− *lower* −1.
    2.  Let *upperP* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*upper*).
    3.  Let *lowerP* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*lower*).
    4.  Let *lowerExists* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, *lowerP*).
    5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lowerExists*).
    6.  If *lowerExists* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *lowerValue* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, *lowerP*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*lowerValue*).

    7.  Let *upperExists* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, *upperP*).
    8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*upperExists*).
    9.  If *upperExists* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *upperValue* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, *upper*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*upperValue*).

    10. If *lowerExists* is **true** and *upperExists* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, *lowerP*, *upperValue*, **true**).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
        3.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, *upperP*, *lowerValue*, **true**).
        4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).

    11. Else if *lowerExists* is **false** and *upperExists* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, *lowerP*, *upperValue*, **true**).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
        3.  Let *deleteStatus* be [DeletePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-deletepropertyorthrow) (*O*, *upperP*).
        4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*deleteStatus*).

    12. Else if *lowerExists* is **true** and *upperExists* is **false**, then
        1.  Let *deleteStatus* be [DeletePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-deletepropertyorthrow) (*O*, *lowerP*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*deleteStatus*).
        3.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, *upperP*, *lowerValue*, **true**).
        4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).

    13. Else both *lowerExists* and *upperExists* are **false**,
        1.  No action is required.

    14. Increase *lower* by 1.

8.  Return *O* .

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `reverse` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore, it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.21" class="secnum">[22.1.3.21](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.shift "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.shift ( )
============================================================================================================================================================================================

<span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE</span> The first element of the array is removed from the array and returned.

When the `shift` method is called the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"length"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
5.  If *len* is zero, then
    1.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, `"length"`, 0, **true**).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
    3.  Return **undefined**.

6.  Let *first* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"0"`).
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*first*).
8.  Let *k* be 1.
9.  Repeat, while *k* &lt; *len*
    1.  Let *from* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
    2.  Let *to* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*–1).
    3.  Let *fromPresent* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, *from*).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*fromPresent*).
    5.  If *fromPresent* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *fromVal* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, *from*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*fromVal*).
        3.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, *to*, *fromVal*, **true**).
        4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).

    6.  Else *fromPresent* is **false**,
        1.  Let *deleteStatus* be [DeletePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-deletepropertyorthrow)(*O*, *to*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*deleteStatus*).

    7.  Increase *k* by 1.

10. Let *deleteStatus* be [DeletePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-deletepropertyorthrow)(*O*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*len*–1)).
11. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*deleteStatus*).
12. Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, `"length"`, *len*–1, **true**).
13. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
