<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `shift` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.22" class="secnum">[22.1.3.22](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.slice "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.slice (start, end)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE</span> The `slice` method takes two arguments, *start* and *end*, and returns an array containing the elements of the array from element *start* up to, but not including, element *end* (or through the end of the array if *end* is **undefined**). If *start* is negative, it is treated as *length*+*start* where *length* is the length of the array. If *end* is negative, it is treated as *length*+*end* where *length* is the length of the array.

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"length"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
5.  Let *relativeStart* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*start*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*relativeStart*).
7.  If *relativeStart* &lt; 0, let *k* be max((*len* + *relativeStart*),0); else let *k* be min(*relativeStart*, *len*).
8.  If *end* is **undefined**, let *relativeEnd* be *len*; else let *relativeEnd* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*end*).
9.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*relativeEnd*).
10. If *relativeEnd* &lt; 0, let *final* be max((*len* + *relativeEnd*),0); else let *final* be min(*relativeEnd*, *len*).
11. Let *count* be max(*final* – *k*, 0).
12. Let *A* be [ArraySpeciesCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrayspeciescreate)(*O*, *count*).
13. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*A*).
14. Let *n* be 0.
15. Repeat, while *k* &lt; *final*
    1.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
    2.  Let *kPresent* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, *Pk*).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kPresent*).
    4.  If *kPresent* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *kValue* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, *Pk*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kValue*).
        3.  Let *status* be [CreateDataPropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdatapropertyorthrow)(*A*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*n*), *kValue* ).
        4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).

    5.  Increase *k* by 1.
    6.  Increase *n* by 1.

16. Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*A*, `"length"`, *n*, **true**).
17. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
18. Return *A*.

The `length` property of the `slice` method is **2**.

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> The explicit setting of the `length` property of the result Array in step 16 is necessary to ensure that its value is correct in situations where the trailing elements of the result Array are not present.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> The `slice` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.23" class="secnum">[22.1.3.23](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.some "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.some ( callbackfn \[ , thisArg \] )
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE</span> *callbackfn* should be a function that accepts three arguments and returns a value that is coercible to the Boolean value **true** or **false**. `some` calls *callbackfn* once for each element present in the array, in ascending order, until it finds one where *callbackfn* returns **true**. If such an element is found, `some` immediately returns **true**. Otherwise, `some` returns **false**. *callbackfn* is called only for elements of the array which actually exist; it is not called for missing elements of the array.

If a *thisArg* parameter is provided, it will be used as the **this** value for each invocation of *callbackfn*. If it is not provided, **undefined** is used instead.

*callbackfn* is called with three arguments: the value of the element, the index of the element, and the object being traversed.

`some` does not directly mutate the object on which it is called but the object may be mutated by the calls to *callbackfn*.

The range of elements processed by `some` is set before the first call to *callbackfn*. Elements that are appended to the array after the call to `some` begins will not be visited by *callbackfn*. If existing elements of the array are changed, their value as passed to *callbackfn* will be the value at the time that `some` visits them; elements that are deleted after the call to `some` begins and before being visited are not visited. `some` acts like the "exists" quantifier in mathematics. In particular, for an empty array, it returns **false**.

When the `some` method is called with one or two arguments, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"length"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
5.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*callbackfn*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
6.  If *thisArg* was supplied, let *T* be *thisArg*; else let *T* be **undefined**.
7.  Let *k* be 0.
8.  Repeat, while *k* &lt; *len*
    1.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
    2.  Let *kPresent* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, *Pk*).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kPresent*).
    4.  If *kPresent* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *kValue* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, *Pk*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kValue*).
        3.  Let *testResult* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)([Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*callbackfn*, *T*, «*kValue*, *k*, and *O*»)).
        4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*testResult*).
        5.  If *testResult* is **true**, return **true**.

    5.  Increase *k* by 1.

9.  Return **false**.

The `length` property of the `some` method is **1**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `some` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.24" class="secnum">[22.1.3.24](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.sort "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.sort (comparefn)
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

The elements of this array are sorted. The sort is not necessarily stable (that is, elements that compare equal do not necessarily remain in their original order). If comparefn is not **undefined**, it should be a function that accepts two arguments x and y and returns a negative value if x <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">&lt;</span> y, zero if x <span style="font-family: Times New
          Roman">=</span> y, or a positive value if x <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">&gt;</span> y.

Upon entry, the following steps are performed to initialize evaluation of the `sort` function:

1.  Let *obj* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*obj*, `"length"`)).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).

Within this specification of the `sort` method, an Array object, obj, is said to be *sparse* if the following algorithm returns **true**:

1.  For each integer *i* in the range 0≤*i*&lt; *len*
    1.  Let *elem* be *obj*.\[\[GetOwnProperty\]\]([ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*i*)).
    2.  If *elem* is **undefined**, return **true**.

2.  Return **false**.

The *sort order* is the ordering, after completion of this function, of the integer indexed property values of obj whose integer indexes are less than len. The result of the `sort` function is then determined as follows:

If comparefn is not **undefined** and is not a consistent comparison function for the elements of this array (see below), the sort order is implementation-defined. The sort order is also implementation-defined if comparefn is **undefined** and [SortCompare](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-sortcompare) ({ REF \_Ref393437395 \\n \\h }22.1.3.24.1) does not act as a consistent comparison function.

Let proto be obj.\[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\](). If proto is not **null** and there exists an integer j such that all of the conditions below are satisfied then the sort order is implementation-defined:

-   obj is sparse
-   0 ≤ j &lt; len
-   [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(proto, <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">[ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*j*))</span> is **true**.

The sort order is also implementation defined if obj is sparse and any of the following conditions are true:

-   [IsExtensible](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isextensible-o)(<span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*obj*)</span> is **false**.

-   Any integer index property of obj whose name is a nonnegative integer less than len is a data property whose \[\[Configurable\]\] attribute is **false**.

The sort order is also implementation defined if any of the following conditions are true:

-   If obj is an exotic object (including Proxy exotic objects) whose behaviour for \[\[Get\]\], \[\[Set\]\], \[\[Delete\]\], and \[\[GetOwnProperty\]\] is not the ordinary object implementation of these internal methods.

-   If any index index property of obj whose name is a nonnegative integer less than len is an accessor property or is a data property whose \[\[Writable\]\] attribute is <span class="value">false</span>.

-   If comparefn is <span class="value">undefined</span> and the application of [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring) to any value passed as an argument to [SortCompare](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-sortcompare) modifies obj or any object on obj’s prototype chain.

-   If comparefn is <span class="value">undefined</span> and all applications of [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring), to any specific value passed as an argument to [SortCompare](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-sortcompare), do not produce the same result.

The following steps are taken:

1.  Perform an implementation-dependent sequence of calls to the \[\[Get\]\] and \[\[Set\]\] internal methods of *obj*, to the [DeletePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-deletepropertyorthrow) and [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty) abstract operation with *obj* as the first argument, and to [SortCompare](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-sortcompare) (described below), such that:
    -   The [property key](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-type) argument for each call to \[\[Get\]\], \[\[Set\]\], [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty), or [DeletePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-deletepropertyorthrow) is the string representation of a nonnegative integer less than *len*.

    -   The arguments for calls to [SortCompare](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-sortcompare) are values returned by a previous call to the \[\[Get\]\] internal method, unless the properties accessed by those previous calls did not exist according to [HasOwnProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasownproperty). If both perspective arguments to [SortCompare](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-sortcompare) correspond to non-existent properties, use +0 instead of calling [SortCompare](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-sortcompare). If only the first perspective argument is non-existent use +1. If only the second perspective argument is non-existent use −1.

    -   If *obj* is not sparse then [DeletePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-deletepropertyorthrow) must not be called.

    -   If any \[\[Set\]\] call returns **false** a **TypeError** exception is thrown.

    -   If an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) is returned from any of these operations, it is immediately returned as the value of this function.

2.  Return *obj*.

Unless the sort order is specified above to be implementation-defined, the returned object must have the following two characteristics:

-   There must be some mathematical permutation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">π</span> of the nonnegative integers less than len, such that for every nonnegative integer j less than len, if property <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">old\[*j*\]</span> existed, then <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">new\[π(*j*)\]</span> is exactly the same value as <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">old\[*j*\]</span>. But if property <span style="font-family: Times New
                  Roman">old\[*j*\]</span> did not exist, then <span style="font-family: Times New
                  Roman">new\[π(*j*)\]</span> does not exist.

-   Then for all nonnegative integers j and k, each less than len, if <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">[SortCompare](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-sortcompare)(old\[*j*\], old\[*k*\]) &lt; 0</span> (see [SortCompare](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-sortcompare) below), then <span style="font-family: Times New
                  Roman">new\[**π**(*j*)\] &lt;</span> <span style="font-family: Times New
                  Roman">new\[**π**(*k*)\]</span>.

Here the notation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">old\[*j*\]</span> is used to refer to the hypothetical result of calling the \[\[Get\]\] internal method of obj with argument j before this function is executed, and the notation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">new\[*j*\]</span> to refer to the hypothetical result of calling the \[\[Get\]\] internal method of obj with argument j after this function has been executed.

A function comparefn is a consistent comparison function for a set of values S if all of the requirements below are met for all values a, b, and c (possibly the same value) in the set S: The notation <span style="font-family: Times New
          Roman">*a* &lt;<sub>CF</sub></span> b means <span style="font-family: Times New
          Roman">*comparefn*(*a*,*b*) &lt; 0</span>; <span style="font-family: Times New
          Roman">*a* =<sub>CF</sub></span> b means <span style="font-family: Times New
          Roman">*comparefn*(*a*,*b*) = 0</span> (of either sign); and <span style="font-family: Times
          New Roman">*a* &gt;<sub>CF</sub></span> b means <span style="font-family: Times New
          Roman">*comparefn*(*a*,*b*) &gt; 0</span>.

-   Calling *comparefn*(*a*,*b*) always returns the same value *v* when given a specific pair of values *a* and *b* as its two arguments. Furthermore, [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*v*) is Number, and *v* is not NaN. Note that this implies that exactly one of *a* &lt;<sub>CF</sub> *b*, *a* =<sub>CF</sub> *b*, and *a* &gt;<sub>CF</sub> *b* will be true for a given pair of *a* and *b*.

-   Calling *comparefn*(*a*,*b*) does not modify *obj* or any object on *obj*’s prototype chain.

-   *a* =<sub>CF</sub> *a* (reflexivity)

-   If *a* =<sub>CF</sub> *b*, then *b* =<sub>CF</sub> *a* (symmetry)

-   If *a* =<sub>CF</sub> *b* and *b* =<sub>CF</sub> *c*, then *a* =<sub>CF</sub> *c* (transitivity of =<sub>CF</sub>)

-   If *a* &lt;<sub>CF</sub> *b* and *b* &lt;<sub>CF</sub> *c*, then *a* &lt;<sub>CF</sub> *c* (transitivity of &lt;<sub>CF</sub>)

-   If *a* &gt;<sub>CF</sub> *b* and *b* &gt;<sub>CF</sub> *c*, then *a* &gt;<sub>CF</sub> *c* (transitivity of &gt;<sub>CF</sub>)

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> The above conditions are necessary and sufficient to ensure that *comparefn* divides the set *S* into equivalence classes and that these equivalence classes are totally ordered.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> The `sort` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore, it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.24.1" class="secnum">[22.1.3.24.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-sortcompare "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: SortCompare( x, y )
===================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the SortCompare abstract operation is called with two arguments x and y. It also has access to the comparefn argument passed to the current invocation of the `sort` method. The following steps are taken:

1.  If *x* and *y* are both **undefined**, return +0.
2.  If *x* is **undefined**, return 1.
3.  If *y* is **undefined**, return −1.
4.  If the argument *comparefn* is not **undefined**, then
    1.  Let *v* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)([Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*comparefn*, **undefined**, «*x*, *y*»)).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*v*).
    3.  If *v* is **NaN**, return +0.
    4.  Return *v*.

5.  Let *xString* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*x*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*xString*).
7.  Let *yString* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*y*).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*yString*).
9.  If *xString* &lt; *yString*, return −1.
10. If *xString* &gt; *yString*, return 1.
11. Return +0.

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> Because non-existent property values always compare greater than **undefined** property values, and **undefined** always compares greater than any other value, **undefined** property values always sort to the end of the result, followed by non-existent property values.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> Method calls performed by the [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring) abstract operations in steps 5 and 7 have the potential to cause SortCompare to not behave as a consistent comparison function.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.25" class="secnum">[22.1.3.25](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.splice "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.splice (start, deleteCount , ...items )
===========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE</span> When the `splice` method is called with two or more arguments *start*, *deleteCount* and zero or more *items*, the *deleteCount* elements of the array starting at integer index *start* are replaced by the arguments *items*. An Array object containing the deleted elements (if any) is returned.

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"length"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
5.  Let *relativeStart* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*start*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*relativeStart*).
7.  If *relativeStart* &lt; 0, let *actualStart* be max((*len* + *relativeStart*),0); else let *actualStart* be min(*relativeStart*, *len*).
8.  If the number of actual arguments is 0, then
    1.  Let *insertCount* be 0.
    2.  Let *actualDeleteCount* be 0.

9.  Else if the number of actual arguments is 1, then
    1.  Let *insertCount* be 0.
    2.  Let *actualDeleteCount* be *len* – *actualStart*.

10. Else,
    1.  Let *insertCount* be the number of actual arguments minus 2.
    2.  Let *dc* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*deleteCount*).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*dc*).
    4.  Let *actualDeleteCount* be min(max(*dc*,0), *len* – *actualStart*).

11. If *len+insertCount*−*actualDeleteCount* &gt; 2<sup>53</sup>-1, throw a **TypeError** exception.
12. Let *A* be [ArraySpeciesCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arrayspeciescreate)(*O*, *actualDeleteCount*).
13. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*A*).
14. Let *k* be 0.
15. Repeat, while *k* &lt; *actualDeleteCount*
    1.  Let *from* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*actualStart*+*k*).
    2.  Let *fromPresent* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, *from*).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*fromPresent*).
    4.  If *fromPresent* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *fromValue* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O,* *from*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*fromValue*).
        3.  Let *status* be [CreateDataPropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdatapropertyorthrow)(*A*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*), *fromValue*).
        4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).

    5.  Increment *k* by 1.

16. Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*A*, `"length"`, *actualDeleteCount*, **true**).
17. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
18. Let *items* be a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) whose elements are, in left to right order, the portion of the actual argument list starting with the third argument. The list is empty if fewer than three arguments were passed.
19. Let *itemCount* be the number of elements in *items*.
20. If *itemCount* &lt; *actualDeleteCount*, then
    1.  Let *k* be *actualStart*.
    2.  Repeat, while *k* &lt; (*len* – *actualDeleteCount*)
        1.  Let *from* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*+*actualDeleteCount*).
        2.  Let *to* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*+*itemCount*).
        3.  Let *fromPresent* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, *from*).
        4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*fromPresent*).
        5.  If *fromPresent* is **true**, then
            1.  Let *fromValue* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, *from*).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*fromValue*).
            3.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, *to*, *fromValue*, **true**).
            4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).

        6.  Else *fromPresent* is **false**,
            1.  Let *deleteStatus* be [DeletePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-deletepropertyorthrow)(*O*, *to*).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*deleteStatus*).

        7.  Increase *k* by 1.

    3.  Let *k* be *len*.
    4.  Repeat, while *k* &gt; (*len* – *actualDeleteCount* + *itemCount*)
        1.  Let *deleteStatus* be [DeletePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-deletepropertyorthrow)(*O*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*–1)).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*deleteStatus*).
        3.  Decrease *k* by 1.

21. Else if *itemCount* &gt; *actualDeleteCount*, then
    1.  Let *k* be (*len* – *actualDeleteCount*).
    2.  Repeat, while *k* &gt; *actualStart*
        1.  Let *from* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k* + *actualDeleteCount* – 1).
        2.  Let *to* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k* + *itemCount* – 1)
        3.  Let *fromPresent* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, *from*).
        4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*fromPresent*).
        5.  If *fromPresent* is **true**, then
            1.  Let *fromValue* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, *from*).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*fromValue*).
            3.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, *to*, *fromValue*, **true**).
            4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).

        6.  Else *fromPresent* is **false**,
            1.  Let *deleteStatus* be [DeletePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-deletepropertyorthrow)(*O*, *to*).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*deleteStatus*).

        7.  Decrease *k* by 1.

22. Let *k* be *actualStart*.
23. Repeat, while *items* is not empty
    1.  Remove the first element from *items* and let *E* be the value of that element.
    2.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*), *E*, **true**).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
    4.  Increase *k* by 1.

24. Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, `"length"`, *len* – *actualDeleteCount* + *itemCount*, **true**).
25. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
26. Return *A*.

The `length` property of the `splice` method is **2**.

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> The explicit setting of the `length` property of the result Array in step 24 is necessary to ensure that its value is correct in situations where its trailing elements are not present.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> The `splice` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.26" class="secnum">[22.1.3.26](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.tolocalestring "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.toLocaleString ( \[ reserved1 \[ , reserved2 \] \] )
================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

An ECMAScript implementation that includes the ECMA-402 Internationalization API must implement the `Array.prototype.toLocaleString` method as specified in the ECMA-402 specification. If an ECMAScript implementation does not include the ECMA-402 API the following specification of the `toLocaleString` method is used.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The first edition of ECMA-402 did not include a replacement specification for the `Array.prototype.toLocaleString` method.

The meanings of the optional parameters to this method are defined in the ECMA-402 specification; implementations that do not include ECMA-402 support must not use those parameter positions for anything else.

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *array* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*array*).
3.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*array*, `"length"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
5.  Let *separator* be the String value for the list-separator String appropriate for the host environment’s current locale (this is derived in an implementation-defined way).
6.  If *len* is zero, return the empty String.
7.  Let *firstElement* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*array*, `"0"`).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*firstElement*).
9.  If *firstElement* is **undefined** or **null**, then
    1.  Let *R* be the empty String.

10. Else
    1.  Let *R* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)([Invoke](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-invoke)(*firstElement*, `"toLocaleString"`)).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*R*).

11. Let *k* be `1`.
12. Repeat, while *k* &lt; *len*
    1.  Let *S* be a String value produced by concatenating *R* and *separator*.
    2.  Let *nextElement* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*array*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*)).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*nextElement*).
    4.  If *nextElement* is **undefined** or **null**, then
        1.  Let *R* be the empty String.

    5.  Else
        1.  Let *R* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)([Invoke](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-invoke)(*nextElement*, `"toLocaleString"`)).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*R*).

    6.  Let *R* be a String value produced by concatenating *S* and *R*.
    7.  Increase *k* by 1.

13. Return *R*.

<span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE 1</span> The elements of the array are converted to Strings using their `toLocaleString` methods, and these Strings are then concatenated, separated by occurrences of a separator String that has been derived in an implementation-defined locale-specific way. The result of calling this function is intended to be analogous to the result of `toString`, except that the result of this function is intended to be locale-specific.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> The `toLocaleString` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.27" class="secnum">[22.1.3.27](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.tostring "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.toString ( )
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `toString` method is called, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *array* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*array*).
3.  Let *func* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*array*, `"join"`).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*func*).
5.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*func*) is **false**, let *func* be the intrinsic function %ObjProto\_toString% ([19.1.3.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object.prototype.tostring)).
6.  Return [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*func*, *array*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `toString` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.28" class="secnum">[22.1.3.28](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.unshift "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.unshift ( ...items )
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE</span> The arguments are prepended to the start of the array, such that their order within the array is the same as the order in which they appear in the argument list.

When the `unshift` method is called with zero or more arguments item1, item2, etc., the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, `"length"`)).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
5.  Let *argCount* be the number of actual arguments.
6.  If *argCount* &gt; 0, then
    1.  If *len*+ *argCount* &gt; 2<sup>53</sup>-1, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    2.  Let *k* be *len*.
    3.  Repeat, while *k* &gt; 0,
        1.  Let *from* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*–1).
        2.  Let *to* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*+*argCount* –1).
        3.  Let *fromPresent* be [HasProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-hasproperty)(*O*, *from*).
        4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*fromPresent*).
        5.  If *fromPresent* is **true**, then
            1.  Let *fromValue* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, *from*).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*fromValue*).
            3.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, *to*, *fromValue*, **true**).
            4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).

        6.  Else *fromPresent* is **false**,
            1.  Let *deleteStatus* be [DeletePropertyOrThrow](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-deletepropertyorthrow)(*O*, *to*).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*deleteStatus*).

        7.  Decrease *k* by 1.

    4.  Let *j* be 0.
    5.  Let *items* be a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) whose elements are, in left to right order, the arguments that were passed to this function invocation.
    6.  Repeat, while *items* is not empty
        1.  Remove the first element from *items* and let *E* be the value of that element.
        2.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*j*), *E*, **true**).
        3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
        4.  Increase *j* by 1.

7.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*O*, `"length"`, *len*+*argCount*, **true**).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
9.  Return *len*+*argCount*.

The `length` property of the `unshift` method is **1**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The `unshift` function is intentionally generic; it does not require that its **this** value be an Array object. Therefore it can be transferred to other kinds of objects for use as a method.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.29" class="secnum">[22.1.3.29](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.values "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype.values ( )
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(**this** value).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
3.  Return [CreateArrayIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createarrayiterator)(*O*, `"value"`).

This function is the %ArrayProto\_values% intrinsic object.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.30" class="secnum">[22.1.3.30](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype-@@iterator "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype \[ @@iterator \] ( )
============================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of the @@iterator property is the same function object as the initial value of the **[Array.prototype.values](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.values)** property.

<span id="sec-22.1.3.31" class="secnum">[22.1.3.31](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype-@@unscopables "link to this section")</span> Array.prototype \[ @@unscopables \]
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of the @@unscopables data property is an object created by the following steps:

1.  Let *blackList* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(**null**).
2.  Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*blackList*, `"copyWithin"`, **true**).
3.  Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*blackList*, `"entries"`, **true**).
4.  Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*blackList*, `"fill"`, **true**).
5.  Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*blackList*, `"find"`, **true**).
6.  Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*blackList*, `"findIndex"`, **true**).
7.  Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*blackList*, `"keys"`, **true**).
8.  Perform [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*blackList*, **"`values"`**, **true**).
9.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): Each of the above calls will return **true**.
10. Return *blackList*.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span> }.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The own property names of this object are property names that were not included as standard properties of `Array.prototype` prior to the ECMAScrupt 2015 specification. These names are ignored for `with` statement binding purposes in order to preserve the behaviour of existing code that might use one of these names as a binding in an outer scope that is shadowed by a `with` statement whose binding object is an Array object.

<span id="sec-22.1.4" class="secnum">[22.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-array-instances "link to this section")</span> Properties of Array Instances
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

Array instances are Array exotic objects and have the internal methods specified for such objects. Array instances inherit properties from the Array prototype object.

Array instances have a `length` property, and a set of enumerable properties with array index names.

<span id="sec-22.1.4.1" class="secnum">[22.1.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-array-instances-length "link to this section")</span> length
======================================================================================================================================================================================

The `length` property of an Array instance is a data property whose value is always numerically greater than the name of every configurable own property whose name is an array index.

The `length` property initially has the attributes <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">{ \[\[Writable\]\]: **true**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }</span>.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Reducing the value of the `length` property has the side-effect of deleting own array elements whose array index is between the old and new length values. However, non-configurable properties can not be deleted. Attempting to set the length property of an Array object to a value that is numerically less than or equal to the largest numeric own property name of an existing non-configurable array indexed property of the array will result in the length being set to a numeric value that is one greater than that non-configurable numeric own property name. See [9.4.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array-exotic-objects-defineownproperty-p-desc).

<span id="sec-22.1.5" class="secnum">[22.1.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array-iterator-objects "link to this section")</span> Array Iterator Objects
====================================================================================================================================================================================

An Array Iterator is an object, that represents a specific iteration over some specific Array instance object. There is not a named constructor for Array Iterator objects. Instead, Array iterator objects are created by calling certain methods of Array instance objects.

<span id="sec-22.1.5.1" class="secnum">[22.1.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createarrayiterator "link to this section")</span> CreateArrayIterator Abstract Operation
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================

Several methods of Array objects return Iterator objects. The abstract operation CreateArrayIterator with arguments array and kind is used to create such iterator objects. It performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*array*) is Object.
2.  Let *iterator* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(%ArrayIteratorPrototype%, «‍\[\[IteratedObject\]\], \[\[ArrayIteratorNextIndex\]\], \[\[ArrayIterationKind\]\]»).
3.  Set *iterator’s* \[\[IteratedObject\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *array*.
4.  Set *iterator’s* \[\[ArrayIteratorNextIndex\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to 0.
5.  Set *iterator’s* \[\[ArrayIterationKind\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *kind*.
6.  Return *iterator*.

<span id="sec-22.1.5.2" class="secnum">[22.1.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%arrayiteratorprototype%-object "link to this section")</span> The %ArrayIteratorPrototype% Object
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================

All Array Iterator Objects inherit properties from the %ArrayIteratorPrototype% intrinsic object. The %ArrayIteratorPrototype% object is an ordinary object and its \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is the %IteratorPrototype% intrinsic object ([25.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%iteratorprototype%-object)). In addition, %ArrayIteratorPrototype% has the following properties:

<span id="sec-22.1.5.2.1" class="secnum">[22.1.5.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%arrayiteratorprototype%.next "link to this section")</span> %ArrayIteratorPrototype%.next( )
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================

1.  Let *O* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *O* does not have all of the internal slots of an Array Iterator Instance ([22.1.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-array-iterator-instances)), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *a* be the value of the \[\[IteratedObject\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
5.  If *a* is **undefined**, return [CreateIterResultObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject)(**undefined**, **true**).
6.  Let *index* be the value of the \[\[ArrayIteratorNextIndex\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
7.  Let *itemKind* be the value of the \[\[ArrayIterationKind\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
8.  If *a* has a \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), then
    1.  Let *len* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

9.  Else,
    1.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*a*, `"length"`)).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).

10. If *index* ≥ *len*, then
    1.  Set the value of the \[\[IteratedObject\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O* to **undefined**.
    2.  Return [CreateIterResultObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject)(**undefined**, **true**).

11. Set the value of the \[\[ArrayIteratorNextIndex\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O* to *index*+1.
12. If *itemKind* is **"`key`"**, return [CreateIterResultObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject)(*index*, **false**).
13. Let *elementKey* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*index*).
14. Let *elementValue* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*a*, *elementKey*).
15. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*elementValue*).
16. If *itemKind* is **"`value`"**, let *result* be *elementValue*.
17. Else,
    1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *itemKind* is **"`key+value`"**.
    2.  Let *result* be [CreateArrayFromList](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createarrayfromlist)(«*index*, *elementValue*»).

18. Return [CreateIterResultObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject)(*result*, **false**).

<span id="sec-22.1.5.2.2" class="secnum">[22.1.5.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%arrayiteratorprototype%-@@tostringtag "link to this section")</span> %ArrayIteratorPrototype% \[ @@toStringTag \]
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of the @@toStringTag property is the string value `"Array Iterator"`.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span> }.

<span id="sec-22.1.5.3" class="secnum">[22.1.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-array-iterator-instances "link to this section")</span> Properties of Array Iterator Instances
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

Array Iterator instances are ordinary objects that inherit properties from the %ArrayIteratorPrototype% intrinsic object. Array Iterator instances are initially created with the internal slots listed in [Table 48](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-48).

<span id="table-48">Table 48</span> — Internal Slots of Array Iterator Instances

| Internal Slot                  | Description                                                                                                                                    |
|--------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| \[\[IteratedObject\]\]         | The object whose array elements are being iterated.                                                                                            |
| \[\[ArrayIteratorNextIndex\]\] | The integer index of the next integer index to be examined by this iteration.                                                                  |
| \[\[ArrayIterationKind\]\]     | A string value that identifies what is returned for each element of the iteration. The possible values are: `"key"`, `"value"`, `"key+value"`. |

<span id="sec-22.2" class="secnum">[22.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-typedarray-objects "link to this section")</span> *TypedArray* Objects
==========================================================================================================================================================================

*TypedArray* objects present an array-like view of an underlying binary data buffer ([24.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraybuffer-objects)). Each element of a *TypedArray* instance has the same underlying binary scalar data type. There is a distinct *TypedArray* constructor, listed in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49), for each of the nine supported element types. Each constructor in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) has a corresponding distinct prototype object.
