<span id="sec-22.2.1" class="secnum">[22.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%-intrinsic-object "link to this section")</span> The %TypedArray% Intrinsic Object
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

The %TypedArray% intrinsic object is a constructor function object that all of the *TypedArray* constructor object inherit from. %TypedArray% and its corresponding prototype object provide common properties that are inherited by all *TypedArray* constructors and their instances. The %TypedArray% intrinsic does not have a global name or appear as a property of the global object.

The %TypedArray% intrinsic function object is designed to act as the superclass of the various *TypedArray* constructors. Those constructors use %TypedArray% to initialize their instances by invoking %TypedArray% as if by making a `super` call. The %TypedArray% intrinsic function is not designed to be directly called in any other way. If %TypedArray% is directly called or called as part of a `new` expression an exception is thrown.

The %TypedArray% intrinsic constructor function is a single function whose behaviour is overloaded based upon the number and types of its arguments. The actual behaviour of a `super` call of %TypedArray% depends upon the number and kind of arguments that are passed to it.

<span id="sec-22.2.1.1" class="secnum">[22.2.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%-intrinsic-object-%typedarray% "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray% ( )
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

This description applies only if the %TypedArray% function is called with no arguments.

1.  If NewTarget is **undefined**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  Return [AllocateTypedArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-allocatetypedarray)(NewTarget, 0).

<span id="sec-22.2.1.2" class="secnum">[22.2.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%-length "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray% ( length )
======================================================================================================================================================================================

This description applies only if the %TypedArray% function is called with at least one argument and the Type of the first argument is not Object.

%TypedArray% called with argument length performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*length*) is not Object.
2.  If NewTarget is **undefined**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *length* is **undefined**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *numberLength* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*length*).
5.  Let *elementLength* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)(*numberLength*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*elementLength*).
7.  If [SameValueZero](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevaluezero)(*numberLength*, *elementLength*) is **false**, throw a **RangeError** exception.
8.  Return [AllocateTypedArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-allocatetypedarray)(NewTarget, *elementLength*).

<span id="sec-22.2.1.2.1" class="secnum">[22.2.1.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-allocatetypedarray "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: AllocateTypedArray (newTarget, length )
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation AllocateTypedArray with argument newTarget and optional argument length is used to validate and create an instance of a TypedArray constructor. If the length argument is passed an ArrayBuffer of that length is also allocated and associated with the new TypedArray instance. AllocateTypedArray provides common semantics that is used by all of the %TypeArray% overloads and other methods. AllocateTypedArray performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor)(*newTarget*) is **true**.
2.  If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(%TypedArray%, *newTarget*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  NOTE <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">%TypedArray%</span> throws an exception when invoked via either a function call or the `new` operator. It can only be successfully invoked by a *SuperCall*.
4.  Let *constructorName* be **undefined**.
5.  Let *subclass* be *newTarget*.
6.  Repeat while *constructorName* is **undefined**
    1.  If *subclass* is **null**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    2.  If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(%TypedArray%, *subclass*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    3.  If *subclass* has a \[\[TypedArrayConstructorName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), let *constructorName* be the value of *subclass*’s \[\[TypedArrayConstructorName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
    4.  Let *subclass* be *subclass*.\[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\]().
    5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*subclass*).

7.  Let *proto* be [GetPrototypeFromConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getprototypefromconstructor)(*newTarget*, `"%TypedArrayPrototype%"`).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*proto*).
9.  Let *obj* be [IntegerIndexedObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-integerindexedobjectcreate) (*proto*, «‍\[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\], \[\[TypedArrayName\]\], \[\[ByteLength\]\], \[\[ByteOffset\]\], \[\[ArrayLength\]\]» ).
10. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): The \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *obj* is **undefined**.
11. Set *obj*’s \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *constructorName*.
12. If *length* was not passed, then
    1.  Set *obj*’s \[\[ByteLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to 0.
    2.  Set *obj*’s \[\[ByteOffset\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to 0.
    3.  Set *obj*’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to 0.

13. Else,
    1.  Let *elementSize* be the Element Size value in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *constructorName*.
    2.  Let *byteLength* be *elementSize* × *length*.
    3.  Let *data* be [AllocateArrayBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-allocatearraybuffer)(<span style="font-family:
                            sans-serif">%ArrayBuffer%</span>, *byteLength*).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*data*).
    5.  Set *obj’s* \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *data*.
    6.  Set *obj*’s \[\[ByteLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *byteLength*.
    7.  Set *obj*’s \[\[ByteOffset\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to 0.
    8.  Set *obj*’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *length*.

14. Return *obj*.

<span id="sec-22.2.1.3" class="secnum">[22.2.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%-typedarray "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray% ( typedArray )
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

This description applies only if the %TypedArray% function is called with at least one argument and the Type of the first argument is Object and that object has a \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

%TypedArray% called with argument typedArray performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*typedArray*) is Object and *typedArray* has a \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
2.  If NewTarget is **undefined**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  Let *O* be [AllocateTypedArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-allocatetypedarray)(NewTarget).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
5.  Let *srcArray* be *typedArray*.
6.  Let *srcData* be the value of *srcArray’s* \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
7.  If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*srcData*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
8.  Let *constructorName* be the string value of *O*’s \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
9.  Let *elementType* be the string value of the Element Type value in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *constructorName*.
10. Let *elementLength* be the value of *srcArray’s* \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
11. Let *srcName* be the string value of *srcArray’s* \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
12. Let *srcType* be the string value of the Element Type value in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *srcName*.
13. Let *srcElementSize* be the Element Size value in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *srcName*.
14. Let *srcByteOffset* be the value of *srcArray*’s \[\[ByteOffset\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
15. Let *elementSize* be the Element Size value in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *constructorName*.
16. Let *byteLength* be *elementSize* × *elementLength*.
17. If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*elementType*,*srcType*) is **true**, then
    1.  Let *data* be [CloneArrayBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-clonearraybuffer)(*srcData*, *srcByteOffset*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*data*).

18. Else,
    1.  Let *bufferConstructor* be [SpeciesConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-speciesconstructor)(*srcData*, %ArrayBuffer%).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*bufferConstructor*).
    3.  Let *data* be [AllocateArrayBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-allocatearraybuffer)(*bufferConstructor*, *byteLength*).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*data*).
    5.  If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*srcData*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    6.  Let *srcByteIndex* be *srcByteOffset*.
    7.  Let *targetByteIndex* be 0.
    8.  Let *count* be *elementLength*.
    9.  Repeat, while *count* &gt;0
        1.  Let *value* be [GetValueFromBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvaluefrombuffer)(*srcData*, *srcByteIndex*, *srcType*).
        2.  Perform [SetValueInBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setvalueinbuffer)(*data*, *targetByteIndex*, *elementType*, *value*).
        3.  Set *srcByteIndex* to *srcByteIndex* + *srcElementSize*.
        4.  Set *targetByteIndex* to *targetByteIndex* + *elementSize*.
        5.  Decrement *count* by 1.

19. Set *O’s* \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *data*.
20. Set *O*’s \[\[ByteLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *byteLength*.
21. Set *O*’s \[\[ByteOffset\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to 0.
22. Set *O*’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *elementLength*.
23. Return *O*.

<span id="sec-22.2.1.4" class="secnum">[22.2.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%-object "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray% ( object )
======================================================================================================================================================================================

This description applies only if the %TypedArray% function is called with at least one argument and the Type of the first argument is Object and that object does not have either a \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] or an \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

%TypedArray% called with argument object performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*object*) is Object and *object* does not have either a \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] or an \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
2.  If NewTarget is **undefined**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  Return [TypedArrayFrom](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-typedarrayfrom)(NewTarget, *object*, **undefined**, **undefined**).

<span id="sec-22.2.1.5" class="secnum">[22.2.1.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%-buffer-byteoffset-length "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray% ( buffer \[ , byteOffset \[ , length \] \] )
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

This description applies only if the %TypedArray% function is called with at least one argument and the Type of the first argument is Object and that object has an \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

%TypedArray% called with arguments <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*buffer*, *byteOffset*, and *length*</span> performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*buffer*) is Object and *buffer* has an \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
2.  If NewTarget is **undefined**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  Let *O* be [AllocateTypedArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-allocatetypedarray)(NewTarget).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
5.  Let *constructorName* be the string value of *O*’s \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
6.  Let *elementSize* be the Number value of the Element Size value in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *constructorName*.
7.  Let *offset* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*byteOffset*).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*offset*).
9.  If *offset* &lt; 0, throw a **RangeError** exception.
10. If *offset* [modulo](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions) *elementSize* ≠ 0, throw a **RangeError** exception.
11. If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*buffer*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
12. Let *bufferByteLength* be the value of *buffer’s* \[\[ArrayBufferByteLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
13. If *length* is **undefined**, then
    1.  If *bufferByteLength* [modulo](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions) *elementSize* ≠ 0, throw a **RangeError** exception.
    2.  Let *newByteLength* be *bufferByteLength* – *offset*.
    3.  If *newByteLength* &lt; 0, throw a **RangeError** exception.

14. Else,
    1.  Let *newLength* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)(*length*)*.*
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*newLength*).
    3.  Let *newByteLength* be *newLength* × *elementSize*.
    4.  If *offset*+*newByteLength* &gt; *bufferByteLength*, throw a **RangeError** exception.

15. Set *O’s* \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *buffer*.
16. Set *O*’s \[\[ByteLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *newByteLength*.
17. Set *O*’s \[\[ByteOffset\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *offset*.
18. Set *O*’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *newByteLength /* *elementSize* .
19. Return *O*.

<span id="sec-22.2.2" class="secnum">[22.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-%typedarray%-intrinsic-object "link to this section")</span> Properties of the %TypedArray% Intrinsic Object
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of %TypedArray% is the intrinsic object %FunctionPrototype% ([19.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-function-prototype-object)).

Besides a `length` property whose value is 3 and a `name` property whose value is `"TypedArray"`, %TypedArray% has the following properties:

<span id="sec-22.2.2.1" class="secnum">[22.2.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.from "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray%.from ( source \[ , mapfn \[ , thisArg \] \] )
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `from` method is called with argument source, and optional arguments *mapfn* and *thisArg*, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *C* be the **this** value.
2.  If [IsConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor)(*C*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *mapfn* was supplied, let *f* be *mapfn*; otherwise let *f* be **undefined**.
4.  If *f* is not **undefined**, then
    1.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*f*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.

5.  If *thisArg* was supplied, let *t* be *thisArg*; else let *t* be **undefined**.
6.  Return [TypedArrayFrom](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-typedarrayfrom)(*C*, *source*, *f*, *t*).

The `length` property of the `from` method is **1**.

<span id="sec-22.2.2.1.1" class="secnum">[22.2.2.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-typedarrayfrom "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: TypedArrayFrom( constructor, items, mapfn, thisArg )
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the TypedArrayFrom abstract operation is called with arguments <span style="font-family: Times New
          Roman">*constructor*,</span> items, mapfn, and thisArg, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *C* be *constructor*.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor)(*C*) is **true**.
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *mapfn* is either a callable Object or **undefined**.
4.  If *mapfn* is **undefined**, let *mapping* be **false.**
5.  Else
    1.  Let *T* be *thisArg*.
    2.  Let *mapping* be **true**

6.  Let *usingIterator* be [GetMethod](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getmethod)(*items*, @@iterator).
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*usingIterator*).
8.  If *usingIterator* is not **undefined**, then
    1.  Let *iterator* be [GetIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getiterator)(*items*, *usingIterator*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*iterator*).
    3.  Let *values* be a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
    4.  Let *next* be **true**.
    5.  Repeat, while *next* is not **false**
        1.  Let *next* be [IteratorStep](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorstep)(*iterator*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*next*).
        3.  If *next* is not **false**, then
            1.  Let *nextValue* be [IteratorValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorvalue)(*next*).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*nextValue*).
            3.  Append *nextValue* to the end of the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) *values*.

    6.  Let *len* be the number of elements in *values*.
    7.  Let *targetObj* be [AllocateTypedArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-allocatetypedarray)(*C*, *len*).
    8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*targetObj*).
    9.  Let *k* be 0.
    10. Repeat, while *k* &lt; *len*
        1.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
        2.  Let *kValue* be the first element of *values* and remove that element from *list*.
        3.  If *mapping* is **true**, then
            1.  Let *mappedValue* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*mapfn*, *T*, «*kValue*, *k*»).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*mappedValue*).

        4.  Else, let *mappedValue* be *kValue*.
        5.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*targetObj*, *Pk*, *mappedValue*, **true**).
        6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
        7.  Increase *k* by 1.

    11. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *values* is now an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
    12. Return *targetObj*.

9.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *items* is not an Iterable so assume it is an array-like object.
10. Let *arrayLike* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(*items*).
11. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*arrayLike*).
12. Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*arrayLike*, `"length"`)).
13. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
14. Let *targetObj* be [AllocateTypedArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-allocatetypedarray)(*C*, *len*).
15. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*targetObj*).
16. Let *k* be 0.
17. Repeat, while *k* &lt; *len*
    1.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
    2.  Let *kValue* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*arrayLike*, *Pk*).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kValue*).
    4.  If *mapping* is **true**, then
        1.  Let *mappedValue* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*mapfn*, *T*, «*kValue*, *k*»).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*mappedValue*).

    5.  Else, let *mappedValue* be *kValue*.
    6.  Let *setStatus* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*targetObj*, *Pk*, *mappedValue*, **true**).
    7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*setStatus*).
    8.  Increase *k* by 1.

18. Return *targetObj*.

<span id="sec-22.2.2.2" class="secnum">[22.2.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.of "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray%.of ( ...items )
=======================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `of` method is called with any number of arguments, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *len* be the actual number of arguments passed to this function.
2.  Let *items* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of arguments passed to this function.
3.  Let *C* be the **this** value.
4.  If [IsConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor)(*C*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
5.  Let *newObj* be [AllocateTypedArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-allocatetypedarray)(*C*, *len*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*newObj*).
7.  Let *k* be 0.
8.  Repeat, while *k* &lt; *len*
    1.  Let *kValue* be *items*\[*k*\].
    2.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
    3.  Let *status* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*newObj*, *Pk*, *kValue*, **true**).
    4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
    5.  Increase *k* by 1.

9.  Return *newObj*.

The `length` property of the `of` method is **0**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The *items* argument is assumed to be a well-formed rest argument value.

<span id="sec-22.2.2.3" class="secnum">[22.2.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.prototype "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray%.prototype
========================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of %TypedArray%.prototype is the %TypedArrayPrototype% intrinsic object ([22.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-%typedarrayprototype%-object)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span> }.

<span id="sec-22.2.2.4" class="secnum">[22.2.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-%typedarray%-@@species "link to this section")</span> get %TypedArray% \[ @@species \]
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

%TypedArray%\[@@species\] is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Return the **this** value.

The value of the `name` property of this function is `"get [Symbol.species]"`.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> %TypedArrayPrototype% methods normally use their `this` object’s constructor to create a derived object. However, a subclass constructor may over-ride that default behaviour by redefining its @@species property.

<span id="sec-22.2.3" class="secnum">[22.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-%typedarrayprototype%-object "link to this section")</span> Properties of the %TypedArrayPrototype% Object
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the %TypedArrayPrototype% object is the intrinsic object %ObjectPrototype% ([19.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-object-prototype-object)). The %TypedArrayPrototype% object is an ordinary object. It does not have a \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] or any other of the internal slots that are specific to *TypedArray* instance objects.

<span id="sec-22.2.3.1" class="secnum">[22.2.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-%typedarray%.prototype.buffer "link to this section")</span> get %TypedArray%.prototype.buffer
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================

%TypedArray%.`prototype.buffer` is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Let *O* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *O* does not have a \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *buffer* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  Return *buffer*.

<span id="sec-22.2.3.2" class="secnum">[22.2.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-%typedarray%.prototype.bytelength "link to this section")</span> get %TypedArray%.prototype.byteLength
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

%TypedArray%.`prototype.byteLength` is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Let *O* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *O* does not have a \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *buffer* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*buffer*) is **true**, return 0.
6.  Let *size* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ByteLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
7.  Return *size*.

<span id="sec-22.2.3.3" class="secnum">[22.2.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-%typedarray%.prototype.byteoffset "link to this section")</span> get %TypedArray%.prototype.byteOffset
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

%TypedArray%.`prototype.byteOffset` is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Let *O* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *O* does not have a \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *buffer* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*buffer*) is **true**, return 0.
6.  Let *offset* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ByteOffset\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
7.  Return *offset*.

<span id="sec-22.2.3.4" class="secnum">[22.2.3.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.constructor "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray%.prototype.constructor
================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of %TypedArray%.prototype.constructor is the %TypedArray% intrinsic object.

<span id="sec-22.2.3.5" class="secnum">[22.2.3.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.copywithin "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray%.prototype.copyWithin (target, start \[, end \] )
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

%TypedArray%`.prototype.copyWithin` is a distinct function that implements the same algorithm as `Array.prototype.copyWithin` as defined in [22.1.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.copywithin) except that the **this** object’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is accessed in place of performing a \[\[Get\]\] of `"length"` and the actual copying of values in step 17 must be performed in a manner that preserves the bit-level encoding of the source data

The implementation of the algorithm may be optimized with the knowledge that the **this** value is an object that has a fixed length and whose integer indexed properties are not sparse. However, such optimization must not introduce any observable changes in the specified behaviour of the algorithm.

This function is not generic. [ValidateTypedArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-validatetypedarray) is applied to the **this** value prior to evaluating the algorithm. If its result is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) that exception is thrown instead of evaluating the algorithm.

The `length` property of the `copyWithin` method is **2**.

<span id="sec-22.2.3.5.1" class="secnum">[22.2.3.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-validatetypedarray "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: ValidateTypedArray ( O )
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================

When called with argument *O* the following steps are taken:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  If *O* does not have a \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *O* does not have a \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.

However, such optimization must not introduce any observable changes in the specified behaviour of the algorithm and must take into account the possibility that calls to callbackfn may cause the **this** value to become detached.

This function is not generic. [ValidateTypedArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-validatetypedarray) is applied to the **this** value prior to evaluating the algorithm. If its result is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) that exception is thrown instead of evaluating the algorithm.

The `length` property of the `reduceRight` method is **1**.

<span id="sec-22.2.3.21" class="secnum">[22.2.3.21](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.reverse "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray%.prototype.reverse ( )
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================

%TypedArray%`.prototype.reverse` is a distinct function that implements the same algorithm as `Array.prototype.reverse` as defined in [22.1.3.20](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.reverse) except that the **this** object’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is accessed in place of performing a \[\[Get\]\] of `"length"`. The implementation of the algorithm may be optimized with the knowledge that the **this** value is an object that has a fixed length and whose integer indexed properties are not sparse. However, such optimization must not introduce any observable changes in the specified behaviour of the algorithm.

This function is not generic. [ValidateTypedArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-validatetypedarray) is applied to the **this** value prior to evaluating the algorithm. If its result is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) that exception is thrown instead of evaluating the algorithm.

<span id="sec-22.2.3.22" class="secnum">[22.2.3.22](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.set-overloaded-offset "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray%.prototype.set ( overloaded \[ , offset \])
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

%TypedArray%`.prototype.set` is a single function whose behaviour is overloaded based upon the type of its first argument.

This function is not generic. The **this** value must be an object with a \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

The `length` property of the `set` method is **1**.

<span id="sec-22.2.3.22.1" class="secnum">[22.2.3.22.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.set-array-offset "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray%.prototype.set (array \[ , offset \] )
===========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

Sets multiple values in this *TypedArray*, reading the values from the object *array*. The optional *offset* value indicates the first element index in this *TypedArray* where values are written. If omitted, it is assumed to be 0.

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *array* is any [ECMAScript language value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types) other than an Object with a \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots). If it is such an Object, the definition in [22.2.3.22.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.set-typedarray-offset) applies.
2.  Let *target* be the **this** value.
3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*target*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  If *target* does not have a \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
5.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *target* has a \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
6.  Let *targetOffset* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger) (*offset*).
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*targetOffset*).
8.  If *targetOffset* &lt; 0, throw a **RangeError** exception.
9.  Let *targetBuffer* be the value of *target*’s \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
10. If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*targetBuffer*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
11. Let *targetLength* be the value of *target*’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
12. Let *targetName* be the string value of *target*’s \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
13. Let *targetElementSize* be the Number value of the Element Size value specified in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *targetName*.
14. Let *targetType* be the string value of the Element Type value in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *targetName*.
15. Let *targetByteOffset* be the value of *target*’s \[\[ByteOffset\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
16. Let *src* be [ToObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toobject)(*array*).
17. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*src*).
18. Let *srcLength* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*src*, `"length"`)).
19. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*srcLength*).
20. If *srcLength* + *targetOffset* &gt; *targetLength*, throw a **RangeError** exception.
21. Let *targetByteIndex* be *targetOffset* × *targetElementSize* + *targetByteOffset*.
22. Let *k* be 0.
23. Let *limit* be *targetByteIndex* + *targetElementSize* × *srcLength*.
24. Repeat, while *targetByteIndex* &lt; *limit*
    1.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
    2.  Let *kNumber* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*src*, *Pk*)).
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kNumber*).
    4.  If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*targetBuffer*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    5.  Perform [SetValueInBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setvalueinbuffer)(*targetBuffer*, *targetByteIndex*, *targetType*, *kNumber*).
    6.  Set *k* to *k* + 1.
    7.  Set *targetByteIndex* to *targetByteIndex* + *targetElementSize*.

25. Return **undefined**.

<span id="sec-22.2.3.22.2" class="secnum">[22.2.3.22.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.set-typedarray-offset "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray%.prototype.set(typedArray \[, offset \] )
===================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

Sets multiple values in this *TypedArray*, reading the values from the typedArray argument object. The optional *offset* value indicates the first element index in this *TypedArray* where values are written. If omitted, it is assumed to be 0.

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *typedArray* has a \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots). If it does not, the definition in [22.2.3.22.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.set-array-offset) applies.
2.  Let *target* be the **this** value.
3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*target*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  If *target* does not have a \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
5.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *target* has a \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
6.  Let *targetOffset* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger) (*offset*).
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*targetOffset*).
8.  If *targetOffset* &lt; 0, throw a **RangeError** exception.
9.  Let *targetBuffer* be the value of *target*’s \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
10. If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*targetBuffer*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
11. Let *targetLength* be the value of *target*’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
12. Let *srcBuffer* be the value of *typedArray*’s \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
13. If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*srcBuffer*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
14. Let *targetName* be the string value of *target*’s \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
15. Let *targetType* be the string value of the Element Type value in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *targetName*.
16. Let *targetElementSize* be the Number value of the Element Size value specified in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *targetName*.
17. Let *targetByteOffset* be the value of *target*’s \[\[ByteOffset\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
18. Let *srcName* be the string value of *typedArray*’s \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
19. Let *srcType* be the string value of the Element Type value in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *srcName* .
20. Let *srcElementSize* be the Number value of the Element Size value specified in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *srcName*.
21. Let *srcLength* be the value of *typedArray*’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
22. Let *srcByteOffset* be the value of *typedArray*’s \[\[ByteOffset\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
23. If *srcLength* + *targetOffset* &gt; *targetLength*, throw a **RangeError** exception.
24. If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*srcBuffer*, *targetBuffer*) is **true**, then
    1.  Let *srcBuffer* be [CloneArrayBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-clonearraybuffer)(*targetBuffer*, *srcByteOffset*, %ArrayBuffer%).
    2.  NOTE: <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">%ArrayBuffer%</span> is used to clone <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*targetBuffer*</span> because is it known to not have any observable side-effects.
    3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*srcBuffer*).
    4.  Let *srcByteIndex* be 0.

25. Else, let *srcByteIndex* be *srcByteOffset*.
26. Let *targetByteIndex* be *targetOffset* × *targetElementSize* + *targetByteOffset*.
27. Let *limit* be *targetByteIndex* + *targetElementSize* × *srcLength*.
28. If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*srcType*, *targetType*) is **false**, then
    1.  Repeat, while *targetByteIndex* &lt; *limit*
        1.  Let *value* be [GetValueFromBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvaluefrombuffer)(*srcBuffer*, *srcByteIndex*, *srcType*).
        2.  Perfrom [SetValueInBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setvalueinbuffer) (*targetBuffer*, *targetByteIndex*, *targetType*, *value*).
        3.  Set *srcByteIndex* to *srcByteIndex* + *srcElementSize*.
        4.  Set *targetByteIndex* to *targetByteIndex* + *targetElementSize*.

29. Else,
    1.  NOTE: If srcType and targetType are the same the transfer must be performed in a manner that preserves the bit-level encoding of the source data.
    2.  Repeat, while *targetByteIndex* &lt; *limit*
        1.  Let *value* be [GetValueFromBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvaluefrombuffer)(*srcBuffer*, *srcByteIndex*, `"Uint8"`).
        2.  Perform [SetValueInBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setvalueinbuffer) (*targetBuffer*, *targetByteIndex*, `"Uint8"`, *value*).
        3.  Set *srcByteIndex* to *srcByteIndex* + 1.
        4.  Set *targetByteIndex* to *targetByteIndex* + 1.

30. Return **undefined**.

<span id="sec-22.2.3.23" class="secnum">[22.2.3.23](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.slice "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray%.prototype.slice ( start, end )
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The interpretation and use of the arguments of %TypedArray%`.prototype.slice` are the same as for `Array.prototype.slice` as defined in [22.1.3.22](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.slice). The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be the **this** value.
2.  Let *valid* be [ValidateTypedArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-validatetypedarray)(*O*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*valid*).
4.  Let *len* be the value of *O’s* \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  Let *relativeStart* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*start*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*relativeStart*).
7.  If *relativeStart* &lt; 0, let *k* be max((*len* + *relativeStart*),0); else let *k* be min(*relativeStart*, *len*).
8.  If *end* is **undefined**, let *relativeEnd* be *len*; else let *relativeEnd* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*end*).
9.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*relativeEnd*).
10. If *relativeEnd* &lt; 0, let *final* be max((*len* + *relativeEnd*),0); else let *final* be min(*relativeEnd*, *len*).
11. Let *count* be max(*final* – *k*, 0).
12. Let *defaultConstructor* be the intrinsic object listed in column one of [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for the value of *O*’s \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
13. Let *C* be [SpeciesConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-speciesconstructor)(*O*, *defaultConstructor*).
14. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*C*).
15. Let *A* be [AllocateTypedArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-allocatetypedarray)(*C*, *count*).
16. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*A*).
17. Let *srcName* be the string value of *O’s* \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
18. Let *srcType* be the string value of the Element Type value in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *srcName*.
19. Let *targetName* be the string value of *A’s* \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
20. Let *targetType* be the string value of the Element Type value in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *targetName*.
21. If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*srcType*, *targetType*) is **false**, then
    1.  Let *n* be 0.
    2.  Repeat, while *k* &lt; *final*
        1.  Let *Pk* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*).
        2.  Let *kValue* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*O*, *Pk*).
        3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*kValue*).
        4.  Let *status* be [Set](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-o-p-v-throw)(*A*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*n*), *kValue*, **true** ).
        5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
        6.  Increase *k* by 1.
        7.  Increase *n* by 1.

22. Else if *count* &gt; 0,
    1.  Let *srcBuffer* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
    2.  If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*srcBuffer*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    3.  Let *targetBuffer* be the value of *A*’s \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
    4.  Let *elementSize* be the Number value of the Element Size value specified in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *srcType*.
    5.  NOTE: If srcType and targetType are the same the transfer must be performed in a manner that preserves the bit-level encoding of the source data.
    6.  Let *srcByteOffet* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ByteOffset\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
    7.  Let *targetByteIndex* be 0.
    8.  Let *srcByteIndex* be (*k* × *elementSize*) + *srcByteOffet*.
    9.  Repeat, while *targetByteIndex* &lt; *count* × *elementSize*
        1.  Let *value* be [GetValueFromBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvaluefrombuffer)(*srcBuffer*, *srcByteIndex*, `"Uint8"`).
        2.  Perform [SetValueInBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setvalueinbuffer) (*targetBuffer*, *targetByteIndex*, `"Uint8"`, *value*).
        3.  Increase *srcByteIndex* by 1.
        4.  Increase *targetByteIndex* by 1.

23. Return *A*.

This function is not generic. The **this** value must be an object with a \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

The `length` property of the `slice` method is **2**.

<span id="sec-22.2.3.24" class="secnum">[22.2.3.24](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.some "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray%.prototype.some ( callbackfn \[ , thisArg \] )
===================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

%TypedArray%`.prototype.some` is a distinct function that implements the same algorithm as `Array.prototype.some` as defined in [22.1.3.23](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.some) except that the **this** object’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is accessed in place of performing a \[\[Get\]\] of `"length"`. The implementation of the algorithm may be optimized with the knowledge that the **this** value is an object that has a fixed length and whose integer indexed properties are not sparse. However, such optimization must not introduce any observable changes in the specified behaviour of the algorithm and must take into account the possibility that calls to callbackfn may cause the **this** value to become detached.

This function is not generic. [ValidateTypedArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-validatetypedarray) is applied to the **this** value prior to evaluating the algorithm. If its result is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) that exception is thrown instead of evaluating the algorithm.

The `length` property of the `some` method is **1**.

<span id="sec-22.2.3.25" class="secnum">[22.2.3.25](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.sort "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray%.prototype.sort ( comparefn )
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================

%TypedArray%`.prototype.sort` is a distinct function that, except as described below, implements the same requirements as those of `Array.prototype.sort` as defined in [22.1.3.24](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.sort). The implementation of the %TypedArray%`.prototype.sort` specification may be optimized with the knowledge that the **this** value is an object that has a fixed length and whose integer indexed properties are not sparse. The only internal methods of the **this** object that the algorithm may call are \[\[Get\]\] and \[\[Set\]\].

This function is not generic. The **this** value must be an object with a \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

Upon entry, the following steps are performed to initialize evaluation of the `sort` function. These steps are used instead of the entry steps in [22.1.3.24](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.sort):

1.  Let *obj* be the **this** value as the argument.
2.  Let *buffer* be [ValidateTypedArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-validatetypedarray)(*obj*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*buffer*).
4.  Let *len* be the value of *obj*’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

The implementation defined sort order condition for exotic objects is not applied by %TypedArray%`.prototype.sort`.

The following version of [SortCompare](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-sortcompare) is used by %TypedArray%`.prototype.sort`. It performs a numeric comparison rather than the string comparison used in [22.1.3.24](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.sort). [SortCompare](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-sortcompare) has access to the comparefn and buffer values of the current invocation of the `sort` method.

When the TypedArray [SortCompare](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-sortcompare) abstract operation is called with two arguments x and y, the following steps are taken:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): Both [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*x*) and [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*y*) is Number.
2.  If the argument *comparefn* is not **undefined**, then
    1.  Let *v* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*comparefn*, **undefined**, «*x*, *y*»).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*v*).
    3.  If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*buffer*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    4.  If *v* is **NaN**, return +0.
    5.  Return *v*.

3.  If *x* and *y* are both **NaN**, return +0.
4.  If *x* is **NaN**, return 1.
5.  If *y* is **NaN**, return −1.
6.  If *x* &lt; *y*, return −1.
7.  If *x* &gt; *y*, return 1.
8.  If *x* is −0 and *y* is +0, return −1.
9.  If *x* is +0 and *y* is −0, return 1.
10. Return +0.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Because **NaN** always compares greater than any other value, **NaN** property values always sort to the end of the result when *comparefn* is not provided.

<span id="sec-22.2.3.26" class="secnum">[22.2.3.26](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.subarray "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray%.prototype.subarray( \[ begin \[ , end \] \] )
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

Returns a new *TypedArray* object whose element type is the same as this *TypedArray* and whose ArrayBuffer is the same as the ArrayBuffer of this *TypedArray*, referencing the elements at begin, inclusive, up to end, exclusive. If either begin or end is negative, it refers to an index from the end of the array, as opposed to from the beginning.

1.  Let *O* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *O* does not have a \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *O* has a \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  Let *buffer* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
6.  Let *srcLength* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
7.  Let *relativeBegin* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*begin*).
8.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*relativeBegin*).
9.  If *relativeBegin* &lt; 0, let *beginIndex* be max((*srcLength* + *relativeBegin*), 0); else let *beginIndex* be min(*relativeBegin*, *srcLength*).
10. If *end* is **undefined**, let *relativeEnd* be *srcLength*; else, let *relativeEnd* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*end*).
11. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*relativeEnd*).
12. If *relativeEnd* &lt; 0, let *endIndex* be max((*srcLength* + *relativeEnd*), 0); else let *endIndex* be min(*relativeEnd*, *srcLength*).
13. Let *newLength* be max(*endIndex* – *beginIndex*, 0).
14. Let *constructorName* be the string value of *O*’s \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
15. Let *elementSize* be the Number value of the Element Size value specified in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *constructorName*.
16. Let *srcByteOffset* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ByteOffset\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
17. Let *beginByteOffset* be *srcByteOffset* + *beginIndex* × *elementSize*.
18. Let *defaultConstructor* be the intrinsic object listed in column one of [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *constructorName*.
19. Let *constructor* be [SpeciesConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-speciesconstructor)(*O*, *defaultConstructor*).
20. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*constructor*).
21. Let *argumentsList* be «*buffer*, *beginByteOffset*, *newLength*».
22. Return [Construct](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-construct)(*constructor*, *argumentsList*).

This function is not generic. The **this** value must be an object with a \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

The `length` property of the `subarray` method is **2**.

<span id="sec-22.2.3.27" class="secnum">[22.2.3.27](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.tolocalestring "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray%.prototype.toLocaleString (\[ reserved1 \[ , reserved2 \] \])
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

%TypedArray%`.prototype.toLocaleString` is a distinct function that implements the same algorithm as `Array.prototype.` `toLocaleString` as defined in [22.1.3.26](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.tolocalestring) except that the **this** object’s \[\[ArrayLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is accessed in place of performing a \[\[Get\]\] of `"length"`. The implementation of the algorithm may be optimized with the knowledge that the **this** value is an object that has a fixed length and whose integer indexed properties are not sparse. However, such optimization must not introduce any observable changes in the specified behaviour of the algorithm.

This function is not generic. [ValidateTypedArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-validatetypedarray) is applied to the **this** value prior to evaluating the algorithm. If its result is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) that exception is thrown instead of evaluating the algorithm.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> If the ECMAScript implementation includes the ECMA-402 Internationalization API this function is based upon the algorithm for `Array.prototype.toLocaleString` that is in the ECMA-402 specification.

<span id="sec-22.2.3.28" class="secnum">[22.2.3.28](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.tostring "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray%.prototype.toString ( )
================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of the %TypedArray%`.prototype.toString` data property is the same built-in function object as the `Array.prototype.toString` method defined in [22.1.3.27](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-array.prototype.tostring).

<span id="sec-22.2.3.29" class="secnum">[22.2.3.29](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.values "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray%.prototype.values ( )
============================================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be the **this** value.
2.  Let *valid* be [ValidateTypedArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-validatetypedarray)(*O*).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*valid*).
4.  Return [CreateArrayIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createarrayiterator)(*O*, `"value"`).

<span id="sec-22.2.3.30" class="secnum">[22.2.3.30](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%.prototype-@@iterator "link to this section")</span> %TypedArray%.prototype \[ @@iterator \] ( )
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of the @@iterator property is the same function object as the initial value of the %TypedArray%`.prototype.values` property.

<span id="sec-22.2.3.31" class="secnum">[22.2.3.31](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-%typedarray%.prototype-@@tostringtag "link to this section")</span> get %TypedArray%.prototype \[ @@toStringTag \]
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

%TypedArray%.`prototype[@@toStringTag]` is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Let *O* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, return **undefined**.
3.  If *O* does not have a \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), return **undefined**.
4.  Let *name* be the value of *O*’s \[\[TypedArrayName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *name* is a String value.
6.  Return *name*.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span> }.

The initial value of the `name` property of this function is `"get [Symbol.toStringTag]"`.

<span id="sec-22.2.4" class="secnum">[22.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-typedarray-constructors "link to this section")</span> The *TypedArray* Constructors
============================================================================================================================================================================================

Each of the *TypedArray* constructor objects is an intrinsic object that has the structure described below, differing only in the name used as the constructor name instead of *TypedArray*, in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49).

The *TypedArray* constructors are not intended to be called as a function and will throw an exception when called in that manner.

The *TypedArray* constructors are designed to be subclassable. They may be used as the value of an `extends` clause of a class definition. Subclass constructors that intend to inherit the specified *TypedArray* behaviour must include a `super` call to the *TypedArray* constructor to create and initialize the subclass instance with the internal state necessary to support the %TypedArray`%.prototype` built-in methods.

<span id="sec-22.2.4.1" class="secnum">[22.2.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-typedarray "link to this section")</span> *TypedArray*( ... argumentsList)
======================================================================================================================================================================================

A *TypedArray* constructor with a list of arguments *argumentsList* performs the following steps:

1.  If NewTarget is **undefined**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  Let *here* be the active function.
