3.  Let *super* be *here*.\[\[GetPrototypeOf\]\]().
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*super*).
5.  If [IsConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor) (*super*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
6.  Let *argumentsList* be the *argumentsList* argument of the \[\[Construct\]\] internal method that invoked the active function.
7.  Return [Construct](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-construct)(*super*, *argumentsList*, NewTarget).

<span id="sec-22.2.5" class="secnum">[22.2.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-typedarray-constructors "link to this section")</span> Properties of the *TypedArray* Constructors
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of each *TypedArray* constructor is the %TypedArray% intrinsic object ([22.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%typedarray%-intrinsic-object)).

Each *TypedArray* constructor has a \[\[TypedArrayConstructorName\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) property whose value is the String value of the constructor name specified for it in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49).

Each *TypedArray* constructor has a `name` property whose value is the String value of the constructor name specified for it in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49).

Besides a `length` property (whose value is 3), each *TypedArray* constructor has the following properties:

<span id="sec-22.2.5.1" class="secnum">[22.2.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-typedarray.bytes_per_element "link to this section")</span> *TypedArray*.BYTES\_PER\_ELEMENT
========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of *TypedArray*.BYTES\_PER\_ELEMENT is the Number value of the Element Size value specified in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *TypedArray*.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-22.2.5.2" class="secnum">[22.2.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-typedarray.prototype "link to this section")</span> *TypedArray*.prototype
======================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of *TypedArray*.prototype is the corresponding *TypedArray* prototype intrinsic object ([22.2.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-typedarray-prototype-objects)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span> }.

<span id="sec-22.2.6" class="secnum">[22.2.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-typedarray-prototype-objects "link to this section")</span> Properties of *TypedArray* Prototype Objects
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of a *TypedArray* prototype object is the intrinsic object %TypedArrayPrototype% ([22.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-%typedarrayprototype%-object)). A *TypedArray* prototype object is an ordinary object. It does not have a \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] or any other of the internal slots that are specific to *TypedArray* instance objects.

<span id="sec-22.2.6.1" class="secnum">[22.2.6.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-typedarray.prototype.bytes_per_element "link to this section")</span> *TypedArray*.prototype.BYTES\_PER\_ELEMENT
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of *TypedArray*`.prototype.BYTES_PER_ELEMENT` is the Number value of the Element Size value specified in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for *TypedArray*.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-22.2.6.2" class="secnum">[22.2.6.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-typedarray.prototype.constructor "link to this section")</span> *TypedArray*.prototype.constructor
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of a *TypedArray*`.prototype.constructor` is the corresponding %*TypedArray*% intrinsic object.

<span id="sec-22.2.7" class="secnum">[22.2.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-typedarray-instances "link to this section")</span> Properties of *TypedArray* Instances
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================

*TypedArray* instances are Integer Indexed exotic objects. Each *TypedArray* instance inherits properties from the corresponding *TypedArray* prototype object. Each *TypedArray* instances has the following internal slots: \[\[TypedArrayName\]\], \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\], \[\[ByteLength\]\], \[\[ByteOffset\]\], and \[\[ArrayLength\]\].

<span id="sec-23" class="secnum">[23](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-keyed-collection "link to this section")</span> Keyed Collection
================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-23.1" class="secnum">[23.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-map-objects "link to this section")</span> Map Objects
==========================================================================================================================================================

Map objects are collections of key/value pairs where both the keys and values may be arbitrary [ECMAScript language values](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types). A distinct key value may only occur in one key/value pair within the Map’s collection. Distinct key values are discriminated using the [SameValueZero](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevaluezero) comparison algorithm.

Map object must be implemented using either hash tables or other mechanisms that, on average, provide access times that are sublinear on the number of elements in the collection. The data structures used in this Map objects specification is only intended to describe the required observable semantics of Map objects. It is not intended to be a viable implementation model.

<span id="sec-23.1.1" class="secnum">[23.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-map-constructor "link to this section")</span> The Map Constructor
==========================================================================================================================================================================

The Map constructor is the %Map% intrinsic object and the initial value of the `Map` property of the global object. When called as a constructor it creates and initializes a new Map object. `Map` is not intended to be called as a function and will throw an exception when called in that manner.

The `Map` constructor is designed to be subclassable. It may be used as the value in an `extends` clause of a class definition. Subclass constructors that intend to inherit the specified `Map` behaviour must include a `super` call to the `Map` constructor to create and initialize the subclass instance with the internal state necessary to support the `Map.prototype` built-in methods.

<span id="sec-23.1.1.1" class="secnum">[23.1.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-map-iterable "link to this section")</span> Map ( \[ iterable \] )
==============================================================================================================================================================================

When the `Map` function is called with optional argument the following steps are taken:

1.  If NewTarget is **undefined**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  Let *map* be [OrdinaryCreateFromConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarycreatefromconstructor)(NewTarget, `"%MapPrototype%"`, «‍\[\[MapData\]\]» ).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*map*).
4.  Set *map’s* \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
5.  If *iterable* is not present, let *iterable* be **undefined**.
6.  If *iterable* is either **undefined** or **null**, let *iter* be **undefined**.
7.  Else,
    1.  Let *adder* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*map*, `"set"`)**.**
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*adder*).
    3.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*adder*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    4.  Let *iter* be [GetIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getiterator)(*iterable*).
    5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*iter*).

8.  If *iter* is **undefined**, return *map*.
9.  Repeat
    1.  Let *next* be [IteratorStep](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorstep)(*iter*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*next*).
    3.  If *next* is **false**, return *map*.
    4.  Let *nextItem* be [IteratorValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorvalue)(*next*).
    5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*nextItem*).
    6.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*nextItem*) is not Object,
        1.  Let *error* be [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: <span style="font-family: sans-serif">throw</span>, \[\[value\]\]: a newly created **TypeError** object, \[\[target\]\]:<span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>}.
        2.  Return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iter*, *error*).

    7.  Let *k* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*nextItem*, `"0"`).
    8.  If *k* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iter*, *k*).
    9.  Let *v* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*nextItem*, `"1"`).
    10. If *v* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iter*, *v*).
    11. Let *status* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*adder*, *map*, «*k*.\[\[value\]\], *v*.\[\[value\]\]»).
    12. If *status* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iter*, *status*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> If the parameter *iterable* is present, it is expected to be an object that implements an @@iterator method that returns an iterator object that produces a two element array-like object whose first element is a value that will be used as a Map key and whose second element is the value to associate with that key.

<span id="sec-23.1.2" class="secnum">[23.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-map-constructor "link to this section")</span> Properties of the Map Constructor
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the Map constructor is the intrinsic object %FunctionPrototype% ([19.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-function-prototype-object)).

Besides the `length` property (whose value is **0**), the Map constructor has the following properties:

<span id="sec-23.1.2.1" class="secnum">[23.1.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-map.prototype "link to this section")</span> Map.prototype
======================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Map.prototype` is the intrinsic object %MapPrototype% ([23.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-map-prototype-object)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-23.1.2.2" class="secnum">[23.1.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-map-@@species "link to this section")</span> get Map \[ @@species \]
====================================================================================================================================================================================

`Map[@@species]` is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Return the **this** value.

The value of the `name` property of this function is `"get [Symbol.species]"`.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Methods that create derived collection objects should call @@species to determine the constructor to use to create the derived objects. Subclass constructor may over-ride @@species to change the default coinstructor assignment.

<span id="sec-23.1.3" class="secnum">[23.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-map-prototype-object "link to this section")</span> Properties of the Map Prototype Object
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The Map prototype object is the intrinsic object %MapPrototype%. The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the Map prototype object is the intrinsic object %ObjectPrototype% ([19.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-object-prototype-object)). The Map prototype object is an ordinary object. It does not have a \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

<span id="sec-23.1.3.1" class="secnum">[23.1.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-map.prototype.clear "link to this section")</span> Map.prototype.clear ( )
======================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *M* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*M*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *M* does not have a \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *M*’s \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  Repeat for each Record {\[\[key\]\], \[\[value\]\]} *p* that is an element of *entries,*
    1.  Set *p*.\[\[key\]\] to <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>*.*
    2.  Set *p*.\[\[value\]\] to <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>*.*

6.  Return **undefined**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The existing \[\[MapData\]\] [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) is preserved because there may be existing MapIterator objects that are [suspended](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) midway through iterating over that [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).

<span id="sec-23.1.3.2" class="secnum">[23.1.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-map.prototype.constructor "link to this section")</span> Map.prototype.constructor
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Map.prototype.constructor` is the intrinsic object %Map%.

<span id="sec-23.1.3.3" class="secnum">[23.1.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-map.prototype.delete "link to this section")</span> Map.prototype.delete ( key )
============================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *M* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*M*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *M* does not have a \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *M*’s \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  Repeat for each Record {\[\[key\]\], \[\[value\]\]} *p* that is an element of *entries,*
    1.  If *p*.\[\[key\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span> and [SameValueZero](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevaluezero)(*p*.\[\[key\]\], *key*) is **true**, then
        1.  Set *p*.\[\[key\]\] to <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>*.*
        2.  Set *p*.\[\[value\]\] to <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>*.*
        3.  Return **true**.

6.  Return **false**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The value **empty** is used as a specification device to indicate that an entry has been deleted. Actual implementations may take other actions such as physically removing the entry from internal data structures.

<span id="sec-23.1.3.4" class="secnum">[23.1.3.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-map.prototype.entries "link to this section")</span> Map.prototype.entries ( )
==========================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *M* be the **this** value.
2.  Return [CreateMapIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createmapiterator)(*M*, `"key+value"`).

<span id="sec-23.1.3.5" class="secnum">[23.1.3.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-map.prototype.foreach "link to this section")</span> Map.prototype.forEach ( callbackfn \[ , thisArg \] )
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `forEach` method is called with one or two arguments, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *M* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*M*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *M* does not have a \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*callbackfn*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
5.  If *thisArg* was supplied, let *T* be *thisArg*; else let *T* be **undefined**.
6.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *M*’s \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
7.  Repeat for each Record {\[\[key\]\], \[\[value\]\]} *e* that is an element of *entries,* in original key insertion order
    1.  If *e*.\[\[key\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, then
        1.  Let *funcResult* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*callbackfn*, *T*, «*e*.\[\[value\]\], *e*.\[\[key\]\], *M*»).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*funcResult*).

8.  Return **undefined**.

The `length` property of the `forEach` method is **1**.

<span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE</span> *callbackfn* should be a function that accepts three arguments. `forEach` calls *callbackfn* once for each key/value pair present in the map object, in key insertion order. *callbackfn* is called only for keys of the map which actually exist; it is not called for keys that have been deleted from the map.

If a *thisArg* parameter is provided, it will be used as the **this** value for each invocation of *callbackfn*. If it is not provided, **undefined** is used instead.

*callbackfn* is called with three arguments: the value of the item, the key of the item, and the Map object being traversed.

`forEach` does not directly mutate the object on which it is called but the object may be mutated by the calls to *callbackfn*. Each entry of a map’s \[\[MapData\]\] is only visited once. New keys added after the call to `forEach` begins are visited. A key will be revisited if it is deleted after it has been visited and then re-added before the `forEach` call completes. Keys that are deleted after the call to `forEach` begins and before being visited are not visited unless the key is added again before the `forEach` call completes.

<span id="sec-23.1.3.6" class="secnum">[23.1.3.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-map.prototype.get "link to this section")</span> Map.prototype.get ( key )
======================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *M* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*M*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *M* does not have a \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *M*’s \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  Repeat for each Record {\[\[key\]\], \[\[value\]\]} *p* that is an element of *entries,*
    1.  If *p*.\[\[key\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span> and [SameValueZero](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevaluezero)(*p*.\[\[key\]\], *key*) is **true**, return *p*.\[\[value\]\].

6.  Return **undefined**.

<span id="sec-23.1.3.7" class="secnum">[23.1.3.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-map.prototype.has "link to this section")</span> Map.prototype.has ( key )
======================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *M* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*M*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *M* does not have a \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *M*’s \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  Repeat for each Record {\[\[key\]\], \[\[value\]\]} *p* that is an element of *entries,*
    1.  If *p*.\[\[key\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span> and [SameValueZero](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevaluezero)(*p*.\[\[key\]\], *key*) is **true**, return **true***.*

6.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-23.1.3.8" class="secnum">[23.1.3.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-map.prototype.keys "link to this section")</span> Map.prototype.keys ( )
====================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *M* be the **this** value.
2.  Return [CreateMapIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createmapiterator)(*M*, `"key"`).

<span id="sec-23.1.3.9" class="secnum">[23.1.3.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-map.prototype.set "link to this section")</span> Map.prototype.set ( key , value )
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *M* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*M*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *M* does not have a \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *M*’s \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  Repeat for each Record {\[\[key\]\], \[\[value\]\]} *p* that is an element of *entries,*
    1.  If *p*.\[\[key\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span> and [SameValueZero](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevaluezero)(*p*.\[\[key\]\], *key*) is **true**, then
        1.  Set *p*.\[\[value\]\] to *value.*
        2.  Return *M*.

6.  If *key* is −0, let *key* be +0.
7.  Let *p* be the Record {\[\[key\]\]: *key*, \[\[value\]\]: *value*}.
8.  Append *p* as the last element of *entries*.
9.  Return *M*.

<span id="sec-23.1.3.10" class="secnum">[23.1.3.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-map.prototype.size "link to this section")</span> get Map.prototype.size
==========================================================================================================================================================================================

Map.prototype.size is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Let *M* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*M*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *M* does not have a \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *M*’s \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  Let *count* be 0.
6.  For each Record {\[\[key\]\], \[\[value\]\]} *p* that is an element of *entries*
    1.  If *p*.\[\[key\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, set *count* to *count*+1.

7.  Return *count*.

<span id="sec-23.1.3.11" class="secnum">[23.1.3.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-map.prototype.values "link to this section")</span> Map.prototype.values ( )
==========================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *M* be the **this** value.
2.  Return [CreateMapIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createmapiterator)(*M*, `"value"`).

<span id="sec-23.1.3.12" class="secnum">[23.1.3.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-map.prototype-@@iterator "link to this section")</span> Map.prototype \[ @@iterator \]( )
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of the @@iterator property is the same function object as the initial value of the **entries** property.

<span id="sec-23.1.3.13" class="secnum">[23.1.3.13](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-map.prototype-@@tostringtag "link to this section")</span> Map.prototype \[ @@toStringTag \]
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of the @@toStringTag property is the string value `"Map"`.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span> }.

<span id="sec-23.1.4" class="secnum">[23.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-map-instances "link to this section")</span> Properties of Map Instances
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

Map instances are ordinary objects that inherit properties from the Map prototype. Map instances also have a \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

<span id="sec-23.1.5" class="secnum">[23.1.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-map-iterator-objects "link to this section")</span> Map Iterator Objects
================================================================================================================================================================================

A Map Iterator is an object, that represents a specific iteration over some specific Map instance object. There is not a named constructor for Map Iterator objects. Instead, map iterator objects are created by calling certain methods of Map instance objects.

<span id="sec-23.1.5.1" class="secnum">[23.1.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createmapiterator "link to this section")</span> CreateMapIterator Abstract Operation
=================================================================================================================================================================================================

Several methods of Map objects return Iterator objects. The abstract operation CreateMapIterator with arguments map and kind is used to create such iterator objects. It performs the following steps:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*map*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  If *map* does not have a \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  Let *iterator* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(%MapIteratorPrototype%, «‍\[\[Map\]\], \[\[MapNextIndex\]\], \[\[MapIterationKind\]\]»).
4.  Set *iterator’s* \[\[Map\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *map*.
5.  Set *iterator’s* \[\[MapNextIndex\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to 0.
6.  Set *iterator’s* \[\[MapIterationKind\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *kind*.
7.  Return *iterator*.

<span id="sec-23.1.5.2" class="secnum">[23.1.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%mapiteratorprototype%-object "link to this section")</span> The %MapIteratorPrototype% Object
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

All Map Iterator Objects inherit properties from the %MapIteratorPrototype% intrinsic object. The %MapIteratorPrototype% intrinsic object is an ordinary object and its \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is the %IteratorPrototype% intrinsic object ([25.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%iteratorprototype%-object)). In addition, %MapIteratorPrototype% has the following properties:

<span id="sec-23.1.5.2.1" class="secnum">[23.1.5.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%mapiteratorprototype%.next "link to this section")</span> %MapIteratorPrototype%.next ( )
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

1.  Let *O* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *O* does not have all of the internal slots of a Map Iterator Instance ([23.1.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-map-iterator-instances)), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *m* be the value of the \[\[Map\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
5.  Let *index* be the value of the \[\[MapNextIndex\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
6.  Let *itemKind* be the value of the \[\[MapIterationKind\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
7.  If *m* is **undefined**, return [CreateIterResultObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject)(**undefined**, **true**).
8.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *m* has a \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
9.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of the \[\[MapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *m*.
10. Repeat while *index* is less than the total number of elements of *entries*. The number of elements must be redetermined each time this method is evaluated.
    1.  Let *e* be the Record {\[\[key\]\], \[\[value\]\]} that is the value of *entries*\[*index*\].
    2.  Set *index* to *index*+1.
    3.  Set the \[\[MapNextIndex\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O* to *index*.
    4.  If *e*.\[\[key\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, then
        1.  If *itemKind* is **"`key`"**, let *result* be *e*.\[\[key\]\].
        2.  Else if *itemKind* is **"`value`"**, let *result* be *e*.\[\[value\]\].
        3.  Else,
            1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *itemKind* is `"key+value"`.
            2.  Let *result* be [CreateArrayFromList](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createarrayfromlist)(«*e*.\[\[key\]\], *e*.\[\[value\]\]»).

        4.  Return [CreateIterResultObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject)(*result*, **false**).

11. Set the \[\[Map\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O* to **undefined**.
12. Return [CreateIterResultObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject)(**undefined**, **true**).

<span id="sec-23.1.5.2.2" class="secnum">[23.1.5.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%mapiteratorprototype%-@@tostringtag "link to this section")</span> %MapIteratorPrototype% \[ @@toStringTag \]
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of the @@toStringTag property is the string value `"Map Iterator"`.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span> }.

<span id="sec-23.1.5.3" class="secnum">[23.1.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-map-iterator-instances "link to this section")</span> Properties of Map Iterator Instances
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

Map Iterator instances are ordinary objects that inherit properties from the %MapIteratorPrototype% intrinsic object. Map Iterator instances are initially created with the internal slots described in [Table 50](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-50).

<span id="table-50">Table 50</span> — Internal Slots of Map Iterator Instances

| Internal Slot            | Description                                                                                                                                          |
|--------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| \[\[Map\]\]              | The Map object that is being iterated.                                                                                                               |
| \[\[MapNextIndex\]\]     | The integer index of the next Map data element to be examined by this iterator.                                                                      |
| \[\[MapIterationKind\]\] | A string value that identifies what is to be returned for each element of the iteration. The possible values are: `"key"`, `"value"`, `"key+value"`. |

<span id="sec-23.2" class="secnum">[23.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-objects "link to this section")</span> Set Objects
==========================================================================================================================================================

Set objects are collections of [ECMAScript language values](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types). A distinct value may only occur once as an element of a Set’s collection. Distinct values are discriminated using the [SameValueZero](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevaluezero) comparison algorithm.

Set objects must be implemented using either hash tables or other mechanisms that, on average, provide access times that are sublinear on the number of elements in the collection. The data structures used in this Set objects specification is only intended to describe the required observable semantics of Set objects. It is not intended to be a viable implementation model.

<span id="sec-23.2.1" class="secnum">[23.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-constructor "link to this section")</span> The Set Constructor
==========================================================================================================================================================================

The Set constructor is the %Set% intrinsic object and the initial value of the `Set` property of the global object. When called as a constructor it creates and initializes a new Set object. `Set` is not intended to be called as a function and will throw an exception when called in that manner.

The `Set` constructor is designed to be subclassable. It may be used as the value in an `extends` clause of a class definition. Subclass constructors that intend to inherit the specified `Set` behaviour must include a `super` call to the `Set` constructor to create and initialize the subclass instance with the internal state necessary to support the `Set.prototype` built-in methods.

<span id="sec-23.2.1.1" class="secnum">[23.2.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-iterable "link to this section")</span> Set ( \[ iterable \] )
==============================================================================================================================================================================

When the `Set` function is called with optional argument iterable the following steps are taken:

1.  If NewTarget is **undefined**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  Let *set* be [OrdinaryCreateFromConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarycreatefromconstructor)(NewTarget, `"%SetPrototype%"`, «‍\[\[SetData\]\]» ).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*set*).
4.  Set *set’s* \[\[SetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
5.  If *iterable* is not present, let *iterable* be **undefined**.
6.  If *iterable* is either **undefined** or **null**, let *iter* be **undefined**.
7.  Else,
    1.  Let *adder* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*set*, `"add"`)**.**
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*adder*).
    3.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*adder*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    4.  Let *iter* be [GetIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getiterator)(*iterable*).
    5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*iter*).

8.  If *iter* is **undefined**, return *set*.
9.  Repeat
    1.  Let *next* be [IteratorStep](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorstep)(*iter*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*next*).
    3.  If *next* is **false**, return *set*.
    4.  Let *nextValue* be [IteratorValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorvalue)(*next*).
    5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*nextValue*).
    6.  Let *status* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*adder*, *set*, «*nextValue*.\[\[value\]\]»).
    7.  If *status* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iter*, *status*).

<span id="sec-23.2.2" class="secnum">[23.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-set-constructor "link to this section")</span> Properties of the Set Constructor
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the Set constructor is the intrinsic object %FunctionPrototype% ([19.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-function-prototype-object)).

Besides the `length` property (whose value is **0**), the Set constructor has the following properties:

<span id="sec-23.2.2.1" class="secnum">[23.2.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set.prototype "link to this section")</span> Set.prototype
======================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Set.prototype` is the intrinsic %SetPrototype% object ([23.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-set-prototype-object)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-23.2.2.2" class="secnum">[23.2.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-set-@@species "link to this section")</span> get Set \[ @@species \]
====================================================================================================================================================================================

`Set[@@species]` is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Return the **this** value.

The value of the `name` property of this function is `"get [Symbol.species]"`.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Methods that create derived collection objects should call @@species to determine the constructor to use to create the derived objects. Subclass constructor may over-ride @@species to change the default coinstructor assignment.

<span id="sec-23.2.3" class="secnum">[23.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-set-prototype-object "link to this section")</span> Properties of the Set Prototype Object
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The Set prototype object is the intrinsic object %SetPrototype%. The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the Set prototype object is the intrinsic object %ObjectPrototype% ([19.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-object-prototype-object)). The Set prototype object is an ordinary object. It does not have a \[\[SetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

<span id="sec-23.2.3.1" class="secnum">[23.2.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set.prototype.add "link to this section")</span> Set.prototype.add ( value )
========================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *S* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*S*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *S* does not have a \[\[SetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *S*’s \[\[SetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  Repeat for each *e* that is an element of *entries,*
    1.  If *e* is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span> and [SameValueZero](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevaluezero)(*e*, *value*) is **true**, then
        1.  Return *S*.

6.  If *value* is −0, let *value* be +0.
7.  Append *value* as the last element of *entries*.
8.  Return *S*.

<span id="sec-23.2.3.2" class="secnum">[23.2.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set.prototype.clear "link to this section")</span> Set.prototype.clear ( )
======================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *S* be **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*S*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *S* does not have a \[\[SetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *S*’s \[\[SetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  Repeat for each *e* that is an element of *entries,*
    1.  Replace the element of *entries* whose value is *e* with an element whose value is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>*.*

6.  Return **undefined**.

<span id="sec-23.2.3.3" class="secnum">[23.2.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set.prototype.constructor "link to this section")</span> Set.prototype.constructor
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Set.prototype.constructor` is the intrinsic object %Set%.

<span id="sec-23.2.3.4" class="secnum">[23.2.3.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set.prototype.delete "link to this section")</span> Set.prototype.delete ( value )
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *S* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*S*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *S* does not have a \[\[SetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *S*’s \[\[SetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  Repeat for each *e* that is an element of *entries*,
    1.  If *e* is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span> and [SameValueZero](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevaluezero)(*e*, *value*) is **true**, then
        1.  Replace the element of *entries* whose value is *e* with an element whose value is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>*.*
        2.  Return **true**.

6.  Return **false**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The value **empty** is used as a specification device to indicate that an entry has been deleted. Actual implementations may take other actions such as physically removing the entry from internal data structures.

<span id="sec-23.2.3.5" class="secnum">[23.2.3.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set.prototype.entries "link to this section")</span> Set.prototype.entries ( )
==========================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *S* be the **this** value.
2.  Return [CreateSetIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createsetiterator)(*S*, **"`key+value`"**).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> For iteration purposes, a Set appears similar to a Map where each entry has the same value for its key and value.

<span id="sec-23.2.3.6" class="secnum">[23.2.3.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set.prototype.foreach "link to this section")</span> Set.prototype.forEach ( callbackfn \[ , thisArg \] )
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `forEach` method is called with one or two arguments, the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *S* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*S*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *S* does not have a \[\[SetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*callbackfn*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
5.  If *thisArg* was supplied, let *T* be *thisArg*; else let *T* be **undefined**.
6.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *S*’s \[\[SetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
7.  Repeat for each *e* that is an element of *entries,* in original insertion order
    1.  If *e* is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, then
        1.  Let *funcResult* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*callbackfn*, *T*, «*e*, *e*, *S*»).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*funcResult*).

8.  Return **undefined**.

The `length` property of the `forEach` method is **1**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> *callbackfn* should be a function that accepts three arguments. `forEach` calls *callbackfn* once for each value present in the set object, in value insertion order. *callbackfn* is called only for values of the Set which actually exist; it is not called for keys that have been deleted from the set.

If a *thisArg* parameter is provided, it will be used as the **this** value for each invocation of *callbackfn*. If it is not provided, **undefined** is used instead.

*callbackfn* is called with three arguments: the first two arguments are a value contained in the Set. The same value is passed for both arguments. The Set object being traversed is passed as the third argument.

The *callbackfn* is called with three arguments to be consistent with the call back functions used by `forEach` methods for Map and Array. For Sets, each item value is considered to be both the key and the value.

`forEach` does not directly mutate the object on which it is called but the object may be mutated by the calls to *callbackfn*.

Each value is normally visited only once. However, a value will be revisited if it is deleted after it has been visited and then re-added before the `forEach` call completes. Values that are deleted after the call to `forEach` begins and before being visited are not visited unless the value is added again before the `forEach` call completes. New values added after the call to `forEach` begins are visited.

<span id="sec-23.2.3.7" class="secnum">[23.2.3.7](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set.prototype.has "link to this section")</span> Set.prototype.has ( value )
========================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *S* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*S*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *S* does not have a \[\[SetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *S*’s \[\[SetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  Repeat for each *e* that is an element of *entries,*
    1.  If *e* is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span> and [SameValueZero](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevaluezero)(*e*, *value*) is **true**, return **true***.*

6.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-23.2.3.8" class="secnum">[23.2.3.8](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set.prototype.keys "link to this section")</span> Set.prototype.keys ( )
====================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of the `keys` property is the same function object as the initial value of the `values` property.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> For iteration purposes, a Set appears similar to a Map where each entry has the same value for its key and value.

<span id="sec-23.2.3.9" class="secnum">[23.2.3.9](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-set.prototype.size "link to this section")</span> get Set.prototype.size
========================================================================================================================================================================================

`Set.prototype.size` is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Let *S* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*S*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *S* does not have a \[\[SetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *S*’s \[\[SetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  Let *count* be 0.
6.  For each *e* that is an element of *entries*
    1.  If *e* is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, set *count* to *count*+1.

7.  Return *count*.

<span id="sec-23.2.3.10" class="secnum">[23.2.3.10](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set.prototype.values "link to this section")</span> Set.prototype.values ( )
==========================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *S* be the **this** value.
2.  Return [CreateSetIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createsetiterator)(*S*, **"`value`"**).

<span id="sec-23.2.3.11" class="secnum">[23.2.3.11](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set.prototype-@@iterator "link to this section")</span> Set.prototype \[ @@iterator \] ( )
========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of the @@iterator property is the same function object as the initial value of the `values` property.

<span id="sec-23.2.3.12" class="secnum">[23.2.3.12](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set.prototype-@@tostringtag "link to this section")</span> Set.prototype \[ @@toStringTag \]
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of the @@toStringTag property is the string value `"Set"`.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span> }.

<span id="sec-23.2.4" class="secnum">[23.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-set-instances "link to this section")</span> Properties of Set Instances
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

Set instances are ordinary objects that inherit properties from the Set prototype. Set instances also have a \[\[SetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

<span id="sec-23.2.5" class="secnum">[23.2.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-set-iterator-objects "link to this section")</span> Set Iterator Objects
================================================================================================================================================================================

A Set Iterator is an ordinary object, with the structure defined below, that represents a specific iteration over some specific Set instance object. There is not a named constructor for Set Iterator objects. Instead, set iterator objects are created by calling certain methods of Set instance objects.

<span id="sec-23.2.5.1" class="secnum">[23.2.5.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createsetiterator "link to this section")</span> CreateSetIterator Abstract Operation
=================================================================================================================================================================================================

Several methods of Set objects return Iterator objects. The abstract operation CreateSetIterator with arguments set and kind is used to create such iterator objects. It performs the following steps:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*set*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  If *set* does not have a \[\[SetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  Let *iterator* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(%SetIteratorPrototype%, «‍\[\[IteratedSet\]\], \[\[SetNextIndex\]\], \[\[SetIterationKind\]\]»).
4.  Set *iterator’s* \[\[IteratedSet\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *set*.
5.  Set *iterator’s* \[\[SetNextIndex\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to 0.
6.  Set *iterator’s* \[\[SetIterationKind\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *kind*.
7.  Return *iterator*.

<span id="sec-23.2.5.2" class="secnum">[23.2.5.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%setiteratorprototype%-object "link to this section")</span> The %SetIteratorPrototype% Object
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

All Set Iterator Objects inherit properties from the %SetIteratorPrototype% intrinsic object. The %SetIteratorPrototype% intrinsic object is an ordinary object and its \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is the %IteratorPrototype% intrinsic object ([25.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%iteratorprototype%-object)). In addition, %SetIteratorPrototype% has the following properties:

<span id="sec-23.2.5.2.1" class="secnum">[23.2.5.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%setiteratorprototype%.next "link to this section")</span> %SetIteratorPrototype%.next ( )
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

1.  Let *O* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *O* does not have all of the internal slots of a Set Iterator Instance ([23.2.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-set-iterator-instances)), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *s* be the value of the \[\[IteratedSet\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
5.  Let *index* be the value of the \[\[SetNextIndex\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
6.  Let *itemKind* be the value of the \[\[SetIterationKind\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O*.
7.  If *s* is **undefined**, return [CreateIterResultObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject)(**undefined**, **true**).
8.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *s* has a \[\[SetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
9.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of the \[\[SetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *s*.
10. Repeat while *index* is less than the total number of elements of *entries*. The number of elements must be redetermined each time this method is evaluated.
    1.  Let *e* be *entries*\[*index*\].
    2.  Set *index* to *index*+1;
    3.  Set the \[\[SetNextIndex\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O* to *index*.
    4.  If *e* is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>, then
        1.  If *itemKind* is **"`key+value`"**, then
            1.  Return [CreateIterResultObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject)([CreateArrayFromList](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createarrayfromlist)(«*e*, *e*»), **false**).

        2.  Return [CreateIterResultObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject)(*e*, **false**).

11. Set the \[\[IteratedSet\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *O* to **undefined**.
12. Return [CreateIterResultObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject)(**undefined**, **true**).

<span id="sec-23.2.5.2.2" class="secnum">[23.2.5.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%setiteratorprototype%-@@tostringtag "link to this section")</span> %SetIteratorPrototype% \[ @@toStringTag \]
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of the @@toStringTag property is the string value `"Set Iterator"`.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span> }.

<span id="sec-23.2.5.3" class="secnum">[23.2.5.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-set-iterator-instances "link to this section")</span> Properties of Set Iterator Instances
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

Set Iterator instances are ordinary objects that inherit properties from the %SetIteratorPrototype% intrinsic object. Set Iterator instances are initially created with the internal slots specified in [Table 51](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-51).

<span id="table-51">Table 51</span> — Internal Slots of Set Iterator Instances

| Internal Slot            | Description                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|--------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| \[\[IteratedSet\]\]      | The Set object that is being iterated.                                                                                                                                                            |
| \[\[SetNextIndex\]\]     | The integer index of the next Set data element to be examined by this iterator                                                                                                                    |
| \[\[SetIterationKind\]\] | A string value that identifies what is to be returned for each element of the iteration. The possible values are: `"key"`, `"value"`, `"key+value"`. `"key"` and `"value"` have the same meaning. |

<span id="sec-23.3" class="secnum">[23.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakmap-objects "link to this section")</span> WeakMap Objects
==================================================================================================================================================================

WeakMap objects are collections of key/value pairs where the keys are objects and values may be arbitrary [ECMAScript language values](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types). A WeakMap may be queried to see if it contains a key/value pair with a specific key, but no mechanism is provided for enumerating the objects it holds as keys. If an object that is being used as the key of a WeakMap key/value pair is only reachable by following a chain of references that start within that WeakMap, then that key/value pair is inaccessible and is automatically removed from the WeakMap. WeakMap implementations must detect and remove such key/value pairs and any associated resources.

An implementation may impose an arbitrarily determined latency between the time a key/value pair of a WeakMap becomes inaccessible and the time when the key/value pair is removed from the WeakMap. If this latency was observable to ECMAScript program, it would be a source of indeterminacy that could impact program execution. For that reason, an ECMAScript implementation must not provide any means to observe a key of a WeakMap that does not require the observer to present the observed key.

WeakMap objects must be implemented using either hash tables or other mechanisms that, on average, provide access times that are sublinear on the number of key/value pairs in the collection. The data structure used in this WeakMap objects specification are only intended to describe the required observable semantics of WeakMap objects. It is not intended to be a viable implementation model.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> WeakMap and WeakSets are intended to provide mechanisms for dynamically associating state with an object in a manner that does not “leak” memory resources if, in the absence of the WeakMap or WeakSet, the object otherwise became inaccessible and subject to resource reclamation by the implementation’s garbage collection mechanisms. Achieving this characteristic can be achieved by using an inverted per-object mapping of weak map instances to keys. Alternatively each weak map may internally store its key to value mappings but this approach requires coordination between the WeakMap or WeakSet implementation and the garbage collector. The following references describe mechanism that may be useful to implementations of WeakMap and WeakSets:

Barry Hayes. 1997. Ephemerons: a new finalization mechanism. In *Proceedings of the 12th ACM SIGPLAN conference on Object-oriented programming, systems, languages, and applications (OOPSLA '97)*, A. Michael Berman (Ed.). ACM, New York, NY, USA, 176-183. <http://doi.acm.org/10.1145/263698.263733>.

Alexandra Barros, Roberto Ierusalimschy, Eliminating Cycles in Weak Tables. Journal of Universal Computer Science - J.UCS , vol. 14, no. 21, pp. 3481-3497, 2008. <http://www.jucs.org/jucs_14_21/eliminating_cycles_in_weak>

<span id="sec-23.3.1" class="secnum">[23.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakmap-constructor "link to this section")</span> The WeakMap Constructor
==================================================================================================================================================================================

The WeakMap constructor is the %WeakMap% intrinsic object and the initial value of the `WeakMap` property of the global object. When called as a constructor it creates and initializes a new WeakMap object. `WeakMap` is not intended to be called as a function and will throw an exception when called in that manner.

The `WeakMap` constructor is designed to be subclassable. It may be used as the value in an `extends` clause of a class definition. Subclass constructors that intend to inherit the specified `WeakMap` behaviour must include a `super` call to the `WeakMap` constructor to create and initialize the subclass instance with the internal state necessary to support the `WeakMap.prototype` built-in methods.
