<span id="sec-23.3.1.1" class="secnum">[23.3.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakmap-iterable "link to this section")</span> WeakMap ( \[ iterable \] )
======================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `WeakMap` function is called with optional argument iterable the following steps are taken:

1.  If NewTarget is **undefined**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  Let *map* be [OrdinaryCreateFromConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarycreatefromconstructor)(NewTarget, `"%WeakMapPrototype%"`, «‍\[\[WeakMapData\]\]» ).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*map*).
4.  Set *map’s* \[\[WeakMapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
5.  If *iterable* is not present, let *iterable* be **undefined**.
6.  If *iterable* is either **undefined** or **null**, let *iter* be **undefined**.
7.  Else,
    1.  Let *adder* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*map*, `"set"`)**.**
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*adder*).
    3.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*adder*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    4.  Let *iter* be [GetIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getiterator)(*iterable*).
    5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*iter*).

8.  If *iter* is **undefined**, return *map*.
9.  Repeat
    1.  Let *next* be [IteratorStep](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorstep)(*iter*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*next*).
    3.  If *next* is **false**, return *map*.
    4.  Let *nextItem* be [IteratorValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorvalue)(*next*).
    5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*nextItem*).
    6.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*nextItem*) is not Object,
        1.  Let *error* be [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: <span style="font-family: sans-serif">throw</span>, \[\[value\]\]: a newly created **TypeError** object, \[\[target\]\]:<span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>}.
        2.  Return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iter*, *error*).

    7.  Let *k* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*nextItem*, `"0"`).
    8.  If *k* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iter*, *k*).
    9.  Let *v* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*nextItem*, `"1"`).
    10. If *v* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iter*, *v*).
    11. Let *status* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*adder*, *map*, «*k*.\[\[value\]\], *v*.\[\[value\]\]»).
    12. If *status* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iter*, *status*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> If the parameter *iterable* is present, it is expected to be an object that implements an @@iterator method that returns an iterator object that produces a two element array-like object whose first element is a value that will be used as a WeakMap key and whose second element is the value to associate with that key.

<span id="sec-23.3.2" class="secnum">[23.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-weakmap-constructor "link to this section")</span> Properties of the WeakMap Constructor
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the WeakMap constructor is the intrinsic object %FunctionPrototype% ([19.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-function-prototype-object)).

Besides the `length` property (whose value is **0**), the WeakMap constructor has the following properties:

<span id="sec-23.3.2.1" class="secnum">[23.3.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakmap.prototype "link to this section")</span> WeakMap.prototype
==============================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `WeakMap.prototype` is the intrinsic object %WeakMapPrototype% ([23.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-weakmap-prototype-object)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-23.3.3" class="secnum">[23.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-weakmap-prototype-object "link to this section")</span> Properties of the WeakMap Prototype Object
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The WeakMap prototype object is the intrinsic object %WeakMapPrototype%. The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the WeakMap prototype object is the intrinsic object %ObjectPrototype% ([19.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-object-prototype-object)). The WeakMap prototype object is an ordinary object. It does not have a \[\[WeakMapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

<span id="sec-23.3.3.1" class="secnum">[23.3.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakmap.prototype.constructor "link to this section")</span> WeakMap.prototype.constructor
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `WeakMap.prototype.constructor` is the intrinsic object %WeakMap%.

<span id="sec-23.3.3.2" class="secnum">[23.3.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakmap.prototype.delete "link to this section")</span> WeakMap.prototype.delete ( key )
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *M* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*M*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *M* does not have a \[\[WeakMapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *M*’s \[\[WeakMapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*key*) is not Object, return **false**.
6.  Repeat for each Record {\[\[key\]\], \[\[value\]\]} *p* that is an element of *entries,*
    1.  If *p*.\[\[key\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span> and [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*p*.\[\[key\]\], *key*) is **true**, then
        1.  Set *p*.\[\[key\]\] to <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>*.*
        2.  Set *p*.\[\[value\]\] to <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>*.*
        3.  Return **true**.

7.  Return **false**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The value **empty** is used as a specification device to indicate that an entry has been deleted. Actual implementations may take other actions such as physically removing the entry from internal data structures.

<span id="sec-23.3.3.3" class="secnum">[23.3.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakmap.prototype.get "link to this section")</span> WeakMap.prototype.get ( key )
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *M* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*M*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *M* does not have a \[\[WeakMapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *M*’s \[\[WeakMapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*key*) is not Object, return **undefined**.
6.  Repeat for each Record {\[\[key\]\], \[\[value\]\]} *p* that is an element of *entries,*
    1.  If *p*.\[\[key\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span> and [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*p*.\[\[key\]\], *key*) is **true**, return *p*.\[\[value\]\].

7.  Return **undefined***.*

<span id="sec-23.3.3.4" class="secnum">[23.3.3.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakmap.prototype.has "link to this section")</span> WeakMap.prototype.has ( key )
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *M* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*M*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *M* does not have a \[\[WeakMapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *M*’s \[\[WeakMapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*key*) is not Object, return **false**.
6.  Repeat for each Record {\[\[key\]\], \[\[value\]\]} *p* that is an element of *entries,*
    1.  If *p*.\[\[key\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span> and [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*p*.\[\[key\]\], *key*) is **true**, return **true***.*

7.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-23.3.3.5" class="secnum">[23.3.3.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakmap.prototype.set "link to this section")</span> WeakMap.prototype.set ( key , value )
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *M* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*M*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *M* does not have a \[\[WeakMapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *M*’s \[\[WeakMapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*key*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
6.  Repeat for each Record {\[\[key\]\], \[\[value\]\]} *p* that is an element of *entries,*
    1.  If *p*.\[\[key\]\] is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span> and [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*p*.\[\[key\]\], *key*) is **true**, then
        1.  Set *p*.\[\[value\]\] to *value.*
        2.  Return *M*.

7.  Let *p* be the Record {\[\[key\]\]: *key*, \[\[value\]\]: *value*}.
8.  Append *p* as the last element of *entries*.
9.  Return *M*.

<span id="sec-23.3.3.6" class="secnum">[23.3.3.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakmap.prototype-@@tostringtag "link to this section")</span> WeakMap.prototype \[ @@toStringTag \]
================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of the @@toStringTag property is the string value `"WeakMap"`.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span> }.

<span id="sec-23.3.4" class="secnum">[23.3.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-weakmap-instances "link to this section")</span> Properties of WeakMap Instances
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

WeakMap instances are ordinary objects that inherit properties from the WeakMap prototype. WeakMap instances also have a \[\[WeakMapData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

<span id="sec-23.4" class="secnum">[23.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakset-objects "link to this section")</span> WeakSet Objects
==================================================================================================================================================================

WeakSet objects are collections of objects. A distinct object may only occur once as an element of a WeakSet’s collection. A WeakSet may be queried to see if it contains a specific object, but no mechanism is provided for enumerating the objects it holds. If an object that is contained by a WeakSet is only reachable by following a chain of references that start within that WeakSet, then that object is inaccessible and is automatically removed from the WeakSet. WeakSet implementations must detect and remove such objects and any associated resources.

An implementation may impose an arbitrarily determined latency between the time an object contained in a WeakSet becomes inaccessible and the time when the object is removed from the WeakSet. If this latency was observable to ECMAScript program, it would be a source of indeterminacy that could impact program execution. For that reason, an ECMAScript implementation must not provide any means to determine if a WeakSet contains a particular object that does not require the observer to present the observed object.

WeakSet objects must be implemented using either hash tables or other mechanisms that, on average, provide access times that are sublinear on the number of elements in the collection. The data structure used in this WeakSet objects specification is only intended to describe the required observable semantics of WeakSet objects. It is not intended to be a viable implementation model.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> See the NOTE in [23.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakmap-objects).

<span id="sec-23.4.1" class="secnum">[23.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakset-constructor "link to this section")</span> The WeakSet Constructor
==================================================================================================================================================================================

The WeakSet constructor is the %WeakSet% intrinsic object and the initial value of the `WeakSet` property of the global object. When called as a constructor it creates and initializes a new WeakSet object. `WeakSet` is not intended to be called as a function and will throw an exception when called in that manner.

The `WeakSet` constructor is designed to be subclassable. It may be used as the value in an `extends` clause of a class definition. Subclass constructors that intend to inherit the specified `WeakSet` behaviour must include a `super` call to the `WeakSet` constructor to create and initialize the subclass instance with the internal state necessary to support the `WeakSet.prototype` built-in methods.

<span id="sec-23.4.1.1" class="secnum">[23.4.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakset-iterable "link to this section")</span> WeakSet ( \[ iterable \] )
======================================================================================================================================================================================

When the `WeakSet` function is called with optional argument iterable the following steps are taken:

1.  If NewTarget is **undefined**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  Let *set* be [OrdinaryCreateFromConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarycreatefromconstructor)(NewTarget, `"%WeakSetPrototype%"`, «‍\[\[WeakSetData\]\]» ).
3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*set*).
4.  Set *set’s* \[\[WeakSetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to a new empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
5.  If *iterable* is not present, let *iterable* be **undefined**.
6.  If *iterable* is either **undefined** or **null**, let *iter* be **undefined**.
7.  Else,
    1.  Let *adder* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*set*, `"add"`)**.**
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*adder*).
    3.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*adder*) is **false**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
    4.  Let *iter* be [GetIterator](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getiterator)(*iterable*).
    5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*iter*).

8.  If *iter* is **undefined**, return *set*.
9.  Repeat
    1.  Let *next* be [IteratorStep](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorstep)(*iter*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*next*).
    3.  If *next* is **false**, return *set*.
    4.  Let *nextValue* be [IteratorValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorvalue)(*next*).
    5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*nextValue*).
    6.  Let *status* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*adder*, *set*, «*nextValue* »).
    7.  If *status* is an [abrupt completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type), return [IteratorClose](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorclose)(*iter*, *status*).

<span id="sec-23.4.2" class="secnum">[23.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-weakset-constructor "link to this section")</span> Properties of the WeakSet Constructor
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the WeakSet constructor is the intrinsic object %FunctionPrototype% ([19.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-function-prototype-object)).

Besides the `length` property (whose value is **0**), the WeakSet constructor has the following properties:

<span id="sec-23.4.2.1" class="secnum">[23.4.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakset.prototype "link to this section")</span> WeakSet.prototype
==============================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `WeakSet.prototype` is the intrinsic %WeakSetPrototype% object ([23.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-weakset-prototype-object)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-23.4.3" class="secnum">[23.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-weakset-prototype-object "link to this section")</span> Properties of the WeakSet Prototype Object
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The WeakSet prototype object is the intrinsic object %WeakSetPrototype%. The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the WeakSet prototype object is the intrinsic object %ObjectPrototype% ([19.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-object-prototype-object)). The WeakSet prototype object is an ordinary object. It does not have a \[\[WeakSetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

<span id="sec-23.4.3.1" class="secnum">[23.4.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakset.prototype.add "link to this section")</span> WeakSet.prototype.add ( value )
================================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *S* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*S*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *S* does not have a \[\[WeakSetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*value*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
5.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *S*’s \[\[WeakSetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
6.  Repeat for each *e* that is an element of *entries,*
    1.  If *e* is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span> and [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*e*, *value*) is **true**, then
        1.  Return *S*.

7.  Append *value* as the last element of *entries*.
8.  Return *S*.

<span id="sec-23.4.3.2" class="secnum">[23.4.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakset.prototype.constructor "link to this section")</span> WeakSet.prototype.constructor
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `WeakSet.prototype.constructor` is the %WeakSet% intrinsic object.

<span id="sec-23.4.3.3" class="secnum">[23.4.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakset.prototype.delete "link to this section")</span> WeakSet.prototype.delete ( value )
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *S* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*S*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *S* does not have a \[\[WeakSetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*value*) is not Object, return **false**.
5.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *S*’s \[\[WeakSetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
6.  Repeat for each *e* that is an element of *entries*,
    1.  If *e* is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span> and [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*e*, *value*) is **true**, then
        1.  Replace the element of *entries* whose value is *e* with an element whose value is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span>*.*
        2.  Return **true**.

7.  Return **false**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The value **empty** is used as a specification device to indicate that an entry has been deleted. Actual implementations may take other actions such as physically removing the entry from internal data structures.

<span id="sec-23.4.3.4" class="secnum">[23.4.3.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakset.prototype.has "link to this section")</span> WeakSet.prototype.has ( value )
================================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *S* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*S*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *S* does not have a \[\[WeakSetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *entries* be the [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) that is the value of *S*’s \[\[WeakSetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*value*) is not Object, return **false.**
6.  Repeat for each *e* that is an element of *entries,*
    1.  If *e* is not <span style="font-family: sans-serif">empty</span> and [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*e*, *value*) is **true**, return **true***.*

7.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-23.4.3.5" class="secnum">[23.4.3.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-weakset.prototype-@@tostringtag "link to this section")</span> WeakSet.prototype \[ @@toStringTag \]
================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of the @@toStringTag property is the string value `"WeakSet"`.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span> }.

<span id="sec-23.4.4" class="secnum">[23.4.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-weakset-instances "link to this section")</span> Properties of WeakSet Instances
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

WeakSet instances are ordinary objects that inherit properties from the WeakSet prototype. WeakSet instances also have a \[\[WeakSetData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

<span id="sec-24" class="secnum">[24](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-structured-data "link to this section")</span> Structured Data
==============================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-24.1" class="secnum">[24.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraybuffer-objects "link to this section")</span> ArrayBuffer Objects
==========================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-24.1.1" class="secnum">[24.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-operations-for-arraybuffer-objects "link to this section")</span> Abstract Operations For ArrayBuffer Objects
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-24.1.1.1" class="secnum">[24.1.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-allocatearraybuffer "link to this section")</span> AllocateArrayBuffer( constructor, byteLength )
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation AllocateArrayBuffer with arguments constructor and byteLength is used to create an ArrayBuffer object. It performs the following steps:

1.  Let *obj* be [OrdinaryCreateFromConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarycreatefromconstructor)(*constructor*, `"%ArrayBufferPrototype%"`, «‍\[\[ArrayBufferData\]\], \[\[ArrayBufferByteLength\]\]» ).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*obj*).
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *byteLength* is a positive integer.
4.  Let *block* be [CreateByteDataBlock](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createbytedatablock)(*byteLength*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*block*).
6.  Set *obj’s* \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *block*.
7.  Set *obj*’s \[\[ArrayBufferByteLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *byteLength*.
8.  Return *obj*.

<span id="sec-24.1.1.2" class="secnum">[24.1.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer "link to this section")</span> IsDetachedBuffer( arrayBuffer )
===========================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation IsDetachedBuffer with argument arrayBuffer performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*arrayBuffer*) is Object and it has an \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
2.  If *arrayBuffer’s* \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is **null**, return **true**.
3.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-24.1.1.3" class="secnum">[24.1.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-detacharraybuffer "link to this section")</span> DetachArrayBuffer( arrayBuffer )
=============================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation DetachArrayBuffer with argument arrayBuffer performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*arrayBuffer*) is Object and it has \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] and \[\[ArrayBufferByteLength\]\] internal slots.
2.  Set *arrayBuffer’s* \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to **null**.
3.  Set *arrayBuffer*’s \[\[ArrayBufferByteLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to 0.
4.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**null**).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Detaching an ArrayBuffer instance disassociates the [Data Block](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-data-blocks) used as its backing store from the instance and sets the byte length of the buffer to 0. No operations defined by this specification use the DetachArrayBuffer abstract operation. However, an ECMAScript implementation or host environment may define such operations.

<span id="sec-24.1.1.4" class="secnum">[24.1.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-clonearraybuffer "link to this section")</span> CloneArrayBuffer( srcBuffer, srcByteOffset \[, cloneConstructor\] )
===============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation CloneArrayBuffer takes three parameters, an ArrayBuffer srcBuffer, an integer srcByteOffset and optionally a constructor function cloneConstructor. It creates a new ArrayBuffer whose data is a copy of srcBuffer’s data starting at srcByteOffset. This operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*srcBuffer*) is Object and it has an \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
2.  If *cloneConstructor* is not present, then
    1.  Let *cloneConstructor* be [SpeciesConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-speciesconstructor)(*srcBuffer*, %ArrayBuffer%).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*cloneConstructor*).
    3.  If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*srcBuffer*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.

3.  Else, [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isconstructor)(*cloneConstructor*) is **true**.
4.  Let *srcLength* be the value of *srcBuffer*’s \[\[ArrayBufferByteLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *srcByteOffset* ≤ *srcLength*.
6.  Let *cloneLength* be *srcLength* – *srcByteOffset.*
7.  Let *srcBlock* be the value of *srcBuffer’s* \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
8.  Let *targetBuffer* be [AllocateArrayBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-allocatearraybuffer)(*cloneConstructor*, *cloneLength*).
9.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*targetBuffer*).
10. If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*srcBuffer*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
11. Let *targetBlock* be the value of *targetBuffer’s* \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
12. Perform [CopyDataBlockBytes](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-copydatablockbytes)(*targetBlock*, 0, *srcBlock*, *srcByteOffset*, *cloneLength*).
13. Return *targetBuffer*.

<span id="sec-24.1.1.5" class="secnum">[24.1.1.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvaluefrombuffer "link to this section")</span> GetValueFromBuffer ( arrayBuffer, byteIndex, type, isLittleEndian )
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation GetValueFromBuffer takes four parameters, an ArrayBuffer arrayBuffer, an integer byteIndex, a String type, and optionally a Boolean isLittleEndian. This operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*arrayBuffer*) is **false**.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): There are sufficient bytes in *arrayBuffer* starting at *byteIndex* to represent a value of *type*.
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *byteIndex* is a positive integer.
4.  Let *block* be *arrayBuffer’s* \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  Let *elementSize* be the Number value of the Element Size value specified in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for Element Type *type*.
6.  Let *rawValue* be a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) of *elementSize* containing, in order*,* the *elementSize* sequence of bytes starting with *block*\[*byteIndex*\].
7.  If *isLittleEndian* is not present, set *isLittleEndian* to either **true** or **false**. The choice is implementation dependent and should be the alternative that is most efficient for the implementation. An implementation must use the same value each time this step is executed and the same value must be used for the corresponding step in the [SetValueInBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setvalueinbuffer) abstract operation.
8.  If *isLittleEndian* is **false**, reverse the order of the elements of *rawValue*.
9.  If *type* is `"Float32"`, then
    1.  Let *value* be the byte elements of *rawValue* concatenated and interpreted as a little-endian bit string encoding of an IEEE 754-2008 binary32 value.
    2.  If *value* is an IEEE 754-2008 binary32 NaN value, return the **NaN** Number value.
    3.  Return the Number value that corresponds to *value*.

10. If *type* is `"Float64"`, then
    1.  Let *value* be the byte elements of *rawValue* concatenated and interpreted as a little-endian bit string encoding of an IEEE 754-2008 binary64 value.
    2.  If *value* is an IEEE 754-2008 binary64 NaN value, return the **NaN** Number value.
    3.  Return the Number value that corresponds to *value*.

11. If the first code unit of *type* is `"U"`, then
    1.  Let *intValue* be the byte elements of *rawValue* concatenated and interpreted as a bit string encoding of an unsigned little-endian binary number.

12. Else
    1.  Let *intValue* be the byte elements of *rawValue* concatenated and interpreted as a bit string encoding of a binary little-endian 2’s complement number of bit length *elementSize* × 8.

13. Return the Number value that corresponds to *intValue*.

<span id="sec-24.1.1.6" class="secnum">[24.1.1.6](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setvalueinbuffer "link to this section")</span> SetValueInBuffer ( arrayBuffer, byteIndex, type, value, isLittleEndian )
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">SetValueInBuffer</span> takes five parameters, an ArrayBuffer arrayBuffer, an integer byteIndex, a String type, a Number value, and optionally a Boolean isLittleEndian. This operation performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*arrayBuffer*) is **false**.
2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): There are sufficient bytes in *arrayBuffer* starting at *byteIndex* to represent a value of *type*.
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *byteIndex* is a positive integer.
4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*value*) is Number.
5.  Let *block* be *arrayBuffer’s* \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
6.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *block* is not **undefined**.
7.  Let *elementSize* be the Number value of the Element Size value specified in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for Element Type *type*.
8.  If *isLittleEndian* is not present, set *isLittleEndian* to either **true** or **false**. The choice is implementation dependent and should be the alternative that is most efficient for the implementation. An implementation must use the same value each time this step is executed and the same value must be used for the corresponding step in the [GetValueFromBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvaluefrombuffer) abstract operation.
9.  If *type* is `"Float32"`, then
    1.  Set *rawBytes*to a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the 4 bytes that are the result of converting *value* to IEEE 754-2008 binary32 format using “Round to nearest, ties to even” rounding mode. If *isLittleEndian* is **false**, the bytes are arranged in big endian order. Otherwise, the bytes are arranged in little endian order. If *value* is **NaN**, *rawValue* may be set to any implementation chosen non-signaling NaN encoding. An implementation must always choose the same non-signaling NaN encoding for a distinct Not-a-Number value.

10. Else, if *type* is `"Float64"`, then
    1.  Set *rawBytes* to a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the 8 bytes that are the IEEE 754-2008 binary64 format encoding of *value*. If *isLittleEndian* is **false**, the bytes are arranged in big endian order. Otherwise, the bytes are arranged in little endian order. If *value* is **NaN**, *rawValue* may be set to any implementation chosen non-signaling NaN encoding. An implementation must always choose the same non-signaling NaN encoding for a distinct Not-a-Number value.

11. Else,
    1.  Let *n* be the Number value of the Element Size specified in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for Element Type *type*.
    2.  Let *convOp* be the abstract operation named in the Conversion Operation column in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for Element Type *type*.
    3.  Let *intValue* be *convOp*(*value*).
    4.  If *intValue* ≥ 0, then
        1.  Let *rawBytes* be a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the *n*-byte binary encoding of *intValue*. If *isLittleEndian* is **false**, the bytes are ordered in big endian order. Otherwise, the bytes are ordered in little endian order.

    5.  Else,
        1.  Let *rawBytes* be a [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type) containing the *n*-byte binary 2’s complement encoding of *intValue*. If *isLittleEndian* is **false**, the bytes are ordered in big endian order. Otherwise, the bytes are ordered in little endian order.

12. Store the individual bytes of *rawBytes* into *block*, in order, starting at *block*\[*byteIndex*\].
13. Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).

<span id="sec-24.1.2" class="secnum">[24.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraybuffer-constructor "link to this section")</span> The ArrayBuffer Constructor
==========================================================================================================================================================================================

The ArrayBuffer constructor is the %ArrayBuffer% intrinsic object and the initial value of the `ArrayBuffer` property of the global object. When called as a constructor it creates and initializes a new ArrayBuffer object. `ArrayBuffer` is not intended to be called as a function and will throw an exception when called in that manner.

The `ArrayBuffer` constructor is designed to be subclassable. It may be used as the value of an `extends` clause of a class definition. Subclass constructors that intend to inherit the specified `ArrayBuffer` behaviour must include a `super` call to the `ArrayBuffer` constructor to create and initialize subclass instances with the internal state necessary to support the `ArrayBuffer.prototype` built-in methods.

<span id="sec-24.1.2.1" class="secnum">[24.1.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraybuffer-length "link to this section")</span> ArrayBuffer( length )
===================================================================================================================================================================================

ArrayBuffer called with argument length performs the following steps:

1.  If NewTarget is **undefined**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  Let *numberLength* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*length*).
3.  Let *byteLength* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)(*numberLength*).
4.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*byteLength*).
5.  If [SameValueZero](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevaluezero)(*numberLength*, *byteLength*) is **false**, throw a **RangeError** exception.
6.  Return [AllocateArrayBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-allocatearraybuffer)(NewTarget, *byteLength*).

<span id="sec-24.1.3" class="secnum">[24.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-arraybuffer-constructor "link to this section")</span> Properties of the ArrayBuffer Constructor
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the ArrayBuffer constructor is the intrinsic object %FunctionPrototype% ([19.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-function-prototype-object)).

Besides its `length` property (whose value is 1), the ArrayBuffer constructor has the following properties:

<span id="sec-24.1.3.1" class="secnum">[24.1.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraybuffer.isview "link to this section")</span> ArrayBuffer.isView ( arg )
========================================================================================================================================================================================

The isView function takes one argument arg, and performs the following steps are taken:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*arg*) is not Object, return **false**.
2.  If *arg* has a \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), return **true**.
3.  Return **false**.

<span id="sec-24.1.3.2" class="secnum">[24.1.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraybuffer.prototype "link to this section")</span> ArrayBuffer.prototype
======================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of ArrayBuffer.prototype is the intrinsic object %ArrayBufferPrototype% ([24.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-arraybuffer-prototype-object)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-24.1.3.3" class="secnum">[24.1.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-arraybuffer-@@species "link to this section")</span> get ArrayBuffer \[ @@species \]
====================================================================================================================================================================================================

`ArrayBuffer[@@species]` is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Return the **this** value.

The value of the `name` property of this function is `"get [Symbol.species]"`.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> ArrayBuffer prototype methods normally use their `this` object’s constructor to create a derived object. However, a subclass constructor may over-ride that default behaviour by redefining its @@species property.

<span id="sec-24.1.4" class="secnum">[24.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-arraybuffer-prototype-object "link to this section")</span> Properties of the ArrayBuffer Prototype Object
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The ArrayBuffer prototype object is the intrinsic object %ArrayBufferPrototype%. The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the ArrayBuffer prototype object is the intrinsic object %ObjectPrototype% ([19.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-object-prototype-object)). The ArrayBuffer prototype object is an ordinary object. It does not have an \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] or \[\[ArrayBufferByteLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

<span id="sec-24.1.4.1" class="secnum">[24.1.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-arraybuffer.prototype.bytelength "link to this section")</span> get ArrayBuffer.prototype.byteLength
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

`ArrayBuffer.prototype.byteLength` is an accessor property whose set accessor function is <span class="value">undefined</span>. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

1.  Let *O* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *O* does not have an \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*O*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
5.  Let *length* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ArrayBufferByteLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
6.  Return *length*.

<span id="sec-24.1.4.2" class="secnum">[24.1.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraybuffer.prototype.constructor "link to this section")</span> ArrayBuffer.prototype.constructor
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `ArrayBuffer.prototype.constructor` is the intrinsic object %ArrayBuffer%.

<span id="sec-24.1.4.3" class="secnum">[24.1.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraybuffer.prototype.slice "link to this section")</span> ArrayBuffer.prototype.slice ( start, end )
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Let *O* be the **this** value.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*O*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *O* does not have an \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*O*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
5.  Let *len* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ArrayBufferByteLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
6.  Let *relativeStart* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*start*).
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*relativeStart*).
8.  If *relativeStart* &lt; 0, let *first* be max((*len* + *relativeStart*),0); else let *first* be min(*relativeStart*, *len*).
9.  If *end* is **undefined**, let *relativeEnd* be *len*; else let *relativeEnd* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*end*).
10. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*relativeEnd*).
11. If *relativeEnd* &lt; 0, let *final* be max((*len* + *relativeEnd*),0); else let *final* be min(*relativeEnd*, *len*).
12. Let *newLen* be max(*final*-*first*,0).
13. Let *ctor* be [SpeciesConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-speciesconstructor)(*O*, %ArrayBuffer%).
14. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*ctor*).
15. Let *new* be [Construct](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-construct)(*ctor*, «*newLen*»).
16. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*new*).
17. If *new* does not have an \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
18. If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*new*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
19. If [SameValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-samevalue)(*new*, *O*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
20. If the value of *new*’s \[\[ArrayBufferByteLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) &lt; *newLen*, throw a **TypeError** exception.
21. NOTE: Side-effects of the above steps may have <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">detached</span> *O*.
22. If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*O*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
23. Let *fromBuf* be the value of *O*’s \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
24. Let *toBuf* be the value of *new*’s \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
25. Perform [CopyDataBlockBytes](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-copydatablockbytes)(*toBuf*, 0, *fromBuf*, *first*, *newLen*).
26. Return *new*.

<span id="sec-24.1.4.4" class="secnum">[24.1.4.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-arraybuffer.prototype-@@tostringtag "link to this section")</span> ArrayBuffer.prototype \[ @@toStringTag \]
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of the @@toStringTag property is the string value `"ArrayBuffer"`.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span> }.

<span id="sec-24.1.5" class="secnum">[24.1.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-arraybuffer-instances "link to this section")</span> Properties of the ArrayBuffer Instances
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

ArrayBuffer instances inherit properties from the ArrayBuffer prototype object. ArrayBuffer instances each have an \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) and an \[\[ArrayBufferByteLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

ArrayBuffer instances whose \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] is **null** are considered to be detached and all operators to access or modify data contained in the ArrayBuffer instance will fail.

<span id="sec-24.2" class="secnum">[24.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-dataview-objects "link to this section")</span> DataView Objects
====================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-24.2.1" class="secnum">[24.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-abstract-operations-for-dataview-objects "link to this section")</span> Abstract Operations For DataView Objects
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-24.2.1.1" class="secnum">[24.2.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getviewvalue "link to this section")</span> GetViewValue ( view, requestIndex, isLittleEndian, type )
=================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation GetViewValue with arguments view, requestIndex, isLittleEndian, and type is used by functions on DataView instances is to retrieve values from the view’s buffer. It performs the following steps:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*view*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  If *view* does not have a \[\[DataView\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  Let *numberIndex* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*requestIndex*).
4.  Let *getIndex* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*numberIndex*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*getIndex*).
6.  If *numberIndex* ≠ *getIndex* or *getIndex* &lt; 0, throw a **RangeError** exception.
7.  Let *isLittleEndian* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)(*isLittleEndian*).
8.  Let *buffer* be the value of *view’s* \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
9.  If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*buffer*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
10. Let *viewOffset* be the value of *view’s* \[\[ByteOffset\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
11. Let *viewSize* be the value of *view’s* \[\[ByteLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
12. Let *elementSize* be the Number value of the Element Size value specified in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for Element Type *type*.
13. If *getIndex* +*elementSize* &gt; *viewSize*, throw a **RangeError** exception.
14. Let *bufferIndex* be *getIndex* + *viewOffset*.
15. Return [GetValueFromBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getvaluefrombuffer)(*buffer*, *bufferIndex*, *type*, *isLittleEndian*).

<span id="sec-24.2.1.2" class="secnum">[24.2.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setviewvalue "link to this section")</span> SetViewValue ( view, requestIndex, isLittleEndian, type, value )
========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation SetViewValue with arguments view, requestIndex, isLittleEndian, type, and value is used by functions on DataView instances to store values into the view’s buffer. It performs the following steps:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*view*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  If *view* does not have a \[\[DataView\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  Let *numberIndex* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*requestIndex*).
4.  Let *getIndex* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*numberIndex*).
5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*getIndex*).
6.  If *numberIndex* ≠ *getIndex* or *getIndex* &lt; 0, throw a **RangeError** exception.
7.  Let *isLittleEndian* be [ToBoolean](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-toboolean)(*isLittleEndian*).
8.  Let *buffer* be the value of *view’s* \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
9.  If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*buffer*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
10. Let *viewOffset* be the value of *view’s* \[\[ByteOffset\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
11. Let *viewSize* be the value of *view’s* \[\[ByteLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
12. Let *elementSize* be the Number value of the Element Size value specified in [Table 49](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-49) for Element Type *type*.
13. If *getIndex* +*elementSize* &gt; *viewSize*, throw a **RangeError** exception.
14. Let *bufferIndex* be *getIndex* + *viewOffset*.
15. Return [SetValueInBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-setvalueinbuffer)(*buffer*, *bufferIndex*, *type*, *value*, *isLittleEndian*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The algorithms for [GetViewValue](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-getviewvalue) and SetViewValue are identical except for their final steps.

<span id="sec-24.2.2" class="secnum">[24.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-dataview-constructor "link to this section")</span> The DataView Constructor
====================================================================================================================================================================================

The DataView constructor is the %DataView% intrinsic object and the initial value of the `DataView` property of the global object. When called as a constructor it creates and initializes a new DataView object. `DataView` is not intended to be called as a function and will throw an exception when called in that manner.

The `DataView` constructor is designed to be subclassable. It may be used as the value of an `extends` clause of a class definition. Subclass constructors that intend to inherit the specified `DataView` behaviour must include a `super` call to the `DataView` constructor to create and initialize subclass instances with the internal state necessary to support the `DataView.prototype` built-in methods.

<span id="sec-24.2.2.1" class="secnum">[24.2.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-dataview-buffer-byteoffset-bytelength "link to this section")</span> DataView (buffer \[ , byteOffset \[ , byteLength \] \] )
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

`DataView` called with arguments <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*buffer*, *byteOffset*, and *length*</span> performs the following steps:

1.  If NewTarget is **undefined**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*buffer*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  If *buffer* does not have an \[\[ArrayBufferData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
4.  Let *numberOffset* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*byteOffset*).
5.  Let *offset* be [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*numberOffset*).
6.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*offset*).
7.  If *numberOffset* ≠ *offset* or *offset* &lt; 0, throw a **RangeError** exception.
8.  If [IsDetachedBuffer](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isdetachedbuffer)(*buffer*) is **true**, throw a **TypeError** exception.
9.  Let *bufferByteLength* be the value of *buffer’s* \[\[ArrayBufferByteLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
10. If *offset* &gt; *bufferByteLength*, throw a **RangeError** exception.
11. If *byteLength* is **undefined**, then
    1.  Let *viewByteLength* be *bufferByteLength* – *offset*.

12. Else,
    1.  Let *viewByteLength* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)(*byteLength*)*.*
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*viewByteLength*).
    3.  If *offset*+*viewByteLength* &gt; *bufferByteLength*, throw a **RangeError** exception.

13. Let *O* be [OrdinaryCreateFromConstructor](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ordinarycreatefromconstructor)(NewTarget, `"%DataViewPrototype%"`, «‍\[\[DataView\]\], \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\], \[\[ByteLength\]\], \[\[ByteOffset\]\]» ).
14. [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*O*).
15. Set *O’s* \[\[DataView\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to **true**.
16. Set *O’s* \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *buffer*.
17. Set *O*’s \[\[ByteLength\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *viewByteLength*.
18. Set *O*’s \[\[ByteOffset\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *offset*.
19. Return *O*.

<span id="sec-24.2.3" class="secnum">[24.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-dataview-constructor "link to this section")</span> Properties of the DataView Constructor
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the `DataView` constructor is the intrinsic object %FunctionPrototype% ([19.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-function-prototype-object)).

Besides the `length` property (whose value is 3), the DataView constructor has the following properties:

<span id="sec-24.2.3.1" class="secnum">[24.2.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-dataview.prototype "link to this section")</span> DataView.prototype
================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `DataView.prototype` is the intrinsic object %DataViewPrototype% ([24.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-dataview-prototype-object)).

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-24.2.4" class="secnum">[24.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-dataview-prototype-object "link to this section")</span> Properties of the DataView Prototype Object
==============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The DataView prototype object is the intrinsic object %DataViewPrototype%. The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the DataView prototype object is the intrinsic object %ObjectPrototype% ([19.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-object-prototype-object)). The DataView prototype object is an ordinary object. It does not have a \[\[DataView\]\], \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\], \[\[ByteLength\]\], or \[\[ByteOffset\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

<span id="sec-24.2.5" class="secnum">[24.2.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-dataview-instances "link to this section")</span> Properties of DataView Instances
========================================================================================================================================================================================================

DataView instances are ordinary objects that inherit properties from the DataView prototype object. DataView instances each have \[\[DataView\]\], \[\[ViewedArrayBuffer\]\], \[\[ByteLength\]\], and \[\[ByteOffset\]\] internal slots.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The value of the \[\[DataView\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is not used within this specification. The simple presence of that [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is used within the specification to identify objects created using the `DataView` constructor.

<span id="sec-24.3" class="secnum">[24.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-json-object "link to this section")</span> The JSON Object
==============================================================================================================================================================

The JSON object is the %JSON% intrinsic object and the initial value of the `JSON` property of the global object. The JSON object is a single ordinary object that contains two functions, **parse** and **stringify**, that are used to parse and construct JSON texts. The JSON Data Interchange Format is defined in ECMA-404. The JSON interchange format used in this specification is exactly that described by ECMA-404.

Conforming implementations of `JSON.parse` and `JSON.stringify` must support the exact interchange format described in the ECMA-404 specification without any deletions or extensions to the format.

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the JSON object is the intrinsic object %ObjectPrototype% ([19.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-object-prototype-object)). The value of the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the JSON object is set to **true**.

The JSON object does not have a \[\[Construct\]\] internal method; it is not possible to use the JSON object as a constructor with the `new` operator.

The JSON object does not have a \[\[Call\]\] internal method; it is not possible to invoke the JSON object as a function.

<span id="sec-24.3.1" class="secnum">[24.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-json.parse "link to this section")</span> JSON.parse ( text \[ , reviver \] )
