=====================================================================================================================================================================================

The `parse` function parses a JSON text (a JSON-formatted String) and produces an ECMAScript value. The JSON format is a subset of the syntax for ECMAScript literals, Array Initializers and Object Initializers. After parsing, JSON objects are realized as ECMAScript objects. JSON arrays are realized as ECMAScript Array instances. JSON strings, numbers, booleans, and null are realized as ECMAScript Strings, Numbers, Booleans, and **null**.

The optional *reviver* parameter is a function that takes two parameters, *key* and *value*. It can filter and transform the results. It is called with each of the *key*/*value* pairs produced by the parse, and its return value is used instead of the original value. If it returns what it received, the structure is not modified. If it returns **undefined** then the property is deleted from the result.

1.  Let *JText* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*text*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*JText*).
3.  Parse *JText* interpreted as UTF-16 encoded Unicode points ([6.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types-string-type)) as a JSON text as specified in
    ECMA-404. Throw a **SyntaxError** exception if *JText* is not a valid JSON text as defined in that specification.
4.  Let *scriptText* be the result of concatenating `"("`, *JText*, and `");"`.
5.  Let *completion* be the result of parsing and evaluating *scriptText* as if it was the source text of an ECMAScript *Script*. but using the alternative definition of *DoubleStringCharacter* provided below. The extended PropertyDefinitionEvaluation semantics defined in [B.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-__proto__-property-names-in-object-initializers) must not be used during the evaluation.
6.  Let *unfiltered* be *completion*.\[\[value\]\].
7.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *unfiltered* will be either a primitive value or an object that is defined by either an *ArrayLiteral* or an *ObjectLiteral*.
8.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*reviver*) is **true**, then
    1.  Let *root* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(%ObjectPrototype%).
    2.  Let *rootName* be the empty String.
    3.  Let *status* be [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*root*, *rootName*, *unfiltered*).
    4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is **true**.
    5.  Return [InternalizeJSONProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-internalizejsonproperty)(*root*, *rootName*).

9.  Else
    1.  Return *unfiltered*.

JSON allows Unicode code units 0x2028 (LINE SEPARATOR) and 0x2029 (PARAGRAPH SEPARATOR) to directly appear in *String* literals without using an escape sequence. This is enabled by using the following alternative definition of *DoubleStringCharacter* when parsing scriptText in step 5:

*DoubleStringCharacter* <span class="geq">::</span>

*SourceCharacter* <span class="grhsmod">but not one of</span> `"` <span class="grhsmod">or</span> `\` <span class="grhsmod">or</span> <span class="gprose">U+0000 through U+001F</span>

`\` *EscapeSequence*

-   The SV of <span class="prod">*DoubleStringCharacter* <span class="geq">::</span> *SourceCharacter* <span class="grhsmod">but not one of</span> `"` <span class="grhsmod">or</span> `\` <span class="grhsmod">or</span></span> U+0000 **through** U+001F is the [UTF16Encoding](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-utf16encoding) ([10.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-utf16encoding)) of the code point value of *SourceCharacter*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The syntax of a valid JSON text is a subset of the ECMAScript *PrimaryExpression* syntax. Hence a valid JSON text is also a valid *PrimaryExpression*. Step 3 above verifies that *JText* conforms to that subset. When *scriptText* is parsed and evaluated as a *Script* the result will be either a String, Number, Boolean, or Null primitive value or an Object defined as if by an *ArrayLiteral* or *ObjectLiteral*.

<span id="sec-24.3.1.1" class="secnum">[24.3.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-internalizejsonproperty "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: InternalizeJSONProperty( holder, name)
============================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation InternalizeJSONProperty is a recursive abstract operation that takes two parameters: a holder object and the String name of a property in that object. InternalizeJSONProperty uses the value of reviver that was originally passed to the above parse function.

1.  Let *val* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*holder*, *name*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*val*).
3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*val*) is Object, then
    1.  Let *isArray* be [IsArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isarray)(*val*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*isArray*).
    3.  If *isArray* is **true**, then
        1.  Set *I* to 0.
        2.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*val*, `"length"`)).
        3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
        4.  Repeat while *I* &lt; *len*,
            1.  Let *newElement* be InternalizeJSONProperty(*val*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*I*)).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*newElement*).
            3.  If *newElement* is **undefined**, then
                1.  Let *status* be *val*.\[\[Delete\]\]([ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*I*)).

            4.  Else
                1.  Let *status* be [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*val*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*I*), *newElement*).
                2.  NOTE This algorithm intentionally does not throw an exception if status is **false**.

            5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).
            6.  Add 1 to *I*.

    4.  Else
        1.  Let *keys* be [EnumerableOwnNames](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-enumerableownnames)(*val*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*keys*).
        3.  For each String *P* in *keys* do,
            1.  Let *newElement* be InternalizeJSONProperty(*val*, *P*).
            2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*newElement*).
            3.  If *newElement* is **undefined**, then
                1.  Let *status* be *val*.\[\[Delete\]\](*P*).

            4.  Else
                1.  Let *status* be [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*val*, *P*, *newElement*).
                2.  NOTE This algorithm intentionally does not throw an exception if status is **false**.

            5.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*status*).

4.  Return [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*reviver*, *holder*, «*name*, *val*»).

It is not permitted for a conforming implementation of `JSON.parse` to extend the JSON grammars. If an implementation wishes to support a modified or extended JSON interchange format it must do so by defining a different parse function.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> In the case where there are duplicate name Strings within an object, lexically preceding values for the same key shall be overwritten.

<span id="sec-24.3.2" class="secnum">[24.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-json.stringify "link to this section")</span> JSON.stringify ( value \[ , replacer \[ , space \] \] )
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================

The `stringify` function returns a String in UTF-16 encoded JSON format representing an ECMAScript value. It can take three parameters. The value parameter is an ECMAScript value, which is usually an object or array, although it can also be a String, Boolean, Number or **null**. The optional replacer parameter is either a function that alters the way objects and arrays are stringified, or an array of Strings and Numbers that acts as a white list for selecting the object properties that will be stringified. The optional space parameter is a String or Number that allows the result to have white space injected into it to improve human readability.

These are the steps in stringifying an object:

1.  Let *stack* be an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
2.  Let *indent* be the empty String.
3.  Let *PropertyList* and *ReplacerFunction* be **undefined**.
4.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*replacer*) is Object, then
    1.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*replacer*) is **true**, then
        1.  Let *ReplacerFunction* be *replacer*.

    2.  Else,
        1.  Let *isArray* be [IsArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isarray)(*replacer*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*isArray*).
        3.  If *isArray* is **true**, then
            1.  Let *PropertyList* be an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type)
            2.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*replacer*, `"length"`)).
            3.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
            4.  Let *k* be 0.
            5.  Repeat while *k*&lt;*len*.
                1.  Let *v* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*replacer*, [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*k*)).
                2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*v*).
                3.  Let *item* be **undefined**.
                4.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*v*) is String, let *item* be *v.*
                5.  Else if [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*v*) is Number, let *item* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*v*).
                6.  Else if [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*v*) is Object, then
                    1.  If *v* has a \[\[StringData\]\] or \[\[NumberData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), let *item* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*v*).
                    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*item*).

                7.  If *item* is not **undefined** and *item* is not currently an element of *PropertyList*, then
                    1.  Append *item* to the end of *PropertyList*.

                8.  Let *k* be *k*+1.

5.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*space*) is Object, then
    1.  If *space* has a \[\[NumberData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), then
        1.  Let *space* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*space*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*space*).

    2.  Else if *space* has a \[\[StringData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), then
        1.  Let *space* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*space*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*space*).

6.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*space*) is Number, then
    1.  Let *space* be min(10, [ToInteger](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tointeger)(*space*)).
    2.  Set *gap* to a String containing *space* occurrences of code unit 0x0020 (SPACE). This will be the empty String if *space* is less than 1.

7.  Else if [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*space*) is String, then
    1.  If the number of elements in *space* is 10 or less, set *gap* to *space* otherwise set *gap* to a String consisting of the first 10 elements of *space*.

8.  Else
    1.  Set *gap* to the empty String.

9.  Let *wrapper* be [ObjectCreate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-objectcreate)(%ObjectPrototype%).
10. Let *status* be [CreateDataProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdataproperty)(*wrapper*, the empty String, *value*).
11. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *status* is **true**.
12. Return [SerializeJSONProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-serializejsonproperty)(the empty String, *wrapper*).

<span class="nh">NOTE 1</span> JSON structures are allowed to be nested to any depth, but they must be acyclic. If *value* is or contains a cyclic structure, then the stringify function must throw a **TypeError** exception. This is an example of a value that cannot be stringified:

    a = [];

    a[0] = a;

    my_text = JSON.stringify(a); // This must throw a TypeError.

<span class="nh">NOTE 2</span> Symbolic primitive values are rendered as follows:

-   The **null** value is rendered in JSON text as the String `null`.
-   The **undefined** value is not rendered.
-   The **true** value is rendered in JSON text as the String `true`.
-   The **false** value is rendered in JSON text as the String `false`.

<span class="nh">NOTE 3</span> String values are wrapped in QUOTATION MARK (`"`) code units. The code units `"` and `\` are escaped with `\` prefixes. Control characters code units are replaced with escape sequences `\u`HHHH, or with the shorter forms, `\b` (backspace), `\f` (form feed), `\n` (LINE FEED), `\r` (carriage return), `\t` (CHARACTER TABULATION).

<span class="nh">NOTE 4</span> Finite numbers are stringified as if by calling [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*number*). **NaN** and Infinity regardless of sign are represented as the String `null`.

<span class="nh">NOTE 5</span> Values that do not have a JSON representation (such as **undefined** and functions) do not produce a String. Instead they produce the **undefined** value. In arrays these values are represented as the String `null`. In objects an unrepresentable value causes the property to be excluded from stringification.

<span class="nh">NOTE 6</span> An object is rendered as U+007B (left CURLY BRACKET) followed by zero or more properties, separated with a U+002C (COMMA), closed with a U+007D (right CURLY BRACKET). A property is a quoted String representing the key or property name, a U+003A (colon), and then the stringified property value. An array is rendered as an opening U+005B (left square bracket followed by zero or more values, separated with a U+002C (COMMA), closed with a U+005D (right square bracket).

<span id="sec-24.3.2.1" class="secnum">[24.3.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-serializejsonproperty "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: SerializeJSONProperty ( key, holder )
=========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation SerializeJSONProperty with arguments key, <span style="font-family: Times New
        Roman">and</span> holder has access to *ReplacerFunction* from the invocation of the `stringify` method. Its algorithm is as follows:

1.  Let *value* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*holder*, *key*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*value*).
3.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*value*) is Object, then
    1.  Let *toJSON* be [Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*value*, `"toJSON"`).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*toJSON*).
    3.  If [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*toJSON*) is **true**
        1.  Let *value* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*toJSON*, *value*, «*key*»).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*value*).

4.  If *ReplacerFunction* is not **undefined**, then
    1.  Let *value* be [Call](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-call)(*ReplacerFunction*, *holder*, «*key*, *value*»).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*value*).

5.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*value*) is Object, then
    1.  If *value* has a \[\[NumberData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), then
        1.  Let *value* be [ToNumber](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tonumber)(*value*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*value*).

    2.  Else if *value* has a \[\[StringData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), then
        1.  Let *value* be [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*value*).
        2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*value*).

    3.  Else if *value* has a \[\[BooleanData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), then
        1.  Let *value* be the value of the \[\[BooleanData\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of *value*.

6.  If *value* is **null**, return `"null"`.
7.  If *value* is **true**, return `"true"`.
8.  If *value* is **false**, return `"false"`.
9.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*value*) is String, return [QuoteJSONString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-quotejsonstring)(*value*).
10. If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*value*) is Number, then
    1.  If *value* is finite, return [ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*value*).
    2.  Else, return `"null"`.

11. If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*value*) is Object, and [IsCallable](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iscallable)(*value*) is **false**, then
    1.  Let *isArray* be [IsArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-isarray)(*value*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*isArray*).
    3.  If *isArray* is **true**, return [SerializeJSONArray](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-serializejsonarray)(*value*).
    4.  Else, return [SerializeJSONObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-serializejsonobject)(*value*).

12. Return **undefined**.

<span id="sec-24.3.2.2" class="secnum">[24.3.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-quotejsonstring "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: QuoteJSONString ( value )
=======================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation QuoteJSONString with argument value wraps a String value in QUOTATION MARK code units and escapes certain other code units within it.

1.  Let *product* be code unit 0x0022 (QUOTATION MARK).
2.  For each code unit *C* in *value*
    1.  If *C* is 0x0022 (quOTATion mark) or 0x005C (reverse solidus), then
        1.  Let *product* be the concatenation of *product* and code unit 0x005C (reverse solidus).
        2.  Let *product* be the concatenation of *product* and *C*.

    2.  Else if *C* is 0x0008 (backspace), 0x000C (form feed), 0x000A (LINE FEED), 0x000D (carriage return), or 0x000B (LINE TABULATION), then
        1.  Let *product* be the concatenation of *product* and code unit 0x005C (reverse solidus).
        2.  Let *abbrev* be the string value corresponding to the value of *C* as follows:
            |                      |                                       |
            |----------------------|---------------------------------------|
            | backspace            | <span class="string value">"b"</span> |
            | form feed (FF)       | <span class="string value">"f"</span> |
            | LINE FEED (LF)       | <span class="string value">"n"</span> |
            | carriage return (CR) | <span class="string value">"r"</span> |
            | LINE TABULATION      | <span class="string value">"t"</span> |

        3.  Let *product* be the concatenation of *product* and *abbrev*.

    3.  Else if *C* has a code unit value less than 0x0020 (SPACE), then
        1.  Let *product* be the concatenation of *product* and code unit 0x005C (reverse solidus).
        2.  Let *product* be the concatenation of *product* and `"u"`.
        3.  Let *hex* be the string result of converting the numeric code unit value of *C* to a String of four hexadecimal digits. Alphabetic hexadecimal digits are presented as lowercase Latin letters.
        4.  Let *product* be the concatenation of *product* and *hex*.

    4.  Else,
        1.  Let *product* be the concatenation of *product* and *C*.

3.  Let *product* be the concatenation of *product* and code unit 0x0022 (QUOTATION MARK).
4.  Return *product*.

<span id="sec-24.3.2.3" class="secnum">[24.3.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-serializejsonobject "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: SerializeJSONObject ( value )
===============================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation SerializeJSONObject with argument value serializes an object. It has access to the stack, indent, gap, and *PropertyList* values of the current invocation of the `stringify` method.

1.  If *stack* contains *value*, throw a **TypeError** exception because the structure is cyclical.
2.  Append *value* to *stack*.
3.  Let *stepback* be *indent*.
4.  Let *indent* be the concatenation of *indent* and *gap*.
5.  If *PropertyList* is not **undefined**, then
    1.  Let *K* be *PropertyList*.

6.  Else,
    1.  Let *K* be [EnumerableOwnNames](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-enumerableownnames)(*value*).

7.  Let *partial* be an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
8.  For each element *P* of *K*,
    1.  Let *strP* be [SerializeJSONProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-serializejsonproperty)(*P*, *value*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*strP*).
    3.  If *strP* is not **undefined**, then
        1.  Let *member* be [QuoteJSONString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-quotejsonstring)(*P*).
        2.  Let *member* be the concatenation of *member* and the string `":"`.
        3.  If *gap* is not the empty String, then
            1.  Let *member* be the concatenation of *member* and code unit 0x0020 (SPACE).

        4.  Let *member* be the concatenation of *member* and *strP*.
        5.  Append *member* to *partial*.

9.  If *partial* is empty, then
    1.  Let *final* be `"{}"`.

10. Else,
    1.  If *gap* is the empty String, then
        1.  Let *properties* be a String formed by concatenating all the element Strings of *partial* with each adjacent pair of Strings separated with code unit 0x002C (comma). A comma is not inserted either before the first String or after the last String.
        2.  Let *final* be the result of concatenating **`"{"`,** *properties*, and `"}"`.

    2.  Else *gap* is not the empty String
        1.  Let *separator* be the result of concatenating code unit 0x002C (comma), code unit 0x000A (line feed), and *indent*.
        2.  Let *properties* be a String formed by concatenating all the element Strings of *partial* with each adjacent pair of Strings separated with *separator*. The *separator* String is not inserted either before the first String or after the last String.
        3.  Let *final* be the result of concatenating `"{"`, code unit 0x000A (line feed), *indent*, *properties*, code unit 0x000A, *stepback*, and `"}"`.

11. Remove the last element of *stack*.
12. Let *indent* be *stepback*.
13. Return *final*.

<span id="sec-24.3.2.4" class="secnum">[24.3.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-serializejsonarray "link to this section")</span> Runtime Semantics: SerializeJSONArray ( value )
=============================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation SerializeJSONArray with argument value serializes an array. It has access to the stack, indent, and gap values of the current invocation of the `stringify` method.

1.  If *stack* contains *value*, throw a **TypeError** exception because the structure is cyclical.
2.  Append *value* to *stack*.
3.  Let *stepback* be *indent*.
4.  Let *indent* be the concatenation of *indent* and *gap*.
5.  Let *partial* be an empty [List](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-list-and-record-specification-type).
6.  Let *len* be [ToLength](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tolength)([Get](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-get-o-p)(*value*, `"length"`)).
7.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*len*).
8.  Let *index* be 0.
9.  Repeat while *index* &lt; *len*
    1.  Let *strP* be [SerializeJSONProperty](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-serializejsonproperty)([ToString](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-tostring)(*index*), *value*).
    2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*strP*).
    3.  If *strP* is **undefined**, then
        1.  Append `"null"` to *partial*.

    4.  Else,
        1.  Append *strP* to *partial*.

    5.  Increment *index* by 1.

10. If *partial* is empty, then
    1.  Let *final* be `"[]"`.

11. Else,
    1.  If *gap* is the empty String, then
        1.  Let *properties* be a String formed by concatenating all the element Strings of *partial* with each adjacent pair of Strings separated with code unit 0x002C (comma). A comma is not inserted either before the first String or after the last String.
        2.  Let *final* be the result of concatenating **`"["`,** *properties*, and `"]"`.

    2.  Else,
        1.  Let *separator* be the result of concatenating code unit 0x002C (comma), code unit 0x000A (line feed), and *indent*.
        2.  Let *properties* be a String formed by concatenating all the element Strings of *partial* with each adjacent pair of Strings separated with *separator*. The *separator* String is not inserted either before the first String or after the last String.
        3.  Let *final* be the result of concatenating `"["`, code unit 0x000A (line feed), *indent*, *properties*, code unit 0x000A, *stepback*, and `"]"`.

12. Remove the last element of *stack*.
13. Let *indent* be *stepback*.
14. Return *final*.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> The representation of arrays includes only the elements between zero and `array.length` – 1 <span style="font-family: sans-serif">inclusive</span>. Properties whose keys are not array indexes are excluded from the stringification. An array is stringified as an opening left square bracket, elements separated by comma, and a closing right square bracket.

<span id="sec-24.3.3" class="secnum">[24.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-json-@@tostringtag "link to this section")</span> JSON \[ @@toStringTag \]
==================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of the @@toStringTag property is the string value `"JSON"`.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span> }.

<span id="sec-25" class="secnum">[25](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-control-abstraction-objects "link to this section")</span> Control Abstraction Objects
======================================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-25.1" class="secnum">[25.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteration "link to this section")</span> Iteration
======================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-25.1.1" class="secnum">[25.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-common-iteration-interfaces "link to this section")</span> Common Iteration Interfaces
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

An interface is a set of property keys whose associated values match a specific specification. Any object that provides all the properties as described by an interface’s specification *conforms* to that interface. An interface is not represented by a distinct object. There may be many separately implemented objects that conform to any interface. An individual object may conform to multiple interfaces.

<span id="sec-25.1.1.1" class="secnum">[25.1.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iterable-interface "link to this section")</span> The *Iterable* Interface
======================================================================================================================================================================================

The *Iterable* interface includes the property described in [Table 52](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-52):

<span id="table-52">Table 52</span> — *Iterable* Interface Required Properties

| Property     | Value                                         | Requirements                                                  |
|--------------|-----------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------|
| `@@iterator` | A function that returns an *Iterator* object. | The returned object must conform to the *Iterator* interface. |

<span id="sec-25.1.1.2" class="secnum">[25.1.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iterator-interface "link to this section")</span> The *Iterator* Interface
======================================================================================================================================================================================

An object that implements the *Iterator* interface must include the property in [Table 53](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-53). Such objects may also implement the properties in [Table 54](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-54).

<span id="table-53">Table 53</span> — *Iterator* Interface Required Properties

| Property | Value                                               | Requirements                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|----------|-----------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `next`   | A function that returns an *IteratorResult* object. | The returned object must conform to the *IteratorResult* interface. If a previous call to the `next` method of an *Iterator* has returned an *IteratorResult* object whose `done` property is **true**, then all subsequent calls to the `next` method of that object should also return an *IteratorResult* object whose `done` property is **true**. However, this requirement is not enforced. |

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Arguments may be passed to the next function but their interpretation and validity is dependent upon the target *Iterator*. The for-of statement and other common users of *Iterators* do not pass any arguments, so *Iterator* objects that expect to be used in such a manner must be prepared to deal with being called with no arguments.

<span id="table-54">Table 54</span> — *Iterator* Interface Optional Properties

| Property | Value                                               | Requirements                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|----------|-----------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `return` | A function that returns an *IteratorResult* object. | The returned object must conform to the *IteratorResult* interface. Invoking this method notifies the *Iterator* object that the caller does not intend to make any more `next` method calls to the *Iterator*. The returned *IteratorResult* object will typically have a `done` property whose value is **true**, and a `value` property with the value passed as the argument of the `return` method. However, this requirement is not enforced.                                 |
| `throw`  | A function that returns an *IteratorResult* object. | The returned object must conform to the *IteratorResult* interface. Invoking this method notifies the *Iterator* object that the caller has detected an error condition. The argument may be used to identify the error condition and typically will be an exception object. A typical response is to `throw` the value passed as the argument. If the method does not `throw`, the returned *IteratorResult* object will typically have a `done` property whose value is **true**. |

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Typically callers of these methods should check for their existence before invoking them. Certain ECMAScript language features including `for`-`of`, `yield*`, and array destructuring call these methods after performing an existence check. Most ECMAScript library functions that accept *Iterable* objects as arguments also conditionally call them.

<span id="sec-25.1.1.3" class="secnum">[25.1.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-iteratorresult-interface "link to this section")</span> The IteratorResult Interface
================================================================================================================================================================================================

The *IteratorResult* interface includes the properties listed in [Table 55](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-55):

<span id="table-55">Table 55</span> — *IteratorResult* Interface Properties

| Property | Value                                                                                                                 | Requirements                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|----------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| `done`   | Either <span class="value">true</span> or <span class="value">false</span>.                                           | This is the result status of an *iterator* `next` method call. If the end of the iterator was reached `done` is <span class="value">true</span>. If the end was not reached `done` is <span class="value">false</span> and a value is available. If a `done` property (either own or inherited) does not exist, it is consider to have the value <span class="value">false</span>.                                                  |
| `value`  | Any [ECMAScript language value](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-language-types). | If done is <span class="value">false</span>, this is the current iteration element value. If done is <span class="value">true</span>, this is the return value of the iterator, if it supplied one. If the iterator does not have a return value, `value` is <span class="value">undefined</span>. In that case, the `value` property may be absent from the conforming object if it does not inherit an explicit `value` property. |

<span id="sec-25.1.2" class="secnum">[25.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%iteratorprototype%-object "link to this section")</span> The %IteratorPrototype% Object
================================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the %IteratorPrototype% object is the intrinsic object %ObjectPrototype% ([19.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-object-prototype-object)). The %IteratorPrototype% object is an ordinary object. The initial value of the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the %IteratorPrototype% object is **true**.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> All objects defined in this specification that implement the Iterator interface also inherit from %IteratorPrototype%. ECMAScript code may also define objects that inherit from %IteratorPrototype%.The %IteratorPrototype% object provides a place where additional methods that are applicable to all iterator objects may be added.

The following expression is one way that ECMAScript code can access the %IteratorPrototype% object:

    Object.getPrototypeOf(Object.getPrototypeOf([][Symbol.iterator]()))

<span id="sec-25.1.2.1" class="secnum">[25.1.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%iteratorprototype%-@@iterator "link to this section")</span> %IteratorPrototype% \[ @@iterator \] ( )
==================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The following steps are taken:

1.  Return the **this** value.

The value of the `name` property of this function is `"[Symbol.iterator]"`.

<span id="sec-25.2" class="secnum">[25.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorfunction-objects "link to this section")</span> GeneratorFunction Objects
======================================================================================================================================================================================

Generator Function objects are constructor functions that are usually created by evaluating *GeneratorDeclaration*, *GeneratorExpression*, and *GeneratorMethod* syntactic productions. They may also be created by calling the %GeneratorFunction% intrinsic.

![A staggering variety of boxes and arrows.](./ECMAScript%20Language%20Specification%20ECMA-262%206th%20Edition%20–%20DRAFT_files/figure-2.png)
Figure 2 (Informative) — Generator Objects Relationships

<span id="sec-25.2.1" class="secnum">[25.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorfunction-constructor "link to this section")</span> The GeneratorFunction Constructor
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

The `GeneratorFunction` constructor is the %GeneratorFunction% intrinsic. When `GeneratorFunction` is called as a function rather than as a constructor, it creates and initializes a new GeneratorFunction object. Thus the function call `GeneratorFunction` `(…)` is equivalent to the object creation expression `new GeneratorFunction` `(…)` with the same arguments.

`GeneratorFunction` is designed to be subclassable. It may be used as the value of an `extends` clause of a class definition. Subclass constructors that intend to inherit the specified `GeneratorFunction` behaviour must include a `super` call to the `GeneratorFunction` constructor to create and initialize subclass instances with the internal slots necessary for built-in GeneratorFunction behaviour. All ECMAScript syntactic forms for defining generator function objects create direct instances of `GeneratorFunction`. There is no syntactic means to create instances of `GeneratorFunction` subclasses.

<span id="sec-25.2.1.1" class="secnum">[25.2.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorfunction "link to this section")</span> GeneratorFunction (p1, p2, … , pn, body)
=====================================================================================================================================================================================================

The last argument specifies the body (executable code) of a generator function; any preceding arguments specify formal parameters.

When the `GeneratorFunction` function is called with some arguments p1, p2, … , pn, body (where n might be <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">0</span>, that is, there are no “p” arguments, and where body might also not be provided), the following steps are taken:

1.  Let *C* be the active function object.
2.  Let *args* be the *argumentsList* that was passed to this function by \[\[Call\]\] or \[\[Construct\]\].
3.  Return [CreateDynamicFunction](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createdynamicfunction)(*C*, NewTarget, `"generator"`, *args*).

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> See NOTE for [19.2.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-p1-p2-pn-body).

<span id="sec-25.2.2" class="secnum">[25.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-generatorfunction-constructor "link to this section")</span> Properties of the GeneratorFunction Constructor
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The `GeneratorFunction` constructor is a standard built-in function object that inherits from the `Function` constructor. The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the `GeneratorFunction` constructor is the intrinsic object %Function%.

The value of the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the GeneratorFunction constructor is **true**.

The value of the `name` property of the GeneratorFunction is `"GeneratorFunction"`.

The `GeneratorFunction` constructor has the following properties:

<span id="sec-25.2.2.1" class="secnum">[25.2.2.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorfunction.length "link to this section")</span> GeneratorFunction.length
============================================================================================================================================================================================

This is a data property with a value of 1. This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true** }.

<span id="sec-25.2.2.2" class="secnum">[25.2.2.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorfunction.prototype "link to this section")</span> GeneratorFunction.prototype
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `GeneratorFunction.prototype` is the intrinsic object %Generator%.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **false** }.

<span id="sec-25.2.3" class="secnum">[25.2.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-the-generatorfunction-prototype-object "link to this section")</span> Properties of the GeneratorFunction Prototype Object
================================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The GeneratorFunction prototype object is an ordinary object. It is not a function object and does not have an \[\[ECMAScriptCode\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) or any other of the internal slots listed in [Table 27](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-27) or [Table 56](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-56). In addition to being the value of the prototype property of the %GeneratorFunction% intrinsic, it is the %Generator% intrinsic (see Figure 2).

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the GeneratorFunction prototype object is the %FunctionPrototype% intrinsic object. The initial value of the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the GeneratorFunction prototype object is **true**.

<span id="sec-25.2.3.1" class="secnum">[25.2.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorfunction.prototype.constructor "link to this section")</span> GeneratorFunction.prototype.constructor
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `GeneratorFunction.prototype.constructor` is the intrinsic object %GeneratorFunction%.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span> }.

<span id="sec-25.2.3.2" class="secnum">[25.2.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorfunction.prototype.prototype "link to this section")</span> GeneratorFunction.prototype.prototype
======================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of `GeneratorFunction.prototype.prototype` is the %GeneratorPrototype% intrinsic object.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span> }.

<span id="sec-25.2.3.3" class="secnum">[25.2.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorfunction.prototype-@@tostringtag "link to this section")</span> GeneratorFunction.prototype \[ @@toStringTag \]
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of the @@toStringTag property is the string value `"GeneratorFunction"`.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span> }.

<span id="sec-25.2.4" class="secnum">[25.2.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorfunction-instances "link to this section")</span> GeneratorFunction Instances
==============================================================================================================================================================================================

Every GeneratorFunction instance is an [ECMAScript function object](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-function-objects) and has the internal slots listed in [Table 27](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-27). The value of the \[\[FunctionKind\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) for all such instances is `"generator"`.

Each GeneratorFunction instance has the following own properties:

<span id="sec-25.2.4.1" class="secnum">[25.2.4.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorfunction-instances-length "link to this section")</span> length
====================================================================================================================================================================================

The value of the `length` property is an integer that indicates the typical number of arguments expected by the GeneratorFunction. However, the language permits the function to be invoked with some other number of arguments. The behaviour of a GeneratorFunction when invoked on a number of arguments other than the number specified by its `length` property depends on the function.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: **false**, \[\[Configurable\]\]: **true** }.

<span id="sec-25.2.4.2" class="secnum">[25.2.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorfunction-instances-name "link to this section")</span> name
================================================================================================================================================================================

The specification for the `name` property of Function instances given in [19.2.4.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-function-instances-name) also applies to GeneratorFunction instances.

<span id="sec-25.2.4.3" class="secnum">[25.2.4.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorfunction-instances-prototype "link to this section")</span> prototype
==========================================================================================================================================================================================

Whenever a GeneratorFunction instance is created another ordinary object is also created and is the initial value of the generator function’s `prototype` property. The value of the prototype property is used to initialize the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of a newly created Generator object when the generator function object is invoked using either \[\[Call\]\] or \[\[Construct\]\].

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span> }.

<span class="nh">NOTE</span> Unlike function instances, the object that is the value of the a GeneratorFunction’s `prototype` property does not have a `constructor` property whose value is the GeneratorFunction instance.

<span id="sec-25.3" class="secnum">[25.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-objects "link to this section")</span> Generator Objects
======================================================================================================================================================================

A Generator object is an instance of a generator function and conforms to both the *Iterator* and *Iterable* interfaces.

Generator instances directly inherit properties from the object that is the value of the `prototype` property of the Generator function that created the instance. Generator instances indirectly inherit properties from the Generator Prototype intrinsic, %GeneratorPrototype%.

<span id="sec-25.3.1" class="secnum">[25.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-generator-prototype "link to this section")</span> Properties of Generator Prototype
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The Generator prototype object is the %GeneratorPrototype% intrinsic. It is also the initial value of the `prototype` property of the %Generator% intrinsic (the [GeneratorFunction.prototype](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorfunction.prototype)).

The Generator prototype is an ordinary object. It is not a Generator instance and does not have a \[\[GeneratorState\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).

The value of the \[\[Prototype\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the Generator prototype object is the intrinsic object %IteratorPrototype% ([25.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-%iteratorprototype%-object)). The initial value of the \[\[Extensible\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) of the Generator prototype object is **true**.

All Generator instances indirectly inherit properties of the Generator prototype object.

<span id="sec-25.3.1.1" class="secnum">[25.3.1.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator.prototype.constructor "link to this section")</span> Generator.prototype.constructor
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of `Generator.prototype.constructor` is the intrinsic object %Generator%.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span> }.

<span id="sec-25.3.1.2" class="secnum">[25.3.1.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator.prototype.next "link to this section")</span> Generator.prototype.next ( value )
======================================================================================================================================================================================================

The `next` method performs the following steps:

1.  Let *g* be the **this** value.
2.  Return [GeneratorResume](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorresume)(*g*, *value*).

<span id="sec-25.3.1.3" class="secnum">[25.3.1.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator.prototype.return "link to this section")</span> Generator.prototype.return ( value )
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

The `return` method performs the following steps:

1.  Let *g* be the **this** value.
2.  Let *C* be [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: <span style="font-family: sans-serif">return</span>, \[\[value\]\]: *value*, \[\[target\]\]: <span style="font-family:
                  sans-serif">empty</span>}.
3.  Return [GeneratorResumeAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorresumeabrupt)(*g*, *C*).

<span id="sec-25.3.1.4" class="secnum">[25.3.1.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator.prototype.throw "link to this section")</span> Generator.prototype.throw ( exception )
============================================================================================================================================================================================================

The `throw` method performs the following steps:

1.  Let *g* be the **this** value.
2.  Let *C* be [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type){\[\[type\]\]: <span style="font-family: sans-serif">throw</span>, \[\[value\]\]: *exception*, \[\[target\]\]: <span style="font-family:
                  sans-serif">empty</span>}.
3.  Return [GeneratorResumeAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorresumeabrupt)(*g*, *C*).

<span id="sec-25.3.1.5" class="secnum">[25.3.1.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator.prototype-@@tostringtag "link to this section")</span> Generator.prototype \[ @@toStringTag \]
====================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The initial value of the @@toStringTag property is the string value `"Generator"`.

This property has the attributes { \[\[Writable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Enumerable\]\]: <span class="value">false</span>, \[\[Configurable\]\]: <span class="value">true</span> }.

<span id="sec-25.3.2" class="secnum">[25.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-properties-of-generator-instances "link to this section")</span> Properties of Generator Instances
==========================================================================================================================================================================================================

Generator instances are initially created with the internal slots described in [Table 56](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#table-56).

<span id="table-56">Table 56</span> — Internal Slots of Generator Instances

| Internal Slot            | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|--------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| \[\[GeneratorState\]\]   | The current execution state of the generator. The possible values are: **undefined**, `"suspendedStart"`<span style="font-family: Times New Roman">,</span> `"suspendedYield"`<span style="font-family: Times New Roman">,</span> `"executing"`, and `"completed"`<span style="font-family: Times New Roman">.</span> |
| \[\[GeneratorContext\]\] | The [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) that is used when executing the code of this generator.                                                                                                                                                         |

<span id="sec-25.3.3" class="secnum">[25.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generator-abstract-operations "link to this section")</span> Generator Abstract Operations
==================================================================================================================================================================================================

<span id="sec-25.3.3.1" class="secnum">[25.3.3.1](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorstart "link to this section")</span> GeneratorStart (generator, generatorBody)
===================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation GeneratorStart with arguments <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*generator* and *generatorBody*</span> performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): The value of *generator’s* \[\[GeneratorState\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) is **undefined**.
2.  Let *genContext* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
3.  Set the Generator component of *genContext* to *generator.*
4.  Set the code evaluation state of *genContext* such that when evaluation is resumed for that [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) the following steps will be performed:
    1.  Let *result* be the result of evaluating *generatorBody*.
    2.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): If we return here, the generator either threw an exception or performed either an implicit or explicit return.
    3.  Remove *genContext* from [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) and restore the [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) that is at the top of [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) as [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
    4.  Set *generator’s* \[\[GeneratorState\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to `"completed"`.
    5.  Once a generator enters the `"completed"` state it never leaves it and its associated [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) is never resumed. Any execution state associated with *generator* can be discarded at this point.
    6.  If *result* is a normal completion, let *resultValue* be **undefined**.
    7.  Else,
        1.  If *result*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">return</span>, let *resultValue* be *result*.\[\[value\]\].
        2.  Else, return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*result*).

    8.  Return [CreateIterResultObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject)(*resultValue*, **true**).

5.  Set *generator’s* \[\[GeneratorContext\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to *genContext*.
6.  Set *generator’s* \[\[GeneratorState\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to `"suspendedStart"`.
7.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(**undefined**).

<span id="sec-25.3.3.2" class="secnum">[25.3.3.2](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorvalidate "link to this section")</span> GeneratorValidate ( generator )
============================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation GeneratorValidate with argument generator performs the following steps:

1.  If [Type](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-ecmascript-data-types-and-values)(*generator*) is not Object, throw a **TypeError** exception.
2.  If *generator* does not have a \[\[GeneratorState\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots), throw a **TypeError** exception.
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *generator* also has a \[\[GeneratorContext\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
4.  Let *state* be the value of *generator’s* \[\[GeneratorState\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
5.  If *state* is `"executing"`, throw a **TypeError** exception.
6.  Return *state*.

<span id="sec-25.3.3.3" class="secnum">[25.3.3.3](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorresume "link to this section")</span> GeneratorResume ( generator, value )
===============================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation GeneratorResume with arguments <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*generator* and *value*</span> performs the following steps:

1.  Let *state* be [GeneratorValidate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorvalidate)(*generator*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*state*).
3.  If *state* is `"completed"`, return [CreateIterResultObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject)(**undefined**, **true**).
4.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *state* is either `"suspendedStart"` or `"suspendedYield"`.
5.  Let *genContext* be the value of *generator’s* \[\[GeneratorContext\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
6.  Let *methodContext* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
7.  [Suspend](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) *methodContext*.
8.  Set *generator’s* \[\[GeneratorState\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to `"executing"`.
9.  Push *genContext* onto [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts); *genContext* is now [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
10. Resume the [suspended](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) evaluation of *genContext* using [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(*value*) as the result of the operation that [suspended](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) it. Let *result* be the value returned by the resumed computation.
11. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): When we return here, *genContext* has already been removed from [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) and *methodContext* is [the currently running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
12. Return *result*.

<span id="sec-25.3.3.4" class="secnum">[25.3.3.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorresumeabrupt "link to this section")</span> GeneratorResumeAbrupt(generator, abruptCompletion)
===================================================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation GeneratorResumeAbrupt with arguments <span style="font-family: Times New Roman">*generator* and *abruptCompletion*</span> performs the following steps:

1.  Let *state* be [GeneratorValidate](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatorvalidate)(*generator*).
2.  [ReturnIfAbrupt](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-returnifabrupt)(*state*).
3.  If *state* is `"suspendedStart"`, then
    1.  Set *generator’s* \[\[GeneratorState\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to `"completed"`.
    2.  Once a generator enters the `"completed"` state it never leaves it and its associated [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) is never resumed. Any execution state associated with *generator* can be discarded at this point.
    3.  Let *state* be `"completed"`.

4.  If *state* is `"completed"`, then
    1.  If *abruptCompletion*.\[\[type\]\] is <span style="font-family: sans-serif">return</span>, then
        1.  Return [CreateIterResultObject](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-createiterresultobject)(*abruptCompletion*.\[\[value\]\], **true**).

    2.  Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*abruptCompletion*).

5.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *state* is `"suspendedYield"`.
6.  Let *genContext* be the value of *generator’s* \[\[GeneratorContext\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots).
7.  Let *methodContext* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
8.  [Suspend](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) *methodContext*.
9.  Set *generator’s* \[\[GeneratorState\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to `"executing"`.
10. Push *genContext* onto [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts); *genContext* is now [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
11. Resume the [suspended](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) evaluation of *genContext* using *abruptCompletion* as the result of the operation that [suspended](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) it. Let *result* be the completion record returned by the resumed computation.
12. [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): When we return here, *genContext* has already been removed from [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) and *methodContext* is [the currently running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
13. Return [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type)(*result*).

<span id="sec-25.3.3.5" class="secnum">[25.3.3.5](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-generatoryield "link to this section")</span> GeneratorYield ( iterNextObj )
========================================================================================================================================================================================

The abstract operation GeneratorYield with argument iterNextObj performs the following steps:

1.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *iterNextObj* is an Object that implements the *IteratorResult* interface.
2.  Let *genContext* be [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
3.  [Assert](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-algorithm-conventions): *genContext* is the [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) of a generator.
4.  Let *generator* be the value of the Generator component of *genContext*.
5.  Set the value of *generator’s* \[\[GeneratorState\]\] [internal slot](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots) to `"suspendedYield"`.
6.  Remove *genContext* from [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) and restore the [execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) that is at the top of [the execution context stack](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts) as [the running execution context](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-execution-contexts).
7.  Set the code evaluation state of *genContext* such that when evaluation is resumed with a [Completion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-completion-record-specification-type) *resumptionValue* the following steps will be performed:
    1.  Return *resumptionValue*.
    2.  NOTE: This returns to the evaluation of the *YieldExpression* production that originally called this abstract operation.

8.  Return [NormalCompletion](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-normalcompletion)(*iterNextObj*).
9.  <span style="font-family: sans-serif">NOTE: This returns to the evaluation of the operation that had most previously resumed evaluation of</span> *genContext*.

<span id="sec-25.4" class="secnum">[25.4](https://people.mozilla.org/~jorendorff/es6-draft.html#sec-promise-objects "link to this section")</span> Promise Objects
